ï»¿THIS IS THE SADDEST STORY [I]0-i have ever heard . [We]329-we had known [the Ashburnhams]178-the ashburnhams for nine seasons of [the town of Nauheim]330-the town of nauheim with an extreme intimacy - or , rather , with an acquaintanceship as loose and easy and yet as close as a good glove 's with [your]331-your hand . [[My]0-i wife]332-my wife and [I]0-i knew [Captain]179-captain ashburnham and [Mrs. Ashburnham]180-branshaw as well as it was possible to know [anybody]333-anybody , and yet , in another sense , [we]329-we knew nothing at all about [them]178-the ashburnhams . This is , [I]0-i believe , a state of things only possible with [English people of whom]334-english people of whom , till today , when [I]0-i sit down to puzzle out what [I]0-i know of this sad affair , [I]0-i knew nothing whatever . Six months ago [I]0-i had never been to [England]1-england , and , certainly , [I]0-i had never sounded the depths of an English heart . [I]0-i had known [the shallows]335-the shallows . [I]0-i do n't mean to say that [we]329-we were not acquainted with [many English people]336-many english people . Living , as [we]329-we perforce lived , in [Europe]2-europe , and being , as [we]329-we perforce were , [leisured Americans]337-leisured americans , which is as much as to say that [we]329-we were un - American , [we]329-we were thrown very much into [the society of [the nicer English]339-the nicer english]338-the society of the nicer english . [Paris]3-paris , [you]340-you see , was [[our]329-we home]341-our home . [Somewhere between [Nice]4-nice and [Bordighera]5-bordighera]342-somewhere between nice and bordighera provided yearly winter quarters for [us]329-we , and [Nauheim]6-nauheim always received [us]329-we from July to September . [You]340-you will gather from this statement that one of [us]329-we had , as the saying is , a " heart , "[6-nauheim] and , from the statement that [[my]0-i wife]332-my wife is dead , that [she]332-my wife was [the sufferer]344-the sufferer . [Captain Ashburnham]179-captain ashburnham also had a heart . But whereas a yearly month or so at [Nauheim]6-nauheim tuned [him]179-captain ashburnham up to exactly the right pitch for the rest of the twelvemonth , the two months or so were only just enough to keep [poor Florence]182-florence alive from year to year . The reason for [his]179-captain ashburnham heart was , approximately , polo , or too much hard sportsmanship in [his]179-captain ashburnham youth . The reason for poor [Florence]182-florence 's broken years was a storm at [sea]345-sea upon [our]329-we first crossing to [Europe]2-europe , and the immediate reasons for [our]329-we imprisonment in [that continent]346-that continent were [doctors]347-doctors ' orders . [They]347-doctors said that even the short Channel crossing might well kill [the poor thing]348-the poor thing . When [we]329-we all first met , [Captain Ashburnham]179-captain ashburnham , home on sick leave from [[an India]349-an india to which [he]179-captain ashburnham was never to return]350-an india to which he was never to return , was thirty - three ; [Mrs. Ashburnham]180-branshaw - [Leonora]183-leonora - was thirty - one . [I]0-i was thirty - six and poor [Florence]182-florence thirty . Thus to - day [Florence]182-florence would have been thirty - nine and [Captain Ashburnham]179-captain ashburnham forty - two ; whereas [I]0-i am forty - five and [Leonora]183-leonora forty . [You]351-you will perceive , therefore , that [our]329-we friendship has been a young - middle - aged affair , since [we]329-we were all of [us]329-we of quite quiet dispositions , [the Ashburnhams]178-the ashburnhams being more particularly what in [England]1-england it is the custom to call " [quite good people]3060-quite good people . "[178-the ashburnhams] [They]178-the ashburnhams were descended , as [you]351-you will probably expect , from the Ashburnham who accompanied [Charles]184-charles [I]0-i to the scaffold , and , as [you]351-you must also expect with [this class of English people]352-this class of english people , [you]351-you would never have noticed it . [Mrs. Ashburnham]180-branshaw was [a Powys]353-a powys ; [Florence]182-florence was a Hurlbird of [Stamford]7-stamford , [Connecticut]8-connecticut , where , as [you]351-you know , [they]178-the ashburnhams are more old - fashioned than even [the inhabitants of [Cranford]9-cranford]354-the inhabitants of cranford , [England]1-england , could have been . [I]0-i [myself]0-i am [a Dowell of [Philadelphia]10-philadelphia]185-a dowell of philadelphia , [Pa.]11-pa. , where , it is historically true , there are more old English families than [you]351-you would find in [any six English counties]355-any six english counties taken together . [I]0-i carry about with [me]0-i , indeed - as if it were the only thing that invisibly anchored [me]0-i to any spot upon the globe - the title deeds of [[my]0-i farm]356-my farm , which once covered several blocks between [Chestnut]12-chestnut and [Walnut Streets]13-walnut streets . These title deeds are of wampum , the grant of [an Indian chief]357-an indian chief to [the first Dowell]358-the first dowell , who left [Farnham]14-farnham in [Surrey]15-surrey in company with [William Penn]186-william penn . [[Florence]182-florence 's people]359-florence 's people , as is so often the case with [the inhabitants of [Connecticut]8-connecticut]360-the inhabitants of connecticut , came from [the neighbourhood of [Fordingbridge]16-fordingbridge]361-the neighbourhood of fordingbridge , where [[the Ashburnhams]178-the ashburnhams ' place]362-the ashburnhams ' place is . From [there]363-there , at this moment , [I]0-i am actually writing . [You]364-you may well ask why [I]0-i write . And yet [my]0-i reasons are quite many . For it is not unusual in [human beings]365-human beings who have witnessed the sack of [a city]366-a city or the falling to pieces of [a people]367-a people to desire to set down what [they]365-human beings have witnessed for the benefit of [unknown heirs or of generations infinitely remote]368-unknown heirs or of generations infinitely remote ; or , if [you]364-you please , just to get the sight out of [their]365-human beings heads . [Someone]369-someone has said that the death of a mouse from cancer is the whole sack of [Rome]17-rome by [the Goths]187-the goths , and [I]0-i swear to [you]364-you that the breaking up of [[our]370-we little four - square coterie]371-our little four - square coterie was such another unthinkable event . Supposing that [you]364-you should come upon [us]370-we sitting together at one of the little tables in front of [the club house]372-the club house , let [us]370-we say , at [Homburg]18-homburg , taking tea of an afternoon and watching the miniature golf , [you]364-you would have said that , as human affairs go , [we]370-we were [an extraordinarily safe castle]373-an extraordinarily safe castle . [We]370-we were , if [you]364-you will , [one of those tall ships with the white sails upon [a blue sea]375-a blue sea]374-one of those tall ships with the white sails upon a blue sea , one of those things that seem the proudest and the safest of all the beautiful and safe things that [God]188-god has permitted the mind of [men]376-men to frame . Where better could one take refuge ? Where better ? Permanence ? Stability ! [I]0-i ca n't believe it 's gone . [I]0-i ca n't believe that that long , tranquil life , which was just stepping a minuet , vanished in four crashing days at the end of nine years and six weeks . Upon [my]0-i word , yes , [our]370-we intimacy was like a minuet , simply because on every possible occasion and in every possible circumstance [we]370-we knew where to go , where to sit , which table [we]370-we unanimously should choose ; and [we]370-we could rise and go , all four together , without a signal from [any one of [us]370-we]377-any one of us , always to the music of [the Kur orchestra]378-the kur orchestra , always in the temperate sunshine , or , if it rained , in [discreet shelters]379-discreet shelters . No , indeed , it ca n't be gone . [You]364-you ca n't kill a minuet de la cour . [You]364-you may shut up the music - book , close the harpsichord ; in the cupboard and presses the rats may destroy the white satin favours . [The mob]380-the mob may sack [Versailles]19-versailles ; [the Trianon]20-the trianon may fall , but surely the minuet - the minuet itself is dancing itself away into the furthest stars , even as [our]370-we minuet of [the Hessian bathing places]381-the hessian bathing places must be stepping itself still . Is n't there any heaven where old beautiful dances , old beautiful intimacies prolong themselves ? Is n't there any Nirvana pervaded by the faint thrilling of [instruments that have fallen into the dust of wormwood but that yet had frail , tremulous , and everlasting souls]382-instruments that have fallen into the dust of wormwood but that yet had frail , tremulous , and everlasting souls ? No , by [God]188-god , it is false ! It was n't a minuet that [we]370-we stepped ; it was [a prison]383-a prison - [a prison full of screaming hysterics , tied down so that they might not outsound the rolling of [our]370-we carriage wheels]384-a prison full of screaming hysterics , tied down so that they might not outsound the rolling of our carriage wheels as [we]370-we went along [the shaded avenues of [the Taunus Wald]21-the taunus wald]385-the shaded avenues of the taunus wald . And yet [I]0-i swear by the sacred name of [[my]0-i creator]386-my creator that it was true . It was true sunshine ; the true music ; the true plash of the fountains from the mouth of stone dolphins . For , if for [me]0-i [we]370-we were [four people with the same tastes , with the same desires]387-four people with the same tastes , with the same desires , acting - or , no , not acting - sitting here and there unanimously , is n't that the truth ? If for nine years [I]0-i have possessed a goodly apple that is rotten at the core and discover its rottenness only in nine years and six months less four days , is n't it true to say that for nine years [I]0-i possessed a goodly apple ? So it may well be with [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward , with [Leonora]183-leonora [[his]189-edward wife]388-his wife , and with [poor dear Florence]182-florence . And , if [you]389-you come to think of it , is n't it a little odd that the physical rottenness of at least two pillars of [[our]370-we four - square house]390-our four - square house never presented itself to [my]0-i mind as a menace to its security ? It does n't so present itself now though [the two of [them]391-the two of them]391-the two of them are actually dead . [I]0-i do n't know . . . [I]0-i know nothing - nothing in [the world]392-the world - of the hearts of [men]376-men . [I]0-i only know that [I]0-i am alone - horribly alone . [No hearthstone]394-no hearthstone will ever again witness , for [me]0-i , friendly intercourse . [No smoking - room]395-no smoking - room will ever be other than peopled with incalculable simulacra amidst smoke wreaths . Yet , in the name of [God]188-god , what should [I]0-i know if [I]0-i do n't know the life of the hearth and of [the smoking - room]396-the smoking - room , since [my]0-i whole life has been passed in [those places]397-those places ? The warm hearthside ! - Well , there was [Florence]182-florence : [I]0-i believe that for the twelve years [her]182-florence life lasted , after the storm that seemed irretrievably to have weakened [her]182-florence heart - [I]0-i do n't believe that for one minute [she]182-florence was out of [my]0-i sight , except when [she]182-florence was safely tucked up in bed and [I]0-i should be [downstairs]398-downstairs , talking to [some good fellow]399-some good fellow or other in [some lounge or smoking - room]400-some lounge or smoking - room or taking [my]0-i final turn with a cigar before going to bed . [I]0-i do n't , [you]401-you understand , blame [Florence]182-florence . But how can [she]182-florence have known what [she]182-florence knew ? How could [she]182-florence have got to know it ? To know it so fully . Heavens ! There does n't seem to have been the actual time . It must have been when [I]0-i was taking [my]0-i baths , and [my]0-i Swedish exercises , being manicured . Leading the life [I]0-i did , of [the sedulous , strained nurse]402-the sedulous , strained nurse , [I]0-i had to do something to keep [myself]0-i fit . It must have been then ! Yet even that ca n't have been enough time to get the tremendously long conversations full of worldly wisdom that [Leonora]183-leonora has reported to [me]0-i since [their]403-their deaths . And is it possible to imagine that during [our]404-our prescribed walks in [Nauheim]6-nauheim and [the neighbourhood]405-the neighbourhood [she]183-leonora found time to carry on the protracted negotiations which [she]183-leonora did carry on between [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward and [[his]189-edward wife]388-his wife ? And is n't it incredible that during all that time [Edward]189-edward and [Leonora]183-leonora never spoke a word to [each other]407-each other in private ? What is one to think of humanity ? For [I]0-i swear to [you]408-you that [they]403-their were [the model couple]409-the model couple . [He]189-edward was as devoted as it was possible to be without appearing fatuous . So well set up , with such honest blue eyes , such a touch of stupidity , such a warm good - heartedness ! And [she]183-leonora - so tall , so splendid in the saddle , so fair ! Yes , [Leonora]183-leonora was extraordinarily fair and so extraordinarily the real thing that [she]183-leonora seemed too good to be true . [You]408-you do n't , [I]0-i mean , as a rule , get it all so superlatively together . To be [the county family]410-the county family , to look [the county family]410-the county family , to be so appropriately and perfectly wealthy ; to be so perfect in manner - even just to the saving touch of insolence that seems to be necessary . To have all that and to be all that ! No , it was too good to be true . And yet , only this afternoon , talking over the whole matter , [she]183-leonora said to [me]0-i : " Once [I]183-leonora tried to have [a lover]3061-a lover but [I]183-leonora was so sick at the heart , so utterly worn out , that [I]183-leonora had to send [him]3061-a lover away . "[183-leonora] That struck [me]0-i as the most amazing thing [I]0-i had ever heard . [She]183-leonora said : " [I]183-leonora was actually in [a man]3062-a man 's arms . [Such a nice chap]3063-such a nice chap ! [Such a dear fellow]3064-such a dear fellow ! And [I]183-leonora was saying to [myself]183-leonora , fiercely , hissing it between [my]183-leonora teeth , as [they]3065-they say in novels - and really clenching them together - [I]183-leonora was saying to [myself]183-leonora : ` Now , [I]183-leonora 'm in for it and [I]183-leonora 'll really have a good time for once in [my]183-leonora life - for once in [my]183-leonora life ! ` It was in the dark , in [a carriage]3066-a carriage , coming back from a hunt ball . Eleven miles [we]3067-we had to drive ! And then suddenly the bitterness of the endless poverty , of the endless acting - it fell on [me]183-leonora like a blight , it spoilt everything . Yes , [I]183-leonora had to realize that [I]183-leonora had been spoilt even for the good time when it came . And [I]183-leonora burst out crying and [I]183-leonora cried and [I]183-leonora cried for the whole eleven miles . Just imagine [me]183-leonora crying ! And just imagine [me]183-leonora making a fool of [the poor dear chap]3068-the poor dear chap like that . It certainly was n't playing the game , was it , now ? "[183-leonora] [I]0-i do n't know ; [I]0-i do n't know ; was that last remark of [hers]412-hers the remark of [a harlot]413-a harlot , or is it what [every decent woman , [county family]415-county family or not [county family]415-county family]414-every decent woman , county family or not county family , thinks at the bottom of [her]414-every decent woman , county family or not county family heart ? Or thinks all the time , for the matter of that ? Who knows ? Yet , if [one]417-one does n't know that at this hour and day , at this pitch of civilization to which [we]418-we have attained , after all the preachings of [all the moralists]419-all the moralists , and all the teachings of [all the mothers]420-all the mothers to all [the daughters]421-the daughters in saeculum saeculorum . . . but perhaps that is what [all mothers]422-all mothers teach [all daughters]423-all daughters , not with lips but with the eyes , or with heart whispering to heart . And if one does n't know as much as that about the first thing in [the world]392-the world , what does [one]417-one know and why is one here ? [I]0-i asked [Mrs. Ashburnham]180-branshaw whether [she]180-branshaw had told [Florence]182-florence that and what [Florence]182-florence had said , and [she]180-branshaw answered : " [Florence]182-florence did n't offer any comment at all . What could [she]182-florence say ? There was n't anything to be said . With the grinding poverty [we]418-we had to put up with to keep up appearances , and the way the poverty came about - [you]3069-you know what [I]180-branshaw mean - [any woman]3070-any woman would have been justified in taking [a lover]3061-a lover and presents too . [Florence]182-florence once said about a very similar position - [she]182-florence was a little too well - bred , too American , to talk about [mine]180-branshaw - that it was a case of perfectly open riding and [the woman]3072-the woman could just act on the spur of the moment . [She]182-florence said it in American of course , but that was the sense of it . [I]180-branshaw think [her]182-florence actual words were : ` That it was up to [her]182-florence to take it or leave it .... ` "[180-branshaw] [I]0-i do n't want [you]426-you to think that [I]0-i am writing [Teddy Ashburnham]189-edward down a brute . [I]0-i do n't believe [he]189-edward was . God knows , perhaps [all men]427-all men are like that . For , as [I]0-i 've said , what do [I]0-i know even of [the smoking - room]396-the smoking - room ? [Fellows]429-fellows come in and tell the most extraordinarily gross stories - so gross that [they]429-fellows will positively give [you]426-you a pain . And yet [they]429-fellows 'd be offended if [you]426-you suggested that [they]429-fellows were n't [the sort of person [you]426-you could trust [[your]426-you wife]431-your wife alone with]430-the sort of person you could trust your wife alone with . And very likely [they]429-fellows 'd be quite properly offended - that is , if [you]426-you can trust [anybody]333-anybody alone with [anybody]333-anybody . But [that sort of fellow]434-that sort of fellow obviously takes more delight in listening to or in telling gross stories - more delight than in anything else in [the world]392-the world . [They]429-fellows 'll hunt languidly and dress languidly and dine languidly and work without enthusiasm and find it a bore to carry on three minutes ' conversation about anything whatever and yet , when the other sort of conversation begins , [they]429-fellows 'll laugh and wake up and throw [themselves]429-fellows about in [their]429-fellows chairs . Then , if [they]429-fellows so delight in the narration , how is it possible that [they]429-fellows can be offended - and properly offended - at the suggestion that [they]429-fellows might make attempts upon [[your]426-you wife]431-your wife 's honour ? Or again : [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward was [the cleanest - looking sort of chap]437-the cleanest - looking sort of chap ; [an excellent magistrate]438-an excellent magistrate , [a first - rate soldier]439-a first - rate soldier , [one of [the best landlords]441-the best landlords]440-one of the best landlords , so [they]429-fellows said , in [Hampshire]22-hampshire , [England]1-england . To [the poor]442-the poor and to [hopeless drunkards]443-hopeless drunkards , as [I]0-i [myself]0-i have witnessed , [he]189-edward was like [a painstaking guardian]444-a painstaking guardian . And [he]189-edward never more than once or twice in all the nine years of [my]0-i knowing [him]189-edward told a story that could n't have gone into the columns of [the Field]23-the field . [He]189-edward did n't even like hearing [them]445-them ; [he]189-edward would fidget and get up and go out to buy a cigar or something of that sort . [You]446-you would have said that [he]189-edward was just exactly the sort of chap that [you]446-you could have trusted [[your]446-you wife]431-your wife with . And [I]0-i trusted [mine]0-i - and it was madness . And yet again [you]446-you have [me]0-i . If poor [Edward]189-edward was dangerous because of the chastity of [his]189-edward expressions - and [they]448-they say that that is always the hall - mark of [a libertine]449-a libertine - what about [myself]0-i ? For [I]0-i solemnly avow that not only have [I]0-i never so much as hinted at an impropriety in [my]0-i conversation in the whole of [my]0-i days ; and more than that , [I]0-i will vouch for the cleanness of [my]0-i thoughts and the absolute chastity of [my]0-i life . At what , then , does it all work out ? Is the whole thing a folly and a mockery ? Am [I]0-i no better than [a eunuch]450-a eunuch or is [the proper man]451-the proper man - [the man with the right to existence]452-the man with the right to existence - a raging stallion forever neighing after [[his]451-the proper man neighbour]453-his neighbour 's womenkind ? [I]0-i do n't know . And there is nothing to guide [us]454-we . And if everything is so nebulous about a matter so elementary as the morals of sex , what is there to guide [us]454-we in the more subtle morality of all other personal contacts , associations , and activities ? Or are [we]454-we meant to act on impulse alone ? It is all a darkness . [I]0-i DON'T KNOW HOW it is best to put this thing down - whether it would be better to try and tell the story from the beginning , as if it were a story ; or whether to tell it from this distance of time , as it reached [me]0-i from the lips of [Leonora]183-leonora or from those of [Edward]189-edward [himself]189-edward . So [I]0-i shall just imagine [myself]0-i for a fortnight or so at one side of the fireplace of [a country cottage]455-a country cottage , with [a sympathetic soul]456-a sympathetic soul opposite [me]0-i . And [I]0-i shall go on talking , in a low voice while [the sea]457-the sea sounds in the distance and overhead the great black flood of wind polishes the bright stars . From time to time [we]454-we shall get up and go to the door and look out at the great moon and say : " Why , it is nearly as bright as in [Provence]24-provence ! "[454-we] And then [we]454-we shall come back to [the fireside]458-the fireside , with just the touch of a sigh because [we]454-we are not in [that Provence]459-that provence where even the saddest stories are gay . Consider the lamentable history of [Peire Vidal]196-peire vidal . Two years ago [Florence]182-florence and [I]0-i motored from [Biarritz]26-biarritz to [Las Tours]27-las tours , which is in [the Black Mountains]28-the black mountains . In [the middle of [a tortuous valley]461-a tortuous valley]460-the middle of a tortuous valley there rises up an immense pinnacle and on the pinnacle are [four castles]462-four castles - [Las Tours]27-las tours , [the Towers]30-the towers . And the immense mistral blew down [that valley which was the way from [France]31-france into [Provence]24-provence]463-that valley which was the way from france into provence so that the silver - grey olive leaves appeared like hair flying in the wind , and the tufts of rosemary crept into the iron rocks that they might not be torn up by the roots . It was , of course , [poor dear [Florence]182-florence who wanted to go to [Las Tours]27-las tours]464-poor dear florence who wanted to go to las tours . [You]465-you are to imagine that , however much [her]182-florence bright personality came from [Stamford]7-stamford , [Connecticut]8-connecticut , [she]182-florence was yet [a graduate of [Vassar]32-vassar]466-a graduate of vassar . [I]0-i never could imagine how [she]182-florence did it - [the queer , chattery person]467-the queer , chattery person that [she]182-florence was . With the faraway look in [her]182-florence eyes - which was n't , however , in the least romantic - [I]0-i mean that [she]182-florence did n't look as if [she]182-florence were seeing poetic dreams , or looking through [you]465-you , for [she]182-florence hardly ever did look at [you]465-you ! - holding up one hand as if [she]182-florence wished to silence any objection - or any comment for the matter of that - [she]182-florence would talk . [We]470-we never did take another look at [Beaucaire]37-beaucaire , of course - beautiful [Beaucaire]37-beaucaire , with the high , triangular white tower , that looked as thin as a needle and as tall as [the Flatiron]471-the flatiron , between [Fifth]38-fifth and [Broadway]39-broadway - [Beaucaire]37-beaucaire with the grey walls on the top of the pinnacle surrounding an acre and a half of blue irises , beneath the tallness of the stone pines . What a beautiful thing the stone pine is ! . . . No , [we]470-we never did go back anywhere . [I]0-i have n't , unfortunately , so that [the world]392-the world is full of places to which [I]0-i want to return - [towns]474-towns with the blinding white sun upon [them]474-towns ; stone pines against the blue of the sky ; [comers of gables]475-comers of gables , all carved and painted with stags and scarlet flowers and crow - stepped gables with [the little saint]476-the little saint at the top ; and grey and pink palazzi and walled towns a mile or so back from [the sea]457-the sea , on [the Mediterranean]45-the mediterranean , between [Leghorn]46-leghorn and [Naples]47-naples . Not one of [them]478-them did [we]470-we see more than once , so that [the whole world]479-the whole world for [me]0-i is like spots of colour in an immense canvas . Perhaps if it were n't so [I]0-i should have something to catch hold of now . Is all this digression or is n't it digression ? Again [I]0-i do n't know . [You]480-you , [the listener]481-the listener , sit opposite [me]0-i . But [you]480-you are so silent . [You]480-you do n't tell [me]0-i anything . [I]0-i am , at any rate , trying to get [you]480-you to see what sort of life it was [I]0-i led with [Florence]182-florence and what [Florence]182-florence was like . Well , [she]182-florence was bright ; and [she]182-florence danced . [She]182-florence seemed to dance over the floors of [castles]482-castles and over [seas]483-seas and over and over [the salons of modistes]484-the salons of modistes and over [the plages of [the Riviera]48-the riviera]485-the plages of the riviera - like a gay tremulous beam , reflected from water upon a ceiling . And [my]0-i function in life was to keep that bright thing in existence . And it was almost as difficult as trying to catch with [your]480-you hand that dancing reflection . And the task lasted for years . [[Florence]182-florence 's aunts]486-florence 's aunts used to say that [I]0-i must be [the laziest man in [Philadelphia]10-philadelphia]487-the laziest man in philadelphia . For [I]0-i was solemnly informed that if [she]182-florence became excited over anything or if [her]182-florence emotions were really stirred [her]182-florence little heart might cease to beat . Just before [they]540-they set out from [San Francisco]59-san francisco for [the South Seas]545-the south seas [old Mr. Hurlbird]201-old mr. hurlbird said [he]201-old mr. hurlbird must take something with [him]201-old mr. hurlbird to make little presents to [people]507-people [he]201-old mr. hurlbird met on the voyage . It had certainly jumped or squeaked or something just sufficiently to take in [the doctors]563-the doctors , but it appears that that was because of an odd formation of the lungs . [I]0-i do n't much understand about these matters . [I]0-i inherited [his]201-old mr. hurlbird money because [Florence]182-florence died five days after [him]201-old mr. hurlbird . [I]0-i arrived , however , too late to be of any good if [I]0-i could have been of any good . And then [I]0-i had [my]0-i first taste of English life . It was amazing . It was overwhelming . [I]0-i never shall forget the polished cob that [Edward]189-edward , beside [me]0-i , drove ; the animal 's action , its highstepping , its skin that was like satin . And the peace ! [The girl]567-the girl was out with the hounds , [I]0-i think . And [that poor devil beside [me]0-i]583-that poor devil beside me was in an agony . Absolute , hopeless , dumb agony such as passes the mind of [man]584-man to imagine . [IT]585-it WAS A VERY HOT SUMMER , in August 1904 ; and [Florence]182-florence had already been taking [the baths]586-the baths for a month . [I]0-i do n't know how it feels to be [a patient]587-a patient at [one of those places]588-one of those places . [I]0-i never was [a patient]587-a patient anywhere . [I]0-i dare say [the patients]590-the patients get a [home]591-home feeling and some sort of anchorage in the spot . [They]590-the patients seem to like [the bath attendants]592-the bath attendants , with [their]592-the bath attendants cheerful faces , [their]592-the bath attendants air of authority , [their]592-the bath attendants white linen . But , for [myself]0-i , to be at [Nauheim]6-nauheim gave [me]0-i a sense - what shall [I]0-i say ? - a sense almost of nakedness - the nakedness that [one]417-one feels on [the sea - shore]594-the sea - shore or in [any great open space]595-any great open space . [I]0-i had no attachments , no accumulations . In [one 's own home]596-one 's own home it is as if little , innate sympathies draw one to particular chairs that seem to enfold [one]417-one in an embrace , or take one along [particular streets]598-particular streets that seem friendly when [others may be hostile]599-others may be hostile . And , believe [me]0-i , that feeling is a very important part of life . [I]0-i know it well , that have been for so long [a wanderer upon the face of public resorts]600-a wanderer upon the face of public resorts . And one is too polished up . [Heaven]203-heaven knows [I]0-i was never [an untidy man]601-an untidy man . But the feeling that [I]0-i had when , whilst [poor Florence]182-florence was taking [her]182-florence morning bath , [I]0-i stood upon the carefully swept steps of [the Englischer Hof]64-the englischer hof , looking at the carefully arranged trees in tubs upon the carefully arranged gravel whilst [carefully arranged people]602-carefully arranged people walked past in carefully calculated gaiety , at the carefully calculated hour , the tall trees of [the public gardens]603-the public gardens , going up to the right ; the reddish stone of [the baths]586-the baths - or were they white half - timber chalets ? Upon [my]0-i word [I]0-i have forgotten , [I]0-i who was there so often . That will give [you]605-you the measure of how much [I]0-i was in [the landscape]606-the landscape . [I]0-i could find [my]0-i way blindfolded to [the hot rooms]607-the hot rooms , to [the douche rooms]608-the douche rooms , to the fountain in [the centre of [the quadrangle]610-the quadrangle]609-the centre of the quadrangle where the rusty water gushes out . Yes , [I]0-i could find [my]0-i way blindfolded . [I]0-i know the exact distances . From [the Hotel Regina]611-the hotel regina [you]605-you took one hundred and eighty - seven paces , then , turning sharp , lefthanded , four hundred and twenty took [you]605-you straight down to [the fountain]612-the fountain . From [the Englischer Hof]64-the englischer hof , starting on [the sidewalk]613-the sidewalk , it was ninety - seven paces and the same four hundred and twenty , but turning righthanded this time . And now [you]605-you understand that , having nothing in [the world]392-the world to do - but nothing whatever ! - [I]0-i fell into the habit of counting [my]0-i footsteps . [I]0-i would walk with [Florence]182-florence to [the baths]586-the baths . And , of course , [she]182-florence entertained [me]0-i with [her]182-florence conversation . It was , as [I]0-i have said , wonderful what [she]182-florence could make conversation out of . [She]182-florence walked very lightly , and [her]182-florence hair was very nicely done , and [she]182-florence dressed beautifully and very expensively . Of course [she]182-florence had money of [her]182-florence own , but [I]0-i should n't have minded . And yet [you]605-you know [I]0-i ca n't remember a single one of [her]182-florence dresses . Or [I]0-i can remember just one , a very simple one of blue figured silk - a Chinese pattern - very full in the skirts and broadening out over the shoulders . And [her]182-florence hair was copper - coloured , and the heels of [her]182-florence shoes were exceedingly high , so that [she]182-florence tripped upon the points of [her]182-florence toes . And when [she]182-florence came to the door of [the bathing place]616-the bathing place , and when it opened to receive [her]182-florence , [she]182-florence would look back at [me]0-i with a little coquettish smile , so that [her]182-florence cheek appeared to be caressing [her]182-florence shoulder . [I]0-i seem to remember that , with that dress , [she]182-florence wore an immensely broad Leghorn hat - like the Chapeau de Paille of [Rubens]65-rubens , only very white . The hat would be tied with a lightly knotted scarf of the same stuff as [her]182-florence dress . [She]182-florence knew how to give value to [her]182-florence blue eyes . And round [her]182-florence neck would be some simple pink , coral beads . And [her]182-florence complexion had a perfect clearness , a perfect smoothness . . . Yes , that is how [I]0-i most exactly remember [her]182-florence , in that dress , in that hat , looking over [her]182-florence shoulder at [me]0-i so that the eyes flashed very blue - dark pebble blue .... And , what the devil ! For whose benefit did [she]182-florence do it ? For that of [the bath attendant]617-the bath attendant ? of [the passers - by]618-the passers - by ? [I]0-i do n't know . Anyhow , it ca n't have been for [me]0-i , for never , in all the years of [her]182-florence life , never on any possible occasion , or in any other place , did [she]182-florence so smile to [me]0-i , mockingly , invitingly . Ah , [she]182-florence was a riddle ; but then , [all other women]619-all other women are riddles . And it occurs to [me]0-i that some way back [I]0-i began a sentence that [I]0-i have never finished .... It was about the feeling that [I]0-i had when [I]0-i stood on the steps of [[my]0-i hotel]620-my hotel every morning before starting out to fetch [Florence]182-florence back from [the bath]621-the bath . Natty , precise , well - brushed , conscious of being rather small amongst [the long English]622-the long english , [the lank Americans]623-the lank americans , [the rotund Germans]624-the rotund germans , and [the obese Russian Jewesses]625-the obese russian jewesses , [I]0-i should stand there , tapping a cigarette on the outside of [my]0-i case , surveying for a moment [the world]392-the world in the sunlight . But a day was to come when [I]0-i was never to do it again alone . [You]627-you can imagine , therefore , what the coming of [the Ashburnhams]178-the ashburnhams meant for [me]0-i . [I]0-i have forgotten the aspect of many things but [I]0-i shall never forget the aspect of [the dining - room of [the Hotel Excelsior]629-the hotel excelsior]628-the dining - room of the hotel excelsior on that evening - and on so many other evenings . [Whole castles]630-whole castles have vanished from [my]0-i memory , [whole cities that [I]0-i have never visited]631-whole cities that i have never visited again , but [that white room]632-that white room , festooned with papier - mache fruits and flowers ; the tall windows ; the many tables ; the black screen round the door with three golden cranes flying upward on each panel ; the palm tree in the centre of [the room]633-the room ; the swish of [the waiter]634-the waiter 's feet ; the cold expensive elegance ; the mien of [the diners]635-the diners as [they]635-the diners came in every evening - [their]635-the diners air of earnestness as if [they]635-the diners must go through a meal prescribed by [the Kur authorities]636-the kur authorities and [their]635-the diners air of sobriety as if [they]635-the diners must seek not by any means to enjoy [their]635-the diners meals - those things [I]0-i shall not easily forget . And then , one evening , in the twilight , [I]0-i saw [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward lounge round the screen into [the room]633-the room . [The head waiter]638-the head waiter , [a man with a face all grey]639-a man with a face all grey - in what subterranean nooks or corners do [people cultivate those absolutely grey complexions]640-people cultivate those absolutely grey complexions ? - went with the timorous patronage of [these creatures]641-these creatures towards [him]638-the head waiter and held out a grey ear to be whispered into . It was generally a disagreeable ordeal for [newcomers]642-newcomers but [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward bore it like [an Englishman]643-an englishman and [a gentleman]644-a gentleman . [I]0-i could see [his]189-edward lips form a word of three syllables - remember [I]0-i had nothing in [the world]392-the world to do but to notice these niceties - and immediately [I]0-i knew that [he]189-edward must be [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward , [Captain]646-captain , [Fourteenth Hussars]647-fourteenth hussars , of [Branshaw House]66-branshaw house , [Branshaw Teleragh]180-branshaw . [I]0-i knew it because every evening just before dinner , whilst [I]0-i waited in [the hall]648-the hall , [I]0-i used , by courtesy of [Monsieur Schontz]204-monsieur schontz , [the proprietor]649-the proprietor , to inspect the little police reports that [each guest]650-each guest was expected to sign upon taking [a room]651-a room . [The head waiter]638-the head waiter piloted [him]189-edward immediately to a vacant table , three away from [[my]0-i own]653-my own - the table that [the Grenfalls of [Falls River]67-falls river , [N.J.]68-n.j.]654-the grenfalls of falls river , n.j. , had just vacated . It struck [me]0-i that that was not a very nice table for [the newcomers]655-the newcomers , since the sunlight , low though it was , shone straight down upon [it]656-it , and the same idea seemed to come at the same moment into [Captain Ashburnham]179-captain ashburnham 's head . [His]189-edward face hitherto had , in the wonderful English fashion , expressed nothing whatever . Nothing . There was in it neither joy nor despair ; neither hope nor fear ; neither boredom nor satisfaction . [He]189-edward seemed to perceive no soul in [that crowded room]657-that crowded room ; [he]189-edward might have been walking in [a jungle]658-a jungle . [I]0-i never came across such a perfect expression before and [I]0-i never shall again . It was insolence and not insolence ; it was modesty and not modesty . [His]189-edward hair was fair , extraordinarily , ordered in a wave , running from the left temple to the right ; [his]189-edward face was a light brick red , perfectly uniform in tint up to the roots of the hair itself ; [his]189-edward yellow moustache was as stiff as a toothbrush and [I]0-i verily believe that [he]189-edward had [his]189-edward black smoking jacket thickened a little over the shoulder - blades so as to give [himself]189-edward the air of the slightest possible stoop . It would be like [him]189-edward to do that ; that was the sort of thing [he]189-edward thought about . [Martingales]69-martingales , Chiffney bits , boots ; where [you]659-you got the best soap , the best brandy , the name of [the chap who rode a plater down [the Khyber cliffs]661-the khyber cliffs]660-the chap who rode a plater down the khyber cliffs ; the spreading power of number - three shot before a charge of number - four powder . . . by heavens , [I]0-i hardly ever heard [him]189-edward talk of anything else . Not in all the years that [I]0-i knew [him]189-edward did [I]0-i hear [him]189-edward talk of anything but these subjects . Oh , yes , once [he]189-edward told [me]0-i that [I]0-i could buy [my]0-i special shade of blue ties cheaper from [a firm in [Burlington Arcade]70-burlington arcade]662-a firm in burlington arcade than from [[my]0-i own people in [New York]51-new york]663-my own people in new york . And [I]0-i have bought [my]0-i ties from [that firm]664-that firm ever since . Otherwise [I]0-i should not remember the name of [the Burlington Arcade]665-the burlington arcade . [I]0-i wonder what it looks like . [I]0-i have never seen it . [I]0-i imagine it to be two immense rows of pillars , like those of [the Forum at [Rome]17-rome]666-the forum at rome , with [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward striding down between them . But it probably is n't - the least like that . Once also [he]189-edward advised [me]0-i to buy Caledonian Deferred , since they were due to rise . And [I]0-i did buy them and [they]667-they did rise . But of how [he]189-edward got the knowledge [I]0-i have n't the faintest idea . It seemed to drop out of the blue sky . And that was absolutely all that [I]0-i knew of [him]189-edward until a month ago - that and the profusion of [his]189-edward cases , all of pigskin and stamped with [his]189-edward initials , E. F. A. There were guncases , and collar cases , and shirt cases , and letter cases , and cases each containing four bottles of medicine ; and hat cases and helmet cases . It must have needed [a whole herd of the Gadarene swine]668-a whole herd of the gadarene swine to make up [his]189-edward outfit . And if [I]0-i ever penetrated into [[his]189-edward private room]669-his private room , it would be to see [him]189-edward standing with [his]189-edward coat and waistcoat off and the immensely long line of [his]189-edward perfectly elegant trousers from waist to boot heel . And [he]189-edward would have a slightly reflective air and [he]189-edward would be just opening one kind of case and just closing another . [Good God]188-god , what did [they]670-they all see in [him]189-edward ? - for [I]0-i swear that was all there was of [him]189-edward , inside and out ; though [they]670-they said [he]189-edward was [a good soldier]671-a good soldier . Yet [Leonora]183-leonora adored [him]189-edward with a passion that was like an agony , and hated [him]189-edward with an agony that was as bitter as [the sea]457-the sea . How could [he]189-edward rouse anything like a sentiment , in [anybody]333-anybody ? What did [he]189-edward even talk to [them]670-they about - when [they]670-they were under four eyes ? - Ah , well , suddenly , as if by a flash of inspiration , [I]0-i know . For [all good soldiers]674-all good soldiers are [sentimentalists]675-sentimentalists - [all good soldiers of that type]676-all good soldiers of that type . [Their]674-all good soldiers profession , for one thing , is full of the big words - " courage , "[674-all good soldiers] " loyalty , "[674-all good soldiers] " honor , "[675-sentimentalists] " constancy . "[674-all good soldiers] And [I]0-i have given a wrong impression of [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward if [I]0-i have made [you]677-you think that literally never in the course of [our]678-our nine years of intimacy did [he]189-edward discuss what [he]189-edward would have called " the graver things . "[189-edward] Even before [his]189-edward final outburst to [me]0-i , at times , very late at night , say , [he]189-edward has blurted out something that gave an insight into the sentimental view of the cosmos that was [his]189-edward . [He]189-edward would say how much the society of [a good woman]679-a good woman could do towards redeeming [you]677-you , and [he]189-edward would say that constancy was the finest of the virtues . [He]189-edward said it very stiffly , of course , but still as if the statement admitted of no doubt . Constancy ! Is n't that [the queer]680-the queer thought ? And yet [I]0-i must add that poor dear [Edward]189-edward was [a great reader]681-a great reader - [he]189-edward would pass hours lost in novels of a sentimental type - novels in which [typewriter girls]682-typewriter girls married [marquises]683-marquises and [governesses earls]684-governesses earls . And in [his]189-edward books , as a rule , the course of true love ran as smooth as buttered honey . And [he]189-edward was fond of poetry , of a certain type - and [he]189-edward could even read a perfectly sad love story . [I]0-i have seen [his]189-edward eyes filled with tears at reading of a hopeless parting . And [he]189-edward loved , with a sentimental yearning , [all children]685-all children , puppies , and the feeble generally .... So , [you]677-you see , [he]189-edward would have plenty to gurgle about to [a woman]686-a woman - with that and [his]189-edward sound common sense about [martingales]687-martingales and [his]189-edward - still sentimental - experiences as [a county magistrate]688-a county magistrate ; and with [his]189-edward intense , optimistic belief that [the woman [he]189-edward was making love to at the moment]689-the woman he was making love to at the moment was the one [he]189-edward was destined , at last , to be eternally constant to [....]205-.... Well , [I]0-i fancy [he]189-edward could put up a pretty good deal of talk when there was [no man around]690-no man around to make [him]189-edward feel shy . And [I]0-i was quite astonished , during [his]189-edward final burst - out to [me]0-i - at the very end of things , when [the poor girl]691-the poor girl was on [her]691-the poor girl way to that fatal [Brindisi]71-brindisi and [he]189-edward was trying to persuade [himself]189-edward and [me]0-i that [he]189-edward had never really cared for [her]691-the poor girl - [I]0-i was quite astonished to observe how literary and how just [his]189-edward expressions were . [He]189-edward talked like quite a good book - a book not in the least cheaply sentimental . [You]692-you see , [I]0-i suppose [he]189-edward regarded [me]0-i not so much as [a man]3062-a man . [I]0-i had to be regarded as [a woman]686-a woman or [a solicitor]695-a solicitor . Anyhow , it burst out of [him]189-edward on that horrible night . And then , next morning , [he]189-edward took [me]0-i over to [the Assizes]696-the assizes and [I]0-i saw how , in a perfectly calm and business - like way [he]189-edward set to work to secure a verdict of not guilty for [a poor girl]697-a poor girl , [the daughter of one of [his]189-edward tenants who had been accused of murdering [[her]697-a poor girl baby]699-her baby]698-the daughter of one of his tenants who had been accused of murdering her baby . [He]189-edward spent two hundred pounds on [her]697-a poor girl defence .... Well , that was [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward . [I]0-i had forgotten about [his]189-edward eyes . They were as blue as the sides of a certain type of box of matches . When [you]700-you looked at them carefully [you]700-you saw that they were perfectly honest , perfectly straightforward , perfectly , perfectly stupid . But the brick pink of [his]189-edward complexion , running perfectly level to the brick pink of [his]189-edward inner eyelids , gave [them]701-them a curious , sinister expression - like a mosaic of blue porcelain set in pink china . And [that chap]702-that chap , coming into [a room]651-a room , snapped up the gaze of [every woman in [it]651-a room]704-every woman in it , as dexterously as [a conjuror]705-a conjuror pockets billiard balls . It was most amazing . [You]700-you know [the man on the stage who throws up sixteen balls at once and they all]706-the man on the stage who throws up sixteen balls at once and they all drop into pockets all over [[his]189-edward person]707-his person , on [his]189-edward shoulders , on [his]189-edward heels , on the inner side of [his]189-edward sleeves ; and [he]189-edward stands perfectly still and does nothing . Well , it was like that . [He]189-edward had rather a rough , hoarse voice . And there [he]189-edward was , standing by the table . [I]0-i was looking at [him]189-edward , with [my]0-i back to the screen . And , suddenly , [I]0-i saw two distinct expressions flicker across [his]189-edward immobile eyes . How [the deuce]708-the deuce did [they]708-the deuce do it , those unflinching blue eyes with the direct gaze ? For the eyes [themselves]708-the deuce never moved , gazing over [my]0-i shoulder towards the screen . And the gaze was perfectly level and perfectly direct and perfectly unchanging . [I]0-i suppose that the lids really must have rounded themselves a little and perhaps the lips moved a little too , as if [he]189-edward should be saying : " There [you]0-i are , [[my]189-edward dear]3075-my dear . "[189-edward] At any rate , the expression was that of pride , of satisfaction , of [the possessor]709-the possessor . [I]0-i saw [him]189-edward once afterwards , for a moment , gaze upon [the sunny fields of [Branshaw]180-branshaw]710-the sunny fields of branshaw and say : " All this is [[my]189-edward land]3076-my land ! "[189-edward] And then again the gaze was perhaps more direct , harder if possible - hardy too . It was a measuring look ; a challenging look . Once when [we]711-we were at [Wiesbaden]73-wiesbaden watching [him]189-edward play in a polo match against [the Bonner Hussaren]206-the bonner hussaren [I]0-i saw the same look come into [his]189-edward eyes , balancing the possibilities , looking over the ground . [The German Captain]712-the german captain , [Count Baron Idigon von Leloffel]207-count baron idigon von leloffel , was right up by [their]713-their goal posts , coming with the ball in an easy canter in that tricky German fashion . The rest of [the field]714-the field were just anywhere . It was only a scratch sort of affair . [Ashburnham]189-edward was quite close to the rails not five yards from [us]711-we and [I]0-i heard [him]189-edward saying to [himself]189-edward : " Might just be done ! "[189-edward] And [he]189-edward did it . Goodness ! [he]189-edward swung that pony round with all its four legs spread out , like a cat dropping off a roof .... Well , it was just that look that [I]0-i noticed in [his]189-edward eyes : " It might , "[189-edward] [I]0-i seem even now to hear [him]189-edward muttering to [himself]189-edward , " just be done . "[189-edward] [I]0-i looked round over [my]0-i shoulder and saw , tall , smiling brilliantly , and buoyant - [Leonora]183-leonora . And , little and fair , and as radiant as the track of sunlight along [the sea]457-the sea - [[my]0-i wife]332-my wife . [That poor wretch]717-that poor wretch ! to think that [he]189-edward was at that moment in a perfect devil of a fix , and there [he]189-edward was , saying at the back of [his]189-edward mind : " It might just be done . "[189-edward] It was like a chap in the middle of the eruption of a volcano , saying that [he]189-edward might just manage to bolt into tumult and set fire to a haystack . Madness ? Predestination ? [Who the devil]718-who the devil knows ? [Mrs. Ashburnham]180-branshaw exhibited at that moment more gaiety than [I]0-i have ever since known [her]180-branshaw to show . There are [certain classes of [English people]720-english people]719-certain classes of english people - [the nicer ones]721-the nicer ones when [they]721-the nicer ones have been to many spas , who seem to make a point of becoming much more than usually animated when [they]721-the nicer ones are introduced to [[my]0-i compatriots]722-my compatriots . [I]0-i have noticed this often . Of course , [they]721-the nicer ones must first have accepted [the Americans]208-the americans . But , that once done , [they]721-the nicer ones seem to say to [themselves]721-the nicer ones : " [Hallo]209-hallo , [these women]3077-these women are so bright . [We]721-the nicer ones are n't going to be outdone in brightness . "[721-the nicer ones] And for the time being [they]721-the nicer ones certainly are n't . But it wears off . So it was with [Leonora]183-leonora - at least until [she]183-leonora noticed [me]0-i . [She]183-leonora began , [Leonora]183-leonora did - and perhaps it was that that gave [me]0-i the idea of a touch of insolence in [her]183-leonora character , for [she]183-leonora never afterwards did any one single thing like it - [she]183-leonora began by saying in quite a loud voice and from quite a distance : " Do n't stop over by that stuffy old table , [Teddy]189-edward . Come and sit by [these nice people]3078-these nice people ! "[183-leonora] And that was an extraordinary thing to say . Quite extraordinary . [I]0-i could n't for the life of [me]0-i refer to [total strangers]723-total strangers as [nice people]724-nice people . But , of course , [she]183-leonora was taking a line of [her]183-leonora own in which [I]0-i at any rate - and [no one else]725-no one else in [the room]633-the room , for [she]183-leonora too had taken the trouble to read through the list of [guests]727-guests - counted [any more than so many clean bull terriers]728-any more than so many clean bull terriers . And [she]183-leonora sat down rather brilliantly at a vacant table , beside [ours]729-ours - one that was reserved for [the Guggenheimers]210-the guggenheimers . And [she]183-leonora just sat absolutely deaf to the remonstrances of [the head waiter]638-the head waiter with [his]638-the head waiter face like a grey ram 's . [That poor chap]731-that poor chap was doing [his]731-that poor chap steadfast duty too . [He]731-that poor chap knew that [the Guggenheimers of [Chicago]74-chicago]732-the guggenheimers of chicago , after [they]732-the guggenheimers of chicago had stayed [there]363-there a month and had worried the poor life out of [him]731-that poor chap , would give [him]731-that poor chap two dollars fifty and grumble at the tipping system . And [he]731-that poor chap knew that [Teddy Ashburnham]189-edward and [[his]189-edward wife]388-his wife would give [him]731-that poor chap no trouble whatever except what the smiles of [Leonora]183-leonora might cause in [his]731-that poor chap apparently unimpressionable bosom - though [you]735-you never can tell what may go on behind even a not quite spotless plastron ! - And every week [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward would give [him]731-that poor chap [a solid , sound , golden English sovereign]736-a solid , sound , golden english sovereign . Yet [this stout fellow]737-this stout fellow was intent on saving that table for [the Guggenheimers of [Chicago]74-chicago]732-the guggenheimers of chicago . [It]739-it ended in [Florence]182-florence saying : " Why should n't [we]3079-we all eat out of [the same trough]3080-the same trough - that 's a nasty New [York]75-york saying . But [I]182-florence 'm sure [we]3079-we 're [all nice quiet people]3081-all nice quiet people and there can be four seats at [our]3079-we table . It 's round . "[182-florence] Then came , as it were , an appreciative gurgle from [the Captain]740-the captain and [I]0-i was perfectly aware of a slight hesitation - a quick sharp motion in [Mrs. Ashburnham]180-branshaw , as if [her]180-branshaw horse had checked . But [she]180-branshaw put it at the fence all right , rising from the seat [she]180-branshaw had taken and sitting down opposite [me]0-i , as it were , all in one motion . [I]0-i never thought that [Leonora]183-leonora looked [her]183-leonora best in evening dress . [She]183-leonora seemed to get it too clearly cut , there was no ruffling . [She]183-leonora always affected black and [her]183-leonora shoulders were too classical . [She]183-leonora seemed to stand out of [her]183-leonora corsage as a white marble bust might out of a black Wedgwood vase . [I]0-i do n't know . [I]0-i loved [Leonora]183-leonora always and , to - day , [I]0-i would very cheerfully lay down [my]0-i life , what is left of it , in [her]183-leonora service . But [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i never had the beginnings of a trace of what is called the sex instinct towards [her]183-leonora . And [I]0-i suppose - no , [I]0-i am certain that [she]183-leonora never had it towards [me]0-i . As far as [I]0-i am concerned [I]0-i think it was those white shoulders that did it . [I]0-i seemed to feel when [I]0-i looked at [them]741-them that , if ever [I]0-i should press [my]0-i lips upon them , they would be slightly cold - not icily , not without a touch of human heat , but , as [they]741-them say of baths , with the chill off . [I]0-i seemed to feel chilled at the end of [my]0-i lips when [I]0-i looked at [her]183-leonora .... No , [Leonora]183-leonora always appeared to [me]0-i at [her]183-leonora best in a blue tailor - made . Then [her]183-leonora glorious hair was n't deadened by [her]183-leonora white shoulders . [Certain women]742-certain women 's lines guide [your]743-your eyes to [their]742-certain women necks , [their]742-certain women eyelashes , [their]742-certain women lips , [their]742-certain women breasts . But [Leonora]183-leonora 's seemed to conduct [your]743-your gaze always to [her]183-leonora wrist . And the wrist was at its best in a black or a dogskin glove and there was always a gold circlet with a little chain supporting a very small golden key to a dispatch box . Perhaps it was that in which [she]183-leonora locked up [her]183-leonora heart and [her]183-leonora feelings . Anyhow , [she]183-leonora sat down opposite [me]0-i and then , for the first time , [she]183-leonora paid any attention to [my]0-i existence . [She]183-leonora gave [me]0-i , suddenly , yet deliberately , one long stare . [Her]183-leonora eyes too were blue and dark and the eyelids were so arched that they gave [you]743-your the whole round of the irises . And it was a most remarkable , a most moving glance , as if for a moment a lighthouse had looked at [me]0-i . [I]0-i seemed to perceive the swift questions chasing each other through the brain that was behind [them]744-them . [I]0-i seemed to hear the brain ask and the eyes answer with all the simpleness of [a woman who was a good hand at taking in qualities of a horse]745-a woman who was a good hand at taking in qualities of a horse - as indeed [she]745-a woman who was a good hand at taking in qualities of a horse was . " Stands well ; has plenty of room for [his]745-a woman who was a good hand at taking in qualities of a horse oats behind the girth . Not so much in the way of shoulders , "[745-a woman who was a good hand at taking in qualities of a horse] and so on . And so [her]183-leonora eyes asked : " Is [this man]3082-this man trustworthy in money matters ; is [he]3082-this man likely to try to play [the lover]3083-the lover ; is [he]3082-this man likely to let [[his]3082-this man women]3084-his women be troublesome ? Is [he]3082-this man , above all , likely to babble about [my]183-leonora affairs ? "[183-leonora] And , suddenly , into those cold , slightly defiant , almost defensive china - blue orbs , there came a warmth , a tenderness , a friendly recognition . . . oh , it was very charming and very touching - and quite mortifying . It was the look of [a mother]746-a mother to [[her]746-a mother son]747-her son , of [a sister to [[her]746-a mother brother]749-her brother]748-a sister to her brother . It implied trust ; it implied the want of any necessity for barriers . By [God]188-god , [she]183-leonora looked at [me]0-i as if [I]0-i were [an invalid]750-an invalid - as [any kind woman]751-any kind woman may look at [a poor chap in a bath chair]752-a poor chap in a bath chair . And , yes , from that day forward [she]183-leonora always treated [me]0-i and not [Florence]182-florence as if [I]0-i were [the invalid]753-the invalid . Why , [she]183-leonora would run after [me]0-i with a rug upon chilly days . [I]0-i suppose , therefore , that [her]183-leonora eyes had made a favourable answer . Or , perhaps , it was n't a favourable answer . And then [Florence]182-florence said : " And so the whole round table is begun . "[182-florence] Again [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward gurgled slightly in [his]189-edward throat ; but [Leonora]183-leonora shivered a little , as if a goose had walked over [her]183-leonora grave . And [I]0-i was passing [her]182-florence the nickel - silver basket of rolls . Avanti . . . SO BEGAN THOSE NINE YEARS of uninterrupted tranquillity . [They]754-they were characterized by an extraordinary want of any communicativeness on the part of [the Ashburnhams]178-the ashburnhams , to which [we]755-we on [our]755-we part replied by leaving out quite as extraordinarily , and nearly as completely , the personal note . Indeed , [you]756-you may take it that what characterized [our]755-we relationship was an atmosphere of taking everything for granted . The given proposition was that [we]755-we were [all " good people]3085-all " good people . "[755-we] [We]755-we took for granted that [we]755-we all liked beef underdone but not too underdone ; that [both men]757-both men preferred a good liqueur brandy after lunch ; that [both women]758-both women drank a very light Rhine wine qualified with Fachingen water - that sort of thing . It was also taken for granted that [we]755-we were both sufficiently well off to afford anything that [we]755-we could reasonably want in the way of amusements fitting to [[our]755-we station]759-our station - that [we]755-we could take [motor cars]760-motor cars and [carriages]761-carriages by the day ; that [we]755-we could give [each other]407-each other dinners and dine [[our]755-we friends]763-our friends and [we]755-we could indulge if [we]755-we liked in economy . Thus , [Florence]182-florence was in the habit of having the Daily Telegraph sent to [her]182-florence every day from [London]76-london . [She]182-florence was always [an Anglomaniac]764-an anglomaniac , was [Florence]182-florence ; the [Paris]3-paris edition of the New [York]75-york Herald was always good enough for [me]0-i . But when [we]755-we discovered that [the Ashburnhams]178-the ashburnhams ' copy of the [London]76-london paper followed [them]178-the ashburnhams from [England]1-england , [Leonora]183-leonora and [Florence]182-florence decided between [them]178-the ashburnhams to suppress one subscription one year and the other the next . Similarly it was the habit of [the Grand Duke of [Nassau]77-nassau Schwerin , who came yearly to [the baths]586-the baths , to dine once with about [eighteen families of [regular Kur guests]768-regular kur guests]767-eighteen families of regular kur guests]765-the grand duke of nassau schwerin , who came yearly to the baths , to dine once with about eighteen families of regular kur guests . In return [he]765-the grand duke of nassau schwerin , who came yearly to the baths , to dine once with about eighteen families of regular kur guests would give a dinner to [all the eighteen]769-all the eighteen at once . And , since these dinners were rather expensive [you]770-you had to take [the Grand Duke]771-the grand duke and a good many of [[his]771-the grand duke suite]772-his suite and [any members of [the diplomatic bodies that might be there]774-the diplomatic bodies that might be there]773-any members of the diplomatic bodies that might be there - [Florence]182-florence and [Leonora]183-leonora , putting [their]178-the ashburnhams heads together , did n't see why [we]775-we should n't give [the Grand Duke]771-the grand duke [his]771-the grand duke dinner together . And so [we]775-we did . [I]0-i do n't suppose [the Serenity]777-the serenity minded that economy , or even noticed it . At any rate , [our]775-we joint dinner to [the Royal Personage]778-the royal personage gradually assumed the aspect of a yearly function . Indeed , it grew larger and larger , until it became a sort of closing function for the season , at any rate , as far as [we]775-we were concerned . [I]0-i do n't in the least mean to say that [we]775-we were [the sort of persons who aspired to mix " with [royalty]3087-royalty]3086-the sort of persons who aspired to mix " with royalty . "[775-we] [We]775-we did n't ; [we]775-we had n't any claims ; [we]775-we were just " [good people]3088-good people . "[775-we] But [the Grand Duke]771-the grand duke was [a pleasant , affable sort of royalty]780-a pleasant , affable sort of royalty , like [the late King Edward VII]211-the late king edward vii , and it was pleasant to hear [him]771-the grand duke talk about the races and , very occasionally , as [a bonne bouche]781-a bonne bouche , about [[his]771-the grand duke nephew]782-his nephew , [the Emperor]783-the emperor ; or to have [him]771-the grand duke pause for a moment in [his]771-the grand duke walk to ask after the progress of [our]775-we cures or to be benignantly interested in the amount of money [we]775-we had put on [Leloffel]207-count baron idigon von leloffel 's hunter for [the Frankfurt Welter Stakes]784-the frankfurt welter stakes . But upon [my]0-i word , [I]0-i do n't know how [we]775-we put in [our]775-we time . How does [one]417-one put in [one]417-one 's time ? How is it possible to have achieved nine years and to have nothing whatever to show for it ? Nothing whatever , [you]787-you understand . Not so much as a bone penholder , carved to resemble [a chessman]788-a chessman and with a hole in the top through which [you]787-you could see four views of [Nauheim]6-nauheim . And , as for experience , as for knowledge of [one 's fellow beings]789-one 's fellow beings - nothing either . Upon [my]0-i word , [I]0-i could n't tell [you]787-you offhand whether [the lady who sold the so expensive violets at [the bottom of [the road]792-the road that leads to [the station]793-the station]791-the bottom of the road that leads to the station]790-the lady who sold the so expensive violets at the bottom of the road that leads to the station was cheating [me]0-i or no ; [I]0-i ca n't say whether [the porter who carried [our]775-we traps across [the station]793-the station at [Leghorn]46-leghorn]794-the porter who carried our traps across the station at leghorn was [a thief]796-a thief or no when [he]794-the porter who carried our traps across the station at leghorn said that the regular tariff was a lira a parcel . The instances of honesty that [one]417-one comes across in [this world]798-this world are just as amazing as the instances of dishonesty . After forty - five years of mixing with [one]417-one 's kind , [one]417-one ought to have acquired the habit of being able to know something about [one 's fellow beings]789-one 's fellow beings . But [one]417-one does n't . [I]0-i think the modern civilized habit - the modern English habit - of taking [everyone]803-everyone for granted is a good deal to blame for this . [I]0-i have observed this matter long enough to know the queer , subtle thing that it is ; to know how [the faculty]804-the faculty , for what it is worth , never lets [you]805-you down . Mind , [I]0-i am not saying that this is not the most desirable type of life in [the world]392-the world ; that it is not an almost unreasonably high standard . For it is really nauseating , when [you]805-you detest it , to have to eat every day several slices of thin , tepid , pink india rubber , and it is disagreeable to have to drink brandy when [you]805-you would prefer to be cheered up by warm , sweet Kummel . And it is nasty to have to take a cold bath in the morning when what [you]805-you want is really a hot one at night . And it stirs a little of the faith of [[your]805-you fathers]807-your fathers that is deep down within [you]805-you to have to have it taken for granted that [you]805-you are [an Episcopalian]808-an episcopalian when really [you]805-you are [an old - fashioned Philadelphia Quaker]809-an old - fashioned philadelphia quaker . But these things have to be done ; it is the cock that [the whole of [this society]811-this society]810-the whole of this society owes to [Aesculapius]212-aesculapius . And the odd , queer thing is that the whole collection of rules applies to [anybody]333-anybody - to the anybodies that [you]805-you meet in [hotels]813-hotels , in [railway trains]814-railway trains , to a less degree , perhaps , in [steamers]815-steamers , but even , in the end , upon [steamers]815-steamers . [You]805-you meet [a man]3062-a man or [a woman]686-a woman and , from tiny and intimate sounds , from the slightest of movements , [you]805-you know at once whether [you]805-you are concerned with [good people]3088-good people or with [those who wo n't do]820-those who wo n't do . [You]805-you know , that is to say , whether [they]821-they will go rigidly through with the whole programme from the underdone beef to the Anglicanism . It wo n't matter whether [they]821-they be short or tall ; whether the voice squeak like a marionette or rumble like a town bull 's ; it wo n't matter whether [they]821-they are [Germans]213-germans , [Austrians]214-austrians , French , Spanish , or even [Brazilians]822-brazilians - [they]821-they will be [the Germans]823-the germans or [Brazilians who take a cold bath every morning and who move , roughly speaking , in diplomatic circles]824-brazilians who take a cold bath every morning and who move , roughly speaking , in diplomatic circles . But the inconvenient - well , hang it all , [I]0-i will say it - the damnable nuisance of the whole thing is , that with all the taking for granted , [you]805-you never really get an inch deeper than the things [I]0-i have catalogued . [I]0-i can give [you]805-you a rather extraordinary instance of this . [I]0-i ca n't remember whether it was in [our]825-our first year - the first year of [us]825-our four at [Nauheim]6-nauheim , because , of course , it would have been the fourth year of [Florence]182-florence and [myself]0-i - but it must have been in the first or second year . And that gives the measure at once of the extraordinariness of [our]825-our discussion and of the swiftness with which intimacy had grown up between [us]825-our . On the one hand [we]825-our seemed to start out on the expedition so naturally and with so little preparation that it was as if [we]825-our must have made many such excursions before ; and [our]825-our intimacy seemed so deep .... Yet the place to which [we]825-our went was obviously one to which [Florence]182-florence at least would have wanted to take [us]825-our quite early , so that [you]805-you would almost think [we]825-our should have gone there together at the beginning of [our]825-our intimacy . [Florence]182-florence was singularly expert as [a guide to archaeological exceptions]826-a guide to archaeological exceptions and there was nothing [she]182-florence liked so much as taking [people]507-people round ruins and showing [you]805-you the window from which [someone]369-someone looked down upon the murder of [someone else]829-someone else . [She]182-florence only did it once ; but [she]182-florence did it quite magnificently . [She]182-florence could find [her]182-florence way , with the sole help of [Baedeker]215-baedeker , as easily about [any old monument]830-any old monument as [she]182-florence could about [any American city where [the blocks are all square]832-the blocks are all square and [the streets]833-the streets all numbered , so that [you]805-you can go perfectly easily from [Twenty - fourth]78-twenty - fourth to [Thirtieth]79-thirtieth]831-any american city where the blocks are all square and the streets all numbered , so that you can go perfectly easily from twenty - fourth to thirtieth . Now it happens that fifty minutes away from [Nauheim]6-nauheim , by [a good train]834-a good train , is [the ancient city of M]835-the ancient city of m - , upon a great pinnacle of basalt , girt with [a triple road]836-a triple road running sideways up [its]836-a triple road shoulder like a scarf . And at the top there is [a castle]837-a castle - not [a square castle like [Windsor]80-windsor]838-a square castle like windsor - but [a castle all slate gables and high peaks with gilt weathercocks]839-a castle all slate gables and high peaks with gilt weathercocks flashing bravely - [the castle of St. Elizabeth of [Hungary]81-hungary]840-the castle of st. elizabeth of hungary . [It]839-a castle all slate gables and high peaks with gilt weathercocks has the disadvantage of being in [Prussia]82-prussia ; and it is always disagreeable to go into [that country]841-that country ; but [it]839-a castle all slate gables and high peaks with gilt weathercocks is very old and there are many double - spired churches and [it]839-a castle all slate gables and high peaks with gilt weathercocks stands up like a pyramid out of [the green valley of [the Lahn]83-the lahn]842-the green valley of the lahn . [I]0-i do n't suppose [the Ashburnhams]178-the ashburnhams wanted especially to go [there]363-there and [I]0-i did n't especially want to go [there]363-there [myself]0-i . But , [you]845-you understand , there was no objection . It was part of the cure to make an excursion three or four times a week . So that [we]846-we were all quite unanimous in being grateful to [Florence]182-florence for providing the motive power . [Florence]182-florence , of course , had a motive of [her]182-florence own . [She]182-florence was at that time engaged in educating [Captain Ashburnham]179-captain ashburnham - oh , of course , quite pour le bon motif ! [She]182-florence used to say to [Leonora]183-leonora : " [I]182-florence simply ca n't understand how [you]183-leonora can let [him]179-captain ashburnham live by [your]183-leonora side and be so ignorant ! "[182-florence] [Leonora]183-leonora [herself]183-leonora always struck [me]0-i as being remarkably well educated . Perhaps [she]182-florence got it up out of [Baedeker]215-baedeker before [Florence]182-florence was up in the morning . [I]0-i do n't mean to say that [you]847-you would ever have known that [Leonora]183-leonora knew anything , but if [Florence]182-florence started to tell [us]848-us how [Ludwig the Courageous]216-ludwig the courageous wanted to have [three wives]849-three wives at once - in which [he]850-he differed from [Henry VIII]217-henry viii , who wanted [them]849-three wives one after the other , and this caused a good deal of trouble - if [Florence]182-florence started to tell [us]848-us this , [Leonora]183-leonora would just nod [her]183-leonora head in a way that quite pleasantly rattled [[my]0-i poor wife]851-my poor wife . "[183-leonora] And [Leonora]183-leonora would look reflectively at [[her]183-leonora husband]509-her husband and say : " [I]183-leonora have an idea that it might injure [his]179-captain ashburnham hand - the hand , [you]509-her husband know , used in connection with horses ' mouths .... "[179-captain ashburnham] [I]0-i fancy [[his]509-her husband wife]388-his wife 's irony did quite alarm poor [Teddy]211-the late king edward vii ; because one evening [he]509-her husband asked [me]0-i seriously in [the smoking - room]396-the smoking - room if [I]0-i thought that having too much in [one]417-one 's head would really interfere with [one]417-one 's quickness in polo . It struck [him]509-her husband , [he]509-her husband said , that [brainy Johnnies]218-brainy johnnies generally were rather muffs when [they]218-brainy johnnies got on to four legs .
