At that time [the Captain]740-the captain was quite evidently enjoying being educated by [Florence]182-florence . [She]182-florence used to do it about three or four times a week under the approving eyes of [Leonora]183-leonora and [myself]0-i . It was n't , [you]858-you understand , systematic . It came in bursts . [It]859-it was [Florence]182-florence clearing up [one of [the dark places of the earth]861-the dark places of the earth]860-one of the dark places of the earth , leaving [the world]392-the world a little lighter than [she]182-florence had found it . [She]182-florence would tell [him]509-her husband the story of [Hamlet]219-hamlet ; explain the form of a symphony , humming the first and second subjects to [him]509-her husband , and so on ; [she]182-florence would explain to [him]509-her husband the difference between [Armenians]220-armenians and [Erastians]221-erastians ; or [she]182-florence would give [him]509-her husband a short lecture on the early history of the [United States]121-the united states . And it was done in a way well calculated to arrest [a young attention]863-a young attention . Did [you]858-you ever read [Mrs. Markham]222-mrs. markham ? Well , it was like that .... But [our]864-our excursion to M - was a much larger , a much more full - dress affair . [You]858-you see , in the archives of [the Schloss in [that city]866-that city]865-the schloss in that city there was a document which [Florence]182-florence thought would finally give [her]182-florence the chance to educate [the whole lot of [us]864-our]867-the whole lot of us together . It really worried [poor Florence]182-florence that [she]182-florence could n't , in matters of culture , ever get the better of [Leonora]183-leonora . [I]0-i do n't know what [Leonora]183-leonora knew or what [she]183-leonora did n't know but certainly [she]183-leonora was always there whenever [Florence]182-florence brought out any information . And [she]183-leonora gave , somehow , the impression of really knowing what poor [Florence]182-florence gave the impression of having only picked up . [I]0-i ca n't exactly define it . It was almost something physical . Have [you]858-you ever seen a retriever dashing in play after a greyhound ? [You]858-you see the two running over [a green field]868-a green field , almost side by side , and suddenly the retriever makes a friendly snap at the other . And the greyhound simply is n't there . [You]858-you have n't observed it quicken its speed or strain a limb ; but there it is , just two yards in front of the retriever 's outstretched muzzle . So it was with [Florence]182-florence and [Leonora]183-leonora in matters of culture . But on this occasion [I]0-i knew that something was up . [I]0-i found [Florence]182-florence some days before , reading books like [Ranke]223-ranke 's History of [the Popes]224-the popes , [Symonds]225-symonds ' Renaissance , [Motley]226-motley 's Rise of the Dutch Republic , and [Luther]227-luther 's Table Talk . [I]0-i must say that , until the astonishment came , [I]0-i got nothing but pleasure out of the little expedition . [I]0-i like catching the two - forty ; [I]0-i like the slow , smooth roll of [the great big trains]869-the great big trains - and they are the best trains in [the world]392-the world ! [I]0-i like being drawn through [the green country]871-the green country and looking at it through the clear glass of the great windows . Though , of course , [the country]872-the country is n't really green . The sun shines , [the earth]502-the earth is blood red , and purple and red , and green and red . And [the oxen]874-the oxen in [the ploughlands]875-the ploughlands are bright varnished brown and black and blackish purple ; and [the peasants]876-the peasants are dressed in the black and white of magpies ; and there are great flocks of magpies too . Or [the peasants]876-the peasants ' dresses in [another field]878-another field where there are [little mounds of hay that will be greygreen on the sunny side]879-little mounds of hay that will be greygreen on the sunny side and purple in the shadows - [the peasants]876-the peasants ' dresses are vermilion with emerald - green ribbons and purple skirts and white shirts and black velvet stomachers . Still , the impression is that [you]881-you are drawn through brilliant green meadows that run away on each side to [the dark purple fir - woods]882-the dark purple fir - woods ; [the basalt pinnacles]883-the basalt pinnacles ; [the immense forests]884-the immense forests . And there is meadowsweet at [the edge of [the streams]886-the streams]885-the edge of the streams , and cattle . Why , [I]0-i remember on that afternoon [I]0-i saw a brown cow hitch its horns under the stomach of a black and white animal and [the black and white one]887-the black and white one was thrown right into the middle of [a narrow stream]888-a narrow stream . [I]0-i burst out laughing . But [Florence]182-florence was imparting information so hard and [Leonora]183-leonora was listening so intently that [no one]889-no one noticed [me]0-i . As for [me]0-i , [I]0-i was pleased to be off duty ; [I]0-i was pleased to think that [Florence]182-florence for the moment was indubitably out of mischief - because [she]182-florence was talking about [Ludwig the Courageous]216-ludwig the courageous [I]0-i think it was [Ludwig the Courageous]216-ludwig the courageous but [I]0-i am not [an historian]890-an historian , about [Ludwig the Courageous of Hessen]216-ludwig the courageous , who wanted to have [three wives]849-three wives at once and patronized [Luther]227-luther - something like that ! - [I]0-i was so relieved to be off duty , because [she]182-florence could n't possibly be doing anything to excite [herself]182-florence or set [her]182-florence poor heart a - fluttering - that the incident of the cow was a real joy to [me]0-i . [I]0-i chuckled over it from time to time for the whole rest of the day . Because it does look very funny , [you]892-you know , to see a black and white cow land on its back in the middle of [a stream]893-a stream . It is so just exactly what [one]417-one does n't expect of a cow . [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i ought to have pitied the poor animal ; but [I]0-i just did n't . [I]0-i was out for enjoyment . And [I]0-i just enjoyed [myself]0-i . It is so pleasant to be drawn along in front of [the spectacular towns with [the peaked castle]896-the peaked castle]895-the spectacular towns with the peaked castle and the many double spires . In the sunlight , gleams come from [the city]897-the city - gleams from the glass of windows ; from the gilt signs of apothecaries ; from the ensigns of [the student corps]898-the student corps high up in [the mountains]899-the mountains ; from the helmets of [the funny little soldiers moving [their]900-the funny little soldiers moving their stiff little legs in white linen trousers stiff little legs in white linen trousers]900-the funny little soldiers moving their stiff little legs in white linen trousers . And it was pleasant to get out in [the great big spectacular Prussian station]901-the great big spectacular prussian station with the hammered bronze ornaments and the paintings of [peasants]902-peasants and flowers and cows ; and to hear [Florence]182-florence bargain energetically with the driver of [an ancient droshky drawn by two lean horses]903-an ancient droshky drawn by two lean horses . Of course , [I]0-i spoke German much more correctly than [Florence]182-florence , though [I]0-i never could rid [myself]0-i quite of the accent of the Pennsylvania Duitsch of [my]0-i childhood . Anyhow , [we]904-we were drawn in a sort of triumph , for five marks without any trinkgeld , right up to [the castle]905-the castle . And [we]904-we were taken though [the museum]906-the museum and saw the firebacks , the old glass , the old swords , and the antique contraptions . And [we]904-we went up [winding corkscrew staircases]907-winding corkscrew staircases and through [the Rittersaal]908-the rittersaal , [the great painted hall where [the Reformer]910-the reformer and [[his]910-the reformer friends]911-his friends met for the first time under the protection of [the gentleman that had [three wives at once]913-three wives at once and formed an alliance with [the gentleman]914-the gentleman that had [six wives]915-six wives]912-the gentleman that had three wives at once and formed an alliance with the gentleman that had six wives]909-the great painted hall where the reformer and his friends met for the first time under the protection of the gentleman that had three wives at once and formed an alliance with the gentleman that had six wives , one after the other [I]0-i 'm not really interested in these facts but they have a bearing on [my]0-i story . And [we]904-we went through [chapels]916-chapels , and [music rooms]917-music rooms , right up immensely high in the air to [a large old chamber , full of presses , with heavily shuttered windows all round]918-a large old chamber , full of presses , with heavily shuttered windows all round . And [Florence]182-florence became positively electric . [She]182-florence told [the tired , bored custodian]919-the tired , bored custodian what shutters to open ; so that the bright sunlight streamed in palpable shafts into [the dim old chamber]920-the dim old chamber . [She]182-florence explained that this was [[Luther]227-luther 's bedroom]921-luther 's bedroom and that just where the sunlight fell had stood [his]227-luther bed . As a matter of fact , [I]0-i believe that [she]182-florence was wrong and that [Luther]227-luther only stopped , as it were , for lunch , in order to evade pursuit . But , no doubt , it would have been [[his]227-luther bedroom]922-his bedroom if [he]227-luther could have been persuaded to stop the night . And then , in spite of the protest of [the custodian]923-the custodian , [she]182-florence threw open another shutter and came tripping back to a large glass case . " And there , "[182-florence] [she]182-florence exclaimed with an accent of gaiety , of triumph , and of audacity . [She]182-florence was pointing at a piece of paper , like the half - sheet of a letter with some faint pencil scrawls that might have been a jotting of the amounts [we]924-we were spending during the day . And [I]0-i was extremely happy at [her]182-florence gaiety , in [her]182-florence triumph , in [her]182-florence audacity . [Captain Ashburnham]179-captain ashburnham had [his]179-captain ashburnham hands upon the glass case . " There it is - the Protest . "[179-captain ashburnham] And then , as [we]924-we all properly stage - managed [our]924-we bewilderment , [she]182-florence continued : " Do n't [you]0-i know that is why [we]924-we were all called [Protestants]228-protestants ? That is the pencil draft of the Protest [they]228-protestants drew up . [You]0-i can see the signatures of [Martin Luther]227-luther , and [Martin Bucer]229-martin bucer , and [Zwingli]230-zwingli , and [Ludwig the Courageous]3089-ludwig the courageous .... "[182-florence] [I]0-i may have got some of the names wrong , but [I]0-i know that [Luther]227-luther and [Bucer]229-martin bucer were there . And [her]182-florence animation continued and [I]0-i was glad . [She]182-florence was better and [she]182-florence was out of mischief . [She]182-florence continued , looking up into [Captain Ashburnham]179-captain ashburnham 's eyes : " It 's because of that piece of paper that [you]0-i 're honest , sober , industrious , provident , and clean - lived . If it were n't for that piece of paper [you]0-i 'd be like [the Irish]231-the irish or [the Italians]232-the italians or the Poles , but particularly the Irish .... "[182-florence] And [she]182-florence laid one finger upon [Captain Ashburnham]179-captain ashburnham 's wrist . [I]0-i was aware of something treacherous , something frightful , something evil in the day . [I]0-i ca n't define it and ca n't find a simile for it . It was n't as if a snake had looked out of a hole . No , it was as if [my]0-i heart had missed a beat . It was as if [we]925-we were going to run and cry out ; all four of [us]925-we in separate directions , averting [our]925-we heads . In [Ashburnham]179-captain ashburnham 's face [I]0-i know that there was absolute panic . [I]0-i was horribly frightened and then [I]0-i discovered that the pain in [my]0-i left wrist was caused by [Leonora]183-leonora 's clutching it . " [I]182-florence ca n't stand this , "[182-florence] [she]182-florence said with a most extraordinary passion ; " [I]182-florence must get out of this . "[182-florence] [I]0-i was horribly frightened . It came to [me]0-i for a moment , though [I]0-i had n't time to think it , that [she]182-florence must be [a madly jealous woman]926-a madly jealous woman - jealous of [Florence]182-florence and [Captain Ashburnham]179-captain ashburnham , of [all people in [the world]392-the world]927-all people in the world ! And it was a panic in which [we]925-we fled ! [We]925-we went right down [the winding stairs]929-the winding stairs , across [the immense Rittersaal]930-the immense rittersaal to [a little terrace that overlooks [the Lahn]83-the lahn , [the broad valley]932-the broad valley and [the immense plain into which]933-the immense plain into which [it]931-a little terrace that overlooks the lahn , the broad valley and the immense plain into which it opens out opens out]931-a little terrace that overlooks the lahn , the broad valley and the immense plain into which it opens out . " Do n't [you]0-i see ? "[182-florence] [she]182-florence said , " do n't [you]0-i see what 's going on ? "[182-florence] The panic again stopped [my]0-i heart . [I]0-i muttered , [I]0-i stuttered - [I]0-i do n't know how [I]0-i got the words out : " No ! What 's the matter ? Whatever 's the matter ? "[0-i] [She]182-florence looked [me]0-i straight in the eyes ; and for a moment [I]0-i had the feeling that those two blue discs were immense , were overwhelming , were like a wall of blue that shut [me]0-i off from the rest of [the world]392-the world . [I]0-i know it sounds absurd ; but that is what it did feel like . " Do n't [you]0-i see , "[182-florence] [she]182-florence said , with a really horrible bitterness , with a really horrible lamentation in [her]182-florence voice , " Do n't [you]0-i see that that 's the cause of the whole miserable affair ; of the whole sorrow of [the world]392-the world ? And of the eternal damnation of [you]0-i and [me]182-florence and [them]3091-them . . . . "[182-florence] [I]0-i do n't remember how [she]182-florence went on ; [I]0-i was too frightened ; [I]0-i was too amazed . [I]0-i think [I]0-i was thinking of running to fetch assistance - [a doctor]935-a doctor , perhaps , or [Captain Ashburnham]179-captain ashburnham . But [I]0-i know that when [I]0-i came out of it [she]182-florence was saying : " Oh , where are [all the bright , happy , innocent beings in [the world]392-the world]3092-all the bright , happy , innocent beings in the world ? Where 's happiness ? [One]417-one reads of it in books ! "[182-florence] [She]182-florence ran [her]182-florence hand with a singular clawing motion upwards over [her]182-florence forehead . [Her]182-florence eyes were enormously distended ; [her]182-florence face was exactly that of [a person looking into the pit of hell and seeing horrors there]936-a person looking into the pit of hell and seeing horrors there . And then suddenly [she]182-florence stopped . [She]182-florence was , most amazingly , just [Mrs. Ashburnham]180-branshaw again . [Her]182-florence face was perfectly clear , sharp , and defined ; [her]182-florence hair was glorious in its golden coils . [Her]182-florence nostrils twitched with a sort of contempt . [She]182-florence appeared to look with interest at [a gypsy caravan that was coming]937-a gypsy caravan that was coming over a little bridge far below [us]938-us . " Do n't [you]0-i know , "[182-florence] [she]182-florence said , in [her]182-florence clear hard voice , " do n't [you]0-i know that [I]182-florence 'm [an Irish Catholic]3095-an irish catholic ? "[182-florence] THOSE WORDS gave [me]0-i the greatest relief that [I]0-i have ever had in [my]0-i life . [They]939-they told [me]0-i , [I]0-i think , almost more than [I]0-i have ever gathered at any one moment - about [myself]0-i . [I]0-i do n't think that before that day [I]0-i had ever wanted anything very much except [Florence]182-florence . [I]0-i have , of course , had appetites , impatiences .... Why , sometimes at a table d'hote , when there would be , say , caviare handed round , [I]0-i have been absolutely full of impatience for fear that when the dish came to [me]0-i there should not be a satisfying portion left over by [the other guests]940-the other guests . [I]0-i have been exceedingly impatient at missing [trains]941-trains . [The Belgian State Railway]86-the belgian state railway has a trick of letting [the French trains]942-the french trains miss [their]942-the french trains connections at [Brussels]87-brussels . That has always infuriated [me]0-i . [I]0-i have written about it letters to the Times that the Times never printed ; those that [I]0-i wrote to the [Paris]3-paris edition of [the New [York]75-york Herald]88-the new york herald were always printed , but they never seemed to satisfy [me]0-i when [I]0-i saw [them]943-them . Well , that was a sort of frenzy with [me]0-i . It was a frenzy that now [I]0-i can hardly realize . [I]0-i can understand it intellectually . [You]944-you see , in those days [I]0-i was interested in [people with " hearts]3096-people with " hearts . "[944-you] There was [Florence]182-florence , there was [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward - or , perhaps , it was [Leonora]183-leonora that [I]0-i was more interested in . [I]0-i do n't mean in the way of love . But , [you]944-you see , [we]945-we were both of the same profession - at any rate as [I]0-i saw it . And the profession was that of keeping [heart patients]946-heart patients alive . [You]944-you have no idea how engrossing such a profession may become . Just as [the blacksmith]947-the blacksmith says : " By hammer and hand all Art doth stand , "[947-the blacksmith] just as [the baker]948-the baker thinks that all the solar system revolves around [his]948-the baker morning delivery of rolls ; as [the postmaster general]949-the postmaster general believes that [he]949-the postmaster general alone is [the preserver of society]950-the preserver of society - and surely , surely , these delusions are necessary to keep [us]945-we going - so did [I]0-i and , as [I]0-i believed , [Leonora]183-leonora imagine that [the whole world]479-the whole world ought to be arranged so as to ensure the keeping alive of [heart patients]946-heart patients . [You]944-you have no idea how engrossing such a profession may become - how imbecile , in view of that engrossment , appear the ways of [princes]953-princes , of [republics]954-republics , of [municipalities]955-municipalities . [A rough bit of [road]957-road beneath [the motor tires]958-the motor tires]956-a rough bit of road beneath the motor tires , a couple of succeeding " thank'ee - marms "[959-their] with [their]959-their quick jolts , would be enough to set [me]0-i grumbling to [Leonora]183-leonora against [the Prince]960-the prince or [the Grand Duke]771-the grand duke or [the Free City through whose territory [we]945-we might be passing]962-the free city through whose territory we might be passing . [I]0-i would grumble like [a stockbroker whose conversations over the telephone are incommoded by the ringing of bells from a city church]963-a stockbroker whose conversations over the telephone are incommoded by the ringing of bells from a city church . [I]0-i would talk about mediaeval survivals , about the taxes being surely high enough . The point , by the way , about the missing of the connections of [the [Calais]89-calais [boat trains]965-boat trains at [Brussels]87-brussels]964-the calais boat trains at brussels was that the shortest possible sea journey is frequently of great importance to [sufferers]966-sufferers from the heart . Now , on [the Continent]90-the continent , there are [two special heart - cure places , [Nauheim]6-nauheim and [Spa]91-spa]967-two special heart - cure places , nauheim and spa , and to reach [both of these baths]968-both of these baths from [England]1-england if , in order to ensure a short sea passage , [you]969-you come by [Calais]89-calais - [you]969-you have to make the connection at [Brussels]87-brussels . And [the Belgian train]970-the belgian train never waits by so much as the shade of a second for the one coming from [Calais]89-calais or from [Paris]3-paris . And even if [the French trains]942-the french trains are just on time , [you]969-you have to run - imagine [a heart patient]972-a heart patient running ! - along the unfamiliar ways of [the Brussels station]973-the brussels station and to scramble up the high steps of [the moving train]974-the moving train . Or , if [you]969-you miss the connection , [you]969-you have to wait five or six hours .... [I]0-i used to keep awake whole nights cursing that abuse . [[My]0-i wife]332-my wife used to run - [she]332-my wife never , in whatever else [she]332-my wife may have misled [me]0-i , tried to give [me]0-i the impression that [she]332-my wife was not [a gallant soul]976-a gallant soul . But , once in the German Express , [she]332-my wife would lean back , with one hand to [her]332-my wife side and [her]332-my wife eyes closed . Well , [she]332-my wife was [a good actress]977-a good actress . And [I]0-i would be in [hell]978-hell . In hell , [I]0-i tell [you]969-you . For in [Florence]182-florence [I]0-i had at once [a wife]979-a wife and [an unattained mistress]980-an unattained mistress - that is what it comes to - and in the retaining of [her]332-my wife in [this world]798-this world [I]0-i had [my]0-i occupation , [my]0-i career , [my]0-i ambition . [I]0-i tell [you]969-you , [she]183-leonora would listen to [me]0-i by the hour , evolving [my]0-i plans for [a shock - proof world]983-a shock - proof world . [She]234-mrs. maidan was a nice little thing , [a dear little dark woman with long lashes]1026-a dear little dark woman with long lashes , of whom [Florence]182-florence grew quite fond . [We]1027-we saw plenty of [her]234-mrs. maidan for the first month of [our]1027-we acquaintance , then [she]234-mrs. maidan died , quite quietly - of heart trouble . But [you]1028-you know , poor little [Mrs. Maidan]234-mrs. maidan - [she]234-mrs. maidan was so gentle , so young . [Such young things]1030-such young things ought to have been left alone . Of course [Ashburnham]189-edward could not leave [her]234-mrs. maidan alone . [I]0-i do not believe that [he]189-edward could . Why , even [I]0-i , at this distance of time , am aware that [I]0-i am a little in love with [her]234-mrs. maidan memory . [She]234-mrs. maidan was so - so submissive . Why , even to [me]0-i [she]234-mrs. maidan had the air of being submissive - to [me]0-i that not [the youngest child]1032-the youngest child will ever pay heed to . Yes , this is the saddest story .... No , [I]0-i can not help wishing that [Florence]182-florence had left [her]234-mrs. maidan alone - with [her]234-mrs. maidan playing with adultery . [I]0-i suppose it was ; though [she]234-mrs. maidan was such [a child]1033-a child that [one]417-one has the impression that [she]234-mrs. maidan would hardly have known how to spell such a word . No , it was just submissiveness - to the importunities , to the tempestuous forces that pushed [that miserable fellow]1035-that miserable fellow on to ruin . And [I]0-i do not suppose that [Florence]182-florence really made much difference . If it had not been for [her]234-mrs. maidan that [Ashburnham]189-edward left [his]189-edward allegiance for [Mrs. Maidan]234-mrs. maidan , then it would have been [some other woman]1036-some other woman . But still , [I]0-i do not know . Perhaps [the poor young thing]1037-the poor young thing would have died - [she]234-mrs. maidan was bound to die , anyhow , quite soon - but [she]234-mrs. maidan would have died without having to soak [her]234-mrs. maidan noonday pillow with tears whilst [Florence]182-florence , below the window , talked to [Captain Ashburnham]179-captain ashburnham about the Constitution of [the United States]1038-the united states .... Yes , it would have left a better taste in the mouth if [Florence]182-florence had let [her]182-florence die in peace .... [Leonora]183-leonora behaved better in a sense . [She]183-leonora just boxed [Mrs. Maidan]234-mrs. maidan 's ears - yes , [she]183-leonora hit [her]234-mrs. maidan , in an uncontrollable access of rage , a hard blow on the side of the cheek , in [the corridor of [the hotel]1040-the hotel]1039-the corridor of the hotel , outside [[Edward]189-edward 's room]1041-edward 's room . It was that , [you]1042-you know , that accounted for the sudden , odd intimacy that sprang up between [Florence]182-florence and [Mrs. Ashburnham]180-branshaw . Because it was , of course , an odd intimacy . If [you]1042-you look at it from the outside nothing could have been more unlikely than that [Leonora]183-leonora , who is [the proudest creature on [[God]188-god 's earth]1044-god 's earth]1043-the proudest creature on god 's earth , would have struck up an acquaintanceship with [two casual Yankees whom [she]183-leonora could not really have regarded as being much more than a carpet beneath [her]183-leonora feet]1045-two casual yankees whom she could not really have regarded as being much more than a carpet beneath her feet . [You]1042-you may ask what [she]183-leonora had to be proud of . Well , [she]183-leonora was [a Powys]353-a powys married to an [Ashburnham]179-captain ashburnham - [I]0-i suppose that gave [her]183-leonora the right to despise [casual Americans]1047-casual americans as long as [she]183-leonora did it unostentatiously . [I]0-i do n't know what [anyone]1048-anyone has to be proud of . [She]183-leonora might have taken pride in [her]183-leonora patience , in [her]183-leonora keeping [[her]183-leonora husband]509-her husband out of [the bankruptcy court]1050-the bankruptcy court . Perhaps [she]183-leonora did . At any rate that was how [Florence]182-florence got to know [her]183-leonora . [She]182-florence came round a screen at the corner of [the hotel corridor]1051-the hotel corridor and found [Leonora]183-leonora with the gold key that hung from [her]183-leonora wrist caught in [Mrs. Maidan]234-mrs. maidan 's hair just before dinner . There was not a single word spoken . [Little Mrs. Maidan]234-mrs. maidan was very pale , with a red mark down [her]234-mrs. maidan left cheek , and the key would not come out of [her]234-mrs. maidan black hair . It was [Florence]182-florence who had to disentangle it , for [Leonora]183-leonora was in such a state that [she]183-leonora could not have brought [herself]183-leonora to touch [Mrs. Maidan]234-mrs. maidan without growing sick . And there was not a word spoken . [You]1052-you see , under those four eyes - [her]183-leonora own and [Mrs. Maidan]234-mrs. maidan 's - [Leonora]183-leonora could just let [herself]183-leonora go as far as to box [Mrs. Maidan]234-mrs. maidan 's ears . But the moment [a stranger]1053-a stranger came along [she]183-leonora pulled [herself]183-leonora wonderfully up . [She]183-leonora was at first silent and then , the moment the key was disengaged by [Florence]182-florence , [she]183-leonora was in a state to say : " So awkward of [me]183-leonora . . . [I]183-leonora was just trying to put the comb straight in [Mrs. Maidan]234-mrs. maidan 's hair .... "[183-leonora] [Mrs. Maidan]234-mrs. maidan , however , was not [a Powys]353-a powys married to [an Ashburnham]1055-an ashburnham ; [she]234-mrs. maidan was [a poor little O'Flaherty whose husband]1056-a poor little o'flaherty whose husband was [a boy of country - parsonage origin]1057-a boy of country - parsonage origin . So there was no mistaking the sob that [she]234-mrs. maidan let go as [she]234-mrs. maidan went desolately away along [the corridor]1058-the corridor . But [Leonora]183-leonora was still going to play up . [She]183-leonora opened the door of [[Ashburnham]189-edward 's room]1059-ashburnham 's room quite ostentatiously , so that [Florence]182-florence should hear [her]183-leonora address [Edward]189-edward in terms of intimacy and liking . " [Edward]189-edward , "[183-leonora] [she]183-leonora called . But there was no [Edward]189-edward there . [You]1060-you understand that there was no [Edward]189-edward there . It was then , for the only time of [her]183-leonora career , that [Leonora]183-leonora really compromised [herself]183-leonora - [she]183-leonora exclaimed : " How frightful ! . . . Poor little [Maisie]235-maisie ! . . . "[183-leonora] [She]183-leonora caught [herself]183-leonora up at that , but of course it was too late . It was a queer sort of affair .... [I]0-i want to do [Leonora]183-leonora every justice . [I]0-i love [her]183-leonora very dearly for one thing , and in this matter , which was certainly the ruin of [my]0-i small household cockleshell , [she]183-leonora certainly tripped up . [I]0-i do not believe - and [Leonora]183-leonora [herself]183-leonora does not believe - that poor little [Maisie Maidan]235-maisie was ever [[Edward]189-edward 's mistress]1061-edward 's mistress . [Her]183-leonora heart was really so bad that [she]183-leonora would have succumbed to anything like an impassioned embrace . That is the plain English of it , and [I]0-i suppose plain English is best . [She]183-leonora was really what [the other two]1062-the other two , for reasons of [their]1062-the other two own , just pretended to be . Queer , is n't it ? Like one of those sinister jokes that [Providence]236-providence plays upon one . Add to this that [I]0-i do not suppose that [Leonora]183-leonora would much have minded , at any other moment , if [Mrs. Maidan]234-mrs. maidan had been [[[her]183-leonora husband]509-her husband 's mistress]1064-her husband 's mistress . It might have been a relief from [Edward]189-edward 's sentimental gurglings over [the lady]518-the lady and from [the lady]518-the lady 's submissive acceptance of those sounds . No , [she]183-leonora would not have minded . But in [boxing Mrs. Maidan]234-mrs. maidan 's ears [Leonora]183-leonora was just striking the face of [an intolerable universe]1067-an intolerable universe . For that afternoon [she]183-leonora had had a frightfully painful scene with [Edward]189-edward . As far as [his]189-edward letters went , [she]183-leonora claimed the right to open them when [she]183-leonora chose . [She]183-leonora arrogated to [herself]183-leonora that right because [Edward]189-edward 's affairs were in such a frightful state and [he]189-edward lied so about them that [she]183-leonora claimed the privilege of having [his]189-edward secrets at [her]183-leonora disposal . There was not , indeed , any other way , for [the poor fool]1068-the poor fool was too ashamed of [his]189-edward lapses ever to make a clean breast of anything . [She]183-leonora had to drag these things out of [him]189-edward . It must have been a pretty elevating job for [her]183-leonora . But that afternoon , [Edward]189-edward being on [his]189-edward bed for the hour and a half prescribed by [the Kur authorities]636-the kur authorities , [she]183-leonora had opened a letter that [she]183-leonora took to come from [a Colonel Hervey]237-a colonel hervey . [They]1070-they were going to stay with [him]189-edward in [Linlithgowshire]100-linlithgowshire for the month of September and [she]183-leonora did not know whether the date fixed would be the 11th or the 18th . The address on this letter was , in handwriting , as like [Colonel Hervey]237-a colonel hervey 's as one blade of corn is like another . So [she]183-leonora had at the moment no idea of spying on [him]189-edward . But [she]183-leonora certainly was . For [she]183-leonora discovered that [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward was paying [a blackmailer of whom [she]183-leonora had never heard something like three hundred pounds a year]1071-a blackmailer of whom she had never heard something like three hundred pounds a year .... It was a devil of a blow ; it was like death ; for [she]183-leonora imagined that by that time [she]183-leonora had really got to the bottom of [[her]183-leonora husband]509-her husband 's liabilities . [You]1073-you see , they were pretty heavy . What had really smashed them up had been a perfectly commonplace affair at [Monte Carlo]101-monte carlo - an affair with [a cosmopolitan harpy who passed for [the mistress of [a Russian Grand Duke]1076-a russian grand duke]1075-the mistress of a russian grand duke]1074-a cosmopolitan harpy who passed for the mistress of a russian grand duke . [She]183-leonora exacted a twenty - thousand - pound pearl tiara from [him]189-edward as the price of [her]183-leonora favours for a week or so . It would have pipped [him]189-edward a good deal to have found so much , and [he]189-edward was not in the ordinary way [a gambler]1077-a gambler . [He]189-edward might , indeed , just have found the twenty thousand and the not slight charges of a week at [an hotel]1078-an hotel with [the fair creature]1079-the fair creature . [He]189-edward must have been worth at that date five hundred thousand dollars and a little over . Well , [he]189-edward must needs go to the tables and lose forty thousand pounds .... Forty thousand solid pounds , borrowed from [sharks]1080-sharks ! And even after that [he]189-edward must - it was an imperative passion - enjoy the favours of [the lady]518-the lady . [He]189-edward got them , of course , when it was a matter of solid bargaining , for far less than twenty thousand , as [he]189-edward might , no doubt , have done from the first . [I]0-i dare say ten thousand dollars covered the bill . Anyhow , there was a pretty solid hole in a fortune of a hundred thousand pounds or so . And [Leonora]183-leonora had to fix things up ; [he]189-edward would have run from [money - lender]1082-money - lender to [money - lender]1082-money - lender . And that was quite in the early days of [her]183-leonora discovery of [his]189-edward infidelities - if [you]1084-you like to call them infidelities . And [she]183-leonora discovered that one from public sources . [God]188-god knows what would have happened if [she]183-leonora had not discovered it from public sources . [I]0-i suppose [he]189-edward would have concealed it from [her]183-leonora until [they]1085-they were penniless . But [she]183-leonora was able , by the grace of [God]188-god , to get hold of [the actual lenders of the money]1086-the actual lenders of the money , to learn the exact sums that were needed . And [she]183-leonora went off to [England]1-england . Yes , [she]183-leonora went right off to [England]1-england to [[her]183-leonora attorney]1087-her attorney and [his]189-edward while [he]189-edward was still in the arms of [[his]189-edward Circe]1088-his circe - at [Antibes]102-antibes , to which place [they]1085-they had retired . [He]189-edward got sick of [the lady]518-the lady quite quickly , but not before [Leonora]183-leonora had had such lessons in the art of business from [[her]183-leonora attorney]1087-her attorney that [she]183-leonora had [her]183-leonora plan as clearly drawn up as was ever that of [General Trochu]238-general trochu for keeping [the Prussians]239-the prussians out of [Paris]3-paris in 1870 . It was about as effectual at first , or it seemed so . That would have been , [you]1091-you know , in 1895 , about nine years before the date of which [I]0-i am talking - the date of [Florence]182-florence 's getting [her]183-leonora hold over [Leonora]183-leonora ; for that was what it amounted to .... Well , [Mrs. Ashburnham]180-branshaw had simply forced [Edward]189-edward to settle all [his]189-edward property upon [her]180-branshaw . [She]180-branshaw could force [him]189-edward to do anything ; in [his]189-edward clumsy , good - natured , inarticulate way [he]189-edward was as frightened of [her]180-branshaw as of the devil . And [he]189-edward admired [her]180-branshaw enormously , and [he]189-edward was as fond of [her]180-branshaw as [any man]1092-any man could be of [any woman]3070-any woman . [She]180-branshaw took advantage of it to treat [him]189-edward as if [he]189-edward had been [a person whose estates are being managed by [the court of bankruptcy]1095-the court of bankruptcy]1094-a person whose estates are being managed by the court of bankruptcy . [I]0-i suppose it was the best thing for [him]189-edward . Anyhow , [she]180-branshaw had no end of a job for the first three years or so . Unexpected liabilities kept on cropping up - and [that afflicted fool]1096-that afflicted fool did not make it any easier . [You]1097-you see , along with the passion of the chase went a frame of mind that made [him]189-edward be extraordinarily ashamed of [himself]189-edward . [You]1097-you may not believe it , but [he]189-edward really had such a sort of respect for the chastity of [Leonora]183-leonora 's imagination that [he]189-edward hated - [he]189-edward was positively revolted - at the thought that [she]180-branshaw should know that the sort of thing that [he]189-edward did existed in [the world]392-the world . So [he]189-edward would stick out in an agitated way against the accusation of ever having done anything . [He]189-edward wanted to preserve the virginity of [[his]189-edward wife]388-his wife 's thoughts . [He]189-edward told [me]0-i that [himself]189-edward during the long talks [we]1100-we had at the last - while [the girl]567-the girl was on the way to [Brindisi]71-brindisi . So , of course , for those three years or so , [Leonora]183-leonora had many agitations . And it was then that [they]1102-they really quarrelled . Yes , [they]1102-they quarrelled bitterly . That seems rather extravagant . [You]1103-you might have thought that [Leonora]183-leonora would be just calmly loathing and [he]189-edward lachrymosely contrite . But that was not it a bit .... Along with [Edward]189-edward 's passions and [his]189-edward shame for [them]1102-they went the violent conviction of the duties of [his]189-edward station - a conviction that was quite unreasonably expensive . [I]0-i trust [I]0-i have not , in talking of [his]189-edward liabilities , given the impression that poor [Edward]189-edward was [a promiscuous libertine]1104-a promiscuous libertine . [He]189-edward was not ; [he]189-edward was [a sentimentalist]1105-a sentimentalist . [The servant girl in the Kilsyte]1106-the servant girl in the kilsyte case had been pretty , but mournful of appearance . [I]0-i think that , when [he]189-edward had kissed [her]1106-the servant girl in the kilsyte , [he]189-edward had desired rather to comfort [her]1106-the servant girl in the kilsyte . [He]189-edward was quite capable of that . No , the only two of [his]189-edward affairs of the heart that cost [him]189-edward money were that of [[the Grand Duke]771-the grand duke 's mistress]1109-the grand duke 's mistress and that which was the subject of the blackmailing letter that [Leonora]183-leonora opened . That had been a quite passionate affair with quite [a nice woman]1110-a nice woman . It had succeeded the one with [the Grand Ducal lady]1111-the grand ducal lady . [The lady]518-the lady was [the wife of [a brother officer]1114-a brother officer]1113-the wife of a brother officer and [Leonora]183-leonora had known all about the passion , which had been quite a real passion and had lasted for several years . [You]1115-you see , poor [Edward]189-edward 's passions were quite logical in their progression upwards . [They]1116-they began with [a servant]1117-a servant , went on to [a courtesan]1118-a courtesan and then to [a quite nice woman]1119-a quite nice woman , very unsuitably mated . For [she]1119-a quite nice woman had [a quite nasty husband]1120-a quite nasty husband who , by means of letters and things , went on blackmailing [poor Edward]189-edward to the tune of three or four hundred a year - with threats of the divorce court . And after [this lady]1121-this lady came [Maisie Maidan]235-maisie , and after [poor Maisie]235-maisie only one more affair and then - the real passion of [his]189-edward life . [His]189-edward marriage with [Leonora]183-leonora had been arranged by [[his]189-edward parents]1122-his parents and , though [he]189-edward always admired [her]183-leonora immensely , [he]189-edward had hardly ever pretended to be much more than tender to [her]183-leonora , though [he]189-edward desperately needed [her]183-leonora moral support too .... But [his]189-edward really trying liabilities were mostly in the nature of generosities proper to [his]189-edward station . [He]189-edward was , according to [Leonora]183-leonora , always remitting [[his]189-edward tenants]1123-his tenants ' rents and giving [the tenants]1124-the tenants to understand that the reductions would be permanent ; [he]189-edward was always [redeeming drunkards who came before [[his]189-edward magisterial bench]1126-his magisterial bench]1125-redeeming drunkards who came before his magisterial bench ; [he]189-edward was always trying to put [prostitutes]1127-prostitutes into [respectable places]1128-respectable places - and [he]189-edward was [a perfect maniac about [children]1130-children]1129-a perfect maniac about children . [I]0-i do n't know how many [ill - used people [he]189-edward did not pick up and provide with careers]1131-ill - used people he did not pick up and provide with careers - [Leonora]183-leonora has told [me]0-i , but [I]0-i dare say [she]183-leonora exaggerated and the figure seems so preposterous that [I]0-i will not put it down . All these things , and the continuance of them , seemed to [him]189-edward to be [his]189-edward duty - along with impossible subscriptions to [hospitals]1132-hospitals and [boy scouts]1133-boy scouts and to provide prizes at cattle shows and antivivisection societies .... Well , [Leonora]183-leonora saw to it that most of these things were not continued . [They]1134-they could not possibly keep up [Branshaw Manor]105-branshaw manor at that rate after the money had gone to [[the Grand Duke]771-the grand duke 's mistress]1109-the grand duke 's mistress . [She]183-leonora put the rents back at [[their]1134-they old figures]1137-their old figures , discharged [the drunkards]1138-the drunkards from [[their]1138-the drunkards homes]1139-their homes , and sent [all the societies]1140-all the societies notice that [they]1140-all the societies were to expect no more subscriptions . To [the children]1141-the children [she]183-leonora was more tender ; nearly all of [them]1141-the children [she]183-leonora supported till the age of apprenticeship or domestic service . [You]1142-you see , [she]183-leonora was childless [herself]183-leonora . [She]183-leonora was childless [herself]183-leonora , and [she]183-leonora considered [herself]183-leonora to be to blame . [She]183-leonora had come of [a penniless branch of [the Powys family]1144-the powys family]1143-a penniless branch of the powys family , and [they]1143-a penniless branch of the powys family had forced [her]183-leonora upon [poor dear [Edward]189-edward]1145-poor dear edward without making the stipulation that [the children]1141-the children should be brought up as [Catholics]1147-catholics . And that , of course , was spiritual death to [Leonora]183-leonora . [I]0-i have given [you]1142-you a wrong impression if [I]0-i have not made [you]1142-you see that [Leonora]183-leonora was [a woman of a strong , cold conscience]1148-a woman of a strong , cold conscience , like [all English Catholics]1149-all english catholics . [I]0-i can not , [myself]0-i , help disliking this religion ; there is always , at the bottom of [my]0-i mind , in spite of [Leonora]183-leonora , the feeling of shuddering at [the Scarlet Woman]240-the scarlet woman , that filtered in upon [me]0-i in the tranquillity of [[the little old Friends]1150-the little old friends ' Meeting House in [Arch Street]106-arch street , [Philadelphia]10-philadelphia]1151-the little old friends ' meeting house in arch street , philadelphia . So [I]0-i do set down a good deal of [Leonora]183-leonora 's mismanagement of poor dear [Edward]189-edward 's case to the peculiarly English form of [her]183-leonora religion . Because , of course , the only thing to have done for [Edward]189-edward would have been to let [him]189-edward sink down until [he]189-edward became [a tramp of gentlemanly address]1152-a tramp of gentlemanly address , having , maybe , chance love affairs upon [the highways]1153-the highways . [He]189-edward would have done so much less harm ; [he]189-edward would have been much less agonized , too . At any rate , [he]189-edward would have had fewer chances of ruining and of remorse . For [Edward]189-edward was great at remorse . But [Leonora]183-leonora 's English Catholic conscience , [her]183-leonora rigid principles , [her]183-leonora coldness , even [her]183-leonora very patience , were , [I]0-i can not help thinking , all wrong in this special case . [She]183-leonora quite seriously and naively imagined that [the Church of [Rome]17-rome]1154-the church of rome disapproves of divorce ; [she]183-leonora quite seriously and naively believed that [[her]183-leonora church]1155-her church could be such a monstrous and imbecile institution as to expect [her]183-leonora to take on the impossible job of making [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward [a faithful husband]1156-a faithful husband . [She]183-leonora had , as [the English]1157-the english would say , the Nonconformist temperament . In [[the United States]1038-the united states of [North America]107-north america]1159-the united states of north america [we]1160-we call it the New England conscience . For , of course , that frame of mind has been driven in on [the English Catholics]241-the english catholics . The centuries that [they]241-the english catholics have gone through - centuries of blind and malignant oppression , of ostracism from public employment , of being , as it were , [a small beleaguered garrison in [a hostile country]1162-a hostile country]1161-a small beleaguered garrison in a hostile country , and therefore having to act with great formality - all these things have combined to perform that conjuring trick . And [I]0-i suppose [the Papists in [England]1-england]1163-the papists in england are even technically [Nonconformists]1164-nonconformists . [Continental Papists]1165-continental papists are [a dirty , jovial , and unscrupulous crew]1166-a dirty , jovial , and unscrupulous crew . But that , at least , lets [them]1165-continental papists be [opportunists]1167-opportunists . [They]1165-continental papists would have fixed poor dear [Edward]189-edward up all right . Forgive [my]0-i writing of these monstrous things in this frivolous manner . If [I]0-i did not [I]0-i should break down and cry . In [Milan]108-milan , say , or in [Paris]3-paris , [Leonora]183-leonora would have had [her]183-leonora marriage dissolved in six months for two hundred dollars paid in the right quarter . And [Edward]189-edward would have drifted about until [he]189-edward became [a tramp of the kind [I]0-i have suggested]1168-a tramp of the kind i have suggested . Or [he]189-edward would have married [a barmaid who would have made [him]189-edward such frightful scenes in public places and would so have torn out [his]189-edward moustache and left visible signs upon [his]189-edward face that [he]189-edward would have been faithful to [her]183-leonora for the rest of [his]189-edward days]1169-a barmaid who would have made him such frightful scenes in public places and would so have torn out his moustache and left visible signs upon his face that he would have been faithful to her for the rest of his days . That was what [he]189-edward wanted to redeem [him]189-edward .... For along with [his]189-edward passions and [his]189-edward shames there went the dread of scenes in [public places]1170-public places , of outcry , of excited physical violence ; of publicity , in short . Yes , [the barmaid]1171-the barmaid would have cured [him]189-edward . And it would have been all the better if [she]1171-the barmaid drank ; [he]189-edward would have been kept busy looking after [her]1171-the barmaid . [I]0-i know that [I]0-i am right in this . [I]0-i know it because of the [Kilsyte]233-the kilsyte case . [You]1172-you see , [the servant girl that [he]189-edward then kissed]1173-the servant girl that he then kissed was [nurse in the family of [the Nonconformist head of [the county]1176-the county]1175-the nonconformist head of the county]1174-nurse in the family of the nonconformist head of the county - whatever that post may be called . And [that gentleman]1177-that gentleman was so determined to ruin [Edward]189-edward , who was [the chairman of [the Tory caucus]1179-the tory caucus]1178-the chairman of the tory caucus , or whatever it is - that [the poor dear sufferer]1180-the poor dear sufferer had the very devil of a time . [They]1181-they asked questions about it in [the House of Commons]1182-the house of commons ; [they]1181-they tried to get [the Hampshire magistrates]1183-the hampshire magistrates degraded ; [they]1181-they suggested to the War Ministry that [Edward]189-edward was not [the proper person to hold [the King]1185-the king 's commission]1184-the proper person to hold the king 's commission . Yes , [he]189-edward got it hot and strong . The result [you]1172-you have heard . [He]189-edward was completely cured of philandering amongst [the lower classes]1186-the lower classes . And that seemed a real blessing to [Leonora]183-leonora . It did not revolt [her]183-leonora so much to be connected - it is a sort of connection - with people like [Mrs. Maidan]234-mrs. maidan , instead of with [a little kitchenmaid]1187-a little kitchenmaid . In a dim sort of way , [Leonora]183-leonora was almost contented when [she]183-leonora arrived in [Nauheim]6-nauheim , that evening .... [She]183-leonora had got things nearly straight by the long years of scraping in [little stations in [Chitral]98-chitral and [Burma]97-burma]1188-little stations in chitral and burma - stations where living is cheap in comparison with the life of [a county magnate]1189-a county magnate , and where , moreover , liaisons of one sort or another are normal and inexpensive , too . So that , when [Mrs. Maidan]234-mrs. maidan came along - and the Maidan affair might have caused trouble out there because of the youth of [the husband]513-the husband - [Leonora]183-leonora had just resigned [herself]183-leonora to coming [home]591-home . With pushing and scraping and with letting [Branshaw Teleragh]180-branshaw , and with selling a picture and a relic of Charles I or so , [she]183-leonora had got - and , poor dear , [she]183-leonora had never had a really decent dress to [her]183-leonora back in all those years and years - [she]183-leonora had got , as [she]183-leonora imagined , [[her]183-leonora poor dear husband]1192-her poor dear husband back into much the same financial position as had been [his]1192-her poor dear husband before [the mistress of [the Grand Duke]771-the grand duke]1193-the mistress of the grand duke had happened along . And , of course , [Edward]189-edward [himself]189-edward had helped [her]183-leonora a little on the financial side . [He]189-edward was [a fellow that many men]1195-a fellow that many men liked . [He]189-edward was so presentable and quite ready to lend [you]1196-you [his]189-edward cigar puncher - that sort of thing . So every now and then [some financier whom [he]189-edward met about]1197-some financier whom he met about would give [him]189-edward a good , sound , profitable tip . And [Leonora]183-leonora was never afraid of a bit of a gamble - [English Papists]1198-english papists seldom are , [I]0-i do not know why . So nearly all [her]183-leonora investments turned up trumps , and [Edward]189-edward was really in fit case to reopen [Branshaw Manor]105-branshaw manor and once more to assume [his]189-edward position in [the county]1176-the county . Thus [Leonora]183-leonora had accepted [Maisie Maidan]235-maisie almost with resignation - almost with a sigh of relief . [She]183-leonora really liked [the poor child]1200-the poor child - [she]183-leonora had to like [somebody]1201-somebody . And , at any rate , [she]183-leonora felt [she]183-leonora could trust [Maisie]235-maisie - [she]183-leonora could trust [her]235-maisie not to rook [Edward]189-edward for several thousands a week , for [Maisie]235-maisie had refused to accept so much as a trinket ring from [him]189-edward . It is true that [Edward]189-edward gurgled and raved about [the girl]567-the girl in a way that [she]567-the girl had never yet experienced . But that , too , was almost a relief . [I]0-i think [she]567-the girl would really have welcomed it if [he]189-edward could have come across the love of [his]189-edward life . It would have given [her]567-the girl a rest . And there could not have been anyone better than poor little [Mrs. Maidan]234-mrs. maidan ; [she]234-mrs. maidan was so ill [she]234-mrs. maidan could not want to be taken on expensive jaunts .... It was [Leonora]183-leonora [herself]183-leonora who paid [Maisie]235-maisie 's expenses to [Nauheim]6-nauheim . [She]183-leonora handed over the money to [the boy husband]1203-the boy husband , for [Maisie]235-maisie would never have allowed it ; but [the husband]513-the husband was in agonies of fear . [Poor devil]1018-poor devil ! [I]0-i fancy that on the voyage from [India]93-india [Leonora]183-leonora was as happy as ever [she]183-leonora had been in [her]183-leonora life . [Edward]189-edward was wrapped up , completely , in [[his]189-edward girl]1206-his girl - [he]189-edward was almost like [a father]1207-a father with [a child]1033-a child , trotting about with rugs and physic and things , from [deck]1209-deck to [deck]1209-deck . [He]189-edward behaved , however , with great circumspection , so that nothing leaked through to [the other passengers]1211-the other passengers . And [Leonora]183-leonora had almost attained to the attitude of [a mother]746-a mother towards [Mrs. Maidan]234-mrs. maidan . So it had looked very well - [the benevolent , wealthy couple of [good people]3088-good people , acting as saviours to the poor , [dark - eyed , dying young thing]1215-dark - eyed , dying young thing]1213-the benevolent , wealthy couple of good people , acting as saviours to the poor , dark - eyed , dying young thing . And that attitude of [Leonora]183-leonora 's towards [Mrs. Maidan]234-mrs. maidan no doubt partly accounted for the smack in the face . [She]183-leonora was hitting [a naughty child who had been stealing chocolates at an inopportune moment]1216-a naughty child who had been stealing chocolates at an inopportune moment . It was certainly an inopportune moment . For , with the opening of that blackmailing letter from [that injured brother officer]1217-that injured brother officer , all the old terrors had redescended upon [Leonora]183-leonora . [[Her]183-leonora road]1218-her road had again seemed to stretch out endless : [she]183-leonora imagined that there might be hundreds and hundreds of such things that [Edward]189-edward was concealing from [her]183-leonora - that they might necessitate more mortgagings , more pawnings of bracelets , more and always more horrors . [She]183-leonora had spent an excruciating afternoon . The matter was one of a divorce case , of course , and [she]183-leonora wanted to avoid publicity as much as [Edward]189-edward did , so that [she]183-leonora saw the necessity of continuing the payments . And [she]183-leonora did not so much mind that . [They]1219-they could find three hundred a year . But it was the horror of there being more such obligations . [She]183-leonora had had no conversation with [Edward]189-edward for many years - none that went beyond the mere arrangements for taking [trains]941-trains or engaging [servants]1019-servants . But that afternoon [she]183-leonora had to let [him]189-edward have it . And [he]189-edward had been just the same as ever . It was like opening a book after a decade to find the words the same . [He]189-edward had the same motives . [He]189-edward had not wished to tell [her]183-leonora about the case because [he]189-edward had not wished [her]183-leonora to sully [her]183-leonora mind with the idea that there was such a thing as [a brother officer who could be [a blackmailer]1223-a blackmailer]1222-a brother officer who could be a blackmailer - and [he]189-edward had wanted to protect the credit of [his]189-edward old light of love . [That lady]1224-that lady was certainly not concerned with [[her]1224-that lady husband]509-her husband . And [he]189-edward swore , and swore , and swore that there was nothing else in [the world]392-the world against [him]189-edward . [She]183-leonora did not believe [him]189-edward . [He]189-edward had done it once too often - and [she]183-leonora was wrong for the first time , so that [he]189-edward acted a rather creditable part in the matter . For [he]189-edward went right straight out to [the post - office]1227-the post - office and spent several hours in coding a telegram to [[his]189-edward solicitor]1228-his solicitor , bidding [that hard - headed man]1229-that hard - headed man to threaten to take out at once a warrant against [the fellow who was on [his]189-edward track]1230-the fellow who was on his track . [He]189-edward said afterwards that it was a bit too thick on [poor old Leonora]183-leonora to be ballyragged any more . That was really the last of [his]189-edward outstanding accounts and [he]189-edward was ready to take [his]189-edward personal chance of the divorce court if [the blackmailer]1231-the blackmailer turned nasty . [He]189-edward would face it out - the publicity , the papers , the whole bally show . Those were [his]189-edward simple words .... [He]189-edward had made , however , the mistake of not telling [Leonora]183-leonora where [he]189-edward was going , so that , having seen [him]189-edward go to [[his]189-edward room]1232-his room to fetch the code for the telegram , and seeing , two hours later , [Maisie Maidan]235-maisie come out of [[his]189-edward room]1232-his room , [Leonora]183-leonora imagined that the two hours [she]183-leonora had spent in silent agony [Edward]189-edward had spent with [Maisie Maidan]235-maisie in [his]189-edward arms . That seemed to [her]183-leonora to be too much . As a matter of fact , [Maisie]235-maisie 's being in [[Edward]189-edward 's room]1041-edward 's room had been the result partly of poverty , partly of pride , partly of sheer innocence . [She]183-leonora could not , in the first place , afford [a maid]1235-a maid ; [she]183-leonora refrained as much as possible from sending [the hotel servants]1236-the hotel servants on errands , since every penny was of importance to [her]183-leonora , and [she]183-leonora feared to have to pay high tips at the end of [her]183-leonora stay . [Edward]189-edward had lent [her]183-leonora one of [his]189-edward fascinating cases containing fifteen different sizes of scissors , and , having seen , from [her]183-leonora window , [his]189-edward departure for [the post - office]1227-the post - office , [she]183-leonora had taken the opportunity of returning the case . [She]183-leonora could not see why [she]183-leonora should not , though [she]183-leonora felt a certain remorse at the thought that [she]183-leonora had kissed the pillows of [his]189-edward bed . That was the way it took [her]183-leonora . But [Leonora]183-leonora could see that , without the shadow of a doubt , the incident gave [Florence]182-florence a hold over [her]182-florence . [It]1238-it let [Florence]182-florence into things and [Florence]182-florence was [the only created being who had any idea that [the Ashburnhams]178-the ashburnhams were not just good people with nothing to [their]178-the ashburnhams tails]1239-the only created being who had any idea that the ashburnhams were not just good people with nothing to their tails . [She]183-leonora determined at once , not so much to give [Florence]182-florence the privilege of [her]182-florence intimacy - which would have been the payment of a kind of blackmail - as to keep [Florence]182-florence under observation until [she]182-florence could have demonstrated to [Florence]182-florence that [she]182-florence was not in the least jealous of poor [Maisie]235-maisie . So that was why [she]182-florence had entered [the dining - room]1240-the dining - room arm in arm with [[my]0-i wife]332-my wife , and why [she]182-florence had so markedly planted [herself]182-florence at [our]1242-our table . "[234-mrs. maidan] For it had been discovered that [Florence]182-florence came of a line that had actually owned [Branshaw Teleragh]180-branshaw for two centuries before [the Ashburnhams]178-the ashburnhams came [there]363-there . At any rate the measure of [my]0-i relief when [Leonora]183-leonora said that [she]183-leonora was [an Irish Catholic]3095-an irish catholic gives [you]1251-you the measure of [my]0-i affection for [that couple]1253-that couple . [I]0-i do not believe that [I]0-i could have gone on any more without [them]1253-that couple . [I]0-i was getting too tired . And [I]0-i verily believe , too , that if [my]0-i suspicion that [Leonora]183-leonora was jealous of [Florence]182-florence had been the reason [she]183-leonora gave for [her]183-leonora outburst [I]0-i should have turned upon [Florence]182-florence with the maddest kind of rage . "[183-leonora] [I]0-i REMEMBER LAUGHING at the phrase " accept the situation , "[183-leonora] which [she]183-leonora seemed to repeat with a gravity too intense . "[0-i] " [She]182-florence had better , "[183-leonora] [Leonora]183-leonora answered , " not say one single word against [[my]183-leonora people]3106-my people or [my]183-leonora faith . "[183-leonora] It struck [me]0-i , at the time , that there was an unusual , an almost threatening , hardness in [her]183-leonora voice . "[183-leonora] But obviously , as [I]0-i saw it , that could not be [her]183-leonora meaning . [Good people]3088-good people , be [they]3088-good people ever so diverse in creed , do not threaten [each other]407-each other . "[0-i] That was the hint that , accordingly , [I]0-i conveyed to [Florence]182-florence when , shortly afterwards , [she]182-florence and [Edward]189-edward came down from [the tower]1260-the tower . And [I]0-i want [you]1261-you to understand that , from that moment until after [Edward]189-edward and [the girl]567-the girl and [Florence]182-florence were all dead together , [I]0-i had never the remotest glimpse , not the shadow of a suspicion , that there was anything wrong , as the saying is . For five minutes , then , [I]0-i entertained the possibility that [Leonora]183-leonora might be jealous ; but there was never another flicker in that flame - like personality . How in [the world]392-the world should [I]0-i get it ? For , all that time , [I]0-i was just [a male sick nurse]1264-a male sick nurse . And what chance had [I]0-i against [those three hardened gamblers]1265-those three hardened gamblers , who were all in league to conceal [their]1265-those three hardened gamblers hands from [me]0-i ? What earthly chance ? [They]1265-those three hardened gamblers were three to one - and [they]1265-those three hardened gamblers made [me]0-i happy . Oh , [God]188-god , [they]1265-those three hardened gamblers made [me]0-i so happy that [I]0-i doubt if even paradise , that shall smooth out all temporal wrongs , shall ever give [me]0-i the like . And what could [they]1265-those three hardened gamblers have done better , or what could [they]1265-those three hardened gamblers have done that could have been worse ? [I]0-i do n't know .... [I]0-i suppose that , during all that time , [I]0-i was [a deceived husband]1266-a deceived husband and that [Leonora]183-leonora was pimping for [Edward]189-edward . That was the cross that [she]183-leonora had to take up during [her]183-leonora long Calvary of a life .... [You]1267-you ask how it feels to be [a deceived husband]1266-a deceived husband . Just heavens , [I]0-i do not know . It feels just nothing at all . It is not hell , certainly it is not necessarily heaven . So [I]0-i suppose it is the intermediate stage . What do [they]1265-those three hardened gamblers call it ? Limbo . No , [I]0-i feel nothing at all about that . [They]1265-those three hardened gamblers are dead ; [they]1265-those three hardened gamblers have gone before [[their]1265-those three hardened gamblers Judge]1269-their judge , who , [I]0-i hope , will open to [them]1265-those three hardened gamblers the springs of [His]1269-their judge compassion . In memoriam aeternam erit .... "[183-leonora] But what were [they]1265-those three hardened gamblers ? [The just]1271-the just ? The unjust ? [God]188-god knows ! [I]0-i think that [the pair of [them]1265-those three hardened gamblers]1272-the pair of them were only poor wretches creeping over [this earth]1273-this earth in the shadow of an eternal wrath . It is very terrible .... It is almost too terrible , the picture of that judgment , as it appears to [me]0-i sometimes , at nights . It is probably the suggestion of some picture that [I]0-i have seen somewhere . But upon [an immense plain]1274-an immense plain , suspended in mid - air , [I]0-i seem to see three figures , two of [them]1265-those three hardened gamblers clasped close in an intense embrace , and [one intolerably solitary]1275-one intolerably solitary . It is in black and white , [my]0-i picture of that judgment , an etching , perhaps ; only [I]0-i can not tell an etching from a photographic reproduction . And [the immense plain]1276-the immense plain is the hand of [God]188-god , stretching out for miles and miles , with great spaces above [it]1276-the immense plain and below [it]1276-the immense plain . And [they]1265-those three hardened gamblers are in the sight of [God]188-god , and it is [Florence]182-florence that is alone .... And , do [you]1277-you know , at the thought of that intense solitude [I]0-i feel an overwhelming desire to rush forward and comfort [her]182-florence . [You]1277-you can not , [you]1277-you see , have acted as [nurse]1278-nurse to [a person]1279-a person for twelve years without wishing to go on nursing [her]182-florence , even though [you]1277-you hate [her]182-florence with the hatred of [the adder]1280-the adder , and even in the palm of [God]188-god . But , in the nights , with that vision of judgment before [me]0-i , [I]0-i know that [I]0-i hold [myself]0-i back . For [I]0-i hate [Florence]182-florence . [I]0-i hate [Florence]182-florence with such a hatred that [I]0-i would not spare [her]182-florence an eternity of loneliness . [She]182-florence need not have done what [she]182-florence did . [She]182-florence was [an American]1281-an american , [a New Englander]1282-a new englander . [She]182-florence had not the hot passions of [these Europeans]1283-these europeans . And [Leonora]183-leonora would treat [her]182-florence like [the whore]1293-the whore [she]182-florence was . Once [she]182-florence said to [Florence]182-florence in the early morning : " [You]182-florence come to [me]182-florence straight out of [[his]189-edward bed]3108-his bed to tell [me]182-florence that that is [my]182-florence proper place . Once [she]182-florence said : " If [you]182-florence can believe that of [Maisie Maidan]235-maisie , as [you]182-florence say [you]182-florence do , why can not [you]182-florence believe it of [me]182-florence ? "[182-florence] [Leonora]183-leonora was , [I]0-i understand , doing [her]183-leonora hair at that time in front of the mirror in [[her]183-leonora bedroom]1296-her bedroom . And [she]183-leonora looked round at [Florence]182-florence , to whom [she]183-leonora did not usually vouchsafe a glance - [she]183-leonora looked round coolly and calmly , and said : " Never do [you]182-florence dare to mention [Mrs. Maidan]234-mrs. maidan 's name again . [You]182-florence murdered [her]234-mrs. maidan . [You]182-florence and [I]183-leonora murdered [her]234-mrs. maidan between [us]3111-us . [I]183-leonora am as much [a scoundrel]3112-a scoundrel as [you]182-florence . [I]183-leonora do n't like to be reminded of it . "[183-leonora] [Florence]182-florence went off at once into a babble of how could [she]183-leonora have hurt [a person whom [she]183-leonora hardly knew]1297-a person whom she hardly knew , [a person whom , with the best intentions , in pursuance of [her]183-leonora efforts to leave [the world]392-the world a little brighter , [she]183-leonora had tried to save from [Edward]189-edward]1298-a person whom , with the best intentions , in pursuance of her efforts to leave the world a little brighter , she had tried to save from edward . That was how [she]183-leonora figured it out to [herself]183-leonora . [She]183-leonora really thought that .... So [Leonora]183-leonora said patiently : " Very well , just put it that [I]183-leonora killed [her]183-leonora and that it 's a painful subject . [One]417-one does not like to think that [one]417-one has killed [someone]369-someone . Naturally not . [I]183-leonora ought never to have brought [her]183-leonora from [India]93-india . "[183-leonora] And that , indeed , is exactly how [Leonora]183-leonora looked at it . It is stated a little baldly , but [Leonora]183-leonora was always [a great one for bald statements]1300-a great one for bald statements . What had happened on the day of [our]1301-our jaunt to [the ancient city of M]835-the ancient city of m - had been this : [Leonora]183-leonora , who had been even then filled with pity and contrition for [the poor child]1200-the poor child , on returning to [[our]1301-our hotel]1304-our hotel had gone straight to [[Mrs. Maidan]234-mrs. maidan 's room]1243-mrs. maidan 's room . [She]183-leonora had wanted just to pet [her]1200-the poor child . And [she]183-leonora had perceived at first only , on the clear , round table covered with red velvet , a letter addressed to [her]183-leonora . It ran something like : " Oh , [Mrs. Ashburnham]180-branshaw , how could [you]180-branshaw have done it ? [I]243-bunny trusted [you]180-branshaw so . [I]0-i fancy [Florence]182-florence was just about beginning [her]182-florence annexing of [poor dear [Edward]189-edward]1145-poor dear edward by addressing to [him]189-edward some words of friendly warning as to the ravages [he]189-edward might be making in [the girl]567-the girl 's heart . [She]183-leonora had determined to take [that child]1332-that child right away from [that hideous place]1333-that hideous place . It seemed to [her]183-leonora to be all unspeakable .
