[She]183-leonora would leave [Edward]189-edward to [Florence]182-florence - and to [me]0-i - and [she]183-leonora would devote all [her]183-leonora time to providing [that child]1332-that child with an atmosphere of love until [she]183-leonora could be returned to [[her]183-leonora poor young husband]1338-her poor young husband . It was naturally too late . [She]183-leonora had not cared to look round [[Maisie]235-maisie 's rooms]1339-maisie 's rooms at first . Now , as soon as [she]183-leonora came in , [she]183-leonora perceived , sticking out beyond the bed , a small pair of feet in high - heeled shoes . [Maisie]235-maisie had died in the effort to strap up a great portmanteau . [She]235-maisie had died so grotesquely that [her]235-maisie little body had fallen forward into the trunk , and it had closed upon [her]235-maisie , like the jaws of a gigantic alligator . The key was in [her]235-maisie hand . [Her]235-maisie dark hair , like the hair of [a Japanese]1340-a japanese , had come down and covered [her]235-maisie body and [her]235-maisie face . [Leonora]183-leonora lifted [her]235-maisie up - [she]235-maisie was [the merest featherweight]1341-the merest featherweight - and laid [her]235-maisie on the bed with [her]235-maisie hair about [her]235-maisie . [She]235-maisie was smiling , as if [she]235-maisie had just scored a goal in a hockey match . [You]1342-you understand [she]235-maisie had not committed suicide . [Her]235-maisie heart had just stopped . [I]0-i saw [her]235-maisie , with the long lashes on the cheeks , with the smile about the lips , with the flowers all about [her]235-maisie . The stem of a white lily rested in [her]235-maisie hand so that the spike of flowers was upon [her]235-maisie shoulder . [She]235-maisie looked like [a bride]1343-a bride in the sunlight of the mortuary candles that were all about [her]235-maisie , and the white coifs of [the two nuns that knelt at [her]235-maisie feet with the faces hidden might have been two swans that were to bear [her]235-maisie away to kissing - [kindness land]1345-kindness land , or wherever it is]1344-the two nuns that knelt at her feet with the faces hidden might have been two swans that were to bear her away to kissing - kindness land , or wherever it is . [Leonora]183-leonora showed [her]235-maisie to [me]0-i . [She]183-leonora would not let [either of [the others]1347-the others]1346-either of the others see [her]235-maisie . [She]183-leonora wanted , [you]1348-you know , to spare poor dear [Edward]189-edward 's feelings . [He]189-edward never could bear the sight of a corpse . And , since [she]183-leonora never gave [him]189-edward an idea that [Maisie]235-maisie had written to [her]183-leonora , [he]189-edward imagined that the death had been the most natural thing in [the world]392-the world . [He]189-edward soon got over it . Indeed , it was the one affair of [his]189-edward about which [he]189-edward never felt much remorse . THE DEATH OF [MRS . MAIDAN]234-mrs. maidan occurred on the 4th of August 1904 . And then nothing happened until the 4th of August 1913 . There is the curious coincidence of dates , but [I]0-i do not know whether that is one of those sinister , as if half - jocular and altogether merciless proceedings on the part of [a cruel Providence]1350-a cruel providence that [we]1351-we call a coincidence . Because it may just as well have been the superstitious mind of [Florence]182-florence that forced [her]182-florence to certain acts , as if [she]182-florence had been hypnotized . It is , however , certain that the 4th of August always proved a significant date for [her]182-florence . To begin with , [she]182-florence was born on the 4th of August . Then on that date , in the year 1899 , [she]182-florence set out with [[her]182-florence uncle]524-her uncle for the tour round [the world]392-the world in company with [a young man called [Jimmy]200-jimmy]1354-a young man called jimmy . But that was not merely a coincidence . [[Her]182-florence kindly old uncle]1355-her kindly old uncle , with the supposedly damaged heart , was , in [his]1355-her kindly old uncle delicate way , offering [her]182-florence , in this trip , a birthday present to celebrate [her]182-florence coming of age . Then , on the 4th of August 1900 , [she]182-florence yielded to an action that certainly coloured [her]182-florence whole life - as well as [mine]1356-mine . [She]182-florence had no luck . [She]182-florence was probably offering [herself]182-florence a birthday present that morning .... On the 4th of August 1901 , [she]182-florence married [me]0-i , and set sail for [Europe]2-europe in a great gale of wind - the gale that affected [her]182-florence heart . And no doubt there , again , [she]182-florence was offering [herself]182-florence a birthday gift - the birthday gift of [my]0-i miserable life . It occurs to [me]0-i that [I]0-i have never told [you]1357-you anything about [my]0-i marriage . That was like this : [I]0-i have told [you]1357-you , as [I]0-i think , that [I]0-i first met [Florence]182-florence at [the Stuyvesants ']109-the stuyvesants ' , in [Fourteenth Street]50-fourteenth street . And , from that moment , [I]0-i determined with all the obstinacy of a possibly weak nature , if not to make [her]182-florence [mine]0-i , at least to marry [her]182-florence . [I]0-i had no occupation - [I]0-i had no business affairs . [I]0-i simply camped down there in [Stamford]7-stamford , in [a vile hotel]1358-a vile hotel , and just passed [my]0-i days in [the house]1359-the house , on [the verandah of [the Misses Hurlbird]198-the misses hurlbird]1360-the verandah of the misses hurlbird . [The Misses Hurlbird]198-the misses hurlbird , in an odd , obstinate way , did not like [my]0-i presence . But [they]198-the misses hurlbird were hampered by the national manners of these occasions . [Florence]182-florence had [[her]182-florence own sitting - room]1361-her own sitting - room . [She]182-florence could ask to it whom [she]182-florence liked , and [I]0-i simply walked into [that apartment]1362-that apartment . [I]0-i was as timid as [you]1363-you will , but in that matter [I]0-i was like a chicken that is determined to get across [the road]792-the road in front of [an automobile]1365-an automobile . [I]0-i would walk into [[Florence]182-florence 's pretty , little , old - fashioned room]1366-florence 's pretty , little , old - fashioned room , take off [my]0-i hat , and sit down . [Florence]182-florence had , of course , [several other fellows]1367-several other fellows , too - [strapping young New Englanders , who worked during the day in [New York]51-new york and spent only the evenings in [the village of]1369-the village of [their]1368-strapping young new englanders , who worked during the day in new york and spent only the evenings in the village of their birth birth]1368-strapping young new englanders , who worked during the day in new york and spent only the evenings in the village of their birth . And , in the evenings , [they]1367-several other fellows would march in on [Florence]182-florence with almost as much determination as [I]0-i [myself]0-i showed . And [I]0-i am bound to say that [they]1367-several other fellows were received with as much disfavour as was [my]0-i portion - from [the Misses Hurlbird]198-the misses hurlbird .... [They]1367-several other fellows were curious old creatures , those two . It was almost as if [they]1367-several other fellows were members of [an ancient family]1370-an ancient family under some curse - [they]1367-several other fellows were so gentlewomanly , so proper , and [they]1367-several other fellows sighed so . Sometimes [I]0-i would see tears in [their]1367-several other fellows eyes . [I]0-i do not know that [my]0-i courtship of [Florence]182-florence made much progress at first . Perhaps that was because it took place almost entirely during the daytime , on hot afternoons , when the clouds of dust hung like fog , right up as high as the tops of the thin - leaved elms . The night , [I]0-i believe , is the proper season for the gentle feats of love , not a Connecticut July afternoon , when any sort of proximity is an almost appalling thought . But , if [I]0-i never so much as kissed [Florence]182-florence , [she]182-florence let [me]0-i discover very easily , in the course of a fortnight , [her]182-florence simple wants . And [I]0-i could supply those wants .... [She]182-florence wanted to marry [a gentleman of leisure]1371-a gentleman of leisure ; [she]182-florence wanted a European establishment . [She]182-florence wanted [[her]182-florence husband]509-her husband to have an English accent , an income of fifty thousand dollars a year from [real estate]1373-real estate and no ambitions to increase that income . And - [she]182-florence faintly hinted - [she]182-florence did not want much physical passion in the affair . [Americans]1374-americans , [you]1375-you know , can envisage such unions without blinking . [She]182-florence gave out this information in floods of bright talk - [she]182-florence would pop a little bit of it into comments over a view of [the Rialto]110-the rialto , [Venice]111-venice , and whilst [she]182-florence was brightly describing [Balmoral Castle]112-balmoral castle , [she]182-florence would say that [[her]182-florence ideal husband]1376-her ideal husband would be one who could get [her]182-florence received at [the British court]1377-the british court . [She]182-florence had spent , it seemed , two months in [Great Britain]113-great britain - seven weeks in touring from [Stratford]114-stratford to [Strathpeffer]115-strathpeffer , and one as [paying guest in [an old English family near [Ledbury]116-ledbury]1379-an old english family near ledbury , [an impoverished , but still stately family]1380-an impoverished , but still stately family , called [Bagshawe]263-bagshawe]1378-paying guest in an old english family near ledbury , an impoverished , but still stately family , called bagshawe . [They]1381-they were to have spent two months more in [that tranquil bosom]1382-that tranquil bosom , but inopportune events , apparently in [[her]182-florence uncle]524-her uncle 's business , had caused [their]1381-they rather hurried return to [Stamford]7-stamford . [The young man called [Jimmy]200-jimmy]1384-the young man called jimmy had remained in [Europe]2-europe to perfect [his]1384-the young man called jimmy knowledge of [that continent]346-that continent . [He]1384-the young man called jimmy certainly did : [he]1384-the young man called jimmy was most useful to [us]1386-us afterwards . But the point that came out - that there was no mistaking - was that [Florence]182-florence was coldly and calmly determined to take no look at [any man who could not give [her]182-florence a European settlement]1387-any man who could not give her a european settlement . [Her]182-florence glimpse of English home life had effected this . [She]182-florence meant , on [her]182-florence marriage , to have a year in [Paris]3-paris , and then to have [[her]182-florence husband]509-her husband buy some real estate in [the neighbourhood of [Fordingbridge]16-fordingbridge]361-the neighbourhood of fordingbridge , from which place [the Hurlbirds]245-the hurlbirds had come in the year 1688 . On the strength of that [she]182-florence was going to take [her]182-florence place in the ranks of [English county society]1390-english county society . That was fixed . [I]0-i used to feel mightily elevated when [I]0-i considered these details , for [I]0-i could not figure out that , amongst [her]182-florence acquaintance in [Stamford]7-stamford , there was [any fellow that would fill the bill]1391-any fellow that would fill the bill . [The most of [them]1391-any fellow that would fill the bill]1392-the most of them were not as wealthy as [I]0-i , and [those that were were not the type]1393-those that were were not the type to give up the fascinations of [Wall Street]118-wall street even for the protracted companionship of [Florence]182-florence . But nothing really happened during the month of July . On the 1st of August [Florence]182-florence apparently told [[her]182-florence aunts]1394-her aunts that [she]182-florence intended to marry [me]0-i . [She]182-florence had not told [me]0-i so , but there was no doubt about [the aunts]1395-the aunts , for , on that afternoon , [Miss Florence Hurlbird]182-florence , [Senior]246-senior , stopped [me]0-i on [my]0-i way to [[Florence]182-florence 's sitting - room]1396-florence 's sitting - room and took [me]0-i , agitatedly , into [the parlour]1397-the parlour . It was a singular interview , in [that old - fashioned colonial room]1398-that old - fashioned colonial room , with the spindle - legged furniture , the silhouettes , the miniatures , the portrait of [General Braddock]247-general braddock , and the smell of lavender . [You]1399-you see , [the two poor maiden ladies]1400-the two poor maiden ladies were in agonies - and [they]1400-the two poor maiden ladies could not say one single thing direct . [They]1400-the two poor maiden ladies would almost wring [their]1400-the two poor maiden ladies hands and ask if [I]0-i had considered such a thing as different temperaments . [I]0-i assure [you]1399-you [they]1400-the two poor maiden ladies were almost affectionate , concerned for [me]0-i even , as if [Florence]182-florence were too bright for [my]0-i solid and serious virtues . For [they]1400-the two poor maiden ladies had discovered in [me]0-i solid and serious virtues . That might have been because [I]0-i had once dropped the remark that [I]0-i preferred [General Braddock]247-general braddock to [General Washington]248-general washington . For [the Hurlbirds]245-the hurlbirds had backed the losing side in the War of Independence , and had been seriously impoverished and quite efficiently oppressed for that reason . [The Misses Hurlbird]198-the misses hurlbird could never forget it . Nevertheless [they]1400-the two poor maiden ladies shuddered at the thought of a European career for [myself]0-i and [Florence]182-florence . Each of [them]1400-the two poor maiden ladies really wailed when [they]1400-the two poor maiden ladies heard that that was what [I]0-i hoped to give [[their]1400-the two poor maiden ladies niece]1401-their niece . That may have been partly because [they]1400-the two poor maiden ladies regarded [Europe]2-europe as a sink of iniquity , where strange laxities prevailed . [They]1400-the two poor maiden ladies thought [the Mother Country]1402-the mother country as [Erastian]119-erastian as any other . And [they]1400-the two poor maiden ladies carried [their]1400-the two poor maiden ladies protests to extraordinary lengths , for [them]1400-the two poor maiden ladies .... [They]1400-the two poor maiden ladies even , almost , said that marriage was a sacrament ; but neither [Miss Florence]182-florence nor [Miss Emily]249-miss emily could quite bring [herself]249-miss emily to utter the word . And [they]1400-the two poor maiden ladies almost brought [themselves]1400-the two poor maiden ladies to say that [Florence]182-florence 's early life had been characterized by flirtations - something of that sort . [I]0-i know [I]0-i ended the interview by saying : " [I]0-i do n't care . "[182-florence] But [I]0-i assured [her]182-florence that [they]1406-they had not and hurried [her]182-florence into [the room of [[her]182-florence strangely afflicted relatives]1408-her strangely afflicted relatives]1407-the room of her strangely afflicted relatives . [She]182-florence treated [me]0-i so very well - with such tact - that if [I]0-i ever thought of it afterwards [I]0-i put it down to [her]182-florence deep affection for [me]0-i . And that evening , when [I]0-i went to fetch [her]182-florence for a buggy - ride , [she]182-florence had disappeared . [I]0-i did not lose any time . [I]0-i went into [New York]51-new york and engaged berths on [the " Pocahontas]3132-the " pocahontas , "[182-florence] that was to sail on the evening of the 4th of the month , and then , returning to [Stamford]7-stamford , [I]0-i tracked out , in the course of the day , that [Florence]182-florence had been driven to [Rye Station]120-rye station . And there [I]0-i found that [she]182-florence had taken [the cars]1409-the cars to [Waterbury]58-waterbury . [She]182-florence had , of course , gone to [[her]182-florence uncle]524-her uncle 's . [The old man]1411-the old man received [me]0-i with a stony , husky face . [I]0-i was not to see [Florence]182-florence ; [she]182-florence was ill ; [she]182-florence was keeping [[her]182-florence room]1412-her room . And , from something that [he]1411-the old man let drop - an odd Biblical phrase that [I]0-i have forgotten - [I]0-i gathered that [all that family]1413-all that family simply did not intend [her]182-florence to marry ever in [her]182-florence life . [I]0-i procured at once the name of [the nearest minister]1414-the nearest minister and a rope ladder - [you]1415-you have no idea how primitively these matters were arranged in those days in [the United States]121-the united states . [I]0-i dare say that may be so still . And at one o'clock in the morning of the 4th of August [I]0-i was standing in [[Florence]182-florence 's bedroom]1416-florence 's bedroom . [I]0-i was so one - minded in [my]0-i purpose that it never struck [me]0-i there was anything improper in being , at one o'clock in the morning , in [[Florence]182-florence 's bedroom]1416-florence 's bedroom . [I]0-i just wanted to wake [her]182-florence up . [She]182-florence was not , however , asleep . [She]182-florence expected [me]0-i , and [[her]182-florence relatives]1418-her relatives had only just left [her]182-florence . [She]182-florence received [me]0-i with an embrace of a warmth . . . Well , it was the first time [I]0-i had ever been embraced by [a woman]686-a woman - and it was the last when [a woman]686-a woman 's embrace has had in it any warmth for [me]0-i .... [I]0-i suppose it was [my]0-i own fault , what followed . At any rate , [I]0-i was in such a hurry to get the wedding over , and was so afraid of [[her]182-florence relatives]1418-her relatives finding [me]0-i [there]363-there , that [I]0-i must have received [her]182-florence advances with a certain amount of absence of mind . [I]0-i was out of [that room]1423-that room and down the ladder in under half a minute . [She]182-florence kept [me]0-i waiting at the foot an unconscionable time - it was certainly three in the morning before [we]1424-we woke up that minister . And [I]0-i think that that wait was the only sign [Florence]182-florence ever showed of having a conscience as far as [I]0-i was concerned , unless [her]182-florence lying for some moments in [my]0-i arms was also a sign of conscience . [I]0-i fancy that , if [I]0-i had shown warmth then , [she]182-florence would have acted [the proper wife]1425-the proper wife to [me]0-i , or would have put [me]0-i back again . Perhaps [she]182-florence thought that [I]0-i should not mind . After that , as [I]0-i gather , [she]182-florence had not any more remorse . [She]182-florence was only anxious to carry out [her]182-florence plans . For , just before [she]182-florence came down the ladder , [she]182-florence called [me]0-i to the top of [that grotesque implement]1428-that grotesque implement that [I]0-i went up and down like [a tranquil jumping - jack]1429-a tranquil jumping - jack . [I]0-i was perfectly collected . [She]182-florence said to [me]0-i with a certain fierceness : " It is determined that [we]3133-we sail at four this afternoon ? It was pretty well thought out , [you]1497-you see . What was n't so well thought out were the ultimate consequences - [our]1498-our being tied to [Europe]2-europe . For [that young man]1499-that young man rubbed it so well into [me]0-i that [Florence]182-florence would die if [she]182-florence crossed the Channel - [he]1499-that young man impressed it so fully on [my]0-i mind that , when later [Florence]182-florence wanted to go to [Fordingbridge]16-fordingbridge , [I]0-i cut the proposal short - absolutely short , with a curt no . As [God]188-god is [[my]0-i Judge]1521-my judge , [I]0-i do not believe that [I]0-i would have separated [those two]1518-those two if [I]0-i had known that [they]1518-those two really and passionately loved [each other]407-each other . For peace [I]0-i never had with [Florence]182-florence , and [I]0-i hardly believe that [I]0-i cared for [her]182-florence in the way of love after a year or two of it . [She]182-florence became for [me]0-i a rare and fragile object , something burdensome , but very frail . Of intrinsic value as [a wife]979-a wife , [I]0-i think [she]182-florence had none at all for [me]0-i . [I]0-i fancy [I]0-i was not even proud of the way [she]182-florence dressed . But [her]182-florence passion for [Jimmy]200-jimmy was not even a passion , and , mad as the suggestion may appear , [she]182-florence was frightened for [her]182-florence life . Yes , [she]182-florence was afraid of [me]0-i . [I]0-i will tell [you]1529-you how that happened . [I]0-i had , in the old days , [a dark servant]1530-a dark servant , called [Julius]255-julius , who valeted [me]0-i , and waited on [me]0-i , and loved [me]0-i , like the crown of [his]1530-a dark servant head . Now , when [we]1531-we left [Waterbury]58-waterbury to go to the " [Pocahontas]122-pocahontas , "[182-florence] [Florence]182-florence entrusted to [me]0-i one very special and very precious leather grip . [She]182-florence told [me]0-i that [her]182-florence life might depend on that grip , which contained [her]182-florence drugs against heart attacks . And , since [I]0-i was never much of a hand at carrying things , [I]0-i entrusted this , in turn , to [Julius]255-julius , who was [a grey - haired chap of sixty or so , and very picturesque at that]1532-a grey - haired chap of sixty or so , and very picturesque at that . [He]255-julius made so much impression on [Florence]182-florence that [she]182-florence regarded [him]255-julius as [a sort of father]1533-a sort of father , and absolutely refused to let [me]0-i take [him]255-julius to [Paris]3-paris . [He]255-julius would have inconvenienced [her]182-florence . Well , [Julius]255-julius was so overcome with grief at being left behind that [he]255-julius must needs go and drop the precious grip . [I]0-i saw red , [I]0-i saw purple . [I]0-i flew at [Julius]255-julius . On [the ferry]1534-the ferry , it was , [I]0-i filled up one of [his]255-julius eyes ; [I]0-i threatened to strangle [him]255-julius . And , since [an unresisting Negro]1535-an unresisting negro can make a deplorable noise and a deplorable spectacle , and , since that was [Florence]182-florence 's first adventure in [the married state]1536-the married state , [she]182-florence got a pretty idea of [my]0-i character . It affirmed in [her]182-florence the desperate resolve to conceal from [me]0-i the fact that [she]182-florence was not what [she]182-florence would have called " [a pure woman]3137-a pure woman . "[182-florence] For that was really the mainspring of [her]182-florence fantastic actions . [She]182-florence was afraid that [I]0-i should murder [her]182-florence .... So [she]182-florence got up the heart attack , at the earliest possible opportunity , on board [the liner]1537-the liner . Perhaps [she]182-florence was not so very much to be blamed . [You]1538-you must remember that [she]182-florence was [a New Englander]1282-a new englander , and that [New England]49-new england no longer idealizes darkies as it did formerly . Whereas , if [she]182-florence had come from [even so little south as [Philadelphia]10-philadelphia]1540-even so little south as philadelphia , and had been of [an oldish family]1541-an oldish family , [she]182-florence would have seen that for [me]0-i to kick [Julius]255-julius was not so outrageous an act as for [[her]182-florence cousin]1542-her cousin , [Reggie Hurlbird]256-reggie hurlbird , to say - as [I]0-i have heard [him]256-reggie hurlbird say to [[his]256-reggie hurlbird English butler]1543-his english butler - that for two cents [he]256-reggie hurlbird would bat [him]256-reggie hurlbird on the pants . To [her]182-florence it was just a useful lie .... Well , there [you]1545-you have the position , as clear as [I]0-i can make it - [the husband]513-the husband [an ignorant fool]1547-an ignorant fool , [the wife]569-the wife [a cold sensualist with imbecile fears]1549-a cold sensualist with imbecile fears - for [I]0-i was such [a fool]1550-a fool that [I]0-i should never have known what [she]182-florence was or was not - and [the blackmailing lover]1551-the blackmailing lover . Well , [I]0-i think [I]0-i have made it pretty clear . Let [me]0-i come to the 4th of August 1913 , the last day of [my]0-i absolute ignorance - and , [I]0-i assure [you]1644-you , of [my]0-i perfect happiness . "[183-leonora] So [Florence]182-florence , with [her]182-florence light step , had slipped out after [them]1653-them . [We]1656-we had gone on sitting in [the lounge]1245-the lounge till towards ten , when [Leonora]183-leonora had gone up to bed . It had been a very hot day , but there it was cool . [The man called [Bagshawe]263-bagshawe]1658-the man called bagshawe had been reading the Times on the other side of [the room]633-the room , but then [he]263-bagshawe moved over to [me]0-i with some trifling question as a prelude to suggesting [an acquaintance]1660-an acquaintance . [The filthy toad]264-the filthy toad .... [He]263-bagshawe began by telling [me]0-i that [he]263-bagshawe came from [Ludlow Manor]131-ludlow manor , near [Ledbury]116-ledbury . And then , quite suddenly , in the bright light of [the street]1564-the street , [I]0-i saw [Florence]182-florence running . It was like that - [Florence]182-florence running with a face whiter than paper and [her]182-florence hand on the black stuff over [her]182-florence heart . [I]0-i tell [you]1666-you , [my]0-i own heart stood still ; [I]0-i tell [you]1666-you [I]0-i could not move . [She]182-florence rushed in at the swing doors . [She]182-florence looked round that place of rush chairs , cane tables , and newspapers . [She]182-florence saw [me]0-i and opened [her]182-florence lips . [She]182-florence saw [the man who was talking to [me]0-i]1667-the man who was talking to me . [She]182-florence stuck [her]182-florence hands over [her]182-florence face as if [she]182-florence wished to push [her]182-florence eyes out . And [she]182-florence was not there any more . [I]0-i could not move ; [I]0-i could not stir a finger . And then [that man]1668-that man said : " By [Jove]265-jove ! [Florry Hurlbird]266-florry hurlbird . "[1668-that man] [He]1668-that man turned upon [me]0-i with an oily and uneasy sound meant for a laugh . [He]1668-that man was really going to ingratiate [himself]1668-that man with [me]0-i . " Do [you]0-i know who that is ? "[1668-that man] [he]1668-that man asked . " The last time [I]1668-that man saw that girl [she]182-florence was coming out of the bedroom of [a young man called [Jimmy]200-jimmy at five o'clock in the morning]3158-a young man called jimmy at five o'clock in the morning . In [[my]1668-that man house at [Ledbury]116-ledbury]3159-my house at ledbury . [You]0-i saw [her]182-florence recognize [me]1668-that man . "[1668-that man] [He]1668-that man was standing on [his]1668-that man feet , looking down at [me]0-i . [I]0-i do n't know what [I]0-i looked like . At any rate , [he]1668-that man gave a sort of gurgle and then stuttered : " Oh , [I]1668-that man say . . . "[1668-that man] Those were the last words [I]0-i ever heard of [Mr. Bagshawe]263-bagshawe 's . A long time afterwards [I]0-i pulled [myself]0-i out of [the lounge]1245-the lounge and went up to [[Florence]182-florence 's room]1670-florence 's room . [She]182-florence had not locked the door - for the first night of [our]1671-our married life . [She]182-florence was lying , quite respectably arranged , unlike [Mrs. Maidan]234-mrs. maidan , on [her]182-florence bed . [She]182-florence had a little phial that rightly should have contained nitrate of amyl , in [her]182-florence right hand . That was on the 4th of August 1913 . THE ODD THING IS that what sticks out in [my]0-i recollection of the rest of that evening was [Leonora]183-leonora 's saying : " Of course [you]0-i might marry [her]567-the girl , "[183-leonora] and when [I]0-i asked whom , [she]183-leonora answered : " [The girl]567-the girl . "[183-leonora] Now that is to [me]0-i a very amazing thing - amazing for the light of possibilities that it casts into the human heart . For [I]0-i had never had the slightest conscious idea of marrying [the girl]567-the girl ; [I]0-i never had the slightest idea even of caring for [her]567-the girl . [I]0-i must have talked in an odd way , as [people do who are recovering from an anaesthetic]1673-people do who are recovering from an anaesthetic . It is as if [one]417-one had a dual personality , the one [I]0-i being entirely unconscious of the other . [I]0-i had thought nothing ; [I]0-i had said such an extraordinary thing . [I]0-i do n't know that analysis of [my]0-i own psychology matters at all to this story . [I]0-i should say that it did n't or , at any rate , that [I]0-i had given enough of it . But that odd remark of [mine]0-i had a strong influence upon what came after . [I]0-i mean , that [Leonora]183-leonora would probably never have spoken to [me]0-i at all about [Florence]182-florence 's relations with [Edward]189-edward if [I]0-i had n't said , two hours after [[my]0-i wife]332-my wife 's death : " Now [I]0-i can marry [the girl]567-the girl . "[0-i] [She]183-leonora had , then , taken it for granted that [I]0-i had been suffering all that [she]183-leonora had been suffering , or , at least , that [I]0-i had permitted all that [she]183-leonora had permitted . So that , a month ago - about a week after the funeral of [poor Edward]189-edward - [she]183-leonora could say to [me]0-i in the most natural way in [the world]392-the world - [I]0-i had been talking about the duration of [my]0-i stay at [Branshaw]180-branshaw - [she]183-leonora said with [her]183-leonora clear , reflective intonation : " Oh , stop here for ever and ever if [you]0-i can . "[183-leonora] And then [she]183-leonora added : " [You]0-i could n't be more of [a brother to [me]183-leonora]3162-a brother to me , - or [more of a counsellor]3163-more of a counsellor , or [more of a support]3164-more of a support . [You]0-i are all the consolation [I]183-leonora have in [the world]392-the world . And is n't it odd to think that if [[your]0-i wife]431-your wife had n't been [[[my]183-leonora husband]3116-my husband 's mistress]3168-my husband 's mistress , [you]0-i would probably never have been [here]3120-here at all ? "[183-leonora] That was how [I]0-i got the news - full in the face , like that . [I]0-i did n't say anything and [I]0-i do n't suppose [I]0-i felt anything , unless may be it was with that mysterious and unconscious self that underlies [most people]1677-most people . Perhaps one day when [I]0-i am unconscious or walking in [my]0-i sleep [I]0-i may go and spit upon poor [Edward]189-edward 's grave . It seems about the most unlikely thing [I]0-i could do ; but there it is . No , [I]0-i remember no emotion of any sort , but just the clear feeling that [one]417-one has from time to time when one hears that some Mrs. So - and - So is au mieux with [a certain gentleman]1679-a certain gentleman . It made things plainer , suddenly , to [my]0-i curiosity . It was as if [I]0-i thought , at that moment , of a windy November evening , that , when [I]0-i came to think it over afterwards , a dozen unexplained things would fit themselves into place . But [I]0-i was n't thinking things over then . [I]0-i remember that distinctly . [I]0-i was just sitting back , rather stiffly , in a deep armchair . That is what [I]0-i remember . It was twilight . [Branshaw Manor]105-branshaw manor lies in a little hollow with lawns across [it]105-branshaw manor and pine - woods on [the fringe of [the dip]1681-the dip]1680-the fringe of the dip . The immense wind , coming from across [the forest]1682-the forest , roared overhead . But the view from the window was perfectly quiet and grey . Not a thing stirred , except a couple of rabbits on the extreme edge of the lawn . It was [[Leonora]183-leonora 's own little study]1683-leonora 's own little study that [we]1684-we were in and [we]1684-we were waiting for the tea to be brought . [I]0-i , as [I]0-i have said , was sitting in the deep chair , [Leonora]183-leonora was standing in the window twirling the wooden acorn at the end of the window - blind cord desultorily round and round . [She]183-leonora looked across [the lawn]1685-the lawn and said , as far as [I]0-i can remember : " [Edward]189-edward has been dead only ten days and yet there are rabbits on [the lawn]1685-the lawn . "[183-leonora] [I]0-i understand that rabbits do a great deal of harm to the short grass in [England]1-england . And then [she]183-leonora turned round to [me]0-i and said without any adornment at all , for [I]0-i remember [her]183-leonora exact words : " [I]183-leonora think it was stupid of [Florence]182-florence to commit suicide . "[183-leonora] [I]0-i can not tell [you]1686-you the extraordinary sense of leisure that [we]1684-we two seemed to have at that moment . It was n't as if [we]1684-we were waiting for [a train]1687-a train , it was n't as if [we]1684-we were waiting for a meal - it was just that there was nothing to wait for . Nothing . There was an extreme stillness with the remote and intermittent sound of the wind . There was the grey light in [that brown , small room]1688-that brown , small room . And there appeared to be nothing else in [the world]392-the world . [I]0-i knew then that [Leonora]183-leonora was about to let [me]0-i into [her]183-leonora full confidence . It was as if - or no , it was the actual fact that - [Leonora]183-leonora with an odd English sense of decency had determined to wait until [Edward]189-edward had been in [[his]189-edward grave]1690-his grave for a full week before [she]183-leonora spoke . And with some vague motive of giving [her]183-leonora an idea of the extent to which [she]183-leonora must permit [herself]183-leonora to make confidences [I]0-i said slowly - and these words too [I]0-i remember with exactitude - " Did [Florence]182-florence commit suicide ? [I]0-i did n't know . "[0-i] [I]0-i was just , [you]1691-you understand , trying to let [her]183-leonora know that , if [she]183-leonora were going to speak , [she]183-leonora would have to talk about a much wider range of things than [she]183-leonora had before thought necessary . SO THAT that was the first knowledge [I]0-i had that [Florence]182-florence had committed suicide . It had never entered [my]0-i head . [You]1691-you may think that [I]0-i had been singularly lacking in suspiciousness ; [you]1691-you may consider [me]0-i even to have been [an imbecile]1692-an imbecile . But consider exactly the position . In such circumstances of clamour , of outcry , of the crash of [many people]1693-many people running together , of the professional reticence of [such people as [hotel - keepers]1695-hotel - keepers]1694-such people as hotel - keepers , the traditional reticence of [such " [good people]3088-good people "[1696-such " good people " as the ashburnhams] as [the Ashburnhams]178-the ashburnhams]1696-such " good people " as the ashburnhams - in such circumstances it is [some little material object , always , that catches the eye and that appeals to the imagination]1697-some little material object , always , that catches the eye and that appeals to the imagination . [I]0-i had no possible guide to the idea of suicide , and the sight of the little flask of nitrate of amyl in [Florence]182-florence 's hand suggested instantly to [my]0-i mind the idea of the failure of [her]182-florence heart . Nitrate of amyl , [you]1691-you understand , is the drug that is given to relieve sufferers from angina pectoris . Seeing [Florence]182-florence , as [I]0-i had seen [her]182-florence , running with a white face and with one hand held over [her]182-florence heart , and seeing [her]182-florence , as [I]0-i immediately afterwards saw [her]182-florence , lying upon [her]182-florence bed with the so familiar little brown flask clenched in [her]182-florence fingers , it was natural enough for [my]0-i mind to frame the idea . As happened now and again , [I]0-i thought [she]182-florence had gone out without [her]182-florence remedy and , having felt an attack coming on whilst [she]182-florence was in [the gardens]1244-the gardens , [she]182-florence had run in to get the nitrate in order , as quickly as possible , to obtain relief . And it was equally inevitable [my]0-i mind should frame the thought that [her]182-florence heart , unable to stand the strain of the running , should have broken in [her]182-florence side . How could [I]0-i have known that , during all the years of [our]1699-our married life , that little brown flask had contained , not nitrate of amyl , but prussic acid ? It was inconceivable . Why , not even [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward , who was , after all , more intimate with [her]182-florence than [I]0-i was , had an inkling of the truth . [He]189-edward just thought that [she]182-florence had dropped dead of heart disease . Indeed , [I]0-i fancy that [the only people who ever knew that]1700-the only people who ever knew that [Florence]182-florence had committed suicide were [Leonora]183-leonora , [the Grand Duke]771-the grand duke , [the head of [the police]1703-the police]1702-the head of the police , and [the hotel - keeper]1704-the hotel - keeper . [I]0-i mention these last three because [my]0-i recollection of that night is only the sort of pinkish effulgence from the electric lamps in [the hotel lounge]1705-the hotel lounge . There seemed to bob into [my]0-i consciousness , like floating globes , the faces of [those three]1706-those three . Now it would be [the bearded , monarchical , benevolent head of [the Grand Duke]771-the grand duke]1707-the bearded , monarchical , benevolent head of the grand duke ; then the sharp - featured , brown , cavalry - moustached features of [the chief of police]1709-the chief of police ; then the globular , polished , and high - collared vacuousness that represented [Monsieur Schontz]204-monsieur schontz , [the proprietor of [the hotel]1040-the hotel]1710-the proprietor of the hotel . At times one head would be [there]363-there alone , at another the spike helmet of [the official]1713-the official would be close to the healthy baldness of [the prince]960-the prince ; then [Monsieur Schontz]204-monsieur schontz 's oiled locks would push in between [the two]1715-the two . [The sovereign]1716-the sovereign 's soft , exquisitely trained voice would say : " Ja , ja , ja ! "[1716-the sovereign] each word dropping out like so many soft pellets of suet ; the subdued rasp of [the official]1713-the official would come : " Zum Befehl , Durchlaucht , "[1713-the official] like five revolver - shots ; the voice of [Monsieur Schontz]204-monsieur schontz would go on and on under its breath like that of [an unclean priest reciting from [his]1718-an unclean priest reciting from his breviary in the corner of a railway carriage breviary in the corner of [a railway carriage]1719-a railway carriage]1718-an unclean priest reciting from his breviary in the corner of a railway carriage . That was how it presented itself to [me]0-i . [They]1706-those three seemed to take no notice of [me]0-i ; [I]0-i do n't suppose that [I]0-i was even addressed by [one of [them]1706-those three]1720-one of them . But as long as one or the other , or [all three of [them]1706-those three]1721-all three of them , were there , [they]1706-those three stood between [me]0-i as if , [I]0-i being [the titular possessor of the corpse]1722-the titular possessor of the corpse , had a right to be present at [their]1706-those three conferences . Then [they]1706-those three all went away and [I]0-i was left alone for a long time . And [I]0-i thought nothing ; absolutely nothing . [I]0-i had no ideas ; [I]0-i had no strength . [I]0-i felt no sorrow , no desire for action , no inclination to go [upstairs]1723-upstairs and fall upon the body of [[my]0-i wife]332-my wife . [I]0-i just saw the pink effulgence , the cane tables , the palms , the globular match - holders , the indented ashtrays . And then [Leonora]183-leonora came to [me]0-i and it appears that [I]0-i addressed to [her]183-leonora that singular remark : " Now [I]0-i can marry [the girl]567-the girl . "[0-i] But [I]0-i have given [you]1725-you absolutely the whole of [my]0-i recollection of that evening , as it is the whole of [my]0-i recollection of the succeeding three or four days . [I]0-i was in a state just simply cataleptic . [They]1726-they put [me]0-i to bed and [I]0-i stayed [there]363-there ; [they]1726-they brought [me]0-i [my]0-i clothes and [I]0-i dressed ; [they]1726-they led [me]0-i to [an open grave]1728-an open grave and [I]0-i stood beside [it]1728-an open grave . If [they]1726-they had taken [me]0-i to [the edge of [a river]1730-a river]1729-the edge of a river , or if [they]1726-they had flung [me]0-i beneath [a railway train]991-a railway train , [I]0-i should have been drowned or mangled in the same spirit . [I]0-i was the walking dead . Well , those are [my]0-i impressions . What had actually happened had been this . [I]0-i pieced it together afterwards . [You]1732-you will remember [I]0-i said that [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward and [the girl]567-the girl had gone off , that night , to a concert at [the Casino]3099-the casino and that [Leonora]183-leonora had asked [Florence]182-florence , almost immediately after [their]1735-their departure , to follow [them]1735-their and to perform [the office of chaperon]1736-the office of chaperon . [Florence]182-florence , [you]1732-you may also remember , was all in black , being the mourning that [she]182-florence wore for [a deceased cousin]1737-a deceased cousin , [Jean Hurlbird]267-jean hurlbird . It was a very black night and [the girl]567-the girl was dressed in cream - coloured muslin , and must have glimmered under the tall trees of [the dark park]1739-the dark park like a phosphorescent fish in a cupboard . [You]1732-you could n't have had a better beacon . And it appears that [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward led [the girl]567-the girl not up [the straight allee that leads to [the Casino]3099-the casino]1741-the straight allee that leads to the casino , but in under [the dark trees of [the park]1744-the park]1743-the dark trees of the park . [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward told [me]0-i all this in [his]189-edward final outburst . [I]0-i have told [you]1732-you that , upon that occasion , [he]189-edward became deucedly vocal . [I]0-i did n't pump [him]189-edward . [I]0-i had n't any motive . At that time [I]0-i did n't in the least connect [him]189-edward with [[my]0-i wife]332-my wife . But [the fellow]1442-the fellow talked like [a cheap novelist]1747-a cheap novelist . - Or like [a very good novelist]1748-a very good novelist for the matter of that , if it 's the business of [a novelist]1749-a novelist to make [you]1732-you see things clearly . And [I]0-i tell [you]1732-you [I]0-i see that thing as clearly as if it were a dream that never left [me]0-i . It appears that , not very far from [the Casino]3099-the casino , [he]189-edward and [the girl]567-the girl sat down in the darkness upon [a public bench]1752-a public bench . The lights from [that place of entertainment]1753-that place of entertainment must have reached [them]1754-them through the tree - trunks , since , [Edward]189-edward said , [he]189-edward could quite plainly see [the girl]567-the girl 's face - that beloved face with the high forehead , the queer mouth , the tortured eyebrows and the direct eyes . And to [Florence]182-florence , creeping up behind [them]1754-them , [they]1754-them must have presented the appearance of silhouettes . For [I]0-i take it that [Florence]182-florence came creeping up behind [them]1754-them over the short grass to a tree that , as [I]0-i quite well remember , was immediately behind [that public seat]1756-that public seat . It was a not very difficult feat for [a woman instinct with jealousy]1757-a woman instinct with jealousy . [The Casino orchestra]1758-the casino orchestra was , as [Edward]189-edward remembered to tell [me]0-i , playing the Rakoczy march , and although it was not loud enough , at that distance , to drown the voice of [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward , it was certainly sufficiently audible to efface , amongst the noises of the night , the slight brushings and rustlings that might have been made by the feet of [Florence]182-florence or by [her]182-florence gown in coming over the short grass . And [that miserable woman]1759-that miserable woman must have got it in the face , good and strong . It must have been horrible for [her]1759-that miserable woman . Horrible ! Well , [I]0-i suppose [she]1759-that miserable woman deserved all that [she]1759-that miserable woman got . Anyhow , there [you]1760-you have the picture : the immensely tall trees , elms most of them , towering and feathering away up into the black mistiness that trees seem to gather about them at night ; the silhouettes of [those two upon the seat]1761-those two upon the seat ; the beams of light coming from [the Casino]133-the casino , [the woman]3072-the woman all in black peeping with fear behind the tree - trunk . It is melodrama ; but [I]0-i ca n't help it . And then , it appears , something happened to [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward . [He]189-edward assured [me]0-i - and [I]0-i see no reason for disbelieving [him]189-edward - that until that moment [he]189-edward had had no idea whatever of caring for [the girl]567-the girl . [He]189-edward said that [he]189-edward had regarded [her]567-the girl exactly as [he]189-edward would have regarded [a daughter]1764-a daughter . [He]189-edward certainly loved [her]567-the girl , but with a very deep , very tender , and very tranquil love . [He]189-edward had missed [her]567-the girl when [she]567-the girl went away to [[her]567-the girl convent - school]1765-her convent - school ; [he]189-edward had been glad when [she]567-the girl had returned . But of more than that [he]189-edward had been totally unconscious . Had [he]189-edward been conscious of it , [he]189-edward assured [me]0-i , [he]189-edward would have fled from it as from a thing accursed . [He]189-edward realized that it was the last outrage upon [Leonora]183-leonora . But the real point was [his]189-edward entire unconsciousness . [He]189-edward had gone with [her]567-the girl into [that dark park]1766-that dark park with no quickening of the pulse , with no desire for the intimacy of solitude . [He]189-edward had gone intending to talk about polo ponies and tennis - racquets ; about the temperament of [the reverend Mother at [the convent]1768-the convent [she]567-the girl had left]1767-the reverend mother at the convent she had left and about whether [her]567-the girl frock for a party when [they]1769-they got [home]591-home should be white or blue . It had n't come into [his]189-edward head that [they]1769-they would talk about a single thing that [they]1769-they had n't always talked about ; it had not even come into [his]189-edward head that the taboo which extended around [her]567-the girl was not inviolable . And then , suddenly , that - [He]189-edward was very careful to assure [me]0-i that at that time there was no physical motive about [his]189-edward declaration . It did not appear to [him]189-edward to be a matter of a dark night and a propinquity and so on . No , it was simply of [her]567-the girl effect on the moral side of [his]189-edward life that [he]189-edward appears to have talked . [He]189-edward said that [he]189-edward never had the slightest notion to enfold [her]567-the girl in [his]189-edward arms or so much as to touch [her]567-the girl hand . [He]189-edward swore that [he]189-edward did not touch [her]567-the girl hand . [He]189-edward said that [they]1769-they sat , [she]567-the girl at one end of the bench , [he]189-edward at the other ; [he]189-edward leaning slightly towards [her]567-the girl and [she]567-the girl looking straight towards the light of the Casino , [her]567-the girl face illuminated by the lamps . The expression upon [her]567-the girl face [he]189-edward could only describe as " queer . "[189-edward] At another time , indeed , [he]189-edward made it appear that [he]189-edward thought [she]567-the girl was glad . It is easy to imagine that [she]567-the girl was glad , since at that time [she]567-the girl could have had no idea of what was really happening . Frankly , [she]567-the girl adored [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward . [He]189-edward was for [her]567-the girl , in everything that [she]567-the girl said at that time , [the model of humanity]1771-the model of humanity , [the hero]1772-the hero , [the athlete]1773-the athlete , [the father of [his]189-edward county]1774-the father of his county , [the law - giver]1775-the law - giver . So that for [her]567-the girl to be suddenly , intimately , and overwhelmingly praised must have been a matter for mere gladness , however overwhelming it were . It must have been as if [a god]1776-a god had approved [her]567-the girl handiwork or [a king]1777-a king [her]567-the girl loyalty . [She]567-the girl just sat still and listened , smiling . And it seemed to [her]567-the girl that all the bitterness of [her]567-the girl childhood , the terrors of [[her]567-the girl tempestuous father]1778-her tempestuous father , [the bewailings of [[her]567-the girl cruel - tongued mother]1780-her cruel - tongued mother]1779-the bewailings of her cruel - tongued mother were suddenly atoned for . [She]567-the girl had [her]567-the girl recompense at last . Because , of course , if [you]1781-you come to figure it out , a sudden pouring forth of passion by [a man whom [you]1781-you regard as a cross between [a pastor]1783-a pastor and [a father]1207-a father]1782-a man whom you regard as a cross between a pastor and a father might , to [a woman]686-a woman , have the aspect of mere praise for good conduct . It would n't , [I]0-i mean , appear at all in the light of an attempt to gain possession . [The girl]567-the girl , at least , regarded [him]1207-a father as firmly anchored to [his]1207-a father Leonora . [She]567-the girl had not the slightest inkling of any infidelities . [He]1207-a father had always spoken to [her]567-the girl of [[his]1207-a father wife]388-his wife in terms of reverence and deep affection . [He]1207-a father had given [her]567-the girl the idea that [he]1207-a father regarded [Leonora]183-leonora as absolutely impeccable and as absolutely satisfying . [Their]1788-their union had appeared to [her]567-the girl to be one of those blessed things that are spoken of and contemplated with reverence by [[her]567-the girl church]1155-her church . So that , when [he]1207-a father spoke of [her]567-the girl as being [the person [he]1207-a father cared most for in [the world]392-the world]1790-the person he cared most for in the world , [she]567-the girl naturally thought that [he]1207-a father meant to except [Leonora]183-leonora and [she]567-the girl was just glad . It was like [a father]1207-a father saying that [he]1207-a father approved of [a marriageable daughter]1793-a marriageable daughter .... And [Edward]189-edward , when [he]189-edward realized what [he]189-edward was doing , curbed [his]189-edward tongue at once . [She]567-the girl was just glad and [she]567-the girl went on being just glad . [I]0-i suppose that that was the most monstrously wicked thing that [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward ever did in [his]189-edward life . And yet [I]0-i am so near to all [these people]1794-these people that [I]0-i can not think any of [them]1794-these people wicked . It is impossible of [me]0-i to think of [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward as anything but straight , upright , and honourable . That , [I]0-i mean , is , in spite of everything , [my]0-i permanent view of [him]189-edward . [I]0-i try at times by dwelling on some of the things that [he]189-edward did to push that image of [him]189-edward away , as [you]1795-you might try to push aside a large pendulum . But it always comes back - the memory of [his]189-edward innumerable acts of kindness , of [his]189-edward efficiency , of [his]189-edward unspiteful tongue . [He]189-edward was such [a fine fellow]1796-a fine fellow . So [I]0-i feel [myself]0-i forced to attempt to excuse [him]189-edward in this as in so many other things . It is , [I]0-i have no doubt , a most monstrous thing to attempt to corrupt [a young girl just out of a convent]1797-a young girl just out of a convent . But [I]0-i think [Edward]189-edward had no idea at all of corrupting [her]1797-a young girl just out of a convent . [I]0-i believe that [he]189-edward simply loved [her]1797-a young girl just out of a convent . [He]189-edward said that that was the way of it and [I]0-i , at least , believe [him]189-edward and [I]0-i believe too that [she]1797-a young girl just out of a convent was [the only woman [he]189-edward ever really loved]1798-the only woman he ever really loved . [He]189-edward said that that was so ; and [he]189-edward did enough to prove it . And [Leonora]183-leonora said that it was so and [Leonora]183-leonora knew [him]189-edward to the bottom of [his]189-edward heart . [I]0-i have come to be very much of [a cynic]1799-a cynic in these matters ; [I]0-i mean that it is impossible to believe in the permanence of [man]584-man 's or [woman]1801-woman 's love . Or , at any rate , it is impossible to believe in the permanence of any early passion . As [I]0-i see it , at least , with regard to [man]584-man , a love affair , a love for [any definite woman]1803-any definite woman , is something in the nature of a widening of the experience . With [each new woman that [a man]3062-a man]1804-each new woman that a man is attracted to there appears to come a broadening of the outlook , or , if [you]1806-you like , an acquiring of new territory . A turn of the eyebrow , a tone of the voice , a queer characteristic gesture - all these things , and it is these things that cause to arise the passion of love - all these things are like so many objects on the horizon of the landscape that tempt [a man]3062-a man to walk beyond the horizon , to explore . [He]189-edward wants to get , as it were , behind those eyebrows with the peculiar turn , as if [he]189-edward desired to see [the world]392-the world with the eyes that [they]1809-they overshadow . [He]189-edward wants to hear that voice applying itself to every possible proposition , to every possible topic ; [he]189-edward wants to see those characteristic gestures against every possible background . Of the question of the sex instinct [I]0-i know very little and [I]0-i do not think that it counts for very much in a really great passion . It can be aroused by such nothings - by an untied shoelace , by a glance of the eye in passing - that [I]0-i think it might be left out of the calculation . [I]0-i do n't mean to say that any great passion can exist without a desire for consummation . That seems to [me]0-i to be a commonplace and to be therefore a matter needing no comment at all . It is a thing , with all its accidents , that must be taken for granted , as , in a novel , or a biography , [you]1806-you take it for granted that [the characters]1810-the characters have [their]1810-the characters meals with some regularity . But the real fierceness of desire , the real heat of a passion long continued and withering up the soul of [a man]3062-a man , is the craving for identity with [the woman that [he]189-edward loves]1812-the woman that he loves . [He]189-edward desires to see with the same eyes , to touch with the same sense of touch , to hear with the same ears , to lose [his]189-edward identity , to be enveloped , to be supported . For , whatever may be said of the relation of the sexes , there is [no man who loves [a woman that does not desire to come to [her]1812-the woman that he loves for the renewal of [his]189-edward courage , for the cutting asunder of [his]189-edward difficulties]1814-a woman that does not desire to come to her for the renewal of his courage , for the cutting asunder of his difficulties]1813-no man who loves a woman that does not desire to come to her for the renewal of his courage , for the cutting asunder of his difficulties . And that will be the mainspring of [his]189-edward desire for [her]1812-the woman that he loves . [We]1815-we are all so afraid , [we]1815-we are all so alone , [we]1815-we all so need from the outside the assurance of [our]1815-we own worthiness to exist . So , for a time , if such a passion come to fruition , [the man]1816-the man will get what [he]1816-the man wants . [He]1816-the man will get the moral support , the encouragement , the relief from the sense of loneliness , the assurance of [his]1816-the man own worth . But these things pass away ; inevitably they pass away as the shadows pass across sun - dials . It is sad , but it is so . The pages of the book will become familiar ; the beautiful corner of [the road]792-the road will have been turned too many times . Well , this is the saddest story . And yet [I]0-i do believe that for [every man]3103-every man there comes at last [a woman]686-a woman - or , no , that is the wrong way of formulating it . For [every man]3103-every man there comes at last a time of life when [the woman who then sets [her]1821-the woman who then sets her seal upon his imagination seal upon [his]189-edward imagination]1821-the woman who then sets her seal upon his imagination has set [her]1821-the woman who then sets her seal upon his imagination seal for good . [He]189-edward will travel over no more horizons ; [he]189-edward will never again set the knapsack over [his]189-edward shoulders ; [he]189-edward will retire from those scenes . [He]189-edward will have gone out of the business . That at any rate was the case with [Edward]189-edward and [the poor girl]691-the poor girl . It was quite literally the case . It was quite literally the case that [his]189-edward passions - for [the mistress of [the Grand Duke]771-the grand duke]1193-the mistress of the grand duke , for [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil , for [little Mrs. Maidan]234-mrs. maidan , for [Florence]182-florence , for whom [you]1825-you will - these passions were merely preliminary canters compared to [his]189-edward final race with death for [her]182-florence . [I]0-i am certain of that . [I]0-i am not going to be so American as to say that all true love demands some sacrifice . It does n't . But [I]0-i think that love will be truer and more permanent in which self - sacrifice has been exacted . And , in the case of [the other women]1826-the other women , [Edward]189-edward just cut in and cut [them]1826-the other women out as [he]189-edward did with the polo - ball from under the nose of [Count Baron von Leloffel]207-count baron idigon von leloffel . [I]0-i do n't mean to say that [he]189-edward did n't wear [himself]189-edward as thin as a lath in the endeavour to capture [the other women]1826-the other women ; but over [her]182-florence [he]189-edward wore [himself]189-edward to rags and tatters and death - in the effort to leave [her]182-florence alone . And in speaking to [her]182-florence on that night , [he]189-edward was n't , [I]0-i am convinced , committing a baseness . It was as if [his]189-edward passion for [her]182-florence had n't existed ; as if the very words that [he]189-edward spoke , without knowing that [he]189-edward spoke them , created the passion as [they]1828-they went along . Before [he]189-edward spoke , there was nothing ; afterwards , was the integral fact of [his]189-edward life . Well , [I]0-i must get back to [my]0-i story . And [my]0-i story was concerning itself with [Florence]182-florence - with [Florence]182-florence , who heard those words from behind the tree . [Leonora]183-leonora says that [she]183-leonora had that flask , apparently of nitrate of amyl , but actually of prussic acid , for many years and that [she]183-leonora was determined to use it if ever [I]0-i discovered the nature of [her]183-leonora relationship with that fellow [Jimmy]200-jimmy . [You]1832-you see , the mainspring of [her]183-leonora nature must have been vanity . But [Mr. Bagshawe]263-bagshawe and the fact that the date was the 4th of [August]269-august must have been too much for [her]182-florence superstitious mind . Or perhaps [she]182-florence would have tried to exact from [me]0-i a new respect for the greatness of [her]182-florence passion on the lines of all for love and [the world]392-the world well lost . That would be just like [Florence]182-florence . In all matrimonial associations there is , [I]0-i believe , one constant factor - a desire to deceive [the person with whom one lives as to some weak spot in [one]417-one 's character or in [one]417-one 's career]1838-the person with whom one lives as to some weak spot in one 's character or in one 's career . For it is intolerable to live constantly with [one human being who perceives one]1841-one human being who perceives one 's small meannesses . It is really death to do so - that is why so many marriages turn out unhappily . [I]0-i , for instance , am [a rather greedy man]1842-a rather greedy man ; [I]0-i have a taste for good cookery and a watering tooth at the mere sound of the names of certain comestibles . If [Florence]182-florence had discovered this secret of [mine]0-i [I]0-i should have found [her]182-florence knowledge of it so unbearable that [I]0-i never could have supported all the other privations of the regime that [she]182-florence extracted from [me]0-i . [I]0-i am bound to say that [Florence]182-florence never discovered this secret . Certainly [she]182-florence never alluded to it ; [I]0-i dare say [she]182-florence never took sufficient interest in [me]0-i . Let [me]0-i , as this is in all probability the last time [I]0-i shall mention [Florence]182-florence 's name , dwell a little upon the change that had taken place in [her]182-florence psychology . [She]182-florence would not , [I]0-i mean , have minded if [I]0-i had discovered that [she]182-florence was [the mistress of [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward]1844-the mistress of edward ashburnham . [She]182-florence would rather have liked it . Indeed , the chief trouble of poor [Leonora]183-leonora in those days was to keep [Florence]182-florence from making , before [me]0-i , theatrical displays , on one line or another , of that very fact . [She]182-florence wanted , in one mood , to come rushing to [me]0-i , to cast [herself]182-florence on [her]182-florence knees at [my]0-i feet , and to declaim a carefully arranged , frightfully emotional outpouring as to [her]182-florence passion . [She]182-florence wanted to say that in cool , balanced , and sarcastic sentences . That was when [she]182-florence wished to appear like [the heroine of a French comedy]1850-the heroine of a french comedy . Because of course [she]182-florence was always play - acting . But what [she]182-florence did n't want [me]0-i to know was the fact of [her]182-florence first escapade with [the fellow called [Jimmy]200-jimmy]1843-the fellow called jimmy . [She]182-florence had arrived at figuring out the sort of low - down Bowery tough that [that fellow]1447-that fellow was . Do [you]1853-you know what it is to shudder , in later life , for some small , stupid action - usually for some small , quite genuine piece of emotionalism - of [your]1853-you early life ? And no doubt the effect of the date was too much for [her]182-florence superstitious personality . [She]182-florence had been born on the 4th of August ; [she]182-florence had started to go round [the world]392-the world on the 4th of August ; [she]182-florence had become [[a low fellow]1860-a low fellow 's mistress]1861-a low fellow 's mistress on the 4th of August . On the same day of the year [she]182-florence had married [me]0-i ; on that 4th [she]182-florence had lost [Edward]189-edward 's love and [Bagshawe]263-bagshawe had appeared like a sinister omen - like a grin on the face of fate . It was the last straw . [She]182-florence ran [upstairs]1723-upstairs , arranged [herself]182-florence decoratively upon [her]182-florence bed - [she]182-florence was [a sweetly pretty woman with smooth pink and white cheeks , long hair]1863-a sweetly pretty woman with smooth pink and white cheeks , long hair , the eyelashes falling like a tiny curtain on [her]182-florence cheeks . [She]182-florence drank the little phial of prussic acid and there [she]182-florence lay . - Oh , extremely charming and clear - cut - looking with a puzzled expression at the electric - light bulb that hung from the ceiling , or perhaps through it , to the stars above . Who knows ? Anyhow , there was an end of [Florence]182-florence . [You]1864-you have no idea how quite extraordinarily for [me]0-i that was the end of [Florence]182-florence . From that day to this [I]0-i have never given [her]182-florence another thought ; [I]0-i have not bestowed upon [her]182-florence so much as a sigh . Of course , when it has been necessary to talk about [her]182-florence to [Leonora]183-leonora or when for the purpose of these writings [I]0-i have tried to figure [her]182-florence out , [I]0-i have thought about [her]182-florence as [I]0-i might do about a problem in [Algebra]134-algebra . But it has always been as a matter for study , not for remembrance . [She]182-florence just went completely out of existence , like yesterday 's paper . [I]0-i was so deadly tired . And [I]0-i dare say that [my]0-i week or ten days of affaissement - of what was practically catalepsy - was just the repose that [my]0-i exhausted nature claimed after twelve years of the repression of [my]0-i instincts , after twelve years of playing the trained poodle . For that was all that [I]0-i had been . [I]0-i suppose that it was the shock that did it - the several shocks . But [I]0-i am unwilling to attribute [my]0-i feelings at that time to anything so concrete as a shock . It was a feeling so tranquil . If was as if an immensely heavy - an unbearably heavy knapsack , supported upon [my]0-i shoulders by straps , had fallen off and had left [my]0-i shoulders themselves , that the straps had cut into , numb and without sensation of life . [I]0-i tell [you]1865-you , [I]0-i had no regret . What [I]0-i had to regret ? [I]0-i suppose that [my]0-i inner soul - [my]0-i dual personality - had realized long before that [Florence]182-florence was a personality of paper - that [she]182-florence represented [a real human being with a heart , with feelings , with sympathies , and with emotions only as a bank note represents a certain quantity of gold]1866-a real human being with a heart , with feelings , with sympathies , and with emotions only as a bank note represents a certain quantity of gold . But [I]0-i just could n't do it ; it would have been like chasing a scrap of paper - an occupation ignoble for [a grown man]1871-a grown man . And as it began , so that matter has remained . [I]0-i did n't care whether [she]182-florence had come out of [that bedroom]1872-that bedroom or whether [she]182-florence had n't . It simply did n't interest [me]0-i . [Florence]182-florence did n't matter . [I]0-i suppose [you]1873-you will retort that [I]0-i was in love with [Nancy Rufford]257-nancy and that [my]0-i indifference was therefore discreditable . [I]0-i did n't attach much importance to [my]0-i superior years . [I]0-i was forty - five and [she]182-florence , poor thing , was only just rising twenty - two . But [she]182-florence was older than [her]182-florence years and quieter . [She]182-florence seemed to have an odd quality of sainthood , as if [she]182-florence must inevitably end in [a convent]1879-a convent with a white coif framing [her]182-florence face . But [she]182-florence had frequently told [me]0-i that [she]182-florence had no vocation ; it just simply was n't there - the desire to become [a nun]1880-a nun . No , [I]0-i did n't see any impediment on the score of age . [I]0-i dare say [no man]1524-no man does , and [I]0-i was pretty confident that , with a little preparation , [I]0-i could make [a young girl]1883-a young girl happy . [I]0-i had been kept for twelve years in a rarefied atmosphere ; what [I]0-i then had to do was a little fighting with real life , some wrestling with [men of business]1886-men of business , some travelling amongst [larger cities]1887-larger cities , something harsh , something masculine .
