IMMEDIATELY AFTER [FLORENCE]182-florence S DEATH [Leonora]183-leonora began to put the leash upon [Nancy Rufford]257-nancy and [Edward]189-edward . [She]183-leonora had guessed what had happened under the trees near [the Casino]3099-the casino . [They]1890-they stayed at [Nauheim]6-nauheim some three weeks after [I]0-i went , and [Leonora]183-leonora has told [me]0-i that that was the most deadly time of [her]183-leonora existence . It seemed like a long , silent duel with invisible weapons , so [she]183-leonora said . And it was rendered all the more difficult by [the girl]567-the girl 's entire innocence . For [Nancy]257-nancy was always trying to go off alone with [Edward]189-edward - as [she]257-nancy had been doing all [her]257-nancy life , whenever [she]257-nancy was [home]591-home for holidays . [She]257-nancy just wanted [him]189-edward to say nice things to [her]257-nancy again . [You]1893-you see , the position was extremely complicated . It was as complicated as it well could be , along delicate lines . There was the complication caused by the fact that [Edward]189-edward and [Leonora]183-leonora never spoke to [each other]407-each other except when [other people]1895-other people were present . Then , as [I]0-i have said , [their]1896-their demeanours were quite perfect . There was the complication caused by [the girl]567-the girl 's entire innocence ; there was the further complication that both [Edward]189-edward and [Leonora]183-leonora really regarded [the girl]567-the girl as [[their]1896-their daughter]1899-their daughter . Or it might be more precise to say that [they]1896-their regarded [her]567-the girl as being [[Leonora]183-leonora 's daughter]1900-leonora 's daughter . And [Nancy]257-nancy was [a queer girl]1901-a queer girl ; it is very difficult to describe [her]257-nancy to [you]1893-you . [She]257-nancy was tall and strikingly thin ; [she]257-nancy had a tortured mouth , agonized eyes , and a quite extraordinary sense of fun . [You]1893-you might put it that at times [she]257-nancy was exceedingly grotesque and at times extraordinarily beautiful . Why , [she]257-nancy had the heaviest head of black hair that [I]0-i have ever come across ; [I]0-i used to wonder how [she]257-nancy could bear the weight of it . [She]257-nancy was just over twenty - one and at times [she]257-nancy seemed as old as [the hills]1902-the hills , at times not much more than sixteen . At one moment [she]257-nancy would be talking of the lives of [the saints]1903-the saints and at the next [she]257-nancy would be tumbling all over [the lawn]1685-the lawn with the St. Bernard puppy . [She]257-nancy could ride to hounds like [a Maenad]1905-a maenad and [she]257-nancy could sit for hours perfectly still , steeping handkerchief after handkerchief in vinegar when [Leonora]183-leonora had one of [her]183-leonora headaches . [She]257-nancy was , in short , a miracle of patience who could be almost miraculously impatient . It was no doubt the convent training that effected that . [I]0-i remember that one of [her]257-nancy letters to [me]0-i , when [she]257-nancy was about sixteen , ran something like : " On Corpus Christi "[257-nancy] - or it may have been some other saint 's day , [I]0-i can not keep these things in [my]0-i head - " [[our]3173-our school]3174-our school played [Roehampton]135-roehampton at Hockey . And , seeing that [our]3173-our side was losing , being three goals to one against [us]3173-our at half - time , [we]3173-our retired into [the chapel]3175-the chapel and prayed for victory . [We]3173-our won by five goals to three . "[257-nancy] And [I]0-i remember that [she]257-nancy seemed to describe afterwards a sort of saturnalia . Apparently , when the victorious fifteen , or eleven , came into [the refectory]1906-the refectory for supper , [the whole school]1907-the whole school jumped upon the tables and cheered and broke the chairs on the floor and smashed the crockery - for a given time , until [the Reverend Mother]1908-the reverend mother rang a hand - bell . That is of course the Catholic tradition - saturnalia that can end in a moment , like the crack of a whip . [I]0-i do n't of course like the tradition , but [I]0-i am bound to say that it gave [Nancy]257-nancy - or at any rate [Nancy]257-nancy had - a sense of rectitude that [I]0-i have never seen surpassed . It was a thing like a knife that looked out of [her]257-nancy eyes and that spoke with [her]257-nancy voice , just now and then . It positively frightened [me]0-i . [I]0-i suppose that [I]0-i was almost afraid to be in a world where there could be so fine a standard . [I]0-i remember when [she]257-nancy was about fifteen or sixteen on going back to [the convent]1768-the convent [I]0-i once gave [her]257-nancy a couple of English sovereigns as a tip . [She]257-nancy thanked [me]0-i in a peculiarly heartfelt way , saying that it would come in extremely handy . [I]0-i asked [her]257-nancy why and [she]257-nancy explained . There was a rule at [the school]1910-the school that [the pupils]1911-the pupils were not to speak when [they]1911-the pupils walked through [the garden]1912-the garden from [the chapel]3175-the chapel to [the refectory]1906-the refectory . And , since this rule appeared to be idiotic and arbitrary , [she]257-nancy broke it on purpose day after day . In the evening [the children]1141-the children were all asked if [they]1141-the children had committed any faults during the day , and every evening [Nancy]257-nancy confessed that [she]257-nancy had broken this particular rule . It cost [her]257-nancy six - pence a time , that being the fine attached to the offence . Just for the information [I]0-i asked [her]257-nancy why [she]257-nancy always confessed , and [she]257-nancy answered in these exact words : " Oh , well , [the girls of the Holy Child]3176-the girls of the holy child have always been noted for [their]3176-the girls of the holy child truthfulness . It 's [a beastly bore]3177-a beastly bore , but [I]257-nancy 've got to do it . "[257-nancy] [I]0-i dare say that the miserable nature of [her]257-nancy childhood , coming before the mixture of saturnalia and discipline that was [her]257-nancy convent life , added something to [her]257-nancy queernesses . [[Her]257-nancy father]1584-her father was [a violent madman of [a fellow]1601-a fellow]1917-a violent madman of a fellow , [a major in one of what [I]0-i believe are called [the Highland regiments]1920-the highland regiments]1919-a major in one of what i believe are called the highland regiments . [He]1584-her father did n't drink , but [he]1584-her father had an ungovernable temper , and the first thing that [Nancy]257-nancy could remember was seeing [[her]257-nancy father]1584-her father strike [[her]257-nancy mother]1583-her mother with [his]1584-her father clenched fist so that [[her]257-nancy mother]1583-her mother fell over sideways from the breakfast table and lay motionless . [The mother]1924-the mother was no doubt [an irritating woman]1925-an irritating woman and [the privates of that regiment]1926-the privates of that regiment appear to have been irritating , too , so that [the house]1359-the house was [a place of outcries and perpetual disturbance]1928-a place of outcries and perpetual disturbance . [Mrs. Rufford]270-mrs. rufford was [[Leonora]183-leonora 's dearest friend]1929-leonora 's dearest friend and [Leonora]183-leonora could be cutting enough at times . But [I]0-i fancy [she]257-nancy was as nothing to [Mrs. Rufford]270-mrs. rufford . [The Major]1930-the major would come in to lunch harassed and already spitting out oaths after an unsatisfactory morning 's drilling of [[his]1930-the major stubborn men]1931-his stubborn men beneath a hot sun . And then [Mrs. Rufford]270-mrs. rufford would make some cutting remark and pandemonium would break loose . Once , when [she]257-nancy had been about twelve , [Nancy]257-nancy had tried to intervene between [the pair of [them]1272-the pair of them]1272-the pair of them . [[Her]257-nancy father]1584-her father had struck [her]257-nancy full upon the forehead a blow so terrible that [she]257-nancy had lain unconscious for three days . Nevertheless [Nancy]257-nancy seemed to prefer [[her]257-nancy father]1584-her father to [[her]257-nancy mother]1583-her mother . [She]257-nancy remembered rough kindnesses from [him]1584-her father . Once or twice when [she]257-nancy had been quite small [he]1584-her father had dressed [her]257-nancy in a clumsy , impatient , but very tender way . It was nearly always impossible to get [a servant]1117-a servant to stay in [the family]1937-the family and for days at a time , apparently , [Mrs. Rufford]270-mrs. rufford would be incapable . [I]0-i fancy [she]257-nancy drank . At any rate [she]257-nancy had so cutting a tongue that even [Nancy]257-nancy was afraid of [her]257-nancy - [she]257-nancy so made fun of any tenderness , [she]257-nancy so sneered at all emotional displays . [Nancy]257-nancy must have been [a very emotional child]1938-a very emotional child .... Then one day , quite suddenly , on [her]257-nancy return from a ride at [Fort William]136-fort william , [Nancy]257-nancy had been sent , with [[her]257-nancy governess]1939-her governess , who had a white face , right down south to [that convent school]1940-that convent school . [She]257-nancy had been expecting to go [there]363-there in two months ' time . [[Her]257-nancy mother]1583-her mother disappeared from [her]257-nancy life at that time . A fortnight later [Leonora]183-leonora came to [the convent]1768-the convent and told [her]257-nancy that [[her]257-nancy mother]1583-her mother was dead . Perhaps [she]257-nancy was . At any rate [I]0-i never heard until the very end what became of [Mrs. Rufford]270-mrs. rufford . [Leonora]183-leonora never spoke of [her]270-mrs. rufford . And then [Major Rufford]271-major rufford went to [India]93-india , from which [he]271-major rufford returned very seldom and only for very short visits ; and [Nancy]257-nancy lived [herself]257-nancy gradually into the life at [Branshaw Teleragh]180-branshaw . [I]0-i think that , from that time onwards , [she]257-nancy led a very happy life , till the end . There were dogs and horses and [old servants]1945-old servants and [the Forest]1682-the forest . And there were [Edward]189-edward and [Leonora]183-leonora , who loved [her]257-nancy . [I]0-i had known [her]257-nancy all the time - [I]0-i mean that [she]257-nancy always came to [[the Ashburnhams]178-the ashburnhams ' at [Nauheim]6-nauheim]1947-the ashburnhams ' at nauheim for the last fortnight of [their]178-the ashburnhams stay , and [I]0-i watched [her]257-nancy gradually growing . [She]257-nancy was very cheerful with [me]0-i . [She]257-nancy always even kissed [me]0-i , night and morning , until [she]257-nancy was about eighteen . And [she]257-nancy would skip about and fetch [me]0-i things and laugh at [my]0-i tales of life in [Philadelphia]10-philadelphia . But , beneath [her]257-nancy gaiety , [I]0-i fancy that there lurked some terrors . [I]0-i remember one day , when [she]257-nancy was just eighteen , during one of [[her]257-nancy father]1584-her father 's rare visits to [Europe]2-europe , [we]1949-we were sitting in [the gardens]1244-the gardens , near the iron - stained fountain . [Leonora]183-leonora had one of [her]183-leonora headaches and [we]1949-we were waiting for [Florence]182-florence and [Edward]189-edward to come from [[their]1951-their baths]1952-their baths . [You]1953-you have no idea how beautiful [Nancy]257-nancy looked that morning . [We]1949-we were talking about the desirability of taking tickets in lotteries - of the moral side of it , [I]0-i mean . [She]257-nancy was all in white , and so tall and fragile ; and [she]257-nancy had only just put [her]257-nancy hair up , so that the carriage of [her]257-nancy neck had that charming touch of youth and of unfamiliarity . Over [her]257-nancy throat there played the reflection from a little pool of water , left by a thunderstorm of the night before , and all the rest of [her]257-nancy features were in the diffused and luminous shade of [her]257-nancy white parasol . [Her]257-nancy dark hair just showed beneath [her]257-nancy broad , white hat of pierced , chip straw ; [her]257-nancy throat was very long and leaned forward , and [her]257-nancy eyebrows , arching a little as [she]257-nancy laughed at some old - fashionedness in [my]0-i phraseology , had abandoned their tense line . And there was a little colour in [her]257-nancy cheeks and light in [her]257-nancy deep blue eyes . And to think that that vivid white thing , that saintly and swanlike being - to think that . . . Why , [she]257-nancy was like the sail of [a ship]1954-a ship , so white and so definite in [her]257-nancy movements . And to think that [she]257-nancy will never . . . Why , [she]257-nancy will never do anything again . [I]0-i ca n't believe it .... Anyhow [we]1955-we were chattering away about the morality of lotteries . And then , suddenly , there came from [the arcades]1956-the arcades behind [us]1955-we the overtones of [[her]257-nancy father]1584-her father 's unmistakable voice ; it was as if a modified foghorn had boomed with a reed inside it . [I]0-i looked round to catch sight of [him]1584-her father . [A tall , fair , stiffly upright man of fifty]1958-a tall , fair , stiffly upright man of fifty , [he]1584-her father was walking away with [an Italian baron who had had much to do with [the Belgian Congo]137-the belgian congo]1959-an italian baron who had had much to do with the belgian congo . [They]1960-they must have been talking about the proper treatment of [natives]1961-natives , for [I]0-i heard [him]1584-her father say : " Oh , hang [humanity]3178-humanity ! "[1584-her father] When [I]0-i looked again at [Nancy]257-nancy [her]257-nancy eyes were closed and [her]257-nancy face was more pallid than [her]257-nancy dress , which had at least some pinkish reflections from the gravel . It was dreadful to see [her]257-nancy with [her]257-nancy eyes closed like that . " Oh , "[257-nancy] [she]257-nancy exclaimed , and [her]257-nancy hand , that had appeared to be groping , settled for a moment on [my]0-i arm . " Never speak of it . Promise never to tell [[my]257-nancy father]3179-my father of it . It brings back those dreadful dreams ... "[257-nancy] And when [she]257-nancy opened [her]257-nancy eyes [she]257-nancy looked straight into [mine]0-i . " [The blessed saints]3180-the blessed saints , "[257-nancy] [she]257-nancy said , " [you]0-i would think [they]3180-the blessed saints would spare [you]0-i such things . [I]257-nancy do n't believe all the sinning in [the world]392-the world could make one deserve [them]3180-the blessed saints . "[257-nancy] [They]1962-they say [the poor thing]348-the poor thing was always allowed a light at night , even in [[her]257-nancy bedroom]1296-her bedroom .... And yet [no young girl]1965-no young girl could more archly and lovingly have played with [an adored father]1966-an adored father . [She]257-nancy was always holding [him]1966-an adored father by both coat lapels ; cross - questioning [him]1966-an adored father as to how [he]1966-an adored father spent [his]1966-an adored father time ; kissing the top of [his]1966-an adored father head . Ah , [she]257-nancy was well - bred , if ever [anyone]1048-anyone was . [The poor , wretched man]1968-the poor , wretched man cringed before [her]257-nancy - but [she]257-nancy could not have done more to put [him]1966-an adored father at [his]1966-an adored father ease . Perhaps [she]257-nancy had had lessons in it at [[her]257-nancy convent]1969-her convent . It was only that peculiar note of [his]1966-an adored father voice , used when [he]1966-an adored father was overbearing or dogmatic , that could unman [her]257-nancy - and that was only visible when it came unexpectedly . That was because the bad dreams that [the blessed saints]3180-the blessed saints allowed [her]257-nancy to have for [her]257-nancy sins always seemed to [her]257-nancy to herald [themselves]1971-themselves by the booming sound of [[her]257-nancy father]1584-her father 's voice . It was that sound that had always preceded [his]1966-an adored father entrance for the terrible lunches of [her]257-nancy childhood .... [I]0-i have reported , earlier in this chapter , that [Leonora]183-leonora said , during that remainder of [their]1973-their stay at [Nauheim]6-nauheim , after [I]0-i had left , it had seemed to [her]257-nancy that [she]257-nancy was fighting a long duel with unseen weapons against [silent adversaries]1974-silent adversaries . [Nancy]257-nancy , as [I]0-i have also said , was always trying to go off with [Edward]189-edward alone . That had been [her]257-nancy habit for years . And [Leonora]183-leonora found it to be [her]183-leonora duty to stop that . It was very difficult . [Nancy]257-nancy was used to having [her]257-nancy own way , and for years [she]257-nancy had been used to going off with [Edward]189-edward , ratting , rabbiting , catching salmon down at [Fordingbridge]16-fordingbridge , [district visiting of the sort that [Edward]189-edward indulged in]1975-district visiting of the sort that edward indulged in , or calling on [the tenants]1124-the tenants . And at [Nauheim]6-nauheim [she]183-leonora and [Edward]189-edward had always gone up to [the Casino]3099-the casino alone in the evenings - at any rate whenever [Florence]182-florence did not call for [his]189-edward attendance . It shows the obviously innocent nature of the regard of those two that even [Florence]182-florence had never had any idea of jealousy . [Leonora]183-leonora had cultivated the habit of going to bed at ten o'clock . [I]0-i do n't know how [she]183-leonora managed it , but , for all the time [they]1978-they were at [Nauheim]6-nauheim , [she]183-leonora contrived never to let [those two]1518-those two be alone together , except in broad daylight , in very crowded places . If [a Protestant]1980-a protestant had done that it would no doubt have awakened a self - consciousness in [the girl]567-the girl . But [Catholics , who have always reservations and queer spots of secrecy]1982-catholics , who have always reservations and queer spots of secrecy , can manage these things better . And [I]0-i dare say that two things made this easier - the death of [Florence]182-florence and the fact that [Edward]189-edward was obviously sickening . [He]189-edward appeared indeed , to be very ill ; [his]189-edward shoulders began to be bowed ; there were pockets under [his]189-edward eyes ; [he]189-edward had extraordinary moments of inattention . And [Leonora]183-leonora describes [herself]183-leonora as watching [him]189-edward as a fierce cat watches an unconscious pigeon in [a roadway]1983-a roadway . In that silent watching , again , [I]0-i think [she]183-leonora was [a Catholic]1984-a catholic - of [a people that can think thoughts alien to [ours]1986-ours and keep them to [themselves]1985-a people that can think thoughts alien to ours and keep them to themselves]1985-a people that can think thoughts alien to ours and keep them to themselves . And the thoughts passed through [her]183-leonora mind ; some of them even got through to [Edward]189-edward with never a word spoken . At first [she]183-leonora thought that it might be remorse , or grief , for the death of [Florence]182-florence that was oppressing [him]189-edward . But [she]183-leonora watched and watched , and uttered apparently random sentences about [Florence]182-florence before [the girl]567-the girl , and [she]183-leonora perceived that [he]189-edward had no grief and no remorse . [He]189-edward had not any idea that [Florence]182-florence could have committed suicide without writing at least a tirade to [him]189-edward . The absence of that made [him]189-edward certain that it had been heart disease . For [Florence]182-florence had never undeceived [him]189-edward on that point . [She]182-florence thought it made [her]182-florence seem more romantic . No , [Edward]189-edward had no remorse . [He]189-edward was able to say to [himself]189-edward that [he]189-edward had treated [Florence]182-florence with gallant attentiveness of the kind that [she]182-florence desired until two hours before [her]182-florence death . [Leonora]183-leonora gathered that from the look in [his]189-edward eyes , and from the way [he]189-edward straightened [his]189-edward shoulders over [her]182-florence as [she]182-florence lay in [her]182-florence coffin - from that and a thousand other little things . [She]183-leonora would speak suddenly about [Florence]182-florence to [the girl]567-the girl and [he]189-edward would not start in the least ; [he]189-edward would not even pay attention , but would sit with bloodshot eyes gazing at the tablecloth . [He]189-edward drank a good deal , at that time - a steady soaking of drink every evening till long after [they]1989-they had gone to bed . For [Leonora]183-leonora made [the girl]567-the girl go to bed at ten , unreasonable though that seemed to [Nancy]257-nancy . [She]183-leonora would understand that , whilst [they]1989-they were in a sort of half - mourning for [Florence]182-florence , [she]183-leonora ought not to be seen at public places , like [the Casino]3099-the casino ; but [she]183-leonora could not see why [she]183-leonora should not accompany [[her]183-leonora uncle]524-her uncle upon [his]189-edward evening strolls through [the park]1744-the park . [I]0-i do n't know what [Leonora]183-leonora put up as an excuse - something , [I]0-i fancy , in the nature of a nightly orison that [she]183-leonora made [the girl]567-the girl and [herself]183-leonora perform for the soul of [Florence]182-florence . And then , one evening , about a fortnight later , when [the girl]567-the girl , growing restive at even devotional exercises , clamoured once more to be allowed to go for a walk with [Edward]189-edward , and when [Leonora]183-leonora was really at [her]183-leonora wits ' end , [Edward]189-edward [himself]189-edward gave [himself]189-edward into [her]183-leonora hands . [He]189-edward was just standing up from dinner and had [his]189-edward face averted . But [he]189-edward turned [his]189-edward heavy head and [his]189-edward bloodshot eyes upon [[his]189-edward wife]388-his wife and looked full at [her]388-his wife . " [Doctor von Hauptmann]272-doctor von hauptmann , "[189-edward] [he]189-edward said , " has ordered [me]189-edward to go to bed immediately after dinner . [My]189-edward heart 's much worse . "[189-edward] [He]189-edward continued to look at [Leonora]183-leonora for a long minute - with a sort of heavy contempt . And [Leonora]183-leonora understood that , with [his]189-edward speech , [he]189-edward was giving [her]388-his wife the excuse that [she]388-his wife needed for separating [him]189-edward from [the girl]567-the girl , and with [his]189-edward eyes [he]189-edward was reproaching [her]388-his wife for thinking that [he]189-edward would try to corrupt [Nancy]257-nancy . [He]189-edward went silently up to [[his]189-edward room]1232-his room and sat there for a long time - until [the girl]567-the girl was well in bed - reading in the Anglican prayer book . And about half past ten [she]388-his wife heard [his]189-edward footsteps pass [her]388-his wife door , going outwards . Two and a half hours later [they]2000-they came back , stumbling heavily . [She]388-his wife remained , reflecting upon this position until the last night of [their]2000-they stay at [Nauheim]6-nauheim . Then [she]388-his wife suddenly acted . For , just in the same way , suddenly after dinner , [she]388-his wife looked at [him]189-edward and said : " [Teddy]189-edward , do n't [you]189-edward think [you]189-edward could take a night off from [[your]189-edward doctor]3182-your doctor 's orders and go with [Nancy]257-nancy to [the Casino]3099-the casino ? [The poor child]1200-the poor child has had [her]1200-the poor child visit so spoiled . "[388-his wife] [He]189-edward looked at [her]388-his wife in turn for a long , balancing minute . " Why , yes , "[189-edward] [he]189-edward said at last . [Nancy]257-nancy jumped out of [her]257-nancy chair and kissed [him]189-edward . Those two words , [Leonora]183-leonora said , gave [her]183-leonora the greatest relief of any two syllables [she]183-leonora had ever heard in [her]183-leonora life . For [she]183-leonora realized that [Edward]189-edward was breaking up , not under the desire for possession , but from the dogged determination to hold [his]189-edward hand . [She]183-leonora could relax some of [her]183-leonora vigilance . Nevertheless [she]183-leonora sat in the darkness behind [her]183-leonora half - closed jalousies looking over [the street]1564-the street and the night and the trees until , very late , [she]183-leonora could hear [Nancy]257-nancy 's clear voice coming closer and saying : " [You]189-edward did look [an old guy with that false nose]3185-an old guy with that false nose . "[257-nancy] There had been some sort of celebration of a local holiday up in [the Kursaal]138-the kursaal . And [Edward]189-edward replied with [his]189-edward sort of sulky good nature : " As for [you]567-the girl , [you]567-the girl looked like [old Mother Sideacher]3186-old mother sideacher . "[189-edward] [The girl]567-the girl came swinging along , a silhouette beneath a gas - lamp ; [Edward]189-edward , another , slouched at [her]567-the girl side . [They]2003-they were talking just as [they]2003-they had talked any time since [the girl]567-the girl had been seventeen ; with the same tones , the same joke about [an old beggar woman who always amused [them]2003-they at [Branshaw]180-branshaw]2005-an old beggar woman who always amused them at branshaw . [The girl]567-the girl , a little later , opened [Leonora]183-leonora 's door whilst [she]567-the girl was still kissing [Edward]189-edward on the forehead as [she]567-the girl had done every night . " [We]2003-they 've had a most glorious time , "[567-the girl] [she]567-the girl said . " [He]189-edward 's ever so much better . [He]189-edward raced [me]567-the girl for twenty yards [home]591-home . Why are [you]2003-they all in the dark ? "[567-the girl] [Leonora]183-leonora could hear [Edward]189-edward going about in [[his]189-edward room]1232-his room , but , owing to [the girl]567-the girl 's chatter , [she]183-leonora could not tell whether [he]189-edward went out again or not . And then , very much later , because [she]183-leonora thought that if [he]189-edward were drinking again something must be done to stop it , [she]183-leonora opened for the first time , and very softly , the never - opened door between [[their]2009-their rooms]2010-their rooms . [She]183-leonora wanted to see if [he]189-edward had gone out again . [Edward]189-edward was kneeling beside [his]189-edward bed with [his]189-edward head hidden in the counterpane . [His]189-edward arms , outstretched , held out before [him]189-edward a little image of [the blessed virgin]2011-the blessed virgin - a tawdry , scarlet and Prussian - blue affair that [the girl]567-the girl had given [him]189-edward on [her]567-the girl first return from [the convent]1768-the convent . [His]189-edward shoulders heaved convulsively three times , and heavy sobs came from [him]189-edward before [she]183-leonora could close the door . [He]189-edward was not [a Catholic]1984-a catholic ; but that was the way it took [him]189-edward . [Leonora]183-leonora slept for the first time that night with a sleep from which [she]183-leonora never once started . AND THEN [Leonora]183-leonora completely broke down - on the day that [they]2015-they returned to [Branshaw Teleragh]180-branshaw . It is the infliction of [our]2016-our miserable minds - it is the scourge of atrocious but probably just destiny that no grief comes by itself . No , any great grief , though the grief itself may have gone , leaves in its place a train of horrors , of misery , and despair . For [Leonora]183-leonora was , in [herself]183-leonora , relieved . [She]183-leonora felt that [she]183-leonora could trust [Edward]189-edward with [the girl]567-the girl and [she]183-leonora knew that [Nancy]257-nancy could be absolutely trusted . And then , with the slackening of [her]183-leonora vigilance , came the slackening of [her]183-leonora entire mind . This is perhaps the most miserable part of the entire story . For it is miserable to see a clear intelligence waver ; and [Leonora]183-leonora wavered . [You]2018-you are to understand that [Leonora]183-leonora loved [Edward]189-edward with a passion that was yet like an agony of hatred . And [she]183-leonora had lived with [him]189-edward for years and years without addressing to [him]189-edward one word of tenderness . [I]0-i do n't know how [she]183-leonora could do it . At the beginning of that relationship [she]183-leonora had been just married off to [him]189-edward . [She]183-leonora had been [one of seven daughters in [a bare , untidy Irish manor house to which [she]183-leonora had returned from [the convent]1768-the convent [I]0-i have so often spoken of]2020-a bare , untidy irish manor house to which she had returned from the convent i have so often spoken of]2019-one of seven daughters in a bare , untidy irish manor house to which she had returned from the convent i have so often spoken of . [She]183-leonora had left [it]2022-it just a year and [she]183-leonora was just nineteen . It is impossible to imagine such inexperience as was [hers]183-leonora . [You]2018-you might almost say that [she]183-leonora had never spoken to [a man]3062-a man except [a priest]2024-a priest . Coming straight from [the convent]1768-the convent , [she]183-leonora had gone in behind the high walls of [the manor house]2026-the manor house that was almost more cloistral than [any convent]2027-any convent could have been . There were [the seven girls]2028-the seven girls , there was [the strained mother]2029-the strained mother , there was [the worried father]2030-the worried father , at whom , three times in the course of that year , [the tenants]1124-the tenants took potshots from behind a hedge . [The women]2032-the women - folk , upon the whole , [the tenants]1124-the tenants respected . Once a week each of [the girls]2034-the girls , since there were [seven of [them]2034-the girls]2035-seven of them , took a drive with [the mother]1924-the mother in the old basketwork chaise drawn by [a very fat , very lumbering pony]2037-a very fat , very lumbering pony . [They]2034-the girls paid occasionally a call , but even these were so rare that , [Leonora]183-leonora had assured [me]0-i , only three times in the year that succeeded [her]183-leonora coming [home]591-home from [the convent]1768-the convent did [she]183-leonora enter [[another person]2040-another person 's house]2041-another person 's house . For the rest of the time [the seven sisters]2042-the seven sisters ran about in [the neglected gardens]2043-the neglected gardens between [the unpruned espaliers]2044-the unpruned espaliers . Or [they]2042-the seven sisters played lawn - tennis or fives in an angle of a great wall that surrounded [the garden]1912-the garden - an angle from which the fruit trees had long died away . [They]2042-the seven sisters painted in water - colour ; [they]2042-the seven sisters embroidered ; [they]2042-the seven sisters copied verses into albums . Once a week [they]2042-the seven sisters went to mass ; once a week to [the confessional]2046-the confessional accompanied by [an old nurse]2047-an old nurse . [They]2042-the seven sisters were happy since [they]2042-the seven sisters had known no other life . It appeared to [them]2042-the seven sisters a singular extravagance when , one day , [a photographer]2048-a photographer was brought over from [the county town]2049-the county town and photographed [them]2042-the seven sisters standing , all seven , in the shadow of an old apple tree with the grey lichen on the raddled trunk . But it was n't an extravagance . Three weeks before [Colonel Powys]273-colonel powys had written to [Colonel Ashburnham]274-colonel ashburnham : " [I]273-colonel powys say , [Harry]217-henry viii , could n't [[your]217-henry viii [Edward]189-edward]3188-your edward marry [one of [[my]273-colonel powys girls]3190-my girls]3189-one of my girls ? It would be a god - send to [me]273-colonel powys , for [I]273-colonel powys 'm at the end of [my]273-colonel powys tether , and once [one girl]3191-one girl begins to go off , the rest of [them]3190-my girls will follow . "[273-colonel powys] [He]273-colonel powys went on to say that all [[his]273-colonel powys daughters]2050-his daughters were tall , upstanding , clean - limbed , and absolutely pure , and [he]273-colonel powys reminded [Colonel Ashburnham]274-colonel ashburnham that , [they]2051-they having been married on the same day , though in [different churches]2052-different churches , since [the one]2053-the one was [a Catholic]1984-a catholic and [the other an Anglican]2055-the other an anglican - [they]2051-they had said to [each other]407-each other , the night before , that , when the time came , [one of [[their]2051-they sons]2058-their sons]2057-one of their sons should marry [one of [[their]2051-they daughters]2060-their daughters]2059-one of their daughters . [Mrs. Ashburnham]180-branshaw had been [a Powys]273-colonel powys and remained [[Mrs. Powys]275-mrs. powys ' dearest friend]2061-mrs. powys ' dearest friend . [They]2051-they had drifted about [the world]392-the world as [English soldiers]2063-english soldiers do , seldom meeting , but [[their]2051-they women]2064-their women always in correspondence one with [another]2065-another . [They]2051-they wrote about minute things such as the teething of [Edward]189-edward and of [the earlier daughters]2066-the earlier daughters or the best way to repair a [Jacob]276-jacob 's ladder in a stocking . And , if [they]2051-they met seldom , yet it was often enough to keep [each other]407-each other 's personalities fresh in [their]2051-they minds , gradually growing greyer , gradually growing a little stiff in the joints , but always with enough to talk about and with a store of reminiscences . Then , as [[his]189-edward girls]2068-his girls began to come of an age when [they]2068-his girls must leave [the convent in which [they]2068-his girls were regularly interned during [his]189-edward years of active service]2069-the convent in which they were regularly interned during his years of active service , [Colonel Powys]273-colonel powys retired from [the army]2070-the army with the necessity of making [a home for [them]2068-his girls]2071-a home for them . It happened that [the Ashburnhams]178-the ashburnhams had never seen [any of [the Powys girls]2073-the powys girls]2072-any of the powys girls , though , whenever [the four parents]2074-the four parents met in [London]76-london , [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward was always of the party . [He]189-edward was at that time twenty - two and , [I]0-i believe , almost as pure in mind as [Leonora]183-leonora [herself]183-leonora . It is odd how [a boy]2075-a boy can have [his]2075-a boy virgin intelligence untouched in [this world]798-this world . That was partly due to the careful handling of [[his]189-edward mother]2077-his mother , partly to the fact that [the house to which [he]189-edward went at [Winchester]104-winchester]2078-the house to which he went at winchester had a particularly pure tone , and partly to [Edward]189-edward 's own peculiar aversion from anything like coarse language or gross stories . At [Sandhurst]139-sandhurst [he]189-edward had just kept out of the way of that sort of thing . [He]189-edward was keen on soldiering , keen on mathematics , on land - surveying , on politics , and , by a queer warp of [his]189-edward mind , on literature . Even when [he]189-edward was twenty - two [he]189-edward would pass hours reading one of [Scott]277-scott 's novels or the Chronicles of [Froissart]278-froissart . [Mrs. Ashburnham]180-branshaw considered that [she]180-branshaw was to be congratulated , and almost every week [she]180-branshaw wrote to [Mrs. Powys]275-mrs. powys , dilating upon [her]180-branshaw satisfaction . Then , one day , taking a walk down [Bond Street]140-bond street with [[her]180-branshaw son]747-her son , after having been at [Lord 's]141-lord 's , [she]180-branshaw noticed [Edward]189-edward suddenly turn [his]189-edward head round to take a second look at [a well - dressed girl who had passed [them]2081-them]2080-a well - dressed girl who had passed them . [She]180-branshaw wrote about that , too , to [Mrs. Powys]275-mrs. powys , and expressed some alarm . It had been , on [Edward]189-edward 's part , the merest reflex action . [He]189-edward was so very abstracted at that time owing to the pressure [his]189-edward crammer was putting upon [him]189-edward that [he]189-edward certainly had n't known what [he]189-edward was doing . It was this letter of [Mrs. Ashburnham]180-branshaw 's to [Mrs. Powys]275-mrs. powys that had caused the letter from [Colonel Powys]273-colonel powys to [Colonel Ashburnham]274-colonel ashburnham - a letter that was half humorous , half longing . [Mrs. Ashburnham]180-branshaw caused [[her]180-branshaw husband]509-her husband to reply , with a letter a little more jocular - something to the effect that [Colonel Powys]273-colonel powys ought to give [them]2081-them some idea of the goods that [he]273-colonel powys was marketing . That was the cause of the photograph . [I]0-i have seen it , [the seven girls]2028-the seven girls , all in white dresses , all very much alike in feature - all , except [Leonora]183-leonora , a little heavy about the chins and a little stupid about the eyes . [I]0-i dare say it would have made [Leonora]183-leonora , too , look a little heavy and a little stupid , for it was not a good photograph . But the black shadow from one the branches of the apple tree cut right across [her]183-leonora face , which is all but invisible . There followed an extremely harassing time for [Colonel]273-colonel powys and [Mrs. Powys]275-mrs. powys . [Mrs. Ashburnham]180-branshaw had written to say that , quite sincerely , nothing would give greater ease to [her]180-branshaw maternal anxieties than to have [[her]180-branshaw son]747-her son marry [one of [[Mrs. Powys]275-mrs. powys ' daughters]2086-mrs. powys ' daughters]2085-one of mrs. powys ' daughters if only [he]747-her son showed some inclination to do so . For , [she]180-branshaw added , nothing but a love - match was to be thought of in [her]180-branshaw [Edward]189-edward 's case . But [the poor Powys couple]2087-the poor powys couple had to run things so very fine that even the bringing together of [the young people]2088-the young people was a desperate hazard . The mere expenditure upon sending [one of [the girls]2034-the girls]2089-one of the girls over from [Ireland]142-ireland to [Branshaw]180-branshaw was terrifying to [them]2087-the poor powys couple ; and [whichever girl [they]2087-the poor powys couple selected]2091-whichever girl they selected might not be the one to ring [Edward]189-edward 's bell . On the other hand , the expenditure upon mere food and extra sheets for a visit from [the Ashburnhams]178-the ashburnhams to [them]2087-the poor powys couple was terrifying , too . It would mean , mathematically , going short in so many meals [themselves]2087-the poor powys couple , afterwards . Nevertheless [they]2087-the poor powys couple chanced it , and [all the three Ashburnhams]2092-all the three ashburnhams came on a visit to [the lonely manor house]2093-the lonely manor house . [They]2092-all the three ashburnhams could give [Edward]189-edward some rough shooting , some rough fishing , and a whirl of femininity ; but [I]0-i should say [the girls]2034-the girls made really more impression upon [Mrs. Ashburnham]180-branshaw than upon [Edward]189-edward [himself]189-edward . [They]2092-all the three ashburnhams appeared to [her]180-branshaw to be so clean - run and so safe . [They]2092-all the three ashburnhams were indeed so clean - run that , in a faint sort of way , [Edward]189-edward seems to have regarded [them]2092-all the three ashburnhams rather as [boys]2095-boys than as [girls]2096-girls . And then , one evening , [Mrs. Ashburnham]180-branshaw had with [[her]180-branshaw boy]2097-her boy one of those conversations that [English mothers]2098-english mothers have with [English sons]2099-english sons . It seems to have been a criminal sort of proceeding , though [I]0-i do n't know what took place at it . Anyhow , next morning [Colonel Ashburnham]274-colonel ashburnham asked on behalf of [[his]274-colonel ashburnham son]2100-his son for the hand of [Leonora]183-leonora . This caused some consternation to [the Powys couple]2101-the powys couple , since [Leonora]183-leonora was [the third daughter]2102-the third daughter and [Edward]189-edward ought to have married [the eldest]2103-the eldest . [Mrs. Powys]275-mrs. powys , with [her]275-mrs. powys rigid sense of the proprieties , almost wished to reject the proposal . But [the Colonel]2104-the colonel , [[her]275-mrs. powys husband]509-her husband , pointed out that the visit would have cost [them]2101-the powys couple sixty pounds , what with the hire of [an extra servant]2106-an extra servant , of a horse and [car]2107-car , and with the purchase of beds and bedding and extra tablecloths . There was nothing else for it but the marriage . In that way [Edward]189-edward and [Leonora]183-leonora became [man]584-man and [wife]2109-wife . [I]0-i do n't know that a very minute study of [their]2101-the powys couple progress towards complete disunion is necessary . Perhaps it is . But there are many things that [I]0-i can not well make out , about which [I]0-i can not well question [Leonora]183-leonora , or about which [Edward]189-edward did not tell [me]0-i . [I]0-i do not know that there was ever any question of love from [Edward]189-edward to [her]183-leonora . [He]189-edward regarded [her]183-leonora , certainly , as desirable amongst [[her]183-leonora sisters]2110-her sisters . [He]189-edward was obstinate to the extent of saying that if [he]189-edward could not have [her]183-leonora [he]189-edward would not have any of [them]2110-her sisters . And no doubt , before the marriage , [he]189-edward made [her]183-leonora pretty speeches out of books that [he]189-edward had read . But , as far as [he]189-edward could describe [his]189-edward feelings at all , later , it seems that , calmly and without any quickening of the pulse , [he]189-edward just carried [the girl]567-the girl off , there being no opposition . It had , however , been all so long ago that it seemed to [him]189-edward , at the end of [his]189-edward poor life , a dim and misty affair . [He]189-edward had the greatest admiration for [Leonora]183-leonora . [He]189-edward had the very greatest admiration . [He]189-edward admired [her]183-leonora for [her]183-leonora truthfulness , for [her]183-leonora cleanness of mind , and the clean - runness of [her]183-leonora limbs , for [her]183-leonora efficiency , for the fairness of [her]183-leonora skin , for the gold of [her]183-leonora hair , for [her]183-leonora religion , for [her]183-leonora sense of duty . It was a satisfaction to take [her]183-leonora about with [him]189-edward . But [she]183-leonora had not for [him]189-edward a touch of magnetism . [I]0-i suppose , really , [he]189-edward did not love [her]183-leonora because [she]183-leonora was never mournful ; what really made [him]189-edward feel good in life was to comfort [somebody who would be darkly and mysteriously mournful]2112-somebody who would be darkly and mysteriously mournful . That [he]189-edward had never had to do for [Leonora]183-leonora . Perhaps , also , [she]183-leonora was at first too obedient . [I]0-i do not mean to say that [she]183-leonora was submissive - that [she]183-leonora deferred , in [her]183-leonora judgments , to [his]189-edward . [She]183-leonora did not . But [she]183-leonora had been handed over to [him]189-edward , like [some patient mediaeval virgin]2113-some patient mediaeval virgin ; [she]183-leonora had been taught all [her]183-leonora life that the first duty of [a woman]686-a woman is to obey . And there [she]183-leonora was . In [her]183-leonora , at least , admiration for [his]189-edward qualities very soon become love of the deepest description . If [his]189-edward pulses never quickened [she]183-leonora , so [I]0-i have been told , became what is called an altered being when [he]189-edward approached [her]183-leonora from the other side of a dancing floor . [Her]183-leonora eyes followed [him]189-edward about full of trustfulness , of admiration , of gratitude , and of love . [He]189-edward was also , in a great sense , [[her]183-leonora pastor]2115-her pastor and [guide]2116-guide - and [he]189-edward guided [her]183-leonora into what , for [a girl]2117-a girl straight out of [a convent]1879-a convent , was almost heaven . [I]0-i have not the least idea of what [an English officer 's wife]2119-an english officer 's wife 's existence may be like . At any rate there were feasts , and chatterings , and [nice men who gave [her]183-leonora the right sort of admiration , and [nice women who treated [her]183-leonora as if [she]183-leonora had been [a baby]2122-a baby]2121-nice women who treated her as if she had been a baby]2120-nice men who gave her the right sort of admiration , and nice women who treated her as if she had been a baby . And [[her]183-leonora confessor]2123-her confessor approved of [her]183-leonora life , and [Edward]189-edward let [her]183-leonora give little treats to [the girls of [the convent]1768-the convent [she]183-leonora had left]2124-the girls of the convent she had left , and [the Reverend Mother]1908-the reverend mother approved of [him]189-edward . There could not have been [a happier girl]2127-a happier girl for five or six years . For it was only at the end of that time that clouds began , as the saying is , to arise . [She]183-leonora was then about twenty - three , and [her]183-leonora purposeful efficiency made [her]183-leonora perhaps have a desire for mastery . [She]183-leonora began to perceive that [Edward]189-edward was extravagant in [[his]189-edward largesses]2128-his largesses . [[His]189-edward parents]1122-his parents died just about that time , and [Edward]189-edward , though [they]1122-his parents both decided that [he]189-edward should continue [his]189-edward soldiering , gave a great deal of attention to the management of [Branshaw]180-branshaw through [a steward]2130-a steward . [Aldershot]143-aldershot was not very far away , and [they]1122-his parents spent all [his]189-edward leaves [there]363-there . And , suddenly , [she]183-leonora seemed to begin to perceive that [his]189-edward generosities were almost fantastic . [He]189-edward subscribed much too much to things connected with [his]189-edward mess , [he]189-edward pensioned off [[[his]189-edward father]2132-his father 's servants]2133-his father 's servants , old or new , much too generously . [They]1122-his parents had a large income , but every now and then [they]1122-his parents would find [themselves]1122-his parents hard up . [He]189-edward began to talk of mortgaging [a farm]2134-a farm or two , though it never actually came to that . [She]183-leonora made tentative efforts at remonstrating with [him]189-edward . [[Her]183-leonora father]1584-her father , whom [she]183-leonora saw now and then , said that [Edward]189-edward was much too generous to [[his]189-edward tenants]1123-his tenants ; [the wives of [[his]189-edward brother]2138-his brother officers]2137-the wives of his brother officers remonstrated with [her]183-leonora in private ; [his]189-edward large subscriptions made it difficult for [[their]2137-the wives of his brother officers husbands]2139-their husbands to keep up with [them]2137-the wives of his brother officers . Ironically enough , the first real trouble between [them]2140-them came from [his]189-edward desire to build [a Roman Catholic chapel]2141-a roman catholic chapel at [Branshaw]180-branshaw . [He]189-edward wanted to do it to honour [Leonora]183-leonora , and [he]189-edward proposed to do it very expensively . [Leonora]183-leonora did not want it ; [she]183-leonora could perfectly well drive from [Branshaw]180-branshaw to [the nearest Catholic church]2142-the nearest catholic church as often as [she]183-leonora liked . [She]183-leonora had as many [priests]2146-priests to stay with [her]183-leonora as could be needed - and even [the priests]2147-the priests did not want [a gorgeous chapel in [that place]574-that place where it would have merely seemed an invidious instance of ostentation]2148-a gorgeous chapel in that place where it would have merely seemed an invidious instance of ostentation . But [Edward]189-edward was as obstinate as [a hog about it]2152-a hog about it . [He]189-edward was truly grieved at [[his]189-edward wife]388-his wife 's want of sentiment - at [her]388-his wife refusal to receive that amount of public homage from [him]189-edward . [She]388-his wife appeared to [him]189-edward to be wanting in imagination - to be cold and hard . [I]0-i do n't exactly know what part [[her]388-his wife priests]2154-her priests played in the tragedy that it all became ; [I]0-i dare say [they]2154-her priests behaved quite creditably but mistakenly . But then , who would not have been mistaken with [Edward]189-edward ? [I]0-i believe [he]189-edward was even hurt that [[Leonora]183-leonora 's confessor]2155-leonora 's confessor did not make strenuous efforts to convert [him]189-edward . Perhaps [they]2154-her priests saw deeper into [Edward]189-edward than [he]189-edward saw [himself]189-edward and thought that [he]189-edward would make not [a very creditable convert]2159-a very creditable convert . At any rate [they]2154-her priests - and [Leonora]183-leonora - left [him]189-edward very much alone . It mortified [him]189-edward very considerably . [He]189-edward has told [me]0-i that if [Leonora]183-leonora had then taken [his]189-edward aspirations seriously everything would have been different . But [I]0-i dare say that was nonsense . At any rate it was over the question of [the chapel]3175-the chapel that [they]2154-her priests had [their]2154-her priests first and really disastrous quarrel . [Edward]189-edward at that time was not well ; [he]189-edward supposed [himself]189-edward to be overworked with [his]189-edward regimental affairs - [he]189-edward was managing the mess at the time . And [Leonora]183-leonora was not well - [she]183-leonora was beginning to fear that [their]2154-her priests union might be sterile . And then [[her]183-leonora father]1584-her father came over from [Glasmoyle]144-glasmoyle to stay with [them]2154-her priests . Those were troublesome times in [Ireland]142-ireland , [I]0-i understand . At any rate [Colonel Powys]273-colonel powys had [tenants on the brain]2162-tenants on the brain - [[his]273-colonel powys own tenants]2163-his own tenants having shot at [him]273-colonel powys with shotguns . And , in conversation with [[Edward]189-edward 's land - steward]2164-edward 's land - steward , [he]2164-edward 's land - steward got it into [his]2164-edward 's land - steward head that [Edward]189-edward managed [[his]189-edward estates]2165-his estates with a mad generosity toward [[his]189-edward tenants]1123-his tenants . [I]0-i understand also that those years - the nineties - were very bad for farming . Wheat was fetching only a few shillings the hundred ; the price of meat was so low that cattle hardly paid for raising ; [whole English counties]2167-whole english counties were ruined . And [Edward]189-edward allowed [[his]189-edward tenants]1123-his tenants very high rebates . To do both justice [Leonora]183-leonora has since acknowledged that [she]183-leonora was in the wrong at that time and that [Edward]189-edward was following out a more far - seeing policy in nursing [[his]189-edward really very good tenants]2169-his really very good tenants over a bad period . It was not as if the whole of [his]189-edward money came from [the land]2170-the land ; a good deal of it was in rails . But [old Colonel Powys]273-colonel powys had that bee in [his]273-colonel powys bonnet and , if [he]273-colonel powys never directly approached [Edward]189-edward [himself]273-colonel powys on the subject , [he]273-colonel powys preached unceasingly , whenever [he]273-colonel powys had the opportunity , to [Leonora]183-leonora . [His]273-colonel powys pet idea was that [Edward]189-edward ought to sack all [[his]189-edward own tenants]2163-his own tenants and import [a set of [farmers]2173-farmers from [Scotland]145-scotland]2172-a set of farmers from scotland . That was what [they]2163-his own tenants were doing in [Essex]146-essex . [He]273-colonel powys was of opinion that [Edward]189-edward was riding hotfoot to ruin . That worried [Leonora]183-leonora very much - it worried [her]183-leonora dreadfully ; [she]183-leonora lay awake nights ; [she]183-leonora had an anxious line round [her]183-leonora mouth . And that , again , worried [Edward]189-edward . [I]0-i do not mean to say that [Leonora]183-leonora actually spoke to [Edward]189-edward about [[his]189-edward tenants]1123-his tenants - but [he]189-edward got to know that [someone]369-someone , probably [[her]183-leonora father]1584-her father , had been talking to [her]183-leonora about the matter . [He]189-edward got to know it because it was the habit of [[his]189-edward steward]2177-his steward to look in on [them]1123-his tenants every morning about breakfast time to report any little happenings . And there was [a farmer called [Mumford]279-mumford who had only paid half [his]279-mumford rent for the last three years]2178-a farmer called mumford who had only paid half his rent for the last three years . One morning [the land - steward]2179-the land - steward reported that [Mumford]279-mumford would be unable to pay [his]279-mumford rent at all that year . [Edward]189-edward reflected for a moment and then [he]189-edward said something like : " Oh well , [he]279-mumford 's [an old fellow]3192-an old fellow and [[his]279-mumford family]3193-his family have been [[our]3194-our tenants]3195-our tenants for over two hundred years . Let [him]279-mumford off altogether . "[189-edward] And then [Leonora]183-leonora - [you]2180-you must remember that [she]183-leonora had reason for being very nervous and unhappy at that time - let out a sound that was very like a groan . It startled [Edward]189-edward , who more than suspected what was passing in [her]183-leonora mind - it startled [him]189-edward into a state of anger . [He]189-edward said sharply : " [You]183-leonora would n't have [me]189-edward turn out people who 've been earning money for [us]3194-our for centuries - [people to whom [we]3194-our have responsibilities]3196-people to whom we have responsibilities - and let in [a pack of [Scotch farmers]3198-scotch farmers]3197-a pack of scotch farmers ? "[189-edward] [He]189-edward looked at [her]183-leonora , [Leonora]183-leonora said , with what was practically a glance of hatred and then , precipitately , [he]189-edward left the breakfast table . [Leonora]183-leonora knew that it probably made it all the worse that [he]189-edward had been betrayed into a manifestation of anger before [a third party]2181-a third party . It was the first and last time that [he]189-edward ever was betrayed into such a manifestation of anger . [The land - steward]2179-the land - steward , [a moderate and well - balanced man whose family also had been with [the Ashburnhams]178-the ashburnhams for over a century]2183-a moderate and well - balanced man whose family also had been with the ashburnhams for over a century , took it upon [himself]2179-the land - steward to explain that [he]2179-the land - steward considered [Edward]189-edward was pursuing a perfectly proper course with [[his]189-edward tenants]1123-his tenants . [He]2179-the land - steward erred perhaps a little on the side of generosity , but hard times were hard times , and [everyone]803-everyone had to feel the pinch , [landlord]2186-landlord as well as [tenants]2187-tenants . The great thing was not to let [the land]2170-the land get into a poor state of cultivation . These arguments at that time carried very little conviction to [Leonora]183-leonora . [She]183-leonora was nevertheless much concerned by [Edward]189-edward 's outburst of anger . The fact is that [Leonora]183-leonora had been practising economies in [[her]183-leonora department]2193-her department . [Two of [the under - housemaids]2195-the under - housemaids]2194-two of the under - housemaids had gone and [she]183-leonora had not replaced [them]2194-two of the under - housemaids ; [she]183-leonora had spent much less that year upon dress . [He]189-edward seemed to see a net closing round [him]189-edward - a net in which [they]2196-they would be forced to live like one of [the comparatively poor county families of [the neighbourhood]405-the neighbourhood]2198-the comparatively poor county families of the neighbourhood . For [she]183-leonora had discovered shortly before this period that [[her]183-leonora parents]2226-her parents had not exacted from [[Edward]189-edward 's family]2227-edward 's family the promise that [any children [she]183-leonora should bear]2228-any children she should bear should be brought up as [Catholics]1147-catholics . This may appear illogical , but [I]0-i dare say it is not so illogical as it looks . [Leonora]183-leonora was in an agony during all this time . [She]183-leonora simply could not see it . Into this really terrible position of strain , from which there appeared to be no issue , [the Kilsyte]233-the kilsyte case came almost as a relief . IT IS VERY DIFFICULT to give an all - round impression of [any man]1092-any man . [I]0-i wonder how far [I]0-i have succeeded with [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward . [I]0-i dare say [I]0-i have n't succeeded at all . It is even very difficult to see how such things matter . Was it the important point about [poor Edward]189-edward that [he]189-edward was very well built , carried [himself]189-edward well , was moderate at the table , and led a regular life - that [he]189-edward had , in fact , all the virtues that are usually accounted English ? Or have [I]0-i in the least succeeded in conveying that [he]189-edward was all those things and had all those virtues ? [He]189-edward certainly was them and had them up to the last months of [his]189-edward life . They were the things that [one]417-one would set upon [his]189-edward tombstone . They will , indeed , be set upon [his]189-edward tombstone by [[his]189-edward widow]2287-his widow . And have [I]0-i , [I]0-i wonder , given the due impression of how [his]189-edward life was portioned and [his]189-edward time laid out ? Because , until the very last , the amount of time taken up by [his]189-edward various passions was relatively small . [I]0-i have been forced to write very much about [his]189-edward passions , but [you]2288-you have to consider - [I]0-i should like to be able to make [you]2288-you consider - that [he]189-edward rose every morning at seven , took a cold bath , breakfasted at eight , was occupied with [[his]189-edward regiment]2254-his regiment from nine until one ; played polo or cricket with [the men]2290-the men when it was the season for cricket , till tea - time . Afterwards [he]189-edward would occupy [himself]189-edward with the letters from [[his]189-edward land - steward]2291-his land - steward or with the affairs of [[his]189-edward mess]2292-his mess , till dinner time . [He]189-edward would dine and pass the evening playing cards , or playing billiards with [Leonora]183-leonora , or at social functions of one kind or another . And the greater part of [his]189-edward life was taken up by that - by far the greater part of [his]189-edward life . [His]189-edward love affairs , until the very end , were sandwiched in at odd moments or took place during the social evenings , the dances and dinners . But [I]0-i guess [I]0-i have made it hard for [you]2288-you , [O silent listener]2293-o silent listener , to get that impression . Anyhow , [I]0-i hope [I]0-i have not given [you]2288-you the idea that [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward was a pathological case . [He]189-edward was n't . [He]189-edward was just [a normal man and very much of a sentimentalist]2294-a normal man and very much of a sentimentalist . That question of first impressions has always bothered [me]0-i a good deal - but quite academically . [I]0-i mean that , from time to time , [I]0-i have wondered whether it were or were not best to trust to [one]417-one 's first impressions in dealing with [people]507-people . But [I]0-i never had [anybody]333-anybody to deal with except [waiters]2303-waiters and [chambermaids]2304-chambermaids and [the Ashburnhams]178-the ashburnhams , with whom [I]0-i did n't know that [I]0-i was having any dealings . And , as far as [waiters]2303-waiters and [chambermaids]2304-chambermaids were concerned , [I]0-i have generally found that [my]0-i first impressions were correct enough . If [my]0-i first idea of [a man]3062-a man was that [he]3062-a man was civil , obliging , and attentive , [he]3062-a man generally seemed to go on being all those things . Once , however , at [[our]2308-our [Paris]3-paris flat]2309-our paris flat [we]2308-our had [a maid who appeared to be charming and transparently honest]2310-a maid who appeared to be charming and transparently honest . So here , as [somebody]1201-somebody says somewhere , was a special case . And , even in [my]0-i short incursion into American business life - an incursion that lasted during part of August and nearly the whole of September - [I]0-i found that to rely upon first impressions was the best thing [I]0-i could do . [I]0-i found [myself]0-i automatically docketing and labelling [each man]2314-each man as [he]2314-each man was introduced to [me]0-i , by the run of [his]2314-each man features and by the first words that [he]2314-each man spoke . [I]0-i ca n't , however , be regarded as really doing business during the time that [I]0-i spent in [the United States]121-the united states . [I]0-i was just winding things up . During [my]0-i life with [Florence]182-florence [I]0-i had almost come to forget that there were such things as fashions or occupations or the greed of gain . In that particular , [Philadelphia]10-philadelphia was [the most amazing place [I]0-i have ever been in in [my]0-i life]2320-the most amazing place i have ever been in in my life . [He]281-young carter was handsome and dark and gentle and tall and modest . [I]0-i understand also that [he]281-young carter was [a good cricketer]2342-a good cricketer . It was [he]281-young carter , therefore , who took [me]0-i over [[my]0-i own property]2344-my own property and [I]0-i saw a good deal of [him]281-young carter and of [a nice girl called [Mary]282-mary , to whom [he]281-young carter was engaged]2345-a nice girl called mary , to whom he was engaged . At that time [I]0-i did , what [I]0-i certainly should n't do now - [I]0-i made some careful inquiries as to [his]281-young carter character . [I]0-i discovered from [[his]281-young carter employers]2346-his employers that [he]281-young carter was just all that [he]281-young carter appeared , honest , industrious , high - spirited , friendly , and ready to do [anyone]1048-anyone a good turn . [[His]281-young carter relatives]2348-his relatives , however , as [they]2348-his relatives were [mine]0-i too , seemed to have something darkly mysterious against [him]281-young carter . [I]0-i imagined that [he]281-young carter must have been mixed up in some case of graft or that [he]281-young carter had at least betrayed [several innocent and trusting maidens]2349-several innocent and trusting maidens . [I]0-i pushed , however , that particular mystery [home]591-home and discovered it was only that [he]281-young carter was [a Democrat]2351-a democrat . [[My]0-i own people]2352-my own people were mostly [Republicans]283-republicans . It seemed to make it worse and more darkly mysterious to [them]2352-my own people that [young Carter]281-young carter was what [they]2352-my own people called a sort of Vermont Democrat , which was the whole ticket and no mistake . But [I]0-i do n't know what it means . Anyhow , [I]0-i suppose that [my]0-i money will go to [him]281-young carter when [I]0-i die - [I]0-i like the recollection of [his]281-young carter friendly image and of [the nice girl [he]281-young carter was engaged to]2353-the nice girl he was engaged to . [May Fate]284-may fate deal very kindly with [them]2354-them . [I]0-i have said just now that , in [my]0-i present frame of mind , nothing would ever make [me]0-i make inquiries as to the character of [any man that [I]0-i liked at first sight]2355-any man that i liked at first sight . The little digression as to [my]0-i Philadelphia experiences was really meant to lead around to this . For who in [this world]798-this world can give [anyone a character]2357-anyone a character ? Who in [this world]798-this world knows anything of any other heart - or of [his]281-young carter own ? [I]0-i do n't mean to say that [one]417-one can not form an average estimate of the way [a person]1279-a person will behave . But [one]417-one can not be certain of the way [any man]1092-any man will behave in every case - and until [one]417-one can do that a " character "[417-one] is of no use to [anyone]1048-anyone . That , for instance , was the way with [[Florence]182-florence 's maid in [Paris]3-paris]2365-florence 's maid in paris . [We]2366-we used to trust [that girl]2367-that girl with blank checks for the payment of [the tradesmen]2368-the tradesmen . For quite a time [she]2367-that girl was so trusted by [us]2366-we . Then , suddenly , [she]2367-that girl stole a ring . [We]2366-we should not have believed [her]2367-that girl capable of it ; [she]2367-that girl would not have believed [herself]2367-that girl capable of it . It was nothing in [her]2367-that girl character . So , perhaps , it was with [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward . Or , perhaps , it was n't . No , [I]0-i rather think it was n't . It is difficult to figure out . [I]0-i have said that [the Kilsyte]233-the kilsyte case eased the immediate tension for [him]189-edward and [Leonora]183-leonora . It let [him]189-edward see that [she]183-leonora was capable of loyalty to [him]189-edward ; it gave [her]183-leonora [her]183-leonora chance to show that [she]183-leonora believed in [him]189-edward . [She]183-leonora accepted without question [his]189-edward statement that , in kissing [the girl]567-the girl , [he]189-edward was n't trying to do more than administer fatherly comfort to [a weeping child]2370-a weeping child . Whatever [people]507-people say , one 's world can be perfectly charitable at times .... But , again , as [I]0-i have said , it did [Edward]189-edward a great deal of harm . That , at least , was [his]189-edward view of it . [He]189-edward assured [me]0-i that , before that case came on and was wrangled about by [counsel]2374-counsel with all the sorts of dirty - mindedness that [counsel]2374-counsel in that sort of case can impute , [he]189-edward had not had the least idea that [he]189-edward was capable of being unfaithful to [Leonora]183-leonora . [He]189-edward began to indulge in day - dreams in which [he]189-edward approached [the nursemaid]2270-the nursemaid more tactfully and carried the matter much further . But [Edward]189-edward maintained that it had put ideas into [his]189-edward head . [I]0-i do n't believe it , though [he]189-edward certainly did . [He]189-edward was twenty - seven then , and [[his]189-edward wife]388-his wife was out of sympathy with [him]189-edward - some crash was inevitable . There was between [them]2386-them a momentary rapprochement ; but it could not last . It made it , probably , all the worse that in that particular matter [Leonora]183-leonora had come so very well up to the scratch . For , whilst [Edward]189-edward respected [her]388-his wife more and was grateful to [her]388-his wife , it made [her]388-his wife seem by so much the more cold in other matters that were near [his]189-edward heart - [his]189-edward responsibilities , [his]189-edward career , [his]189-edward tradition . It brought [his]189-edward despair of [her]388-his wife up to a point of exasperation - and it riveted on [him]189-edward the idea that [he]189-edward might find [some other woman who would give [him]189-edward the moral support that [he]189-edward needed]2387-some other woman who would give him the moral support that he needed . [He]189-edward would have liked to pass [his]189-edward days talking to [one or other of [these ladies]2394-these ladies]2393-one or other of these ladies . [He]189-edward wanted only moral support at the hands of [some female]2401-some female , because [he]189-edward found [men]376-men difficult to talk to about ideals . Indeed , [I]0-i do not believe that [he]189-edward had , at any time , any idea of making [anyone]1048-anyone [[his]189-edward mistress]2404-his mistress . That sounds queer ; but [I]0-i believe it is quite true as a statement of character . It was , [I]0-i believe , [one of [[Leonora]183-leonora 's priests]2406-leonora 's priests]2405-one of leonora 's priests - [a man of [the world]392-the world]2407-a man of the world - who suggested that [she]183-leonora should take [him]189-edward to [Monte Carlo]101-monte carlo . [He]2405-one of leonora 's priests had the idea that what [Edward]189-edward needed , in order to fit [him]189-edward for [the society of [Leonora]183-leonora]2409-the society of leonora , was a touch of irresponsibility . For [Edward]189-edward , at that date , had much the aspect of [a prig]2410-a prig . [I]0-i mean that , if [he]189-edward played polo and was [an excellent dancer]2411-an excellent dancer , [he]189-edward did the one for the sake of keeping [himself]189-edward fit and the other because it was a social duty to show [himself]189-edward at dances , and , when there , to dance well . [He]189-edward did nothing for fun except what [he]189-edward considered to be [his]189-edward work in life . As [the priest]2412-the priest saw it , this must forever estrange [him]189-edward from [Leonora]183-leonora - not because [Leonora]183-leonora set much store by the joy of life , but because [she]183-leonora was out of sympathy with [Edward]189-edward 's work . On the other hand , [Leonora]183-leonora did like to have a good time , now and then , and , as [the priest]2412-the priest saw it , if [Edward]189-edward could be got to like having a good time now and then too , there would be a bond of sympathy between [them]2414-them . It was a good idea , but it worked out wrongly . It worked out , in fact , in [the mistress of [the Grand Duke]771-the grand duke]1193-the mistress of the grand duke . In anyone less sentimental than [Edward]189-edward that would not have mattered . With [Edward]189-edward it was fatal . For , such was [his]189-edward honourable nature that for [him]189-edward , to enjoy [a woman]686-a woman 's favours , made [him]189-edward feel that [she]686-a woman had a bond on [him]189-edward for life . That was the way it worked out in practice . Psychologically it meant that [he]189-edward could not have [a mistress]2418-a mistress without falling violently in love with [her]2418-a mistress . [He]189-edward was [a serious person]2419-a serious person - and in this particular case it was very expensive . [The mistress of [the Grand Duke]771-the grand duke]1193-the mistress of the grand duke - [a Spanish dancer of passionate appearance]2422-a spanish dancer of passionate appearance - singled out [Edward]189-edward for [her]1193-the mistress of the grand duke glances at a ball that was held in [[their]2423-their common hotel]2424-their common hotel . [Edward]189-edward was tall , handsome , blond , and very wealthy as [she]1193-the mistress of the grand duke understood - and [Leonora]183-leonora went up to bed early . [She]1193-the mistress of the grand duke did not care for public dances , but [she]1193-the mistress of the grand duke was relieved to see that [Edward]189-edward appeared to be having a good time with [several amiable girls]2425-several amiable girls . And that was the end of [Edward]189-edward - for [the Spanish dancer of passionate appearance]2426-the spanish dancer of passionate appearance wanted one night of [him]189-edward for [his]189-edward beaux yeux . [He]189-edward took [her]183-leonora into [the dark gardens]2427-the dark gardens and , remembering suddenly [the girl of the Kilsyte case]2428-the girl of the kilsyte case , [he]189-edward kissed [her]183-leonora . [He]189-edward kissed [her]183-leonora passionately , violently , with a sudden explosion of the passion that had been bridled all [his]189-edward life - for [Leonora]183-leonora was cold , or , at any rate , well behaved . [La Dolciquita]285-la dolciquita liked this reversion , and [he]189-edward passed the night in [her]285-la dolciquita bed . When [the palpitating creature]2429-the palpitating creature was at last asleep in [his]189-edward arms [he]189-edward discovered that [he]189-edward was madly , was passionately , was overwhelmingly in love with [her]285-la dolciquita . It was a passion that had arisen like fire in dry corn . [He]189-edward could think of nothing else ; [he]189-edward could live for nothing else . But [La Dolciquita]285-la dolciquita was [a reasonable creature]2430-a reasonable creature without an ounce of passion in [her]285-la dolciquita . [She]285-la dolciquita wanted a certain satisfaction of [her]285-la dolciquita appetites and [Edward]189-edward had appealed to [her]285-la dolciquita the night before . Now that was done with and , quite coldly , [she]285-la dolciquita said that [she]285-la dolciquita wanted money if [he]189-edward was to have any more of [her]285-la dolciquita . It was a perfectly reasonable commercial transaction . [She]285-la dolciquita did not care two buttons for [Edward]189-edward or for [any man]1092-any man and [he]189-edward was asking [her]285-la dolciquita to risk a very good situation with [a Grand Duke]2432-a grand duke . If [Edward]189-edward could put up sufficient money to serve as a kind of insurance against accident [she]285-la dolciquita was ready to like [Edward]189-edward for a time that would be covered , as it were , by the policy . [She]285-la dolciquita was getting fifty thousand dollars a year from [[her]285-la dolciquita Grand Duke]2433-her grand duke ; [Edward]189-edward would have to pay a premium of two years ' hire for a month of [her]285-la dolciquita society . There would not be much risk of [the Grand Duke]286-the grand duke 's finding it out and it was not certain that [he]189-edward would give [her]285-la dolciquita the keys of [the street]1564-the street if [he]189-edward did find out . But there was the risk - a twenty per cent risk , as [she]285-la dolciquita figured it out . [She]285-la dolciquita talked to [Edward]189-edward as if [she]285-la dolciquita had been a solicitor with an estate to sell - perfectly quietly and perfectly coldly without any inflections in [her]285-la dolciquita voice . [She]285-la dolciquita did not want to be unkind to [him]189-edward ; but [she]285-la dolciquita could see no reason for being kind to [him]189-edward . [She]285-la dolciquita did not expect more than a five years ' further run . "[285-la dolciquita] [Edward]189-edward swore that [he]189-edward would provide for [her]285-la dolciquita for life if [she]285-la dolciquita would come to [him]189-edward and leave off talking so horribly ; but [she]285-la dolciquita only shrugged one shoulder slowly and contemptuously . [He]189-edward tried to convince [this woman]2438-this woman , who , as [he]189-edward saw it , had surrendered to [him]189-edward [her]2438-this woman virtue , that [he]189-edward regarded it as in any case [his]189-edward duty to provide for [her]285-la dolciquita , and to cherish [her]285-la dolciquita and even to love [her]285-la dolciquita - for life . That was how [he]189-edward figured it out . [She]285-la dolciquita shrugged the same shoulder with the same gesture and held out [her]285-la dolciquita left hand with the elbow at [her]285-la dolciquita side .
