"[285-la dolciquita] And [she]285-la dolciquita turned [her]285-la dolciquita back on [him]189-edward . [Edward]189-edward went mad ; [[his]189-edward world]2440-his world stood on its head ; the palms in front of [the blue sea]2441-the blue sea danced grotesque dances . [You]2442-you see , [he]189-edward believed in the virtue , tenderness , and moral support of [women]2443-women . [He]189-edward wanted more than anything to argue with [La Dolciquita]285-la dolciquita ; to retire with [her]285-la dolciquita to [an island]2444-an island and point out to [her]285-la dolciquita the damnation of [her]285-la dolciquita point of view and how salvation can only be found in true love and the feudal system . [She]285-la dolciquita had once been [[his]189-edward mistress]2404-his mistress , [he]189-edward reflected , and , by all the moral laws , [she]285-la dolciquita ought to have gone on being [[his]189-edward mistress]2404-his mistress or at the very least [[his]189-edward sympathetic confidante]2447-his sympathetic confidante . But [[her]285-la dolciquita rooms]1331-her rooms were closed to [him]189-edward ; [she]285-la dolciquita did not appear in [the hotel]1040-the hotel . Nothing : blank silence . To break that down [he]189-edward had to have twenty thousand pounds . [You]2450-you have heard what happened . [He]189-edward spent a week of madness ; [he]189-edward hungered ; [his]189-edward eyes sank in ; [he]189-edward shuddered at [Leonora]183-leonora 's touch . [I]0-i dare say that nine - tenths of what [he]189-edward took to be [his]189-edward passion for [La Dolciquita]285-la dolciquita was really discomfort at the thought that [he]189-edward had been unfaithful to [Leonora]183-leonora . [He]189-edward felt uncommonly bad , that is to say - oh , unbearably bad , and [he]189-edward took it all to be love . [Poor devil]1018-poor devil , [he]189-edward was incredibly naive . [He]189-edward drank like a fish after [Leonora]183-leonora was in bed and [he]189-edward spread [himself]189-edward over the tables , and this went on for about a fortnight . [Heaven]203-heaven knows what would have happened ; [he]189-edward would have thrown away every penny that [he]189-edward possessed . On the night after [he]189-edward had lost about forty thousand pounds and whilst [the whole hotel]2452-the whole hotel was whispering about it , [La Dolciquita]285-la dolciquita walked composedly into [[his]189-edward bedroom]922-his bedroom . [He]189-edward was too drunk to recognize [her]285-la dolciquita , and [she]285-la dolciquita sat in [his]189-edward armchair , knitting and holding smelling salts to [her]285-la dolciquita nose - for [he]189-edward was pretty far gone with alcoholic poisoning - and , as soon as [he]189-edward was able to understand [her]285-la dolciquita , [she]285-la dolciquita said : " Look here , [mon ami]3202-mon ami , do not go to the tables again . Take a good sleep now and come and see [me]285-la dolciquita this afternoon . "[285-la dolciquita] [He]189-edward slept till the lunch hour . By that time [Leonora]183-leonora had heard the news . [A Mrs. Colonel Whelen]287-a mrs. colonel whelen told [her]183-leonora . [She]285-la dolciquita had argued it out that there must be [a woman of the harpy variety]2455-a woman of the harpy variety connected with [Edward]189-edward 's incredible behaviour and mien ; and [she]285-la dolciquita advised [Leonora]183-leonora to go straight off to [town]2456-town - which might have the effect of bringing [Edward]189-edward to [his]189-edward senses - and to consult [[her]285-la dolciquita solicitor]2457-her solicitor and [[her]285-la dolciquita spiritual adviser]2458-her spiritual adviser . [She]285-la dolciquita had better go that very morning ; it was no good arguing with [a man in [Edward]189-edward 's condition]2459-a man in edward 's condition . [Edward]189-edward , indeed , did not know that [she]285-la dolciquita had gone . As soon as [he]189-edward woke [he]189-edward went straight to [[La Dolciquita]285-la dolciquita 's room]2460-la dolciquita 's room and [she]285-la dolciquita stood [him]189-edward [his]189-edward lunch in [[her]285-la dolciquita own apartments]2461-her own apartments . [He]189-edward fell on [her]285-la dolciquita neck and wept , and [she]285-la dolciquita put up with it for a time . [She]285-la dolciquita was quite [a good - natured woman]2462-a good - natured woman . And , when [she]285-la dolciquita had calmed [him]189-edward down with [Eau de Melisse]288-eau de melisse , [she]285-la dolciquita said : " Look here , [[my]285-la dolciquita friend]1622-my friend , how much money have [you]189-edward left ? Five thousand dollars ? Ten ? "[285-la dolciquita] for the rumour went that [Edward]189-edward had lost [two kings]2463-two kings ' ransoms a night for fourteen nights and [she]285-la dolciquita imagined that [he]189-edward must be near the end of [his]189-edward resources . [The Eau de Melisse]288-eau de melisse had calmed [Edward]189-edward to such an extent that , for the moment , [he]189-edward really had a head on [his]189-edward shoulders . [He]189-edward did nothing g more than grunt : " And then ? "[189-edward] " Why , "[285-la dolciquita] [she]285-la dolciquita answered , " [I]285-la dolciquita may just as well have the ten thousand dollars as the tables . [I]285-la dolciquita will go with [you]189-edward to [Antibes]102-antibes for a week for that sum . "[285-la dolciquita] [Edward]189-edward grunted : " Five . "[189-edward] [She]285-la dolciquita tried to get seven thousand five hundred ; but [he]189-edward stuck to [his]189-edward five thousand and the hotel expenses at [Antibes]102-antibes . The sedative carried [him]189-edward just as far as that and then [he]189-edward collapsed again . [He]189-edward had to leave for [Antibes]102-antibes at three ; [he]189-edward could not do without it . [He]189-edward left a note for [Leonora]183-leonora saying that [he]189-edward had gone off for a week with [the Clinton Morleys]289-the clinton morleys , yachting . [He]189-edward did not enjoy [himself]189-edward very much at [Antibes]102-antibes . [La Dolciquita]285-la dolciquita could talk of nothing with any enthusiasm except money , and [she]285-la dolciquita tired [him]189-edward unceasingly during every waking hour for presents of the most expensive description . And , at the end of a week , [she]285-la dolciquita just quietly kicked [him]189-edward out . [He]189-edward hung about in [Antibes]102-antibes for three days . [He]189-edward was cured of the idea that [he]189-edward had any duties towards La Dolciquita - feudal or otherwise . But [his]189-edward sentimentalism required of [him]189-edward an attitude of Byronic gloom - as if [[his]189-edward court]2464-his court had gone into half - mourning . Then [his]189-edward appetite suddenly returned , and [he]189-edward remembered [Leonora]183-leonora . [He]189-edward found at [[his]189-edward hotel at [Monte Carlo]101-monte carlo]2465-his hotel at monte carlo a telegram from [Leonora]183-leonora , dispatched from [London]76-london , saying : " Please return as soon as convenient . "[183-leonora] [He]189-edward could not understand why [Leonora]183-leonora should have abandoned [him]189-edward so precipitately when [she]183-leonora only thought that [he]189-edward had gone yachting with [the Clinton Morleys]289-the clinton morleys . Then [he]189-edward discovered that [she]183-leonora had left [the hotel]1040-the hotel before [he]189-edward had written the note . [He]189-edward had a pretty rocky journey back to [town]2456-town ; [he]189-edward was frightened out of [his]189-edward life - and [Leonora]183-leonora had never seemed so desirable to [him]189-edward . [I]0-i CALL THIS the Saddest Story rather than " The Ashburnham Tragedy , "[0-i] just because it is so sad , just because there was no current to draw things along to a swift and inevitable end . There is about this story none of the elevation that accompanies tragedy ; there is about it no nemesis , no destiny . Here were [two noble people]2468-two noble people - for [I]0-i am convinced that both [Edward]189-edward and [Leonora]183-leonora had noble natures - here then , were two noble natures , drifting down life , like fireships afloat on [a lagoon]2469-a lagoon and causing miseries , heartaches , agony of the mind , and death . And [they]2468-two noble people [themselves]2468-two noble people steadily deteriorated ? And why ? For what purpose ? To point what lesson ? It is all a darkness . There is not even [any villain in the story]2470-any villain in the story - for even [Major Basil]290-major basil , [the husband of [the lady who next , and really , comforted [the unfortunate Edward]189-edward]2472-the lady who next , and really , comforted the unfortunate edward]2471-the husband of the lady who next , and really , comforted the unfortunate edward - even [Major Basil]290-major basil was not [a villain in this piece]2473-a villain in this piece . [He]290-major basil was [a slack , loose , shiftless sort of fellow]2474-a slack , loose , shiftless sort of fellow - but [he]290-major basil did not do anything to [Edward]189-edward . Whilst [they]2468-two noble people were in [the same station]2475-the same station in [Burma]97-burma [he]290-major basil borrowed a good deal of money - though , really , since [Major Basil]290-major basil had no particular vices , it was difficult to know why [he]290-major basil wanted it . [He]290-major basil collected - different types of horses ' bits from the earliest times to the present day - but , since [he]290-major basil did not prosecute even this occupation with any vigour , [he]290-major basil can not have needed much money for the acquirement , say , of the bit of [Genghis Khan]291-genghis khan 's charger - if [Genghis Khan]291-genghis khan had a charger . And when [I]0-i say that [he]290-major basil borrowed a good deal of money from [Edward]189-edward [I]0-i do not mean to say that [he]290-major basil had more than a thousand pounds from [him]189-edward during the five years that the connection lasted . [Edward]189-edward , of course , did not have a great deal of money ; [Leonora]183-leonora was seeing to that . Still [he]189-edward may have had five hundred pounds a year English , for [his]189-edward menus plaisirs - for [his]189-edward regimental subscriptions and for keeping [[his]189-edward men]2476-his men smart . [Leonara]292-leonara hated that ; [she]292-leonara would have preferred to buy dresses for [herself]292-leonara or to have devoted the money to paying off a mortgage . Still , with [her]292-leonara sense of justice , [she]292-leonara saw that , since [she]292-leonara was managing [a property]2477-a property bringing in three thousand a year with a view to reestablishing [it]2477-a property as a property of five thousand a year , and since [the property]2478-the property really , if not legally , belonged to [Edward]189-edward , it was reasonable and just that [Edward]189-edward should get a slice of [his]189-edward own . Of course [she]292-leonara had the devil of a job . [I]0-i do n't know that [I]0-i have got the financial details exactly right . [I]0-i am [a pretty good head at figures]2479-a pretty good head at figures , but [my]0-i mind , still , sometimes mixes up pounds with dollars and [I]0-i get a figure wrong . Anyhow , the proposition was something like this : Properly worked and without rebates to [the tenants]1124-the tenants and keeping up schools and things , [the Branshaw]180-branshaw estate should have brought in about five thousand a year when [Edward]189-edward had it . [It]2481-it brought in actually about four . [I]0-i am talking in pounds , not dollars . [Edward]189-edward 's excesses with [the Spanish lady]2482-the spanish lady had reduced its value to about three - as the maximum figure , without reductions . [Leonora]183-leonora wanted to get it back to five . [She]292-leonara was , of course , very young to be faced with such a proposition - twenty - four is not a very advanced age . So [she]292-leonara did things with a youthful vigour that [she]292-leonara would , very likely , have made more merciful if [she]292-leonara had known more about life . [She]292-leonara got [Edward]189-edward remarkably on the hop . [He]189-edward had to face [her]292-leonara in [a London hotel]2483-a london hotel , when [he]189-edward crept back from [Monte Carlo]101-monte carlo with [his]189-edward poor tail between [his]189-edward poor legs . As far as [I]0-i can make out , [she]292-leonara cut short [his]189-edward first mumblings and [his]189-edward first attempts at affectionate speech with words something like : " [We]3205-we 're on the verge of ruin . Do [you]189-edward intend to let [me]292-leonara pull things together ? If not [I]292-leonara shall retire to [Hendon]148-hendon on [my]292-leonara jointure . "[292-leonara] [Hendon]148-hendon represented [a convent to which [she]292-leonara occasionally went for what is called a " retreat "[292-leonara] in [Catholic circles]2485-catholic circles]2484-a convent to which she occasionally went for what is called a " retreat " in catholic circles . And poor dear [Edward]189-edward knew nothing - absolutely nothing . [He]189-edward did not know how much money [he]189-edward had , as [he]189-edward put it , " blued "[292-leonara] at the tables . It might have been a quarter of a million for all [he]189-edward remembered . [He]189-edward did not know whether [she]292-leonara knew about [La Dolciquita]285-la dolciquita or whether [she]292-leonara imagined that [he]189-edward had gone off yachting or had stayed at [Monte Carlo]101-monte carlo . [He]189-edward was just dumb and [he]189-edward just wanted to get into a hole and not have to talk . [Leonora]183-leonora did not make [him]189-edward talk and [she]183-leonora said nothing [herself]183-leonora . [I]0-i do not know much about English legal procedure - [I]0-i can not , [I]0-i mean , give technical details of how [they]2486-they tied [him]189-edward up . But [I]0-i know that , two days later , without [her]292-leonara having said more than [I]0-i have reported to [you]2487-you , [Leonora]183-leonora and [[her]292-leonara attorney]1087-her attorney had become [the trustees]2489-the trustees , as [I]0-i believe it is called , of all [[Edward]189-edward 's property]2490-edward 's property and there was an end of [Edward]189-edward as [the good landlord and father of [[his]189-edward people]2492-his people]2491-the good landlord and father of his people . [He]189-edward went out . [Leonora]183-leonora then had three thousand a year at [her]183-leonora disposal . [She]183-leonora occupied [Edward]189-edward with getting [himself]189-edward transferred to [a part of [[his]189-edward regiment]2254-his regiment that was in [Burma]97-burma]2493-a part of his regiment that was in burma - if that is the right way to put it . [She]183-leonora [herself]183-leonora had an interview - lasting a week or so - with [[Edward]189-edward 's land - steward]2164-edward 's land - steward . [She]183-leonora made [him]189-edward understand that [the estate]2496-the estate would have to yield up to its last penny . Before [they]2497-they left for [India]93-india [she]183-leonora had let [Branshaw]180-branshaw for seven years at a thousand a year . [She]183-leonora sold two Vandykes and a little silver for eleven thousand pounds and [she]183-leonora raised , on mortgage , twenty - nine thousand . That went to [[Edward]189-edward 's money - lending friends]2498-edward 's money - lending friends in [Monte Carlo]101-monte carlo . So [she]183-leonora had to get the twenty - nine thousand back , for [she]183-leonora did not regard [the Vandykes]294-the vandykes and the silver as things [she]183-leonora would have to replace . [They]2499-they were just frills to [the Ashburnham vanity]2500-the ashburnham vanity . [Edward]189-edward cried for two days over the disappearance of [[his]189-edward ancestors]2243-his ancestors and then [she]183-leonora wished [she]183-leonora had not done it ; but it did not teach [her]183-leonora anything and it lessened such esteem as [she]183-leonora had for [him]189-edward . [She]183-leonora did not also understand that to let [Branshaw]180-branshaw affected [him]189-edward with a feeling of physical soiling - that it was almost as bad for [him]189-edward as if [a woman belonging to [him]189-edward]2502-a woman belonging to him had become [a prostitute]2503-a prostitute . That was how it did affect [him]189-edward ; but [I]0-i dare say [she]183-leonora felt just as bad about [the Spanish dancer]2504-the spanish dancer . So [she]183-leonora went at it . [They]2505-they were eight years in [India]93-india , and during the whole of that time [she]183-leonora insisted that [they]2505-they must be self - supporting - [they]2505-they had to live on [[his]189-edward captain]2506-his captain 's pay , plus the extra allowance for being at the front . [She]183-leonora gave [him]189-edward the five hundred a year for [Ashburnham]179-captain ashburnham frills as [she]183-leonora called it to [herself]183-leonora - and [she]183-leonora considered [she]183-leonora was doing [him]189-edward very well . Indeed , in a way , [she]183-leonora did [him]189-edward very well - but it was not [his]189-edward way . [She]183-leonora was always buying [him]189-edward expensive things which , as it were , [she]183-leonora took off [her]183-leonora own back . [I]0-i have , for instance , spoken of [Edward]189-edward 's leather cases . Well , they were not [Edward]189-edward 's at all ; they were [Leonora]183-leonora 's manifestations . [He]189-edward liked to be clean , but [he]189-edward preferred , as it were , to be threadbare . [She]183-leonora never understood that , and all that pigskin was [her]183-leonora idea of a reward to [him]189-edward for putting [her]183-leonora up to a little speculation by which [she]183-leonora made eleven hundred pounds . [She]183-leonora did , [herself]183-leonora , the threadbare business . When [they]2507-they went up to [a place called [Simla]150-simla]2508-a place called simla , where , as [I]0-i understand , it is cool in the summer and very social - when [they]2507-they went up to [Simla]150-simla for [their]2507-they healths it was [she]183-leonora who had [him]189-edward prancing around , as [we]2509-we should say in [the United States]121-the united states , on [a thousand - dollar horse]2510-a thousand - dollar horse with the gladdest of glad rags all over [him]189-edward . [She]183-leonora [herself]183-leonora used to go into " retreat . "[183-leonora] [I]0-i believe that was very good for [her]183-leonora health and it was also very inexpensive . It was probably also very good for [Edward]189-edward 's health , because [he]189-edward pranced about mostly with [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil , who was [a nice woman]1110-a nice woman and very , very kind to [him]189-edward . [I]0-i suppose [she]183-leonora was [[his]189-edward mistress]2404-his mistress , but [I]0-i never heard it from [Edward]189-edward , of course . [I]0-i seem to gather that [they]2513-they carried it on in a high romantic fashion , very proper to [both of [them]2513-they]2514-both of them - or , at any rate , for [Edward]189-edward ; [she]183-leonora seems to have been [a tender and gentle soul who did what [he]189-edward wanted]2515-a tender and gentle soul who did what he wanted . [I]0-i do not mean to say that [she]183-leonora was without character ; that was [her]183-leonora job , to do what [Edward]189-edward wanted . So [I]0-i figured it out that , for those five years , [Edward]189-edward wanted long passages of deep affection kept up in long , long talks and that every now and then [they]2513-they " fell , "[2513-they] which would give [Edward]189-edward an opportunity for remorse and an excuse to lend [the Major]1930-the major another fifty . [I]0-i do n't think that [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil considered it to be " falling "[268-mrs. basil] ; [she]268-mrs. basil just pitied [him]189-edward and loved [him]189-edward . [You]2517-you see , [Leonora]183-leonora and [Edward]189-edward had to talk about something during all those years . [You]2517-you can not be absolutely dumb when [you]2517-you live with [a person]1279-a person unless [you]2517-you are [an inhabitant of [the North of [England]1-england]2520-the north of england or [the State of [Maine]151-maine]2521-the state of maine]2519-an inhabitant of the north of england or the state of maine . So [Leonora]183-leonora imagined the cheerful device of letting [him]189-edward see the accounts of [[his]189-edward estate]2255-his estate and discussing them with [him]189-edward . [He]189-edward did not discuss them much ; [he]189-edward was trying to behave prettily . But it was [old Mr. Mumford]279-mumford - [the farmer who did not pay [his]279-mumford rent]2523-the farmer who did not pay his rent - that threw [Edward]189-edward into [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil 's arms . [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil came upon [Edward]189-edward in the dusk , in [the Burmese garden]2524-the burmese garden , with all sorts of flowers and things . And [he]189-edward was cutting up that crop - with [his]189-edward sword , not a walking - stick . [He]189-edward was also carrying on and cursing in a way [you]2525-you would not believe . [She]268-mrs. basil ascertained that [an old gentleman called [Mumford]279-mumford]2526-an old gentleman called mumford had been ejected from [[his]279-mumford farm]2527-his farm and had been given [a little cottage]2528-a little cottage rent - free , where [he]279-mumford lived on ten shillings a week from [[a farmers]2529-a farmers ' benevolent society]2530-a farmers ' benevolent society , supplemented by seven that was being allowed [him]279-mumford by [the Ashburnham trustees]2531-the ashburnham trustees . [Edward]189-edward had just discovered that fact from the estate accounts . [Leonora]183-leonora had left them in [[his]189-edward dressing - room]2532-his dressing - room and [he]189-edward had begun to read them before taking off [his]189-edward marching - kit . That was how [he]189-edward came to have a sword . [Leonora]183-leonora considered that [she]183-leonora had been unusually generous to [old Mr. Mumford]279-mumford in allowing [him]189-edward to inhabit [a cottage]2533-a cottage , rent - free , and in giving [him]189-edward seven shillings a week . Anyhow , [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil had never seen [a man in such a state as [Edward]189-edward was]2534-a man in such a state as edward was . [She]268-mrs. basil had been passionately in love with [him]189-edward for quite a time , and [he]189-edward had been longing for [her]268-mrs. basil sympathy and admiration with a passion as deep . That was how [they]2535-they came to speak about it , in [the Burmese garden]2524-the burmese garden , under the pale sky , with sheafs of severed vegetation , misty and odorous in the night around [their]2535-they feet . [I]0-i think [they]2535-they behaved [themselves]2535-they with decorum for quite a time after that , though [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil spent so many hours over the accounts of [the Ashburnham estate]2537-the ashburnham estate that [she]268-mrs. basil got the name of [every field]2538-every field by heart . [Edward]189-edward had a huge map of [[his]189-edward lands]2539-his lands in [[his]189-edward harness room]2540-his harness room and [Major Basil]290-major basil did not seem to mind . [I]0-i believe that [people]507-people do not mind much in [lonely stations]2542-lonely stations . It might have lasted forever if [the Major]1930-the major had not been made what is called [a brevet - colonel]2544-a brevet - colonel during the shuffling of troops that went on just before the South African War . [He]1930-the major was sent off somewhere else and , of course , [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil could not stay with [Edward]189-edward . [Edward]189-edward ought , [I]0-i suppose , to have gone to [the Transvaal]2545-the transvaal . It would have done [him]189-edward a great deal of good to get killed . But [Leonora]183-leonora would not let [him]189-edward ; [she]183-leonora had heard awful stories of the extravagance of [the hussar regiment]2546-the hussar regiment in war - time - how [they]2546-the hussar regiment left hundred - bottle cases of champagne at five guineas a bottle on the veldt and so on . Besides , [she]183-leonora preferred to see how [Edward]189-edward was spending [his]189-edward five hundred a year . [I]0-i do n't mean to say that [Edward]189-edward had any grievance in that . [He]189-edward was never [a man of the deeds - of - heroism sort]2547-a man of the deeds - of - heroism sort and it was just as good for [him]189-edward to be sniped at up in [the hills on [the North Western frontier]2549-the north western frontier]2548-the hills on the north western frontier , as to be shot at by [an old gentleman in a top hat at the bottom of some spruit]2550-an old gentleman in a top hat at the bottom of some spruit . Those are more or less [his]189-edward words about it . [I]0-i believe [he]189-edward quite distinguished [himself]189-edward over there . At any rate , [he]189-edward had [his]189-edward D.S.O. and was made [a brevet - major]2551-a brevet - major . [Leonora]183-leonora , however , was not in the least keen on [his]189-edward soldiering . [She]183-leonora hated also [his]189-edward deeds of heroism . One of [their]2552-they bitterest quarrels came after [he]189-edward had , for the second time , in [the Red Sea]129-the red sea , jumped overboard from [the troop - ship]2553-the troop - ship and rescued [a private soldier]2554-a private soldier . [She]183-leonora stood it the first time and even complimented [him]189-edward . But [the Red Sea]2555-the red sea was awful , that trip , and [the private soldiers]2556-the private soldiers seemed to develop a suicidal craze . It got on [Leonora]183-leonora 's nerves ; [she]183-leonora figured [Edward]189-edward , for the rest of that trip , jumping overboard every ten minutes . And the mere cry of " Man overboard "[189-edward] is a disagreeable , alarming , and disturbing thing . [The ship]500-the ship gets stopped and there are all sorts of shouts . And [Edward]189-edward would not promise not to do it again , though fortunately [they]2552-they struck a streak of cooler weather when [they]2552-they were in [the Persian Gulf]152-the persian gulf . [Leonora]183-leonora had got it into [her]183-leonora head that [Edward]189-edward was trying to commit suicide , so [I]0-i guess it was pretty awful for [her]183-leonora when [he]189-edward would not give the promise . [Leonora]183-leonora ought never to have been on [that troop - ship]2558-that troop - ship ; but [she]183-leonora got there somehow , as [an economy]2559-an economy . [Major Basil]290-major basil discovered [[his]290-major basil wife]388-his wife 's relation with [Edward]189-edward just before [he]290-major basil was sent to [[his]290-major basil other station]2561-his other station . [I]0-i do n't know whether that was [a blackmailer]1223-a blackmailer 's adroitness or just a trick of destiny . [He]189-edward may have known of it all the time or [he]189-edward may not . At any rate , [he]189-edward got hold of , just about then , some letters and things . It cost [Edward]189-edward three hundred pounds immediately . [I]0-i do not know how it was arranged ; [I]0-i can not imagine how even [a blackmailer]1223-a blackmailer can make [his]1223-a blackmailer demands . [I]0-i suppose there is some sort of way of saving [your]2564-your face . [I]0-i figure [the Major]1930-the major as disclosing the letters to [Edward]189-edward with furious oaths , then accepting [his]1930-the major explanations that the letters were perfectly innocent if the wrong construction were not put upon [them]2566-them . Then [the Major]1930-the major would say : " [I]1930-the major say , [old chap]3206-old chap , [I]1930-the major 'm deuced hard up . Could n't [you]189-edward lend [me]1930-the major three hundred or so ? "[1930-the major] [I]0-i fancy that was how it was . And , year by year , after that there would come a letter from [the Major]1930-the major , saying that [he]1930-the major was deuced hard up and could n't [Edward]189-edward lend [him]1930-the major three hundred or so . [Edward]189-edward was pretty hard hit when [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil had to go away . [He]189-edward really had been very fond of [her]268-mrs. basil , and [he]189-edward remained faithful to [her]268-mrs. basil memory for quite a long time . And [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil had loved [him]189-edward very much and continued to cherish a hope of reunion with [him]189-edward . Three days ago there came a quite proper , but very lamentable letter from [her]268-mrs. basil to [Leonora]183-leonora , asking to be given particulars as to [Edward]189-edward 's death . [She]183-leonora had read the advertisement of it in an Indian paper . [I]0-i think [she]183-leonora must have been [a very nice woman]2569-a very nice woman .... And then [the Ashburnhams]178-the ashburnhams were moved somewhere up towards a place or [a district called [Chitral]98-chitral]2570-a district called chitral . [I]0-i am no good at geography of [the Indian Empire]2571-the indian empire . By that time [they]2572-they had settled down into [a model couple]2573-a model couple and [they]2572-they never spoke in private to [each other]407-each other . [Leonora]183-leonora had given up even showing the accounts of [the Ashburnham estate]2537-the ashburnham estate to [Edward]189-edward . [He]189-edward thought that that was because [she]183-leonora had piled up such a lot of money that [she]183-leonora did not want [him]189-edward to know how [she]183-leonora was getting on any more . But , as a matter of fact , after five or six years it had penetrated to [her]183-leonora mind that it was painful to [Edward]189-edward to have to look on at the accounts of [[his]189-edward estate]2255-his estate and have no hand in the management of it . [She]183-leonora was trying to do [him]189-edward a kindness . And , up in [Chitral]98-chitral , [poor dear little [Maisie Maidan]235-maisie]235-maisie came along .... That was the most unsettling to [Edward]189-edward of all [his]189-edward affairs . It made [him]189-edward suspect that [he]189-edward was inconstant . The affair with [the Dolciquita]285-la dolciquita [he]189-edward had sized up as a short attack of madness like hydrophobia . [His]189-edward relations with [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil had not seemed to [him]189-edward to imply moral turpitude of a gross kind . [The husband]513-the husband had been complaisant ; [they]2578-they had really loved [each other]407-each other ; [[his]189-edward wife]388-his wife was very cruel to [him]189-edward and had long ceased to be [a wife to [him]189-edward]2581-a wife to him . [He]189-edward thought that [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil had been [[his]189-edward soul - mate]2582-his soul - mate , separated from [him]189-edward by an unkind fate - something sentimental of that sort . But [he]189-edward discovered that , whilst [he]189-edward was still writing long weekly letters to [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil , [he]189-edward was beginning to be furiously impatient if [he]189-edward missed seeing [Maisie Maidan]235-maisie during the course of the day . [He]189-edward discovered [himself]189-edward watching the doorways with impatience ; [he]189-edward discovered that [he]189-edward disliked [[her]235-maisie boy husband]2583-her boy husband very much for hours at a time . [He]189-edward discovered that [he]189-edward was getting up at unearthly hours in order to have time , late in the morning , to go for a walk with [Maisie Maidan]235-maisie . [He]189-edward discovered [himself]189-edward using little slang words that [she]235-maisie used and attaching a sentimental value to those words . These , [you]2584-you understand , were discoveries that came so late that [he]189-edward could do nothing but drift . [He]189-edward was losing weight ; [his]189-edward eyes were beginning to fall in ; [he]189-edward had touches of bad fever . [He]189-edward was , as [he]189-edward described it , pipped . And , one ghastly hot day , [he]189-edward suddenly heard [himself]189-edward say to [Leonora]183-leonora : " [I]189-edward say , could n't [we]3207-we take [little Mrs. Maidan]234-mrs. maidan with [us]3207-we to [Europe]2-europe and drop [her]234-mrs. maidan at [Nauheim]6-nauheim ? "[189-edward] [He]189-edward had n't had the least idea of saying that to [Leonora]183-leonora . [He]189-edward had merely been standing , looking at an illustrated paper , waiting for dinner . Dinner was twenty minutes late or [the Ashburnhams]178-the ashburnhams would not have been alone together . No , [he]189-edward had n't had the least idea of framing that speech . [He]189-edward had just been standing in a silent agony of fear , of longing , of heat , of fever . [He]189-edward was thinking that [they]178-the ashburnhams were going back to [Branshaw]180-branshaw in a month and that [Maisie Maidan]235-maisie was going to remain behind and die . And then , that had come out . [The punkah]2585-the punkah swished in [the darkened room]2586-the darkened room ; [Leonora]183-leonora lay exhausted and motionless in [her]183-leonora cane - lounge ; neither of [them]178-the ashburnhams stirred . [They]178-the ashburnhams were both at that time very ill in indefinite ways . And then [Leonora]183-leonora said : " Yes . [I]183-leonora promised it to [Charlie Maidan]184-charles this afternoon . [I]183-leonora have offered to pay [[her]235-maisie ex]3208-her ex 's [myself]183-leonora . "[183-leonora] [Edward]189-edward just saved [himself]189-edward from saying : " [Good God]188-god ! "[189-edward] [You]2587-you see , [he]189-edward had not the least idea of what [Leonora]183-leonora knew - about [Maisie]235-maisie , about [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil , or even about [La Dolciquita]285-la dolciquita . It was a pretty enigmatic situation for [him]189-edward . It struck [him]189-edward that [Leonora]183-leonora must be intending to manage [his]189-edward loves as [she]183-leonora managed [his]189-edward money affairs and it made [her]183-leonora more hateful to [him]189-edward - and more worthy of respect . [Leonora]183-leonora , at any rate , had managed [his]189-edward money to some purpose . [She]183-leonora had spoken to [him]189-edward , a week before , for the first time in several years - about money . [She]183-leonora had made twenty - two thousand pounds out of [the [Branshaw]180-branshaw land]2588-the branshaw land and seven by the letting of [[Branshaw]180-branshaw furnished]2589-branshaw furnished . By fortunate investments - in which [Edward]189-edward had helped [her]183-leonora - [she]183-leonora had made another six or seven thousand that might well become more . The mortgages were all paid off so that , except for the departure of [the two Vandykes]2590-the two vandykes and the silver , [they]2591-they were as well off as [they]2591-they had been before [the Dolciquita]285-la dolciquita had acted the locust . It was [Leonora]183-leonora 's great achievement . [She]183-leonora laid the figures before [Edward]189-edward , who maintained an unbroken silence . " [I]183-leonora propose , "[183-leonora] [she]183-leonora said , " that [you]189-edward should resign from [the army]2070-the army and that [we]3210-we should go back to [Branshaw]180-branshaw . [We]3210-we are both too ill to stay [here]3120-here any longer . "[183-leonora] [Edward]189-edward said nothing at all . " This , "[183-leonora] [Leonora]183-leonora continued passionlessly , " is the great day of [my]183-leonora life . "[183-leonora] [Edward]189-edward said : " [You]183-leonora have managed the job amazingly . [You]183-leonora are [a wonderful woman]3212-a wonderful woman . "[189-edward] [He]189-edward was thinking that if [they]2592-they went back to [Branshaw]180-branshaw [they]2592-they would leave [Maisie Maidan]235-maisie behind . That thought occupied [him]189-edward exclusively . [They]2592-they must , undoubtedly , return to [Branshaw]180-branshaw ; there could be no doubt that [Leonora]183-leonora was too ill to stay in [that place]574-that place . [She]183-leonora said : " [You]189-edward understand that the management of the whole of the expenditure of the income will be in [your]189-edward hands . There will be five thousand a year . "[183-leonora] [She]183-leonora thought that [he]189-edward cared very much about the expenditure of an income of five thousand a year and that the fact that [she]183-leonora had done so much for [him]189-edward would rouse in [him]189-edward some affection for [her]183-leonora . But [he]189-edward was thinking exclusively of [Maisie Maidan]235-maisie - of [Maisie]235-maisie , thousands of miles away from [him]189-edward . [He]189-edward was seeing [the mountains between [them]2595-them]2594-the mountains between them - [blue mountains]2596-blue mountains and [the sea]457-the sea and [sunlit plains]2598-sunlit plains . [He]189-edward said : " That is very generous of [you]183-leonora . "[189-edward] And [she]183-leonora did not know whether that were praise or a sneer . That had been a week before . And all that week [he]189-edward had passed in an increasing agony at the thought that [those mountains]2599-those mountains , [that sea]2600-that sea and [those sunlit plains]2601-those sunlit plains would be between [him]189-edward and [Maisie Maidan]235-maisie . That thought shook [him]189-edward in the burning nights : the sweat poured from [him]189-edward and [he]189-edward trembled with cold , in the burning noons - at that thought . [He]189-edward had no minute 's rest ; [his]189-edward bowels turned round and round within [him]189-edward : [his]189-edward tongue was perpetually dry and it seemed to [him]189-edward that the breath between [his]189-edward teeth was like air from [a pest - house]2602-a pest - house . [He]189-edward gave no thought to [Leonora]183-leonora at all ; [he]189-edward had sent in [his]189-edward papers . [They]2603-they were to leave in a month . It seemed to [him]189-edward to be [his]189-edward duty to leave [that place]574-that place and to go away , to support [Leonora]183-leonora . [He]189-edward did [his]189-edward duty . It was horrible , in [their]2605-their relationship at that time , that whatever [she]183-leonora did caused [him]189-edward to hate [her]183-leonora . [He]189-edward hated [her]183-leonora when [he]189-edward found that [she]183-leonora proposed to set [him]189-edward up as [the Lord of [Branshaw]180-branshaw]2606-the lord of branshaw again - as a sort of [dummy lord]2607-dummy lord , in swaddling clothes . [He]189-edward imagined that [she]183-leonora had done this in order to separate [him]189-edward from [Maisie Maidan]235-maisie . Hatred hung in all the heavy nights and filled the shadowy corners of [the room]633-the room . So when [he]189-edward heard that [she]183-leonora had offered to [the Maidan boy]2609-the maidan boy to take [[his]189-edward wife]388-his wife to [Europe]2-europe with [him]189-edward , automatically [he]189-edward hated [her]183-leonora since [he]189-edward hated all that [she]183-leonora did . It seemed to [him]189-edward , at that time , that [she]183-leonora could never be other than cruel even if , by accident , an act of [hers]183-leonora were kind .... Yes , it was a horrible situation . But the cool breezes of [the ocean]2611-the ocean seemed to clear up that hatred as if it had been a curtain . They seemed to give [him]189-edward back admiration for [her]183-leonora , and respect . The agreeableness of having money lavishly at command , the fact that it had bought for [him]189-edward the companionship of [Maisie Maidan]235-maisie - these things began to make [him]189-edward see that [[his]189-edward wife]388-his wife might have been right in the starving and scraping upon which [she]183-leonora had insisted . [He]189-edward was at ease ; [he]189-edward was even radiantly happy when [he]189-edward carried cups of bouillon for [Maisie Maidan]235-maisie along [the deck]2613-the deck . One night , when [he]189-edward was leaning , beside [Leonora]183-leonora , over [the ship]500-the ship 's side , [he]189-edward said suddenly : " By [Jove]265-jove , [you]183-leonora 're [the finest woman in [the world]392-the world]3213-the finest woman in the world . [I]189-edward wish [we]3215-we could be [better friends]3216-better friends . "[189-edward] [She]183-leonora just turned away , without a word , and went to [[her]183-leonora cabin]1462-her cabin . Still , [she]183-leonora was very much better in health . AND , NOW , [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i must give [you]183-leonora [Leonora]183-leonora 's side of the case .... That is very difficult . For [Leonora]183-leonora , if [she]183-leonora preserved an unchanged front , changed very frequently [her]183-leonora point of view . [She]183-leonora had been drilled - in [her]183-leonora tradition , in [her]183-leonora upbringing - to keep [her]183-leonora mouth shut . But there were times , [she]183-leonora said , when [she]183-leonora was so near yielding to the temptation of speaking that afterwards [she]183-leonora shuddered to think of those times . [You]183-leonora must postulate that what [she]183-leonora desired above all things was to keep a shut mouth to [the world]392-the world , to [Edward]189-edward , and to [the women that [he]189-edward loved]2617-the women that he loved . If [she]183-leonora spoke [she]183-leonora would despise [herself]183-leonora . From the moment of [his]189-edward unfaithfulness with [La Dolciquita]285-la dolciquita [she]183-leonora never acted the part of [wife]2109-wife to [Edward]189-edward . It was not that [she]183-leonora intended to keep [herself]183-leonora from [him]189-edward as a principle , forever . [[Her]183-leonora spiritual advisers]2248-her spiritual advisers , [I]0-i believe , forbade that . But [she]183-leonora stipulated that [he]189-edward must , in some way , perhaps symbolical , come back to [her]183-leonora . [She]183-leonora was not very clear as to what [she]183-leonora meant ; probably [she]183-leonora did not know [herself]183-leonora . Or perhaps [she]183-leonora did . There were moments when [he]189-edward seemed to be coming back to [her]183-leonora ; there were moments when [she]183-leonora was within a hair of yielding to [her]183-leonora physical passion for [him]189-edward . In just the same way , at moments , [she]183-leonora almost yielded to the temptation to denounce [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil to [[her]183-leonora husband]509-her husband or [Maisie Maidan]235-maisie to [hers]235-maisie . [She]183-leonora desired then to cause the horrors and pains of public scandals . For , watching [Edward]189-edward more intently and with more straining of ears than that which a cat bestows upon a bird overhead , [she]183-leonora was aware of the progress of [his]189-edward passion for [each of [these ladies]2394-these ladies]2621-each of these ladies . [She]183-leonora was aware of it from the way in which [his]189-edward eyes returned to doors and gateways ; [she]183-leonora knew from [his]189-edward tranquillities when [he]189-edward had received satisfactions . ; At times [she]183-leonora imagined [herself]183-leonora to see more than was warranted . [She]183-leonora imagined that [Edward]189-edward was carrying on intrigues with [other women]2379-other women - with two at once ; with three . For whole periods [she]183-leonora imagined [him]189-edward to be [a monster of libertinage]2624-a monster of libertinage and [she]183-leonora could not see that [he]189-edward could have anything against [her]183-leonora . [She]183-leonora left [him]189-edward [his]189-edward liberty ; [she]183-leonora was starving [herself]183-leonora to build up [his]189-edward fortunes ; [she]183-leonora allowed [herself]183-leonora none of the joys of femininity - no dresses , no jewels - hardly even any friendship , for fear they should cost money . And yet , oddly , [she]183-leonora could not but be aware that both [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil and [Maisie Maidan]235-maisie were [nice women]2625-nice women . The curious , discounting eye which [one woman]2626-one woman can turn on another did not prevent [her]183-leonora seeing that [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil was very good to [Edward]189-edward and [Mrs. Maidan]234-mrs. maidan very good for [him]189-edward . That seemed to [her]183-leonora to be a monstrous and incomprehensible working of fate 's . Incomprehensible ! Why , [she]183-leonora asked [herself]183-leonora again and again , did none of the good deeds that [she]183-leonora did for [[her]183-leonora husband]509-her husband ever come through to [him]189-edward , or appear to [him]189-edward as good deeds ? By what trick of mania could not [he]189-edward let [her]183-leonora be as good to [him]189-edward as [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil was ? [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil was not so extraordinarily dissimilar to [herself]268-mrs. basil . [She]268-mrs. basil was , it was true , tall , dark , with a soft mournful voice and a great kindness of manner for every created thing , from [punkah men]2628-punkah men to flowers on the trees . But [she]268-mrs. basil was not so well read as [Leonora]183-leonora , at any rate in learned books . [Leonora]183-leonora could not stand novels . But , even with all [her]268-mrs. basil differences [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil did not appear to [Leonora]183-leonora to differ so very much from [herself]268-mrs. basil . [She]268-mrs. basil was truthful , honest and , for the rest , just [a woman]686-a woman . And [Leonora]183-leonora had a vague sort of idea that , to [a man]3062-a man , [all women]2631-all women are the same after three weeks of close intercourse . [She]183-leonora thought that the kindness should no longer appeal , the soft and mournful voice no longer thrill , the tall darkness no longer give [a man]3062-a man the illusion that [he]3062-a man was going into the depths of [an unexplored wood]2633-an unexplored wood . [She]183-leonora could not understand how [Edward]189-edward could go on and on maundering over [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil . [She]183-leonora could not see why [he]189-edward should continue to write [her]183-leonora long letters after [their]2634-their separation . After that , indeed , [she]183-leonora had a very bad time . [She]183-leonora had at that period what [I]0-i will call the " monstrous "[183-leonora] theory of [Edward]189-edward . [She]183-leonora was always imagining [him]189-edward ogling at [every woman that [he]189-edward came across]2635-every woman that he came across . [She]183-leonora did not , that year , go into " retreat "[183-leonora] at [Simla]150-simla because [she]183-leonora was afraid that [he]189-edward would corrupt [[her]183-leonora maid]2636-her maid in [her]183-leonora absence . [She]183-leonora imagined [him]189-edward carrying on intrigues with [native women]2637-native women or [Eurasians]2638-eurasians . At dances [she]183-leonora was in a fever of watchfulness .... [She]183-leonora persuaded [herself]183-leonora that this was because [she]183-leonora had a dread of scandals . [Edward]189-edward might get [himself]189-edward mixed up with [a marriageable daughter of [some man who would make a row]2640-some man who would make a row or [some husband who would matter]2641-some husband who would matter]2639-a marriageable daughter of some man who would make a row or some husband who would matter . But , really , [she]183-leonora acknowledged afterwards to [herself]183-leonora , [she]183-leonora was hoping that , [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil being out of the way , the time might have come when [Edward]189-edward should return to [her]183-leonora . All that period [she]183-leonora passed in an agony of jealousy and fear - the fear that [Edward]189-edward might really become promiscuous in [his]189-edward habits . So that , in an odd way , [she]183-leonora was glad when [Maisie Maidan]235-maisie came along - and [she]183-leonora realized that [she]183-leonora had not , before , been afraid of [husbands]3149-husbands and of scandals , since , then , [she]183-leonora did [her]183-leonora best to keep [[Maisie]235-maisie 's husband]2643-maisie 's husband unsuspicious . [She]183-leonora wished to appear so trustful of [Edward]189-edward that [Maidan]235-maisie could not possibly have any suspicions . It was an evil position for [her]183-leonora . But [Edward]189-edward was very ill and [she]183-leonora wanted to see [him]189-edward smile again . [She]183-leonora thought that if [he]189-edward could smile again through [her]183-leonora agency [he]189-edward might return , through gratitude and satisfied love - to [her]183-leonora . At that time [she]183-leonora thought that [Edward]189-edward was [a person of light and fleeting passions]2644-a person of light and fleeting passions . And [she]183-leonora could understand [Edward]189-edward 's passion for [Maisie]235-maisie , since [Maisie]235-maisie was [one of those women to whom [other women]2379-other women will allow magnetism]2645-one of those women to whom other women will allow magnetism . [She]235-maisie was very pretty ; [she]235-maisie was very young ; in spite of [her]235-maisie heart [she]235-maisie was very gay and light on [her]235-maisie feet . And [Leonora]183-leonora was really very fond of [Maisie]235-maisie , who was fond enough of [Leonora]183-leonora . [Leonora]183-leonora , indeed , imagined that [she]183-leonora could manage this affair all right . [She]183-leonora had no thought of [Maisie]235-maisie 's being led into adultery ; [she]183-leonora imagined that if [she]183-leonora could take [Maisie]235-maisie and [Edward]189-edward to [Nauheim]6-nauheim , [Edward]189-edward would see enough of [her]235-maisie to get tired of [her]235-maisie pretty little chatterings , and of the pretty little motions of [her]235-maisie hands and feet . And [she]183-leonora thought [she]183-leonora could trust [Edward]189-edward . For there was not any doubt of [Maisie]235-maisie 's passion for [Edward]189-edward . [She]235-maisie raved about [him]189-edward to [Leonora]183-leonora as [Leonora]183-leonora had heard [girls]2096-girls rave about drawing [masters]2648-masters in [schools]2649-schools . [She]235-maisie was perpetually asking [[her]235-maisie boy husband]2583-her boy husband why [he]189-edward could not dress , ride , shoot , play polo , or even recite sentimental poems , like [[their]2651-their Major]2652-their major . And [young Maidan]235-maisie had the greatest admiration for [Edward]189-edward and [he]189-edward adored , was bewildered by , and entirely trusted [[his]189-edward wife]388-his wife . It appeared to [him]189-edward that [Edward]189-edward was devoted to [Leonora]183-leonora . And [Leonora]183-leonora imagined that when poor [Maisie]235-maisie was cured of [her]235-maisie heart and [Edward]189-edward had seen enough of [her]235-maisie , [he]189-edward would return to [her]235-maisie . [She]183-leonora had the vague , passionate idea that when [Edward]189-edward had exhausted [a number of other types of [women]2443-women]2654-a number of other types of women [he]189-edward must turn to [her]235-maisie . Why should not [[her]235-maisie type]2656-her type have its turn in [his]189-edward heart ? [She]183-leonora imagined that , by now , [she]183-leonora understood [him]189-edward better , that [she]183-leonora understood better [his]189-edward vanities , and that , by making [him]189-edward happier , [she]183-leonora could arouse [his]189-edward love . [Florence]182-florence knocked all that on the head .... [I]0-i HAVE , [I]0-i am aware , told this story in a very rambling way so that it may be difficult for [anyone]1048-anyone to find [his]1048-anyone path through what may be a sort of maze . [I]0-i can not help it . [I]0-i have stuck to [my]0-i idea of being in [a country cottage]455-a country cottage with [a silent listener]2659-a silent listener , hearing between the gusts of the wind and amidst the noises of [the distant sea]2660-the distant sea the story as it comes . And , when [one]417-one discusses an affair - a long , sad affair - one goes back , [one]417-one goes forward . [One]417-one remembers points that [one]417-one has forgotten and one explains them all the more minutely since [one]417-one recognizes that [one]417-one has forgotten to mention [them]2667-them in [their]2667-them proper places and that [one]417-one may have given , by omitting [them]2667-them , a false impression . [I]0-i console [myself]0-i with thinking that this is a real story and that , after all , real stories are probably told best in the way [a person telling a story]2669-a person telling a story would tell [them]2670-them . They will then seem most real . At any rate , [I]0-i think [I]0-i have brought [my]0-i story up to the date of [Maisie Maidan]235-maisie 's death . [I]0-i mean that [I]0-i have explained everything that went before it from the several points of view that were necessary - from [Leonora]183-leonora 's , from [Edward]189-edward 's , and , to some extent , from [my]0-i own . [You]2671-you have the facts for the trouble of finding them ; [you]2671-you have the points of view as far as [I]0-i could ascertain or put them . Let [me]0-i imagine [myself]0-i back , then , at the day of [Maisie]235-maisie 's death - or rather at the moment of [Florence]182-florence 's dissertation on the Protest , up in [the old Castle of [the town of M]1250-the town of m]2672-the old castle of the town of m - . Let [us]2674-us consider [Leonora]183-leonora 's point of view with regard to [Florence]182-florence ; [Edward]189-edward 's , of course , [I]0-i can not give [you]2671-you for [Edward]189-edward naturally never spoke of [his]189-edward affair with [[my]0-i wife]332-my wife . [I]0-i may , in what follows , be a little hard on [Florence]182-florence ; but [you]2671-you must remember that [I]0-i have been writing away at this story now for six months and reflecting longer and longer upon these affairs . And the longer [I]0-i think about [them]2676-them the more certain [I]0-i become that [Florence]182-florence was a contaminating influence - [she]182-florence depressed and deteriorated poor [Edward]189-edward ; [she]182-florence deteriorated , hopelessly , [the miserable Leonora]183-leonora . There is no doubt that [she]182-florence caused [Leonora]183-leonora 's character to deteriorate . If there was a fine point about [Leonora]183-leonora it was that [she]183-leonora was proud and that [she]183-leonora was silent . But that pride and that silence broke when [she]183-leonora made that extraordinary outburst , in [the shadowy room that contained the Protest , and in the little terrace looking over [the river]2678-the river]2677-the shadowy room that contained the protest , and in the little terrace looking over the river . [I]0-i do n't mean to say that [she]183-leonora was doing a wrong thing . [She]183-leonora was certainly doing right in trying to warn [me]0-i that [Florence]182-florence was making eyes at [[her]183-leonora husband]509-her husband . But , if [she]183-leonora did the right thing , [she]183-leonora was doing it in the wrong way . Perhaps [she]183-leonora should have reflected longer ; [she]183-leonora should have spoken , if [she]183-leonora wanted to speak , only after reflection . Or it would have been better if [she]183-leonora had acted - if , for instance , [she]183-leonora had so chaperoned [Florence]182-florence that private communication between [her]183-leonora and [Edward]189-edward became impossible . [She]183-leonora should have gone eavesdropping ; [she]183-leonora should have watched outside bedroom doors . It is odious ; but that is the way the job is done . [She]183-leonora should have taken [Edward]189-edward away the moment [Maisie]235-maisie was dead . No , [she]183-leonora acted wrongly .... And yet , poor thing , is it for [me]0-i to condemn [her]183-leonora - and what did it matter in the end ? If it had not been [Florence]182-florence , it would have been some other .... Still , it might have been [a better woman than [[my]0-i wife]332-my wife]2680-a better woman than my wife . For [Florence]182-florence was vulgar ; [Florence]182-florence was [a common flirt who would not , at the last]2682-a common flirt who would not , at the last , lacher prise ; and [Florence]182-florence was [an unstoppable talker]2683-an unstoppable talker . [You]2684-you could not stop [her]182-florence ; nothing would stop [her]182-florence . [Edward]189-edward and [Leonora]183-leonora were at least proud and [reserved people]2685-reserved people . Pride and reserve are not the only things in life ; perhaps they are not even the best things . But if they happen to be [your]2684-you particular virtues [you]2684-you will go all to pieces if [you]2684-you let [them]2686-them go . And [Leonora]183-leonora let [them]2686-them go . [She]183-leonora let [them]2686-them go before poor [Edward]189-edward did even . Consider [her]183-leonora position when [she]183-leonora burst out over the [Luther]227-luther - Protest .... Consider [her]183-leonora agonies .... [You]2684-you are to remember that the main passion of [her]183-leonora life was to get [Edward]189-edward back ; [she]183-leonora had never , till that moment , despaired of getting [him]189-edward back . That may seem ignoble ; but [you]2684-you have also to remember that [her]183-leonora getting [him]189-edward back represented to [her]183-leonora not only a victory for [herself]183-leonora . It would , as it appeared to [her]183-leonora , have been a victory for [all wives]2687-all wives and a victory for [[her]183-leonora church]1155-her church . That was how it presented itself to [her]183-leonora . These things are a little inscrutable . [I]0-i do n't know why the getting back of [Edward]189-edward should have represented to [her]183-leonora a victory for [all wives]2687-all wives , for [Society]2690-society , and for [[her]183-leonora church]1155-her church . Or , maybe , [I]0-i have a glimmering of it . [She]183-leonora saw life as a perpetual sex - battle between [[husbands]3149-husbands who desire to be unfaithful to [[their]3149-husbands wives]2694-their wives , and wives who desire to recapture [[their]2687-all wives husbands]2139-their husbands in the end]2693-husbands who desire to be unfaithful to their wives , and wives who desire to recapture their husbands in the end . That was [her]183-leonora sad and modest view of matrimony . [Man]584-man , for [her]183-leonora , was [a sort of brute who must have [his]584-man divagations , [his]584-man moments of excess , [his]584-man nights out , let [us]2698-us say , rutting seasons]2697-a sort of brute who must have his divagations , his moments of excess , his nights out , let us say , rutting seasons . [She]183-leonora had read few novels , so that the idea of a pure and constant love succeeding the sound of wedding bells had never been very much presented to [her]183-leonora . [She]183-leonora went , numbed and terrified , to [the Mother Superior of [[her]183-leonora childhood 's convent]2700-her childhood 's convent]2699-the mother superior of her childhood 's convent with the tale of [Edward]189-edward 's infidelities with [the Spanish dancer]2504-the spanish dancer , and all that [the old nun]2702-the old nun , who appeared to [her]183-leonora to be [infinitely wise , mystic , and reverend]2703-infinitely wise , mystic , and reverend , had done had been to shake [her]183-leonora head sadly and to say : " [Men]376-men are like that . By the blessing of [God]188-god it will all come right in the end . "[183-leonora] That was what was put before [her]183-leonora by [[her]183-leonora spiritual advisers]2248-her spiritual advisers as [her]183-leonora programme in life . Or , at any rate , that was how [their]2248-her spiritual advisers teachings came through to [her]183-leonora - that was the lesson [she]183-leonora told [me]0-i [she]183-leonora had learned of [them]2248-her spiritual advisers . [I]0-i do n't know exactly what [they]2248-her spiritual advisers taught [her]183-leonora . [The lot of women]2705-the lot of women was patience and patience and again patience - ad majorem Dei gloriam - until upon the appointed day , if [God]188-god saw fit , [she]183-leonora should have [her]183-leonora reward . If then , in the end , [she]183-leonora should have succeeded in getting [Edward]189-edward back [she]183-leonora would have kept [[her]183-leonora man]2706-her man within the limits that are all that wifehood has to expect . [She]183-leonora was even taught that such excesses in [men]376-men are natural , excusable - as if [they]376-men had been [children]1130-children . And the great thing was that there should be no scandal before [the congregation]2709-the congregation . So [she]183-leonora had clung to the idea of getting [Edward]189-edward back with a fierce passion that was like an agony . [She]183-leonora had looked the other way ; [she]183-leonora had occupied [herself]183-leonora solely with one idea . That was the idea of having [Edward]189-edward appear , when [she]183-leonora did get [him]189-edward back , wealthy , glorious as it were , on account of [[his]189-edward lands]2539-his lands , and upright . [She]183-leonora would show , in fact , that in an unfaithful world [one Catholic woman]2711-one catholic woman had succeeded in retaining the fidelity of [[her]2711-one catholic woman husband]509-her husband . And [she]183-leonora thought [she]183-leonora had come near [her]183-leonora desires . [Her]183-leonora plan with regard to [Maisie]235-maisie had appeared to be working admirably . [Edward]189-edward had seemed to be cooling off towards [the girl]567-the girl . [He]189-edward did not hunger to pass every minute of the time at [Nauheim]6-nauheim beside [the child]1315-the child 's recumbent form ; [he]189-edward went out to polo matches ; [he]189-edward played auction bridge in the evenings ; [he]189-edward was cheerful and bright . [She]183-leonora was certain that [he]189-edward was not trying to seduce [that poor child]2715-that poor child ; [she]183-leonora was beginning to think that [he]189-edward had never tried to do so . [He]189-edward seemed in fact to be dropping back into what [he]189-edward had been for [Maisie]235-maisie in the beginning - [a kind , attentive , superior officer in [the regiment]2717-the regiment]2716-a kind , attentive , superior officer in the regiment , paying gallant attentions to [a bride]1343-a bride . [They]2719-they were as open in [their]2719-they little flirtations as the dayspring from on high . And [Maisie]235-maisie had not appeared to fret when [he]189-edward went off on excursions with [us]2720-us ; [she]235-maisie had to lie down for so many hours on [her]235-maisie bed every afternoon , and [she]235-maisie had not appeared to crave for the attentions of [Edward]189-edward at those times . And [Edward]189-edward was beginning to make little advances to [Leonora]183-leonora . Once or twice , in private - for [he]189-edward often did it before [people]507-people - [he]189-edward had said : " How nice [you]183-leonora look ! "[189-edward] or " What a pretty dress ! "[189-edward] [She]183-leonora had gone with [Florence]182-florence to [Frankfurt]153-frankfurt , where [they]2719-they dress as well as in [Paris]3-paris , and had got [herself]183-leonora a gown or two . [She]183-leonora could afford it and [Florence]182-florence was [an excellent adviser as to dress]2722-an excellent adviser as to dress . [She]183-leonora seemed to have got hold of the clue to the riddle . Yes , [Leonora]183-leonora seemed to have got hold of the clue to the riddle . [She]183-leonora imagined [herself]183-leonora to have been in the wrong to some extent in the past . [She]183-leonora should not have kept [Edward]189-edward on such a tight rein with regard to money . [She]183-leonora thought [she]183-leonora was on the right tack in letting [him]189-edward - as [she]183-leonora had done only with fear and irresolution - have again the control of [his]189-edward income . [He]189-edward came even a step towards [her]183-leonora and acknowledged , spontaneously , that [she]183-leonora had been right in husbanding , for all those years , [their]2719-they resources . [He]189-edward said to [her]183-leonora one day : " [You]183-leonora 've done right , [old girl]3218-old girl . There 's nothing [I]189-edward like so much as to have a little to chuck away . And [I]189-edward can do it , thanks to [you]183-leonora . "[189-edward] That was really , [she]183-leonora said , the happiest moment of [her]183-leonora life . And [he]189-edward , seeming to realize it , had ventured to pat [her]183-leonora on the shoulder . [He]189-edward had , ostensibly , come in to borrow a safety pin of [her]183-leonora . And the occasion of [her]183-leonora boxing [Maisie]235-maisie 's ears had , after it was over , riveted in [her]183-leonora mind the idea that there was no intrigue between [Edward]189-edward and [Mrs. Maidan]234-mrs. maidan . [She]183-leonora imagined that , from henceforward , all that [she]183-leonora had to do was to keep [him]189-edward well supplied with money and [his]189-edward mind amused with [pretty girls]2723-pretty girls . [She]183-leonora was convinced that [he]189-edward was coming back to [her]183-leonora . For that month [she]183-leonora no longer repelled [his]189-edward timid advances that never went very far . For [he]189-edward certainly made timid advances . [He]189-edward patted [her]183-leonora on the shoulder ; [he]189-edward whispered into [her]183-leonora ear little jokes about the odd figures that [they]2724-they saw up at [the Casino]3099-the casino . It was not much to make a little joke - but the whispering of it was a precious intimacy .... And then - smash - it all went . It went to pieces at the moment when [Florence]182-florence laid [her]182-florence hand upon [Edward]189-edward 's wrist , as it lay on the glass sheltering the manuscript of the Protest , up in [the high tower with the shutters where the sunlight here and there streamed in]2726-the high tower with the shutters where the sunlight here and there streamed in . Or , rather , it went when [she]182-florence noticed the look in [Edward]189-edward 's eyes as [he]189-edward gazed back into [Florence]182-florence 's . [She]182-florence knew that look . [She]182-florence had known - since the first moment of [their]2724-they meeting , since the moment of [our]2727-our all sitting down to dinner together - that [Florence]182-florence was making eyes at [Edward]189-edward . But [she]182-florence had seen [so many women]2728-so many women make eyes at [Edward]189-edward - hundreds and hundreds of [women]2443-women , in [railway trains]814-railway trains , in [hotels]813-hotels , [aboard liners]2732-aboard liners , at [street corners]2733-street corners . And [she]182-florence had arrived at thinking that [Edward]189-edward took little stock in [women that made eyes]2734-women that made eyes at [him]189-edward . [She]182-florence had formed what was , at that time , a fairly correct estimate of the methods of , the reasons for , [Edward]189-edward 's love . [She]182-florence was certain that hitherto [they]2735-they had consisted of the short passion for [the Dolciquita]285-la dolciquita , the real sort of love for [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil , and what [she]182-florence deemed the pretty courtship of [Maisie Maidan]235-maisie . Besides [she]182-florence despised [Florence]182-florence so haughtily that [she]182-florence could not imagine [Edward]189-edward 's being attracted by [her]182-florence . And [she]182-florence and [Maisie]235-maisie were a sort of bulwark round [him]189-edward . [She]182-florence wanted , besides , to keep [her]182-florence eyes on [Florence]182-florence - for [Florence]182-florence knew that [she]182-florence had boxed [Maisie]235-maisie 's ears . And [Leonora]183-leonora so desperately desired that [her]183-leonora union with [Edward]189-edward should appear to be flawless . But all that went .... With the answering gaze of [Edward]189-edward into [Florence]182-florence 's blue and uplifted eyes , [she]182-florence knew that it had all gone . [She]182-florence knew that that gaze meant that [those two]1518-those two had had long conversations of an intimate kind - about [their]1518-those two likes and dislikes , about [their]1518-those two natures , about [their]1518-those two views of marriage . [She]182-florence knew what it meant that [she]182-florence , when [we]2737-we all four walked out together , had always been with [me]0-i ten yards ahead of [Florence]182-florence and [Edward]189-edward . [She]182-florence did not imagine that it had gone further than talks about [their]1518-those two likes and dislikes , about [their]1518-those two natures , or about marriage as an institution . But , having watched [Edward]189-edward all [her]182-florence life , [she]182-florence knew that that laying on of hands , that answering of gaze , meant that the thing was unavoidable . [Edward]189-edward was such [a serious person]2419-a serious person . [She]182-florence knew that any attempt on [her]182-florence part to separate those two would be to rivet on [Edward]189-edward an irrevocable passion ; that , as [I]0-i have before told [you]2739-you , it was a trick of [Edward]189-edward 's nature to believe that the seducing of [a woman]686-a woman gave [her]182-florence an irrevocable hold over [him]189-edward for life . And that touching of hands , [she]182-florence knew , would give [that woman]2741-that woman an irrevocable claim - to be seduced . And [she]182-florence so despised [Florence]182-florence that [she]182-florence would have preferred it to be [a parlour - maid]2742-a parlour - maid . There are [very decent parlour - maids]2743-very decent parlour - maids . And , suddenly , there came into [her]182-florence mind the conviction that [Maisie Maidan]235-maisie had a real passion for [Edward]189-edward ; that this would break [her]235-maisie heart - and that [she]235-maisie , [Leonora]183-leonora , would be responsible for that . [She]235-maisie went , for the moment , mad . [She]235-maisie clutched [me]0-i by the wrist ; [she]235-maisie dragged [me]0-i down [those stairs]2744-those stairs and across [that whispering Rittersaal]2745-that whispering rittersaal with the high painted pillars , the high painted chimney piece . [I]0-i guess [she]235-maisie did not go mad enough . [She]235-maisie ought to have said : " [[Your]189-edward wife]431-your wife is [a harlot who is going to be [[my]235-maisie husband]3116-my husband 's mistress]3220-a harlot who is going to be my husband 's mistress .... "[235-maisie] That might have done the trick . But even in [her]235-maisie madness [she]235-maisie was afraid to go as far as that . [She]235-maisie was afraid that , if [she]235-maisie did , [Edward]189-edward and [Florence]182-florence would make a bolt of it and that , if [they]2746-they did that , [she]235-maisie would lose forever all chance of getting [him]189-edward back in the end . [She]235-maisie acted very badly to [me]0-i . Well , [she]235-maisie was [a tortured soul who put [[her]235-maisie church]1155-her church before the interests of [a Philadelphia Quaker]2749-a philadelphia quaker]2747-a tortured soul who put her church before the interests of a philadelphia quaker . That is all right - [I]0-i dare say [the Church of [Rome]17-rome]154-the church of rome is the more important of the two . A week after [Maisie Maidan]235-maisie 's death [she]235-maisie was aware that [Florence]182-florence had become [[Edward]189-edward 's mistress]1061-edward 's mistress . [She]235-maisie waited outside [Florence]182-florence 's door and met [Edward]189-edward as [he]189-edward came away . [She]235-maisie said nothing and [he]189-edward only grunted . But [I]0-i guess [he]189-edward had a bad time . Yes , the mental deterioration that [Florence]182-florence worked in [Leonora]183-leonora was extraordinary ; it smashed up [her]183-leonora whole life and all [her]183-leonora chances . It made [her]183-leonora , in the first place , hopeless - for [she]183-leonora could not see how , after that , [Edward]189-edward could return to [her]183-leonora - after a vulgar intrigue with [a vulgar woman]2751-a vulgar woman . [His]189-edward affair with [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil , which was now all that [she]183-leonora had to bring , in [her]183-leonora heart , against [him]189-edward , [she]183-leonora could not find it in [her]183-leonora to call an intrigue . It was a love affair - a pure enough thing in its way . But this seemed to [her]183-leonora to be a horror - a wantonness , all the more detestable to [her]183-leonora because [she]183-leonora so detested [Florence]182-florence . And [Florence]182-florence talked .... That was what was terrible , because [Florence]182-florence forced [Leonora]183-leonora [herself]182-florence to abandon [her]182-florence high reserve - [Florence]182-florence and the situation . It appears that [Florence]182-florence was in two minds whether to confess to [me]0-i or to [Leonora]183-leonora . Confess [she]182-florence had to . And [she]182-florence pitched at last on [Leonora]183-leonora , because if it had been [me]0-i [she]182-florence would have had to confess a great deal more . Or , at least , [I]0-i might have guessed a great deal more , about [her]182-florence " heart , "[182-florence] and about [Jimmy]200-jimmy . So [she]182-florence went to [Leonora]183-leonora one day and began hinting and hinting . And [she]182-florence enraged [Leonora]183-leonora to such an extent that at last [Leonora]183-leonora said : " [You]183-leonora want to tell [me]183-leonora that [you]183-leonora are [[Edward]189-edward 's mistress]1061-edward 's mistress . [You]183-leonora can be . [I]183-leonora have no use for [him]189-edward . "[183-leonora] That was really a calamity for [Leonora]183-leonora , because , once started , there was no stopping the talking . [She]183-leonora tried to stop - but it was not to be done . [She]183-leonora found it necessary to send [Edward]189-edward messages through [Florence]182-florence ; for [she]183-leonora would not speak to [him]189-edward . [She]183-leonora had to give [him]189-edward , for instance , to understand that if [I]0-i ever came to know of [his]189-edward intrigue [she]183-leonora would ruin [him]189-edward beyond repair . And it complicated matters a good deal that [Edward]189-edward , at about this time , was really a little in love with [her]183-leonora . [He]189-edward thought that [he]189-edward had treated [her]183-leonora so badly ; that [she]183-leonora was so fine . [She]183-leonora was so mournful that [he]189-edward longed to comfort [her]183-leonora , and [he]189-edward thought [himself]189-edward such [a blackguard]2752-a blackguard that there was nothing [he]189-edward would not have done to make amends . And [Florence]182-florence communicated these items of information to [Leonora]183-leonora . [I]0-i do n't in the least blame [Leonora]183-leonora for [her]183-leonora coarseness to [Florence]182-florence ; it must have done [Florence]182-florence a world of good . But [I]0-i do blame [her]182-florence for giving way to what was in the end a desire for communicativeness . [You]2753-you see , that business cut [her]182-florence off from [[her]182-florence church]1155-her church . [She]182-florence did not want to confess what [she]182-florence was doing because [she]182-florence was afraid that [[her]182-florence spiritual advisers]2248-her spiritual advisers would blame [her]182-florence for deceiving [me]0-i . [I]0-i rather imagine that [she]182-florence would have preferred damnation to breaking [my]0-i heart . That is what it works out at . [She]182-florence need not have troubled . But , having [no priests]2756-no priests to talk to [she]182-florence had to talk to [someone]369-someone and , as [Florence]182-florence insisted on talking to [her]369-someone , [she]182-florence talked back , in short , explosive sentences , like one of the damned . Precisely like [one of the damned]2758-one of the damned . Well , if a pretty period in hell on [this earth]1273-this earth can spare [her]182-florence any period of pain in eternity - where there are not any periods - [I]0-i guess [Leonora]183-leonora will escape hell fire . [Her]183-leonora conversations with [Florence]182-florence would be like this . [Florence]182-florence would happen in on [her]183-leonora , whilst [she]183-leonora was doing [her]183-leonora wonderful hair , with a proposition from [Edward]189-edward , who seems about that time to have conceived the naive idea that [he]189-edward might become [a polygamist]2760-a polygamist . [I]0-i dare say it was [Florence]182-florence who put it into [his]189-edward head . Anyhow , [I]0-i am not responsible for the oddities of the human psychology . But it certainly appears that at about that date [Edward]189-edward cared more for [Leonora]183-leonora than [he]189-edward had ever done before - or , at any rate , for a long time . And if [Leonora]183-leonora had been [a person to play cards]2761-a person to play cards and if [she]183-leonora had played [her]183-leonora cards well , and if [she]183-leonora had had no sense of shame and so on , [she]183-leonora might then have shared [Edward]189-edward with [Florence]182-florence until the time came for jerking that poor cuckoo out of the nest . Well , [Florence]182-florence would come to [Leonora]183-leonora with some such proposition . [I]0-i do not mean to say that [she]182-florence put it baldly , like that . [She]182-florence stood out that [she]182-florence was not [[Edward]189-edward 's mistress]1061-edward 's mistress until [Leonora]183-leonora said that [she]183-leonora had seen [Edward]189-edward coming out of [[her]183-leonora room]1412-her room at an advanced hour of the night . That checked [Florence]182-florence a bit ; but [she]182-florence fell back upon [her]182-florence " heart "[182-florence] and stuck out that [she]182-florence had merely been conversing with [Edward]189-edward in order to bring [him]189-edward to a better frame of mind . [Florence]182-florence had , of course , to stick to that story ; for even [Florence]182-florence would not have had the face to implore [Leonora]183-leonora to grant [her]182-florence favours to [Edward]189-edward if [she]182-florence had admitted that [she]182-florence was [[Edward]189-edward 's mistress]1061-edward 's mistress . That could not be done . At the same time [Florence]182-florence had such a pressing desire to talk about something . There would have been nothing else to talk about but a rapprochement between [that estranged pair]2765-that estranged pair . So [Florence]182-florence would go on babbling and [Leonora]183-leonora would go on brushing [her]183-leonora hair . And then [Leonora]183-leonora would say suddenly something like : " [I]183-leonora should think [myself]183-leonora defiled if [Edward]189-edward touched [me]183-leonora now that [he]189-edward has touched [you]182-florence . "[183-leonora] That would discourage [Florence]182-florence a bit ; but after a week or so , on another morning [she]182-florence would have another try . And even in other things [Leonora]183-leonora deteriorated . [She]183-leonora had promised [Edward]189-edward to leave the spending of [his]189-edward own income in [his]189-edward own hands . And [she]183-leonora had fully meant to do that .
