[I]0-i dare say [she]183-leonora would have done it too ; though , no doubt , [she]183-leonora would have spied upon [his]189-edward banking account in secret . [She]183-leonora was not [a Roman Catholic]2766-a roman catholic for nothing . But [she]183-leonora took so serious a view of [Edward]189-edward 's unfaithfulness to the memory of [poor little Maisie]235-maisie that [she]183-leonora could not trust [him]189-edward any more at all . So when [she]183-leonora got back to [Branshaw]180-branshaw [she]183-leonora started , after less than a month , to worry [him]189-edward about the minutest items of [his]189-edward expenditure . [She]183-leonora allowed [him]189-edward to draw [his]189-edward own cheques , but there was hardly a cheque that [she]183-leonora did not scrutinize - except for a private account of about five hundred a year which , tacitly , [she]183-leonora allowed [him]189-edward to keep for expenditure on [[his]189-edward mistress]2404-his mistress or [mistresses]2768-mistresses . [He]189-edward had to have [his]189-edward jaunts to [Paris]3-paris ; [he]189-edward had to send expensive cables in cipher to [Florence]182-florence about twice a week . But [she]183-leonora worried [him]189-edward about [his]189-edward expenditure on wines , on fruit trees , on harness , on gates , on the account at [[his]189-edward blacksmith]2769-his blacksmith 's for work done to [a new patent army stirrup that [he]189-edward was trying to invent]2770-a new patent army stirrup that he was trying to invent . [She]183-leonora could not see why [he]189-edward should bother to invent a new army stirrup and [she]183-leonora was really enraged when , after the invention was mature , [he]189-edward made a present to [the War Office of the designs]2771-the war office of the designs and the patent rights . It was a remarkably good stirrup . [I]0-i have told [you]2772-you , [I]0-i think , that [Edward]189-edward spent a great deal of time , and about two hundred pounds , for law - fees on getting [a poor girl]697-a poor girl , [the daughter of one of [[his]189-edward gardeners]2775-his gardeners , acquitted of a charge of murdering [[her]183-leonora baby]699-her baby]2774-the daughter of one of his gardeners , acquitted of a charge of murdering her baby . That was positively the last act of [Edward]189-edward 's life . It came at a time when [Nancy Rufford]257-nancy was on [her]257-nancy way to [India]93-india ; when the most horrible gloom was over [the household]2777-the household ; when [Edward]189-edward , [himself]189-edward , was in an agony and behaving as prettily as [he]189-edward knew how . Yet even then [Leonora]183-leonora made [him]189-edward a terrible scene about this expenditure of time and trouble . [She]183-leonora sort of had the vague idea that what had passed with [the girl]567-the girl and the rest of it ought to have taught [Edward]189-edward a lesson - the lesson of economy . [She]183-leonora threatened to take [his]189-edward banking account away from [him]189-edward again . [I]0-i guess that made [him]189-edward cut [his]189-edward throat . [He]189-edward might have stuck it out otherwise - but the thought that [he]189-edward had lost [his]189-edward Nancy and that , in addition , there was nothing left for [him]189-edward but a dreary , dreary succession of days in which [he]189-edward could be of no public service . . . Well , it finished [him]189-edward . It was during those years that [Leonora]183-leonora tried to get up a love affair of [her]183-leonora own with [a fellow called [Bayham]295-rodney bayham]2779-a fellow called bayham - [a decent sort of fellow]2780-a decent sort of fellow . [A really nice man]2781-a really nice man . But the affair was no sort of success . [I]0-i have told [you]2782-you about it already .... WELL , that about brings [me]0-i up to the date of [my]0-i receiving , in [Waterbury]58-waterbury , the laconic cable from [Edward]189-edward to the effect that [he]189-edward wanted [me]0-i to go to [Branshaw]180-branshaw and have a chat . [I]0-i was pretty busy at the time and [I]0-i was half minded to send [him]189-edward a reply cable to the effect that [I]0-i would start in a fortnight . But [I]0-i was having a long interview with [[old Mr. Hurlbird]201-old mr. hurlbird 's attorneys]2783-old mr. hurlbird 's attorneys and immediately afterwards [I]0-i had to have a long interview with [the Misses Hurlbird]198-the misses hurlbird , so [I]0-i delayed cabling . [I]0-i had expected to find [the Misses Hurlbird]198-the misses hurlbird excessively old - in the nineties or thereabouts . The time had passed so slowly that [I]0-i had the impression that it must have been thirty years since [I]0-i had been in [the United States]121-the united states . It was only twelve years . Actually [Miss Hurlbird]182-florence was just sixty - one and [Miss Florence Hurlbird]182-florence fifty - nine and [they]2784-they were both , mentally and physically , as vigorous as could be desired . [They]2784-they were , indeed , more vigorous , mentally , than suited [my]0-i purpose , which was to get away from [the United States]1038-the united states as quickly as [I]0-i could . [The Hurlbirds]245-the hurlbirds were an exceedingly united family - exceedingly united except on one set of points . [Each of [the three of [them]245-the hurlbirds]2787-the three of them]2786-each of the three of them had [a separate doctor]2788-a separate doctor , whom [she]182-florence trusted implicitly - and each had [a separate attorney]2789-a separate attorney . And , naturally , [the doctors]563-the doctors and [the attorneys]2793-the attorneys warned one all the time - against [each other]407-each other . [You]2795-you can not imagine how complicated it all became for [me]0-i . Of course [I]0-i had [an attorney of [my]0-i own]2796-an attorney of my own - recommended to [me]0-i by [young Carter]281-young carter , [[my]0-i Philadelphia nephew]2797-my philadelphia nephew . [I]0-i do not mean to say that there was any unpleasantness of a grasping kind . The problem was quite another one - a moral dilemma . [You]2795-you see , [old Mr. Hurlbird]201-old mr. hurlbird had left all [[his]201-old mr. hurlbird property]2798-his property to [Florence]182-florence with the mere request that [she]182-florence would have erected to [him]201-old mr. hurlbird in [the city of [Waterbury]58-waterbury]2799-the city of waterbury , [Conn.]155-conn. , [a memorial that should take the form of some sort of institution for the relief of [sufferers]966-sufferers from the heart]2800-a memorial that should take the form of some sort of institution for the relief of sufferers from the heart . [Florence]182-florence 's money had all come to [me]0-i - and with it [old Mr. Hurlbird]201-old mr. hurlbird 's . [He]201-old mr. hurlbird had died just five days before [Florence]182-florence . Well , [I]0-i was quite ready to spend a round million dollars on the relief of [sufferers from the heart]2802-sufferers from the heart . [The old gentleman]542-the old gentleman had left about a million and a half ; [Florence]182-florence had been worth about eight hundred thousand - and as [I]0-i figured it out , [I]0-i should cut up at about a million [myself]0-i . Anyhow , there was ample money . But [I]0-i naturally wanted to consult the wishes of [[his]201-old mr. hurlbird surviving relatives]2804-his surviving relatives and then the trouble really began . [You]2805-you see , it had been discovered that [Mr. Hurlbird]201-old mr. hurlbird had had nothing whatever the matter with [his]201-old mr. hurlbird heart . [His]201-old mr. hurlbird lungs had been a little affected all through [his]201-old mr. hurlbird life and [he]201-old mr. hurlbird had died of bronchitis . It struck [Miss Florence Hurlbird]182-florence that , since [[her]182-florence brother]749-her brother had died of lungs and not of heart , [his]201-old mr. hurlbird money ought to go to [lung patients]2807-lung patients . That , [she]182-florence considered , was what [[her]182-florence brother]749-her brother would have wished . On the other hand , by a kink that [I]0-i could not at the time understand , [Miss Hurlbird]182-florence insisted that [I]0-i ought to keep the money all to [myself]0-i . [She]182-florence said that [she]182-florence did not wish for any monuments to [the Hurlbird family]2809-the hurlbird family . At the time [I]0-i thought that that was because of a New [England]1-england dislike for necrological ostentation . So [I]0-i guess [Florence]182-florence had told [Miss Hurlbird]182-florence a good bit about [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward in a few scrawled words - and that was why [the old lady]2812-the old lady did not wish the name of [Hurlbird]182-florence perpetuated . Perhaps also [she]2812-the old lady thought that [I]0-i had earned the [Hurlbird]182-florence money . It meant a pretty tidy lot of discussing , what with [the doctors]563-the doctors warning [each other]407-each other about the bad effects of discussions , on the health of [the old ladies]2815-the old ladies , and warning [me]0-i covertly against [each other]407-each other , and saying that [old Mr. Hurlbird]201-old mr. hurlbird might have died of heart , after all , in spite of the diagnosis of [[his]201-old mr. hurlbird doctor]2817-his doctor . And [the solicitors]2818-the solicitors all had separate methods of arranging about how the money should be invested and entrusted and bound . If [old Mr. Hurlbird]201-old mr. hurlbird had not died of any defects in that organ [he]201-old mr. hurlbird had considered that it was defective . And when [Miss Florence Hurlbird]182-florence stood out that the money ought to go to [chest sufferers]2820-chest sufferers [I]0-i was brought to thinking that there ought to be a chest institution too , and [I]0-i advanced the sum that [I]0-i was ready to provide to a million and a half of dollars . That would have given seven hundred and fifty thousand to [each class of invalid]2821-each class of invalid . [I]0-i did not want money at all badly . All [I]0-i wanted it for was to be able to give [Nancy Rufford]257-nancy a good time . [I]0-i did not know much about housekeeping expenses in [England]1-england , where , [I]0-i presumed , [she]257-nancy would wish to live . [I]0-i knew that [her]257-nancy needs at that time were limited to good chocolates , and a good horse or two , and simple , pretty frocks . Probably [she]257-nancy would want more than that later on . But even if [I]0-i gave a million and a half dollars to [these institutions]2822-these institutions [I]0-i should still have the equivalent of about twenty thousand a year English , and [I]0-i considered that [Nancy]257-nancy could have a pretty good time on that or less . Anyhow , [we]2823-we had a stiff set of arguments up at [the Hurlbird mansion]1454-the hurlbird mansion , which stands on [a bluff over [the town]533-the town]2825-a bluff over the town . It may strike [you]2827-you , [silent listener]2828-silent listener , as being funny if [you]2827-you happen to be European . [I]0-i imagined that what must have happened was that [the undesirable young man]2847-the undesirable young man had been forbidden [the place]2848-the place and that [Nancy]257-nancy was fretting a little . What had happened was just hell . [Leonora]183-leonora had spoken to [Nancy]257-nancy ; [Nancy]257-nancy had spoken to [Edward]189-edward ; [Edward]189-edward had spoken to [Leonora]183-leonora - and [they]2849-they had talked and talked . And talked . [You]2850-you have to imagine horrible pictures of gloom and half lights , and emotions running through silent nights - through whole nights . [You]2850-you have to imagine [[my]0-i beautiful [Nancy]257-nancy]2851-my beautiful nancy appearing suddenly to [Edward]189-edward , rising up at the foot of [his]189-edward bed , with [her]257-nancy long hair falling , like a split cone of shadow , in the glimmer of a night - light that burned beside [him]189-edward . And [you]2850-you have to imagine [his]189-edward frantic refusal - and talk . And talk ! [[My]0-i God]2852-my god ! And yet , to [me]0-i , living in [the house]1359-the house , enveloped with the charm of the quiet and ordered living , with [the silent , skilled servants whose mere laying out of [my]0-i dress clothes was like a caress]2854-the silent , skilled servants whose mere laying out of my dress clothes was like a caress - to [me]0-i who was hourly with [them]2854-the silent , skilled servants whose mere laying out of my dress clothes was like a caress [they]2854-the silent , skilled servants whose mere laying out of my dress clothes was like a caress appeared like [tender , ordered , and devoted people]2855-tender , ordered , and devoted people , smiling , absenting [themselves]2854-the silent , skilled servants whose mere laying out of my dress clothes was like a caress at the proper intervals ; driving [me]0-i to meets - [just good people]1005-just good people ! At dinner one evening [Leonora]183-leonora said - [she]183-leonora had just opened a telegram : - " [Nancy]257-nancy will be going to [India]93-india , to - morrow , to be with [[her]257-nancy father]1584-her father . "[183-leonora] [No one]889-no one spoke . [Nancy]257-nancy looked at [her]257-nancy plate ; [Edward]189-edward went on eating [his]189-edward pheasant . [I]0-i felt very bad ; [I]0-i imagined that it would be up to [me]0-i to propose to [Nancy]257-nancy that evening . And that evening [Edward]189-edward spoke to [me]0-i . WHAT IN THE INTERVAL had happened had been this : Upon [her]183-leonora return from [Nauheim]6-nauheim [Leonora]183-leonora had completely broken down - because [she]183-leonora knew [she]183-leonora could trust [Edward]189-edward . That seems odd but , if [you]2859-you know anything about breakdowns , [you]2859-you will know that , by the ingenious torments that fate prepares for [us]2861-us , these things come as soon as , a strain having relaxed , there is nothing more to be done . It is after [a husband]1444-a husband 's long illness and death that [a widow]2863-a widow goes to pieces , it is at the end of a long rowing contest that [a crew]2864-a crew collapses and lies forward upon its oars . And that was what happened to [Leonora]183-leonora . From certain tones in [Edward]189-edward 's voice ; from the long , steady stare that [he]189-edward had given [her]183-leonora from [his]189-edward bloodshot eyes on rising from the dinner table in [the Nauheim hotel]2865-the nauheim hotel , [she]183-leonora knew that , in the affair of [the poor girl]691-the poor girl , this was a case in which [Edward]189-edward 's moral scruples , or [his]189-edward social code , or [his]189-edward idea that it would be playing it too low down , rendered [Nancy]257-nancy perfectly safe . [The girl]567-the girl , [she]183-leonora felt sure , was in no danger at all from [Edward]189-edward . And in that [she]183-leonora was perfectly right . The smash was to come from [herself]183-leonora . [She]183-leonora relaxed ; [she]183-leonora broke ; [she]183-leonora drifted , at first quickly , then with an increasing momentum , down the stream of destiny . [You]2868-you may put it that , having been cut off from the restraints of [her]183-leonora religion , for the first time in [her]183-leonora life , [she]183-leonora acted along the lines of [her]183-leonora instinctive desires . [I]0-i do not know whether to think that , in that [she]183-leonora was no longer [herself]183-leonora ; or that , having let loose the bonds of [her]183-leonora standards , [her]183-leonora conventions , and [her]183-leonora traditions , [she]183-leonora was being , for the first time , [her]183-leonora own natural self . [She]183-leonora was torn between [her]183-leonora intense , maternal love for [the girl]567-the girl and an intense jealousy of [the woman who realizes that [the man [she]183-leonora loves has met what appears to be the final passion of [his]2872-his life]2871-the man she loves has met what appears to be the final passion of his life]2870-the woman who realizes that the man she loves has met what appears to be the final passion of his life . [She]183-leonora was divided between an intense disgust for [Edward]189-edward 's weakness in conceiving this passion , an intense pity for the miseries that [he]189-edward was enduring , and a feeling equally intense , but one that [she]183-leonora hid from [herself]183-leonora - a feeling of respect for [Edward]189-edward 's determination to keep [himself]189-edward , in this particular affair , unspotted . And the human heart is a very mysterious thing . It is impossible to say that [Leonora]183-leonora , in acting as [she]183-leonora then did , was not filled with a sort of hatred of [Edward]189-edward 's final virtue . [She]183-leonora wanted , [I]0-i think , to despise [him]189-edward . [He]189-edward was , [she]183-leonora realized , gone from [her]183-leonora for good . Then let [him]189-edward suffer , let [him]189-edward agonize ; let [him]189-edward , if possible , break and go to that hell that is the abode of broken resolves . [She]183-leonora might have taken a different line . It would have been so easy to send [the girl]567-the girl away to stay with [some friends]2874-some friends ; to have taken [her]567-the girl away [herself]183-leonora upon some pretext or other . That would not have cured things but it would have been the decent line .... But , at that date , poor [Leonora]183-leonora was incapable of taking any line whatever . [She]183-leonora pitied [Edward]189-edward frightfully at one time - and then [she]183-leonora acted along the lines of pity ; [she]183-leonora loathed [him]189-edward at another and then [she]183-leonora acted as [her]183-leonora loathing dictated . [She]183-leonora gasped , as [a person dying of tuberculosis gasps for air]2875-a person dying of tuberculosis gasps for air . [She]183-leonora craved madly for communication with [some other human soul]2876-some other human soul . And the human soul that [she]183-leonora selected was that of [the girl]567-the girl . Perhaps [Nancy]257-nancy was [the only person that [she]183-leonora could have talked to]2878-the only person that she could have talked to . With [her]183-leonora necessity for reticences , with [her]183-leonora coldness of manner , [Leonora]183-leonora had singularly few intimates . [She]183-leonora had none at all , with the exception of [the Mrs. Colonel Whelen]287-a mrs. colonel whelen , who had advised [her]183-leonora about the affair with [La Dolciquita]285-la dolciquita , and [the one or two religious]2879-the one or two religious , who had guided [her]183-leonora through life . [[The Colonel]2104-the colonel 's wife]2881-the colonel 's wife was at that time in [Madeira]156-madeira ; [the religious [she]183-leonora now avoided]2882-the religious she now avoided . [[Her]183-leonora visitor]2883-her visitor 's book had seven hundred names in it ; there was not a soul that [she]183-leonora could speak to . [She]183-leonora was [Mrs. Ashburnham of Branshaw Teleragh]180-branshaw . [She]183-leonora was the great [Mrs. Ashburnham of Branshaw]180-branshaw and [she]183-leonora lay all day upon [her]183-leonora bed in [[her]183-leonora marvellous , light , airy bedroom]2884-her marvellous , light , airy bedroom with the chintzes and [the Chippendale]296-the chippendale and the portraits of [deceased Ashburnhams]178-the ashburnhams by [Zoffany]297-zoffany and [Zucchero]298-zucchero . When there was a meet [she]183-leonora would struggle up - supposing it were within driving distance - and let [Edward]189-edward drive [her]183-leonora and [the girl]567-the girl to [the cross - roads]2886-the cross - roads or [the country house]2887-the country house . [She]183-leonora would drive [herself]183-leonora back alone ; [Edward]189-edward would ride off with [the girl]567-the girl . [Ride Leonora]183-leonora could not , that season - [her]183-leonora head was too bad . Each pace of [[her]183-leonora mare]2889-her mare was an anguish . But [she]183-leonora drove with efficiency and precision ; [she]183-leonora smiled at [the Gimmers]299-the gimmers and [Ffoulkes]300-ffoulkes and the Hedley Seatons . [She]183-leonora threw with exactitude pennies to [the boys who opened gates for [her]183-leonora]2890-the boys who opened gates for her ; [she]183-leonora sat upright on the seat of [the high dog - cart]2891-the high dog - cart ; [she]183-leonora waved [her]183-leonora hands to [Edward]189-edward and [Nancy]257-nancy as [they]2892-they rode off with the hounds , and [everyone]803-everyone could hear [her]183-leonora clear , high voice , in the chilly weather , saying : " Have a good time ! "[183-leonora] [Poor forlorn woman]2894-poor forlorn woman ! . . . There was , however , one spark of consolation . It came from the fact that [Rodney Bayham]295-rodney bayham , of [Bayham]295-rodney bayham , followed [her]183-leonora always with [his]295-rodney bayham eyes . It had been three years since [she]183-leonora had tried [her]183-leonora abortive love affair with [him]295-rodney bayham . Yet still , on the winter mornings [he]295-rodney bayham would ride up to [[her]183-leonora shafts]2895-her shafts and just say : " Good day , "[295-rodney bayham] and look at [her]183-leonora with eyes that were not imploring , but that seemed to say : " [You]183-leonora see , [I]295-rodney bayham am still , as [the Germans]213-germans say - at disposition . "[295-rodney bayham] It was a great consolation , not because [she]183-leonora proposed ever to take [him]295-rodney bayham up again but because it showed [her]183-leonora that there was in [the world]392-the world [one faithful soul]2897-one faithful soul in riding - breeches . And it showed [her]183-leonora that [she]183-leonora was not losing [her]183-leonora looks . And , indeed , [she]183-leonora was not losing [her]183-leonora looks . [She]183-leonora was forty , but [she]183-leonora was as clean - run as on the day [she]183-leonora had left [the convent]1768-the convent - as clear in outline , as clear - coloured in the hair , as dark blue in the eyes . [She]183-leonora thought that [her]183-leonora looking - glass told [her]183-leonora this ; but there are always the doubts .... [Rodney Bayham]295-rodney bayham 's eyes took them away . It is very singular that [Leonora]183-leonora should not have aged at all . [I]0-i suppose that there are some types of beauty and [even of youth made for the embellishments that come with enduring sorrow]2899-even of youth made for the embellishments that come with enduring sorrow . That is too elaborately put . [I]0-i mean that [Leonora]183-leonora , if everything had prospered , might have become too hard , and , maybe , overbearing . As it was , [she]183-leonora was tuned down to appearing efficient - and yet sympathetic . That is the rarest of all blends . And yet [I]0-i swear that [Leonora]183-leonora , in [her]183-leonora restrained way , gave the impression of being intensely sympathetic . When [she]183-leonora listened to [you]2900-you [she]183-leonora appeared also to be listening to some sound that was going on in the distance . But still , [she]183-leonora listened to [you]2900-you and took in what [you]2900-you said , which , since the record of humanity is a record of sorrows , was , as a rule , something sad . [I]0-i think that [she]183-leonora must have taken [Nancy]257-nancy through many terrors of the night and many bad places of the day . And that would account for [the girl]567-the girl 's passionate love for [the elder woman]2902-the elder woman . For [Nancy]257-nancy 's love for [Leonora]183-leonora was an admiration that is awakened in [Catholics]241-the english catholics by [their]241-the english catholics feeling for [the Virgin Mary]282-mary and for [various of [the saints]1903-the saints]2903-various of the saints . It is too little to say that [the girl]567-the girl would have laid [her]567-the girl life at [Leonora]183-leonora 's feet . Well , [she]567-the girl laid there the offer of [her]567-the girl virtue - and [her]567-the girl reason . Those were sufficient instalments of [her]567-the girl life . It would to - day be much better for [Nancy Rufford]257-nancy if [she]257-nancy were dead . Perhaps all these reflections are a nuisance ; but they crowd on [me]0-i . [I]0-i will try to tell the story . [You]2906-you see - when [she]567-the girl came back from [Nauheim]6-nauheim [Leonora]183-leonora began to have [her]183-leonora headaches - headaches lasting through whole days , during which [she]183-leonora could speak no word and could bear to hear no sound . And , day after day , [Nancy]257-nancy would sit with [her]257-nancy , silent and motionless for hours , steeping handkerchiefs in vinegar and water , and thinking [her]257-nancy own thoughts . It must have been very bad for [her]257-nancy - and [her]257-nancy meals alone with [Edward]189-edward must have been bad for [her]257-nancy too - and beastly bad for [Edward]189-edward . [Edward]189-edward , of course , wavered in [his]189-edward demeanour . What else could [he]189-edward do ? At times [he]189-edward would sit silent and dejected over [his]189-edward untouched food . [He]189-edward would utter nothing but monosyllables when [Nancy]257-nancy spoke to [him]189-edward . Then [he]189-edward was simply afraid of [the girl]567-the girl falling in love with [him]189-edward . At other times [he]189-edward would take a little wine ; pull [himself]189-edward together ; attempt to chaff [Nancy]257-nancy about a stake and binder hedge that [her]257-nancy mare had checked at or talk about the habits of [the Chitralis]301-the chitralis . That was when [he]189-edward was thinking that it was rough on [the poor girl]691-the poor girl that [he]189-edward should have become [a dull companion]2909-a dull companion . [He]189-edward realized that [his]189-edward talking to [her]257-nancy in [the park]1744-the park at [Nauheim]6-nauheim had done [her]257-nancy no harm . But all that was doing a great deal of harm to [Nancy]257-nancy . It gradually opened [her]257-nancy eyes to the fact that [Edward]189-edward was [a man with [his]189-edward ups and downs and not [an invariably gay uncle]2912-an invariably gay uncle like a nice dog , a trustworthy horse , or [a girl friend]2913-a girl friend]2911-a man with his ups and downs and not an invariably gay uncle like a nice dog , a trustworthy horse , or a girl friend . [She]257-nancy would find [him]189-edward in attitudes of frightful dejection , sunk into [his]189-edward armchair in [the study that was half [a gun - room]2915-a gun - room]2914-the study that was half a gun - room . [She]257-nancy would notice through the open door that [his]189-edward face was the face of [an old , dead man]2916-an old , dead man , when [he]189-edward had [no one]889-no one to talk to . Gradually it forced itself upon [her]257-nancy attention that there were profound differences between [the pair]2918-the pair that [she]257-nancy regarded as [[her]257-nancy uncle]524-her uncle and [[her]257-nancy aunt]1405-her aunt . It was a conviction that came very slowly . It began with [Edward]189-edward 's giving an oldish horse to [a young fellow]2921-a young fellow called [Selmes]302-young selmes . [[Selmes]302-young selmes ' father]2922-selmes ' father had been ruined by [a fraudulent solicitor]2923-a fraudulent solicitor and [the Selmes family]2924-the selmes family had had to sell [their]2924-the selmes family hunters . It was a case that had excited a good deal of sympathy in [that part of [the county]1176-the county]2925-that part of the county . And [Edward]189-edward , meeting [the young man]2927-the young man , one day , unmounted and seeing [him]2927-the young man to be very unhappy had offered to give [him]2927-the young man an old Irish cob upon which [he]2927-the young man was riding . It was a silly sort of thing to do , really . The horse was worth from thirty to forty pounds and [Edward]189-edward might have known that the gift would upset [[his]189-edward wife]388-his wife . But [Edward]189-edward just had to comfort [that unhappy young man whose father [he]189-edward had known all [his]189-edward life]2929-that unhappy young man whose father he had known all his life . And what made it all the worse was that [young Selmes]302-young selmes could not afford to keep the horse even . [Edward]189-edward recollected this , immediately after [he]189-edward had made the offer , and said quickly : " Of course [I]189-edward mean that [you]257-nancy should stable the horse at [Branshaw]180-branshaw until [you]257-nancy have time to turn round or want to sell [him]2932-a splendid husband and get a better . "[189-edward] [Nancy]257-nancy went straight [home]591-home and told all this to [Leonora]183-leonora , who was lying down . [She]183-leonora regarded it as a splendid instance of [Edward]189-edward 's quick consideration for the feelings and the circumstances of the distressed . [She]183-leonora thought it would cheer [Leonora]183-leonora up - because it ought to cheer [any woman]3070-any woman up to know that [she]183-leonora had such [a splendid husband]2932-a splendid husband . That was the last girlish thought [she]183-leonora ever had . For [Leonora]183-leonora , whose headache had left [her]183-leonora collected but miserably weak , turned upon [her]183-leonora bed and uttered words that were amazing to [the girl]567-the girl : " [I]183-leonora wish to [God]188-god , "[183-leonora] [she]183-leonora said , " that [he]189-edward was [[your]567-the girl husband]3224-your husband , and not [mine]183-leonora . [We]3225-we shall be ruined . [We]3225-we shall be ruined . Am [I]183-leonora never to have a chance . "[183-leonora] And suddenly [Leonora]183-leonora burst into a passion of tears . [She]183-leonora pushed [herself]183-leonora up from the pillows with one elbow and sat there - crying , crying , crying , with [her]183-leonora face hidden in [her]183-leonora hands and the tears falling through [her]183-leonora fingers . [The girl]567-the girl flushed , stammered , and whimpered as if [she]567-the girl had been personally insulted . " But if [Uncle Edward]303-uncle edward . . . "[183-leonora] [she]183-leonora began . " [That man]1668-that man , "[183-leonora] said [Leonora]183-leonora , with an extraordinary bitterness , " would give the shirt off [his]1668-that man back and . off [mine]183-leonora - and off [yours]183-leonora to any . . . "[183-leonora] [She]183-leonora could not finish the sentence . At that moment [she]183-leonora had been feeling an extraordinary hatred and contempt for [[her]183-leonora husband]509-her husband . All the morning and all the afternoon [she]183-leonora had been lying there thinking that [Edward]189-edward and [the girl]567-the girl were together - in [the field]714-the field and hacking it [home]591-home at dusk . [She]183-leonora had been digging [her]183-leonora sharp nails into [her]183-leonora palms . [The house]1359-the house had been very silent in the drooping winter weather . And then , after an eternity of torture , there had invaded it the sound of opening doors , of [the girl]567-the girl 's gay voice saying : " Well , it was only under the mistletoe . "[567-the girl] . . . And there was [Edward]189-edward 's gruff undertone . Then [Nancy]257-nancy had come in , with feet that had hastened up the stairs and that tiptoed as [they]2941-they approached the open door of [[Leonora]183-leonora 's room]2942-leonora 's room . [Branshaw]180-branshaw had [a great big hall with oak floors and tigerskins]2943-a great big hall with oak floors and tigerskins . Round [this hall]2944-this hall there ran [a gallery upon which [Leonora]183-leonora 's doorway]2945-a gallery upon which leonora 's doorway gave . And even when [she]183-leonora had the worst of [her]183-leonora headaches [she]183-leonora liked to have [her]183-leonora door open - [I]0-i suppose so that [she]183-leonora might hear the approaching footsteps of ruin and disaster . At any rate [she]183-leonora hated to be in [a room with a shut door]2946-a room with a shut door . At that moment [Leonora]183-leonora hated [Edward]189-edward with a hatred that was like hell , and [she]183-leonora would have liked to bring [her]183-leonora riding - whip down across [the girl]567-the girl 's face . What right had [Nancy]257-nancy to be young and slender and dark , and gay at times , at times mournful ? What right had [she]257-nancy to be exactly [the woman to make [[Leonora]183-leonora 's husband]2949-leonora 's husband]2948-the woman to make leonora 's husband happy ? For [Leonora]183-leonora knew that [Nancy]257-nancy would have made [Edward]189-edward happy . Yes , [Leonora]183-leonora wished to bring [her]183-leonora riding - whip down on [Nancy]257-nancy 's young face . [She]183-leonora imagined the pleasure [she]183-leonora would feel when the lash fell across those queer features ; the pleasure [she]183-leonora would feel at drawing the handle at the same moment toward [her]257-nancy , so as to cut deep into the flesh and to leave a lasting wheal . Well , [she]183-leonora left a lasting wheal and [her]183-leonora words cut deeply into [the girl]567-the girl 's mind .... [They]2951-they neither of [them]2951-they spoke about that again . A fortnight went by - a fortnight of deep rains , of heavy fields , of bad scent . [Leonora]183-leonora 's headaches seemed to have gone for good . [She]183-leonora hunted once or twice , letting [herself]183-leonora be piloted by [Bayham]295-rodney bayham , whilst [Edward]189-edward looked after [the girl]567-the girl . Then , one evening , when [those three]1706-those three were dining alone , [Edward]189-edward said , in the queer , deliberate , heavy tones that came out of [him]189-edward in those days [he]189-edward was looking at the table : " [I]189-edward have been thinking that [Nancy]257-nancy ought to do more for [[her]257-nancy father]1584-her father . [He]1584-her father is getting [an old man]3228-an old man . [I]189-edward have written to [Colonel Rufford]304-colonel rufford , suggesting that [she]257-nancy should go to [him]1584-her father . "[189-edward] [Leonora]183-leonora called out : " How dare [you]189-edward ? How dare [you]189-edward ? "[183-leonora] [The girl]567-the girl put [her]567-the girl hand over [her]567-the girl heart and cried out : " Oh , [[my]567-the girl sweet Saviour]3229-my sweet saviour , help [me]567-the girl ! "[567-the girl] That was the queer way [she]567-the girl thought within [her]567-the girl mind , and the words forced themselves to [her]567-the girl lips . [Edward]189-edward said nothing . AND THAT NIGHT , by a merciless trick of the devil that pays attention to [this sweltering hell of [ours]2956-ours]2955-this sweltering hell of ours , [Nancy Rufford]257-nancy had a letter from [[her]257-nancy mother]1583-her mother . It came whilst [Leonora]183-leonora was talking to [Edward]189-edward , or [Leonora]183-leonora would have intercepted it as [she]183-leonora had intercepted [others]2958-others . It was an amazing and a horrible letter .... [I]0-i do n't know what it contained . [I]0-i just average out from its effect on [Nancy]257-nancy that [[her]257-nancy mother]1583-her mother , having eloped with [some worthless sort of fellow]2960-some worthless sort of fellow , had done what is called ' sinking lower and lower . " Whether [she]1583-her mother was actually on [the streets]833-the streets [I]1583-her mother do not know , but [I]1583-her mother rather think that [she]1583-her mother eked out a small allowance that [she]1583-her mother had from [[her]1583-her mother husband]509-her husband by that means of livelihood . And [I]1583-her mother think that [she]1583-her mother stated as much in [her]1583-her mother letter to [Nancy]257-nancy and upbraided [the girl]567-the girl with living in luxury whilst [[her]257-nancy mother]1583-her mother starved . And it must have been horrible in tone , for [Mrs. Rufford]270-mrs. rufford was [a cruel sort of woman]3234-a cruel sort of woman at the best of times . It must have seemed to [that poor girl]3235-that poor girl , opening [her]1583-her mother letter , for distraction from another grief , up in [[her]1583-her mother bedroom]1296-her bedroom , like the laughter of [a devil]3237-a devil . [I]1583-her mother just can not bear to think of [[my]1583-her mother poor dear girl]3238-my poor dear girl at that moment .... And , at the same time , [Leonora]183-leonora was lashing , like [a cold fiend]3239-a cold fiend , into the unfortunate [Edward]189-edward . Or , perhaps , [he]189-edward was not so unfortunate ; because [he]189-edward had done what [he]189-edward knew to be the right thing , [he]189-edward may be deemed happy . [I]1583-her mother leave it to [you]2961-you . At any rate , [he]189-edward was sitting in [his]189-edward deep chair , and [Leonora]183-leonora came into [[his]189-edward room]1232-his room - for the first time in nine years . [She]183-leonora said : "[1583-her mother] This is the most atrocious thing [you]2961-you have done in [your]2961-you atrocious life . " [He]189-edward never moved and [he]189-edward never looked at [her]183-leonora . [God]188-god knows what was in [Leonora]183-leonora 's mind exactly . [I]2961-you like to think that uppermost in it was concern and horror at the thought of [the poor girl]691-the poor girl 's going back to [a father whose voice made [her]183-leonora shriek in the night]3242-a father whose voice made her shriek in the night . And , indeed , that motive was very strong with [Leonora]183-leonora . But [I]2961-you think there was also present the thought that [she]183-leonora wanted to go on torturing [Edward]189-edward with [the girl]567-the girl 's presence . [She]183-leonora was , at that time , capable of that . [Edward]189-edward was sunk in [his]189-edward chair ; there were in [the room]633-the room two candles , hidden by green glass shades . The green shades were reflected in the glasses of the bookcases that contained not books but guns with gleaming brown barrels and fishing - rods in green baize overcovers . There was dimly to be seen , above a mantelpiece encumbered with spurs , hooves , and bronze models of horses , a dark - brown picture of a white horse . "[2961-you] If [you]2961-you think , " [Leonora]183-leonora said , "[2961-you] that [I]0-i do not know that [you]2961-you are in love with [the girl]567-the girl . . . " [She]183-leonora began spiritedly , but [she]183-leonora could not find any ending for the sentence . [Edward]189-edward did not stir ; [he]189-edward never spoke . And then [Leonora]183-leonora said : "[2961-you] If [you]2961-you want [me]0-i to divorce [you]2961-you [I]0-i will . [You]2961-you can marry [her]567-the girl then . [She]567-the girl 's in love with [you]2961-you . " [He]189-edward groaned at that , a little , [Leonora]183-leonora said . Then [she]183-leonora went away . [Heaven]203-heaven knows what happened in [Leonora]183-leonora after that . [She]183-leonora certainly does not [herself]183-leonora know . [She]183-leonora probably said a good deal more to [Edward]189-edward than [I]0-i have been able to report ; but that is all that [she]183-leonora has told [me]0-i and [I]0-i am not going to make up speeches . To follow [her]183-leonora psychological development of that moment [I]0-i think [we]3245-we must allow that [she]183-leonora upbraided [him]189-edward for a great deal of [their]3245-we past life , whilst [Edward]189-edward sat absolutely silent . And , indeed , in speaking of it afterwards , [she]0-i had said several times : "[0-i] [I]0-i said a great deal more to [him]2963-him than [I]0-i wanted to , just because [he]2963-him was so silent . " [She]0-i talked , in fact , in the endeavour to sting [him]2963-him into speech . [She]0-i must have said so much that , with the expression of [her]0-i grievance , [her]0-i mood changed . [She]0-i went back to [[her]0-i own room]3246-her own room in [the gallery]3247-the gallery , and sat there for a long time thinking . And [she]0-i thought [herself]0-i into a mood of absolute unselfishness , of absolute self - contempt , too . [She]0-i said to [herself]0-i that [she]0-i was no good ; that [she]0-i had failed in all [her]0-i efforts - in [her]0-i efforts to get [Edward]189-edward back as in [her]0-i efforts to make [him]2963-him curb [his]2963-him expenditure . [She]0-i imagined [herself]0-i to be exhausted ; [she]0-i imagined [herself]0-i to be done . Then a great fear came over [her]0-i . [She]0-i thought that [Edward]189-edward , after what [she]0-i had said to [him]189-edward , must have committed suicide . [She]0-i went out on to [the gallery]3247-the gallery and listened ; there was no sound in all [the house]1359-the house except the regular beat of the great clock in [the hall]648-the hall . But , even in [her]0-i debased condition , [she]0-i was not the person to hang about . [She]0-i acted . [She]0-i went straight to [[Edward]189-edward 's room]1041-edward 's room , opened the door , and looked in . [He]189-edward was oiling the breech action of a gun . It was an unusual thing for [him]189-edward to do , at that time of night , in [his]189-edward evening clothes . It never occurred to [her]0-i , nevertheless , that [he]189-edward was going to shoot [himself]189-edward with that implement . [She]0-i knew that [he]189-edward was doing it just for occupation - to keep [himself]189-edward from thinking . [He]189-edward looked up when [she]0-i opened the door , [his]189-edward face illuminated by the light cast upwards from the round orifices in the green candle shades . [She]0-i said : "[0-i] [I]0-i did n't imagine that [I]0-i should find [Nancy]257-nancy [here]3120-here . " [She]0-i thought that [she]0-i owed that to [him]189-edward . [He]189-edward answered then : "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't imagine that [you]0-i did imagine it . " Those were the only words [he]189-edward spoke that night . [She]0-i went , like a lame duck , back through [the long corridors]3252-the long corridors ; [she]0-i stumbled over the familiar tigerskins in [the dark hall]3253-the dark hall . [She]0-i could hardly drag one limb after the other . In [the gallery]3247-the gallery [she]0-i perceived that [Nancy]257-nancy 's door was half open and that there was a light in [[the girl]567-the girl 's room]3256-the girl 's room . A sudden madness possessed [her]0-i , a desire for action , a thirst for self - explanation . [[Their]3257-their rooms]2010-their rooms all gave on to [the gallery]3247-the gallery ; [[Leonora]183-leonora 's]3260-leonora 's to the east , [the girl]567-the girl 's next , then [[Edward]189-edward 's]3262-edward 's . The sight of those three open doors , side by side , gaping to receive whom the chances of the black night might bring , made [Leonora]183-leonora shudder all over [her]183-leonora body . [She]183-leonora went into [[Nancy]257-nancy 's room]3263-nancy 's room . [The girl]567-the girl was sitting perfectly still in an armchair , very upright , as [she]567-the girl had been taught to sit at [the convent]1768-the convent . [She]567-the girl appeared to be as calm as [a church]1489-a church ; [her]567-the girl hair fell , black and like a pall , down over both [her]567-the girl shoulders . The fire beside [her]567-the girl was burning brightly ; [she]567-the girl must have just put coals on . [She]567-the girl was in a white silk kimono that covered [her]567-the girl to the feet . The clothes that [she]567-the girl had taken off were exactly folded upon the proper seats . [Her]567-the girl long hands were one upon each arm of the chair , that had a pink and white chintz back . [Leonora]183-leonora told [me]0-i these things . [She]183-leonora seemed to think it extraordinary that [the girl]567-the girl could have done such orderly things as fold up the clothes [she]567-the girl had taken off upon such a night - when [Edward]189-edward had announced that [he]189-edward was going to send [her]567-the girl to [[her]567-the girl father]1584-her father , and when , from [[her]567-the girl mother]1583-her mother , [she]567-the girl had received that letter . The letter , in its envelope , was in [her]567-the girl right hand . [Leonora]183-leonora did not at first perceive it . [She]183-leonora said : "[0-i] What are [you]2965-you doing so late ? " [The girl]567-the girl answered : "[2965-you] Just thinking . " [They]3271-they seemed to think in whispers and to speak below [their]3271-they breaths . Then [Leonora]183-leonora 's eyes fell on the envelope , and [she]183-leonora recognized [Mrs. Rufford]270-mrs. rufford 's handwriting . It was one of those moments when thinking was impossible , [Leonora]183-leonora said . It was as if stones were being thrown at [her]567-the girl from every direction and [she]567-the girl could only run . [She]183-leonora heard [herself]183-leonora exclaim : "[2965-you] [Edward]189-edward 's dying - because of [you]2965-you . [He]189-edward 's dying . " "[0-i] [I]0-i am going to [Glasgow]158-glasgow , " [Nancy]257-nancy answered . "[0-i] [I]0-i shall go to [Glasgow]158-glasgow to - morrow morning . [[My]0-i mother]2860-my mother is in [Glasgow]158-glasgow . " It appears that it was in [Glasgow]158-glasgow that [Mrs. Rufford]270-mrs. rufford pursued [her]270-mrs. rufford disorderly life . " [She]567-the girl added : "[2860-my mother] To the ends of [the earth]502-the earth , " for , if the last months had made [her]567-the girl nature that of [a woman]686-a woman , [her]567-the girl phrases were still romantically those of [a school - girl]3279-a school - girl . It was as if [she]567-the girl had grown up so quickly that there had not been time to put [her]567-the girl hair up .
