[You]2976-you ca n't let [that man]1668-that man go on to ruin for want of [you]2976-you . [You]2976-you must belong to [him]1668-that man . " [The girl]567-the girl , [she]567-the girl said , smiled at [her]567-the girl with a queer , faraway smile - as if [she]567-the girl were a thousand years old , as if [Leonora]183-leonora were [a tiny child]3281-a tiny child . "[0-i] [I]0-i knew [you]2976-you would come to that , " [she]567-the girl said , very slowly . "[0-i] But [we]2979-we are not worth it - [Edward]189-edward and [I.]2980-i. " [NANCY]257-nancy HAD , in fact , been thinking ever since [Leonora]183-leonora had made that comment over the giving of the horse to [young Selmes]302-young selmes . [She]257-nancy had been thinking and thinking , because [she]257-nancy had had to sit for many days silent beside [[her]257-nancy aunt]1405-her aunt 's bed . [She]257-nancy had always thought of [Leonora]183-leonora as [[her]257-nancy aunt]1405-her aunt . And [she]257-nancy had had to sit thinking during many silent meals with [Edward]189-edward . And then , at times , with [his]189-edward bloodshot eyes and creased , heavy mouth , [he]189-edward would smile at [her]257-nancy . And gradually the knowledge had come to [her]257-nancy that [Edward]189-edward did not love [Leonora]183-leonora and that [Leonora]183-leonora hated [Edward]189-edward . Several things contributed to form and to harden this conviction . [She]257-nancy was allowed to read the papers in those days - or , rather , since [Leonora]183-leonora was always on [her]183-leonora bed and [Edward]189-edward breakfasted alone and went out early , over [the estate]2496-the estate , [she]257-nancy was left alone with the papers . One day , in the paper , [she]257-nancy saw the portrait of [a woman [she]257-nancy knew very well]3285-a woman she knew very well . Beneath it [she]257-nancy read the words : "[305-mrs. brand] [The Hon . Mrs. Brand]305-mrs. brand , plaintiff in the remarkable divorce case reported on p. 8 . " [Nancy]257-nancy hardly knew what a divorce case was . [She]257-nancy had been so remarkably well brought up , and [Roman Catholics]306-roman catholics do not practise divorce . [I]305-mrs. brand do n't know how [Leonora]183-leonora had done it exactly . [I]305-mrs. brand suppose [she]183-leonora had always impressed it on [Nancy]257-nancy 's mind that [nice women]2625-nice women did not read these things , and that would have been enough to make [Nancy]257-nancy skip those pages . [She]257-nancy read , at any rate , the account of [the Brand]305-mrs. brand divorce case - principally because [she]257-nancy wanted to tell [Leonora]183-leonora about it . [She]257-nancy imagined that [Leonora]183-leonora , when [her]183-leonora headache left [her]183-leonora , would like to know what was happening to [Mrs. Brand]305-mrs. brand , who lived at [Christchurch]159-christchurch , and whom [they]3287-they both liked very well . The case occupied three days , and the report that [Nancy]257-nancy first came upon was that of the third day . [Edward]189-edward , however , kept the papers of the week , after [his]189-edward methodical fashion , in a rack in [[his]189-edward gun - room]3288-his gun - room , and when [she]257-nancy had finished [her]257-nancy breakfast [Nancy]257-nancy went to [that quiet apartment]3289-that quiet apartment and had what [she]257-nancy would have called a good read . It seemed to [her]257-nancy to be a queer affair . [She]257-nancy could not understand why [one counsel]3290-one counsel should be so anxious to know all about the movements of [Mr. Brand]307-mr. brand upon a certain day ; [she]257-nancy could not understand why a chart of [the bedroom accommodation at [Christchurch Old Hall]160-christchurch old hall]3291-the bedroom accommodation at christchurch old hall should be produced in [court]3292-court . [She]257-nancy did not even see why [they]3287-they should want to know that , upon a certain occasion , the drawing - room door was locked . It made [her]257-nancy laugh : it appeared to be all so senseless that [grown people]3293-grown people should occupy [themselves]3293-grown people with such matters . It struck [her]257-nancy , nevertheless , as odd that [one of [the counsel]3295-the counsel]3294-one of the counsel should cross - question [Mr. Brand]307-mr. brand so insistently and so impertinently as to [his]307-mr. brand feelings for [Miss Lupton]308-miss lupton . [Nancy]257-nancy knew [[Miss Lupton]308-miss lupton of [Ringwood]161-ringwood]3296-miss lupton of ringwood very well - [a jolly girl]3297-a jolly girl , who rode a horse with two white fetlocks . [Mr. Brand]307-mr. brand persisted that [he]307-mr. brand did not love [Miss Lupton]308-miss lupton .... Well , of course [he]307-mr. brand did not love [Miss Lupton]308-miss lupton ; [he]307-mr. brand was [a married man]3298-a married man . [You]3299-you might as well think of [Uncle Edward]303-uncle edward loving . . . loving [anybody]333-anybody but [Leonora]183-leonora . When [people]507-people were married there was an end of loving . There were , no doubt , [people who misbehaved]3302-people who misbehaved - but [they]3302-people who misbehaved were [poor people]3303-poor people - or [people not like those [she]308-miss lupton knew]3304-people not like those she knew . So these matters presented [themselves]3305-themselves to [Nancy]257-nancy 's mind . But later on in the case [she]257-nancy found that [Mr. Brand]307-mr. brand had to confess to a "[305-mrs. brand] guilty intimacy " with [someone or other]3306-someone or other . [Nancy]257-nancy imagined that [he]307-mr. brand must have been telling [someone]369-someone [[his]307-mr. brand wife]388-his wife 's secrets ; [she]257-nancy could not understand why that was a serious offence .. Of course it was not very gentlemanly - it lessened [her]257-nancy opinion of [Mr. Brand]307-mr. brand . But , since [she]257-nancy found that [Mrs. Brand]305-mrs. brand had condoned that offence , [she]257-nancy imagined that [they]3309-they could not have been very serious secrets that [Mr. Brand]307-mr. brand had told . And then , suddenly , it was forced on [her]257-nancy conviction that [Mr. Brand]307-mr. brand - [the mild Mr. Brand]307-mr. brand that [she]257-nancy had seen a month or two before [their]3309-they departure to [Nauheim]6-nauheim , playing "[309-blind man] [Blind Man]309-blind man 's Buff " with [[his]307-mr. brand children]3310-his children and kissing [[his]307-mr. brand wife]388-his wife when [he]307-mr. brand caught [her]388-his wife - [Mr. Brand]307-mr. brand and [Mrs. Brand]305-mrs. brand had been on the worst possible terms . That was incredible . Yet there it was - in black and white . [Mr. Brand]307-mr. brand drank ; [Mr. Brand]307-mr. brand had struck [Mrs. Brand]305-mrs. brand to the ground when [he]307-mr. brand was drunk . [Mr. Brand]307-mr. brand was adjudged , in two or three abrupt words , at the end of columns and columns of paper , to have been guilty of cruelty to [[his]307-mr. brand wife]388-his wife and to have committed adultery with [Miss Lupton]308-miss lupton . The last words conveyed nothing to [Nancy]257-nancy - nothing real , that is to say . [She]305-mrs. brand knew that [one]417-one was commanded not to commit adultery - but why , [she]305-mrs. brand thought , should one ? It was probably something like catching salmon out of season - a thing [one]417-one did not do . [She]305-mrs. brand gathered it had something to do with kissing , or holding [someone]369-someone in [your]3316-your arms .... And yet the whole effect of that reading upon [Nancy]257-nancy was mysterious , terrifying , and evil . [She]305-mrs. brand felt a sickness - a sickness that grew as [she]305-mrs. brand read . [Her]305-mrs. brand heart beat painfully ; [she]305-mrs. brand began to cry . [She]305-mrs. brand asked [God]188-god how [He]307-mr. brand could permit such things to be . And [she]305-mrs. brand was more certain that [Edward]189-edward did not love [Leonora]183-leonora and that [Leonora]183-leonora hated [Edward]189-edward . Perhaps , then , [Edward]189-edward loved [someone else]829-someone else . It was unthinkable . If [he]189-edward could love [someone else]829-someone else than [Leonora]183-leonora , [her]305-mrs. brand fierce , unknown heart suddenly spoke in [her]305-mrs. brand side , why could it not be [herself]305-mrs. brand ? And [he]189-edward did not love [her]183-leonora .... This had occurred about a month before [she]305-mrs. brand got the letter from [[her]305-mrs. brand mother]1583-her mother . [She]305-mrs. brand let the matter rest until the sick feeling went off ; it did that in a day or two . Then , finding that [Leonora]183-leonora 's headaches had gone , [she]305-mrs. brand suddenly told [Leonora]183-leonora that [Mrs. Brand]305-mrs. brand had divorced [[her]305-mrs. brand husband]509-her husband . [She]305-mrs. brand asked what , exactly , it all meant . [Leonora]183-leonora was lying on the sofa in [the hall]648-the hall ; [she]183-leonora was feeling so weak that [she]183-leonora could hardly find any words . [She]183-leonora answered just : "[309-blind man] It means that [Mr. Brand]307-mr. brand will be able to marry again . " [Nancy]257-nancy said : "[307-mr. brand] But . . . but . . . " and then : "[307-mr. brand] [He]307-mr. brand will be able to marry [Miss Lupton]308-miss lupton . " [Leonora]183-leonora just moved a hand in assent . [Her]183-leonora eyes were shut . "[308-miss lupton] Then . . . " [Nancy]257-nancy began . [Her]257-nancy blue eyes were full of horror : [her]257-nancy brows were tight above them ; the lines of pain about [her]257-nancy mouth were very distinct . In [her]257-nancy eyes the whole of [that familiar , great hall]3322-that familiar , great hall had a changed aspect . [The andirons with the brass flowers at the ends]3323-the andirons with the brass flowers at the ends appeared unreal ; the burning logs were just logs that were burning and not the comfortable symbols of an indestructible mode of life . The flame fluttered before the high fireback ; [the St. Bernard]310-the st. bernard sighed in [his]3324-his sleep . Outside the winter rain fell and fell . And suddenly [she]183-leonora thought that [Edward]189-edward might marry [someone else]829-someone else ; and [she]183-leonora nearly screamed . [Leonora]183-leonora opened [her]183-leonora eyes , lying sideways , with [her]183-leonora face upon the black and gold pillow of the sofa that was drawn half across the great fireplace . "[0-i] [I]0-i thought , " [Nancy]257-nancy said , "[0-i] [I]0-i never imagined .... Are n't marriages sacraments ? Are n't they indissoluble ? [I]0-i thought [you]2981-you were married . . . and . . . " [She]183-leonora was sobbing . "[0-i] [I]0-i thought [you]2981-you were married or not married as [you]2981-you are alive or dead . " "[0-i] That , " [Leonora]183-leonora said , "[0-i] is the law of the church . It is not the law of [the land]2170-the land .... " "[0-i] Oh , yes , " [Nancy]257-nancy said , "[0-i] [the Brands]311-the brands are [Protestants]2983-protestants . " [She]257-nancy felt a sudden safeness descend upon [her]257-nancy , and for an hour or so [her]257-nancy mind was at rest . It seemed to [her]257-nancy idiotic not to have remembered [Henry VIII]217-henry viii and the basis upon which Protestantism rests . [She]257-nancy almost laughed at [herself]257-nancy . The long afternoon wore on ; the flames still fluttered when [the maid]3326-the maid made up the fire ; [the St. Bernard]310-the st. bernard awoke and lolloped away towards [the kitchen]3327-the kitchen . And then [Leonora]183-leonora opened [her]183-leonora eyes and said almost coldly : "[2983-protestants] And [you]2981-you ? Do n't [you]2981-you think [you]2981-you will get married ? " It was so unlike [Leonora]183-leonora that , for the moment , [the girl]567-the girl was frightened in the dusk . But then , again , it seemed a perfectly reasonable question . "[2981-you] [I]0-i do n't know , " [she]0-i answered . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know that [anyone]1048-anyone wants to marry [me]0-i . " "[1048-anyone] [Several people]2985-several people want to marry [you]2981-you , " [Leonora]183-leonora said . "[2985-several people] But [I]0-i do n't want to marry , " [Nancy]257-nancy answered . "[0-i] [I]0-i should like to go on living with [you]2981-you and [Edward]189-edward . [I]0-i do n't think [I]0-i am in the way , or that [I]0-i am really an expense . If [I]0-i went [you]2981-you would have to have [a companion]2986-a companion . Or , perhaps , [I]0-i ought to earn [my]0-i living .... " "[0-i] [I]0-i was n't thinking of that , " [Leonora]183-leonora answered in the same dull tone . "[0-i] [You]2981-you will have enough money from [[your]2981-you father]2987-your father . But [most people]1677-most people want to be married . " [I]1677-most people believe that [she]257-nancy then asked [the girl]567-the girl if [she]567-the girl would not like to marry [me]1677-most people , and that [Nancy]257-nancy answered that [she]257-nancy would marry [me]1677-most people if [she]257-nancy were told to ; but that [she]257-nancy wanted to go on living [there]363-there . [She]0-i added : "[1677-most people] If [I]0-i married [anyone]1048-anyone [I]0-i should want [him]1048-anyone to be like [Edward]189-edward . " [She]0-i was frightened out of [her]0-i life . [Leonora]183-leonora writhed on [her]183-leonora couch and called out : "[189-edward] Oh , [God]188-god ! . . . " [Nancy]257-nancy ran for [the maid]3326-the maid ; for tablets of aspirin ; for wet handkerchiefs . It never occurred to [her]257-nancy that [Leonora]183-leonora 's expression of agony was for anything else than physical pain . [You]3332-you are to remember that all this happened a month before [Leonora]183-leonora went into [[the girl]567-the girl 's room]3256-the girl 's room at night . [I]189-edward have been casting back again ; but [I]189-edward can not help it . It is so difficult to keep [all these people]3335-all these people going . [I]189-edward tell [you]3332-you about [Leonora]183-leonora and bring [her]183-leonora up to date ; then about [Edward]189-edward , who has fallen behind . And then [the girl]567-the girl gets hopelessly left behind . [I]189-edward wish [I]189-edward could put it down in diary form . Thus : On the 1st of September [they]3335-all these people returned from [Nauheim]6-nauheim . [Leonora]183-leonora at once took to [her]183-leonora bed . By the 1st of October [they]3335-all these people were all going to meets together . [Nancy]257-nancy had already observed very fully that [Edward]189-edward was strange in [his]189-edward manner . About the 6th of that month [Edward]189-edward gave the horse to [young Selmes]302-young selmes , and [Nancy]257-nancy had cause to believe that [[her]257-nancy aunt]1405-her aunt did not love [[her]257-nancy uncle]524-her uncle . On the 20th [she]257-nancy read the account of the divorce case , which is reported in the papers of the 18th and the two following days . On the 23rd [she]257-nancy had the conversation with [[her]257-nancy aunt]1405-her aunt in [the hall]648-the hall - about marriage in general and about [her]257-nancy own possible marriage . [[Her]257-nancy aunt]1405-her aunt 's coming to [[her]257-nancy bedroom]1296-her bedroom did not occur until the 12th of November .... Thus [she]257-nancy had three weeks for introspection - for introspection beneath gloomy skies , in [that old house]3343-that old house , rendered darker by the fact that [it]3343-that old house lay in [a hollow crowned by fir trees with their black shadows]3344-a hollow crowned by fir trees with their black shadows . It was not a good situation for [a girl]2117-a girl . [She]257-nancy began thinking about love , [she]257-nancy who had never before considered it as anything other than a rather humorous , rather nonsensical matter . [She]257-nancy remembered chance passages in chance books - things that had not really affected [her]257-nancy at all at the time . [She]257-nancy remembered [someone]369-someone 's love for [the Princess Badrulbadour]312-the princess badrulbadour ; [she]257-nancy remembered to have heard that love was a flame , a thirst , a withering up of the vitals - though [she]257-nancy did not know what the vitals were . [She]257-nancy had a vague recollection that love was said to render [a hopeless lover]3347-a hopeless lover 's eyes hopeless ; [she]257-nancy remembered [a character in a book who was said to have taken to drink through love]3348-a character in a book who was said to have taken to drink through love ; [she]257-nancy remembered that [lovers]3349-lovers ' existences were said to be punctuated with heavy sighs . Once [she]257-nancy went to [the little cottage piano that was in a corner of [the hall]648-the hall]3350-the little cottage piano that was in a corner of the hall and began to play . It was a tinkly , reedy instrument , for [none of [that household]3353-that household]3352-none of that household had any turn for music . [Nancy]257-nancy [herself]257-nancy could play a few simple songs , and [she]257-nancy found [herself]257-nancy playing . [She]257-nancy had been sitting on the window seat , looking out on the fading day . [Leonora]183-leonora had gone to pay some calls ; [Edward]189-edward was looking after some planting up in [the new spinney]3354-the new spinney . Thus [she]257-nancy found [herself]257-nancy playing on the old piano . [She]257-nancy did not know how [she]257-nancy came to be doing it . A silly , lilting , wavering tune came from before [her]257-nancy in the dusk - a tune in which major notes with their cheerful insistence wavered and melted into minor sounds , as beneath a bridge the high lights on [dark waters]3355-dark waters melt and waver and disappear into black depths . Well , it was a silly old tune .... It goes with the words - they are about a willow tree , [I]189-edward think : [Thou]3356-thou are to all lost loves the best , The only true plant found - that sort of thing . It is [Herrick]313-herrick , [I]189-edward believe , and the music was the reedy , irregular , lilting sound that goes with [Herrick]313-herrick . And it was dusk ; the heavy , hewn , dark pillars that supported [the gallery]3247-the gallery were like mourning presences ; the fire had sunk to nothing - a mere glow amongst white ashes .... It was a sentimental sort of place and light and hour .... And suddenly [Nancy]257-nancy found that [she]257-nancy was crying . [She]257-nancy was crying quietly ; [she]257-nancy went on to cry with long convulsive sobs . It seemed to [her]257-nancy that everything gay , everything charming , all light , all sweetness , had gone out of life . Unhappiness ; unhappiness ; unhappiness was all around [her]257-nancy . [She]257-nancy seemed to know no happy being and [she]257-nancy [herself]257-nancy was agonizing .... [She]257-nancy remembered that [Edward]189-edward 's eyes were hopeless ; [she]257-nancy was certain that [he]189-edward was drinking too much ; at times [he]189-edward sighed deeply . [He]189-edward appeared as [a man who was burning with inward flame ; drying up in the soul with thirst ; withering up in the vitals]3358-a man who was burning with inward flame ; drying up in the soul with thirst ; withering up in the vitals . Then , the torturing conviction came to [her]257-nancy - the conviction that had visited [her]257-nancy again and again - that [Edward]189-edward must love [someone other than [Leonora]183-leonora]3359-someone other than leonora . With [her]257-nancy little , pedagogic sectarianism [she]257-nancy remembered that [Catholics]1147-catholics do not do this thing . But [Edward]189-edward was [a Protestant]1980-a protestant . Then [Edward]189-edward loved [somebody ....]3362-somebody .... And , after that thought , [her]257-nancy eyes grew hopeless ; [she]257-nancy sighed as [the old St. Bernard beside [her]257-nancy]3363-the old st. bernard beside her did . At meals [she]257-nancy would feel an intolerable desire to drink a glass of wine , and then another and then a third . Then [she]257-nancy would find [herself]257-nancy grow gay .... But in half an hour the gaiety went ; [she]257-nancy felt like [a person who is burning up with an inward flame]3364-a person who is burning up with an inward flame ; desiccating at the soul with thirst ; withering up in the vitals . One evening [she]257-nancy went into [[Edward]189-edward 's gun - room]3365-edward 's gun - room - [he]189-edward had gone to a meeting of [the National Reserve Committee]3366-the national reserve committee . On the table beside [his]189-edward chair was a decanter of whiskey . [She]257-nancy poured out a wine - glassful and drank it off . Flame then really seemed to fill [her]257-nancy body ; [her]257-nancy legs swelled ; [her]257-nancy face grew feverish . [She]257-nancy dragged [her]257-nancy tall height up to [[her]257-nancy room]1412-her room and lay in the dark . The bed reeled beneath [her]257-nancy ; [she]257-nancy gave way to the thought that [she]257-nancy was in [Edward]189-edward 's arms ; that [he]189-edward was kissing [her]257-nancy on [her]257-nancy face , that burned ; on [her]257-nancy shoulders , that burned , and on [her]257-nancy neck , that was on fire . [She]257-nancy never touched alcohol again . Not once after that did [she]257-nancy have such thoughts . [They]3368-they died out of [her]257-nancy mind ; they left only a feeling of shame so insupportable that [her]257-nancy brain could not take it in and they vanished . [She]257-nancy imagined that [her]257-nancy anguish at the thought of [Edward]189-edward 's love for [another person]2040-another person was solely sympathy for [Leonora]183-leonora ; [she]257-nancy determined that the rest of [her]257-nancy life must be spent in acting as [[Leonora]183-leonora 's handmaiden]3370-leonora 's handmaiden - sweeping , tending , embroidering , like [some Deborah]3371-some deborah , [some mediaeval saint]3372-some mediaeval saint - [I]189-edward am not , unfortunately , up in the Catholic hagiology . But [I]189-edward know that [she]257-nancy pictured [herself]257-nancy as [some personage with a depressed , earnest face and tightly closed lips]3373-some personage with a depressed , earnest face and tightly closed lips , in a clear white room , watering flowers or tending an embroidery frame . Or [she]257-nancy desired to go with [Edward]189-edward to [Africa]163-africa and to throw [herself]257-nancy in the path of a charging lion so that [Edward]189-edward might be saved for [Leonora]183-leonora at the cost of [her]257-nancy life . Well , along with [her]257-nancy sad thoughts [she]257-nancy had [her]257-nancy childish ones . [She]257-nancy knew nothing - nothing of life , except that [one]417-one must live sadly . That [she]257-nancy now knew . What happened to [her]257-nancy on the night when [she]257-nancy received at once the blow that [Edward]189-edward wished [her]257-nancy to go to [[her]257-nancy father]1584-her father in [India]93-india and the blow of the letter from [[her]257-nancy mother]1583-her mother was this . [She]257-nancy called first upon [her]257-nancy sweet Saviour - and [she]257-nancy thought of [[Our]3377-our Lord]3378-our lord as [her]257-nancy sweet Saviour ! - that [He]189-edward might make it impossible that [she]257-nancy should go to [India]93-india . Then [she]257-nancy realized from [Edward]189-edward 's demeanour that [he]189-edward was determined that [she]257-nancy should go to [India]93-india . It must then be right that [she]257-nancy should go . [Edward]189-edward was always right in [his]189-edward determinations . [He]189-edward was [the Cid]314-the cid ; [he]189-edward was [Lohengrin]260-lohengrin ; [he]189-edward was [the Chevalier Bayard]261-the chevalier bayard . Nevertheless [her]257-nancy mind mutinied and revolted . [She]257-nancy could not leave [that house]3379-that house . [She]257-nancy imagined that [he]189-edward wished [her]257-nancy gone that [she]257-nancy might not witness [his]189-edward amours with [another girl]3380-another girl . Well , [she]257-nancy was prepared to tell [him]189-edward that [she]257-nancy was ready to witness [his]189-edward amours with [another young girl]3381-another young girl . [She]257-nancy would stay there - to comfort [Leonora]183-leonora . Then came the desperate shock of the letter from [[her]183-leonora mother]1583-her mother . [[Her]183-leonora mother]1583-her mother said , [I]189-edward believe , something like : "[189-edward] [You]2990-you have no right to go on living [your]2990-you life of prosperity and respect . [You]2990-you ought to be on [the streets]833-the streets with [me]0-i . How do [you]2990-you know that [you]2990-you are even [[Colonel Rufford]304-colonel rufford 's daughter]2992-colonel rufford 's daughter ? " [She]183-leonora did not know what these words meant . [She]183-leonora thought of [[her]183-leonora mother]1583-her mother as sleeping beneath the arches whilst the snow fell . That was the impression conveyed to [her]183-leonora mind by the words "[2990-you] on [the streets]833-the streets . " A platonic sense of duty gave [her]183-leonora the idea that [she]183-leonora ought to go to comfort [[her]183-leonora mother]1583-her mother - [the mother that bore [her]183-leonora]3386-the mother that bore her , though [she]183-leonora hardly knew what the words meant . At the same time [she]183-leonora knew that [[her]183-leonora mother]1583-her mother had left [[her]183-leonora father]1584-her father with [another man]3389-another man - therefore [she]183-leonora pitied [[her]183-leonora father]1584-her father , and thought it terrible in [herself]183-leonora that [she]183-leonora trembled at the sound of [[her]183-leonora father]1584-her father 's voice . If [[her]183-leonora mother]1583-her mother was [that sort of woman]3393-that sort of woman it was natural that [[her]183-leonora father]1584-her father should have had accesses of madness in which [he]1584-her father had struck [herself]1583-her mother to the ground . And the voice of [her]183-leonora conscience said to [her]183-leonora that [her]183-leonora first duty was to [[her]183-leonora parents]2226-her parents . It was in accord with this awakened sense of duty that [she]183-leonora undressed with great care and meticulously folded the clothes that [she]183-leonora took off . Sometimes , but not very often , [she]183-leonora threw them helter - skelter about [the room]633-the room . And that sense of duty was [her]183-leonora prevailing mood when [Leonora]183-leonora , tall , clean - run , golden - haired , all in black , appeared in the doorway , and told [her]183-leonora that [Edward]189-edward was dying of love for [her]183-leonora . [She]183-leonora knew then with [her]183-leonora conscious mind what [she]183-leonora had known within [herself]183-leonora for months - that [Edward]189-edward was dying - actually and physically dying - of love for [her]183-leonora . It seemed to [her]183-leonora that for one short moment [her]183-leonora spirit could say : "[2990-you] [Domine]315-domine , nunc dimittis .... Lord , now lettest [thou]2994-thou [[thy]2994-thou servant]2995-thy servant depart in peace . " [She]183-leonora imagined that [she]183-leonora could cheerfully go away to [Glasgow]158-glasgow and rescue [[her]183-leonora fallen mother]3397-her fallen mother . AND IT SEEMED TO [HER]183-leonora to be in tune with the mood , with the hour , and with [the woman in front of [her]183-leonora]3398-the woman in front of her to say that [she]183-leonora knew [Edward]189-edward was dying of love for [her]183-leonora and that [she]183-leonora was dying of love for [Edward]189-edward . For that fact had suddenly slipped into place and become real for [her]183-leonora as the niched marker on a whist table slips round with the pressure of [your]3399-your thumb . That rubber at least was made . And suddenly [Leonora]183-leonora seemed to have become different and [she]183-leonora seemed to have become different in [her]183-leonora attitude towards [Leonora]183-leonora . It was as if [she]183-leonora , in [her]183-leonora frail , white , silken kimono , sat beside [her]183-leonora fire , but upon a throne . It was as if [Leonora]183-leonora , in [her]183-leonora close dress of black lace , with the gleaming white shoulders and the coiled yellow hair that [the girl]567-the girl had always considered the most beautiful thing in [the world]392-the world - it was as if [Leonora]183-leonora had become pinched , shrivelled , blue with cold , shivering , suppliant . Yet [Leonora]183-leonora was commanding [her]183-leonora . It was no good commanding [her]183-leonora . [She]183-leonora was going on the morrow to [[her]183-leonora mother]1583-her mother , who was in [Glasgow]158-glasgow . [Leonora]183-leonora went on saying that [she]183-leonora must stay [there]363-there to save [Edward]189-edward , who was dying of love for [her]183-leonora . And , proud and happy in the thought that [Edward]189-edward loved [her]183-leonora , and that [she]183-leonora loved [him]189-edward , [she]183-leonora did not even listen to what [Leonora]183-leonora said . It appeared to [her]183-leonora that it was [Leonora]183-leonora 's business to save [[her]183-leonora husband]509-her husband 's body ; [she]183-leonora , [Nancy]257-nancy , possessed [his]189-edward soul - a precious thing that [she]183-leonora would shield and bear away up in [her]183-leonora arms - as if [Leonora]183-leonora were a hungry dog , trying to spring up at a lamb that [she]183-leonora was carrying . Yes , [she]183-leonora felt as if [Edward]189-edward 's love were a precious lamb that [she]183-leonora was bearing away from a cruel and predatory beast . For , at that time , [Leonora]183-leonora appeared to [her]183-leonora as a cruel and predatory beast . [Leonora]183-leonora , [Leonora]183-leonora with [her]183-leonora hunger , with [her]183-leonora cruelty , had driven [Edward]189-edward to madness . [He]189-edward must be sheltered by [his]189-edward love for [her]183-leonora and by [her]183-leonora love - [her]183-leonora love from a great distance and unspoken , enveloping [him]189-edward , surrounding [him]189-edward , upholding [him]189-edward ; by [her]183-leonora voice speaking from [Glasgow]158-glasgow , saying that [she]183-leonora loved , that [she]183-leonora adored , that [she]183-leonora passed no moment without longing , loving , quivering at the thought of [him]189-edward . [Leonora]183-leonora said loudly , insistently , with a bitterly imperative tone : "[2996-you] [You]2996-you must stay [here]3120-here ; [you]2996-you must belong to [Edward]189-edward . [I]0-i will divorce [him]189-edward . " [The girl]567-the girl answered : "[0-i] [The church]2998-the church does not allow of divorce . [I]0-i can not belong to [[your]2996-you husband]3224-your husband . [I]0-i am going to [Glasgow]158-glasgow to rescue [[my]0-i mother]2860-my mother . " The half - opened door opened noiselessly to the full . [Edward]189-edward was there . [His]189-edward devouring , doomed eyes were fixed on [the girl]567-the girl 's face ; [his]189-edward shoulders slouched forward ; [he]189-edward was undoubtedly half drunk and [he]189-edward had the whiskey decanter in one hand , a slanting candlestick in the other . [He]189-edward said , with a heavy ferocity , to [Nancy]257-nancy : "[0-i] [I]0-i forbid [you]0-i to talk about these things . [You]0-i are to stay here until [I]0-i hear from [[your]0-i father]2987-your father . Then [you]0-i will go to [[your]0-i father]2987-your father . " [The two women]3407-the two women , looking at [each other]407-each other , like beasts about to spring , hardly gave a glance to [him]189-edward . [He]189-edward leaned against the door - post . [He]189-edward said again : "[257-nancy] [Nancy]257-nancy , [I]0-i forbid [you]257-nancy to talk about these things . [I]0-i am [the master of [this house]3004-this house]3003-the master of this house . " And , at the sound of [his]189-edward voice , heavy , male , coming from a deep chest , in the night , with the blackness behind [him]189-edward , [Nancy]257-nancy felt as if [her]257-nancy spirit bowed before [him]189-edward , with folded hands . [She]257-nancy felt that [she]257-nancy would go to [India]93-india , and that [she]257-nancy desired never again to talk of these things . [Leonora]183-leonora said : "[0-i] [You]257-nancy see that it is [your]257-nancy duty to belong to [him]3005-him . [He]3005-him must not be allowed to go on drinking . " [Nancy]257-nancy did not answer . [Edward]189-edward was gone ; [they]3409-they heard [him]189-edward slipping and shambling on the polished black oak of [the stairs]1330-the stairs . [Nancy]257-nancy screamed when there came the sound of a heavy fall . [Leonora]183-leonora said again : "[257-nancy] [You]257-nancy see ! " The sounds went on from [the hall below]3411-the hall below ; the light of the candle [Edward]189-edward held flickered up between the hand rails of [the gallery]3247-the gallery . Then [they]3409-they heard [his]189-edward voice : "[257-nancy] Give [me]0-i [Glasgow]158-glasgow . . . [Glasgow]158-glasgow , in [Scotland]145-scotland . . . [I]0-i want the number of [a man called [White]317-white]3006-a man called white , of [Simrock Park]164-simrock park , [Glasgow]158-glasgow . . . [Edward White]317-white , [Simrock Park]164-simrock park , [Glasgow]158-glasgow . . . ten minutes . . . at this time of night . . . " [His]189-edward voice was quite level , normal , and patient . [Alcohol]318-alcohol took [him]189-edward in the legs , not the speech . "[0-i] [I]0-i can wait , " [his]189-edward voice came again . "[0-i] Yes , [I]0-i know [they]3007-they have a number . [I]0-i have been in communication with [them]3007-they before . " "[317-white] [He]317-white is going to telephone to [[your]0-i mother]3008-your mother , " [Leonora]183-leonora said . "[317-white] [He]317-white will make it all right for [her]3008-your mother . " [She]183-leonora got up and closed the door . [She]183-leonora came back to the fire , and added bitterly : "[317-white] [He]317-white can always make it all right for [everybody]2322-everybody , except [me]0-i - excepting [me]0-i ! " [The girl]567-the girl said nothing . [She]567-the girl sat there in a blissful dream . [She]567-the girl seemed to see [[her]567-the girl lover]1492-her lover , sitting as [he]1492-her lover always sat , in a round - backed chair , in [the dark hall]3253-the dark hall - sitting low , with the receiver at [his]1492-her lover ear , talking in a gentle , slow voice , that [he]1492-her lover reserved for the telephone - and saving [the world]392-the world and [her]567-the girl , in the black darkness . [She]567-the girl moved [her]567-the girl hand over the bareness of the base of [her]567-the girl throat , to have the warmth of flesh upon it and upon [her]567-the girl bosom . [She]567-the girl said nothing ; [Leonora]183-leonora went on talking .... God knows what [Leonora]183-leonora said . [She]183-leonora repeated that [the girl]567-the girl must belong to [[her]183-leonora husband]509-her husband . [She]183-leonora said that [she]183-leonora used that phrase because , though [she]183-leonora might have a divorce , or even a dissolution of the marriage by [the church]2998-the church , it would still be adultery that [the girl]567-the girl and [Edward]189-edward would be committing . But [she]183-leonora said that that was necessary ; it was the price [the girl]567-the girl must pay for the sin of having made [Edward]189-edward love [her]567-the girl , for the sin of loving [[her]567-the girl husband]509-her husband . [She]183-leonora talked on and on , beside the fire . [The girl]567-the girl must become [an adulteress]3121-an adulteress ; [she]567-the girl had wronged [Edward]189-edward by being so beautiful , so gracious , so good . It was sinful to be so good . [She]567-the girl must pay the price so as to save [the man [she]567-the girl had wronged]3425-the man she had wronged . In between [her]567-the girl pauses [the girl]567-the girl could hear the voice of [Edward]189-edward , droning on , indistinguishably , with jerky pauses for replies . It made [her]567-the girl glow with pride ; [the man [she]567-the girl loved]3427-the man she loved was working for [her]567-the girl . [He]189-edward at least was resolved ; was malely determined ; knew the right thing . [Leonora]183-leonora talked on with [her]183-leonora eyes boring into [Nancy]257-nancy 's . [The girl]567-the girl hardly looked at [her]257-nancy and hardly heard [her]257-nancy . After a long time [Nancy]257-nancy said - after hours and hours : "[0-i] [I]0-i shall go to [India]93-india as soon as [Edward]189-edward hears from [[my]0-i father]3179-my father . [I]0-i can not talk about these things , because [Edward]189-edward does not wish it . " At that [Leonora]183-leonora screamed out and wavered swiftly towards the closed door . And [Nancy]257-nancy found that [she]257-nancy was springing out of [her]257-nancy chair with [her]257-nancy white arms stretched wide . [She]257-nancy was clasping [the other woman]3429-the other woman to [her]257-nancy breast ; [she]257-nancy was saying : "[3011-my poor dear] Oh , [[my]0-i poor dear]3011-my poor dear ; oh , [[my]0-i poor dear]3011-my poor dear . " And [they]3430-they sat , crouching together in [each other]407-each other 's arms , and crying and crying ; and [they]3430-they lay down in the same bed , talking and talking , all through the night . And all through the night [Edward]189-edward could hear [their]3430-they voices through the wall . That was how it went .... NEXT MORNING [they]3430-they were all three as if nothing had happened . Towards eleven [Edward]189-edward came to [Nancy]257-nancy , who was arranging some Christmas roses in a silver bowl . [He]189-edward put a telegram beside [her]3011-my poor dear on the table . "[3011-my poor dear] [You]3011-my poor dear can uncode it for [yourself]3011-my poor dear , " [he]189-edward said . [He]319-mr. dowell will make things easier till [you]3011-my poor dear leave . " The telegram , when it was uncoded , read , as far as [I]319-mr. dowell can remember : "[319-mr. dowell] Will take [Mrs. Rufford]270-mrs. rufford to [Italy]165-italy . Undertake to do this for certain . [Am]0-i devotedly attached to [Mrs. Rufford]270-mrs. rufford . Have no need of financial assistance . Did not know there was [a daughter]1764-a daughter , and am much obliged to [you]3011-my poor dear for pointing out [my]0-i duty . - [White]317-white . " It was something like that . Then [that household]3353-that household resumed its wonted course of days until [my]317-white arrival . IT IS THIS PART OF THE STORY that makes [me]317-white saddest of all . For [I]317-white ask [myself]317-white unceasingly , [my]317-white mind going round and round in a weary , baffled space of pain - what should [these people]1794-these people have done ? What , in the name of [God]188-god , should [they]1794-these people have done ? The end was perfectly plain to [each of [them]1794-these people]3434-each of them - it was perfectly manifest at this stage that , if [the girl]567-the girl did not , in [Leonora]183-leonora 's phrase , "[317-white] belong to [Edward]189-edward , " [Edward]189-edward must die , [the girl]567-the girl must lose [her]567-the girl reason because [Edward]189-edward died - and that after a time [Leonora]183-leonora , who was [the coldest and strongest of [the three]3438-the three]3437-the coldest and strongest of the three , would console [herself]183-leonora by marrying [Rodney Bayham]295-rodney bayham and have a quiet , comfortable , good time . That end , on that night , whilst [Leonora]183-leonora sat in [[the girl]567-the girl 's bedroom]3440-the girl 's bedroom and [Edward]189-edward telephoned down below - that end was plainly manifest . [The girl]567-the girl , plainly , was half - mad already ; [Edward]189-edward was half dead ; only [Leonora]183-leonora , active , persistent , instinct with [her]183-leonora cold passion of energy , was "[317-white] doing things . " What then , should [they]3438-the three have done ? It worked out in the extinction of [two very splendid personalities]3442-two very splendid personalities - for [Edward]189-edward and [the girl]567-the girl were splendid personalities , in order that [a third personality]3444-a third personality , more normal , should have , after a long period of trouble , a quiet , comfortable , good time . [I]317-white AM WRITING THIS , now , [I]317-white should say , a full eighteen months after the words that end [my]317-white last chapter . Since writing the words "[317-white] until [my]0-i arrival , " which [I]317-white see end that paragraph , [I]317-white have seen again , for a glimpse , from [a swift train]3445-a swift train , [Beaucaire]37-beaucaire , with [the beautiful white tower]3446-the beautiful white tower , [Tarascon]35-tarascon with [the square castles]3447-the square castles , [the great Rhone]3448-the great rhone , [the immense stretches of [the Crau]166-the crau]3449-the immense stretches of the crau . [I]317-white have rushed through all [Provence]24-provence - and all [Provence]24-provence no longer matters . It is no longer in [the olive hills]3450-the olive hills that [I]317-white shall find [[my]317-white heaven]3451-my heaven ; because there is only hell .... [Edward]189-edward is dead ; [the girl]567-the girl is gone - oh , utterly gone ; [Leonora]183-leonora is having [her]183-leonora good time with [Rodney Bayham]295-rodney bayham , and [I]317-white sit alone in [Branshaw Teleragh]180-branshaw . Credo in unum Deum Omnipotentem . " Those are the only reasonable words [she]3454-my poor girl uttered ; those are the only words , it appears , that [she]3454-my poor girl ever will utter . [I]317-white suppose that they are reasonable words ; must be extraordinarily reasonable for [her]3454-my poor girl , if [she]3454-my poor girl can say that [she]3454-my poor girl believes in [an Omnipotent Deity]3455-an omnipotent deity . Well , there it is . [I]317-white am very tired of it all .... For , [I]317-white dare say , all this may sound romantic , but it is tiring , tiring , tiring to have been in the midst of it ; to have taken the tickets ; to have caught [the trains]3456-the trains ; to have chosen [the cabins]3457-the cabins ; to have consulted [the purser]3458-the purser and [the stewards]3459-the stewards as to diet for [the quiescent patient who did nothing but announce [her]3454-my poor girl belief in [an Omnipotent Deity]3455-an omnipotent deity]3460-the quiescent patient who did nothing but announce her belief in an omnipotent deity . That may sound romantic - but it is just a record of fatigue . [I]317-white do n't know why [I]317-white should always be selected to be serviceable . [I]317-white do n't resent it - but [I]317-white have never been the least good . [Florence]182-florence selected [me]317-white for [her]182-florence own purposes , and [I]317-white was no good to [her]182-florence ; [Edward]189-edward called [me]317-white to come and have a chat with [him]189-edward and [I]317-white could n't stop [him]189-edward cutting [his]189-edward throat . And then , one day eighteen months ago , [I]317-white was quietly writing in [[my]317-white room at [Branshaw]180-branshaw]3462-my room at branshaw when [Leonora]183-leonora came to [me]317-white with a letter . It was a very pathetic letter from [Colonel Rufford]304-colonel rufford about [Nancy]257-nancy . [Colonel Rufford]304-colonel rufford had left [the army]2070-the army and had taken up the management of [a tea - planting estate in [Ceylon]168-ceylon]3464-a tea - planting estate in ceylon . [His]304-colonel rufford letter was pathetic because it was so brief , so inarticulate , and so business - like . [He]304-colonel rufford had gone down to [the boat]3465-the boat to meet [[his]304-colonel rufford daughter]3466-his daughter and had found [[his]304-colonel rufford daughter]3466-his daughter quite mad . It appears that at [Aden Nancy]320-aden nancy had seen in a local paper the news of [Edward]189-edward 's suicide . In [the Red Sea]2555-the red sea [she]257-nancy had gone mad . [She]257-nancy had remarked to [Mrs. Colonel Luton]321-mrs. colonel luton , who was chaperoning [her]257-nancy , that [she]257-nancy believed in [an Omnipotent Deity]3455-an omnipotent deity . [She]257-nancy had n't made any fuss ; [her]257-nancy eyes were quite dry and glassy . Even when [she]257-nancy was mad [Nancy]257-nancy could behave [herself]257-nancy . [Colonel Rufford]304-colonel rufford said [the doctor]1469-the doctor did not anticipate that there was any chance of [[his]304-colonel rufford child]3471-his child 's recovery . It was , nevertheless , possible that if [she]257-nancy could see someone from [Branshaw]180-branshaw it might soothe [her]257-nancy and it might have a good effect . And [he]304-colonel rufford just simply wrote to [Leonora]183-leonora : "[317-white] Please come and see if [you]3015-you can do it . " [I]0-i seem to have lost all sense of the pathetic ; but still , that simple , enormous request of [the old Colonel]3472-the old colonel strikes [me]0-i as pathetic . [He]304-colonel rufford was cursed by [his]304-colonel rufford atrocious temper ; [he]304-colonel rufford had been cursed by [a half - mad wife]3473-a half - mad wife , who drank and went on [the streets]833-the streets . [[His]304-colonel rufford daughter]3466-his daughter was totally mad - and yet [he]304-colonel rufford believed in the goodness of human nature . [He]304-colonel rufford believed that [Leonora]183-leonora would take the trouble to go all the way to [Ceylon]168-ceylon in order to soothe [[his]304-colonel rufford daughter]3466-his daughter . [Leonora]183-leonora would n't . [Leonora]183-leonora did n't ever want to see [Nancy]257-nancy again . [I]0-i dare say that that , in the circumstances , was natural enough . At the same time [she]3473-a half - mad wife agreed , as it were , on public grounds , that [someone soothing ought to go from [Branshaw]180-branshaw to [Ceylon]168-ceylon]3477-someone soothing ought to go from branshaw to ceylon . [She]3473-a half - mad wife sent [me]0-i and [[her]3473-a half - mad wife old nurse , who had looked after [Nancy]257-nancy from the time when [the girl]567-the girl , [a child of thirteen]3480-a child of thirteen , had first come to [Branshaw]180-branshaw]3478-her old nurse , who had looked after nancy from the time when the girl , a child of thirteen , had first come to branshaw . So off [I]0-i go , rushing through [Provence]24-provence , to catch [the steamer]1504-the steamer at [Marseilles]169-marseilles . And [I]0-i was n't the least good when [I]0-i got to [Ceylon]168-ceylon ; and [the nurse]3482-the nurse was n't the least good . Nothing has been the least good . [The doctors]563-the doctors said , at [Kandy]170-kandy , that if [Nancy]257-nancy could be brought to [England]1-england , the sea air , the change of climate , the voyage , and all the usual sort of things might restore [her]257-nancy reason . Of course , [they]563-the doctors have n't restored [her]257-nancy reason . [She]257-nancy is , [I]0-i am aware , sitting in [the hall]648-the hall , forty paces from where [I]0-i am now writing . [I]0-i do n't want to be in the least romantic about it . [She]257-nancy is very well dressed ; [she]257-nancy is quite quiet ; [she]257-nancy is very beautiful . [The old nurse]3485-the old nurse looks after [her]257-nancy very efficiently . Of course [you]3486-you have the makings of a situation here , but it is all very humdrum , as far as [I]0-i am concerned . [I]0-i should marry [Nancy]257-nancy if [her]257-nancy reason were ever sufficiently restored to let [her]257-nancy appreciate the meaning of the Anglican marriage service . But it is probable that [her]257-nancy reason will never be sufficiently restored to let [her]257-nancy appreciate the meaning of the Anglican marriage service . Therefore [I]0-i can not marry [her]257-nancy , according to the law of [the land]2170-the land . So here [I]0-i am very much where [I]0-i started thirteen years ago . [I]0-i am [the attendant]3488-the attendant , not [the husband , of [a beautiful girl]3490-a beautiful girl , who pays no attention to [me]0-i . [I]0-i am estranged from [Leonora]183-leonora , who married [Rodney Bayham]295-rodney bayham in [my]0-i absence and went to live at [Bayham]295-rodney bayham]3489-the husband , of a beautiful girl , who pays no attention to me . i am estranged from leonora , who married rodney bayham in my absence and went to live at bayham . [Leonora]183-leonora rather dislikes [me]0-i , because [she]183-leonora has got it into [her]183-leonora head that [I]0-i disapprove of [her]183-leonora marriage with [Rodney Bayham]295-rodney bayham . Well , [I]0-i disapprove of [her]183-leonora marriage . Possibly [I]0-i am jealous . Yes , no doubt [I]0-i am jealous . In [my]0-i fainter sort of way [I]0-i seem to perceive [myself]0-i following the lines of [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward . [I]0-i suppose that [I]0-i should really like to be [a polygamist]2760-a polygamist ; with [Nancy]257-nancy , and with [Leonora]183-leonora , and with [Maisie Maidan]235-maisie , and possibly even with [Florence]182-florence . [I]0-i am no doubt like [every other man]3492-every other man ; only , probably because of [my]0-i American origin , [I]0-i am fainter . At the same time [I]0-i am able to assure [you]3493-you that [I]0-i am [a strictly respectable person]3494-a strictly respectable person . [I]0-i have never done anything that [the most anxious mother of a daughter]3495-the most anxious mother of a daughter or [the most careful dean of [a cathedral]3497-a cathedral]3496-the most careful dean of a cathedral would object to . [I]0-i have only followed , faintly , and in [my]0-i unconscious desires , [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward . Well , it is all over . [Not one of [us]3499-us]3498-not one of us has got what [he]189-edward really wanted . [Leonora]183-leonora wanted [Edward]189-edward , and [she]183-leonora has got [Rodney Bayham]295-rodney bayham , [a pleasant enough sort of sheep]3500-a pleasant enough sort of sheep . [Florence]182-florence wanted [Branshaw]180-branshaw , and it is [I]0-i who have bought it from [Leonora]183-leonora . [I]0-i did n't really want it ; what [I]0-i wanted mostly was to cease being [a nurse - attendant]3501-a nurse - attendant . Well , [I]0-i am [a nurse - attendant]3501-a nurse - attendant . [Edward]189-edward wanted [Nancy Rufford]257-nancy and [I]0-i have got [her]257-nancy . Only [she]257-nancy is mad . It is a queer and fantastic world . Why ca n't [people]507-people have what [they]507-people want ? The things were all there to content [everybody]2322-everybody ; yet [everybody]2322-everybody has the wrong thing . Perhaps [you]3506-you can make head or tail of it ; it is beyond [me]0-i . Is there then any [terrestrial paradise]3507-terrestrial paradise where , amidst the whispering of the olive - leaves , [people]507-people can be with whom [they]507-people like and have what [they]507-people like and take [their]507-people ease in shadows and in coolness ? Or are [all men]427-all men 's lives like the lives of [[us]3510-us [good people]3088-good people]3511-us good people - like the lives of [the Ashburnhams]178-the ashburnhams , of [the Dowells]3513-the dowells , of [the Ruffords]171-the ruffords - broken , tumultuous , agonized , and unromantic lives , periods punctuated by screams , by imbecilities , by deaths , by agonies ? Who [the devil]3514-the devil knows ? FOR THERE WAS A GREAT DEAL of imbecility about the closing scenes of the Ashburnham tragedy . [Neither of those two women]3515-neither of those two women knew what [she]3515-neither of those two women wanted . It was only [Edward]189-edward who took a perfectly clear line and [he]189-edward was drunk most of the time . But , drunk or sober , [he]189-edward stuck to what was demanded by convention and by the traditions of [[his]189-edward house]3516-his house . [Nancy Rufford]257-nancy had to be exported to [India]93-india and [Nancy Rufford]257-nancy had n't to hear a word of love from [him]189-edward . [She]257-nancy was exported to [India]93-india and [she]257-nancy never heard a word from [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward . It was the conventional line ; it was in tune with the tradition of [[Edward]189-edward 's house]3517-edward 's house . [I]0-i dare say it worked out for the greatest good of the body politic . Conventions and traditions [I]0-i suppose work blindly but surely for the preservation of the normal type ; for the extinction of [proud , resolute , and unusual individuals]3518-proud , resolute , and unusual individuals . [Edward]189-edward was [the normal man]3519-the normal man , but there was too much of the sentimentalist about [him]189-edward and society does not need [too many sentimentalists]3520-too many sentimentalists . [Nancy]257-nancy was [a splendid creature]3521-a splendid creature but [she]257-nancy had about [her]257-nancy a touch of madness . Society does not need [individuals]3522-individuals with touches of madness about [them]3522-individuals . So [Edward]189-edward and [Nancy]257-nancy found [themselves]3523-their steam - rolled out and [Leonora]183-leonora survives , the perfectly normal type , married to [a man who is rather like a rabbit]3524-a man who is rather like a rabbit . For [Rodney Bayham]295-rodney bayham is rather like a rabbit and [I]0-i hear that [Leonora]183-leonora is expected to have [a baby]2122-a baby in three months ' time . So those splendid and tumultuous creatures with [their]3523-their magnetism and [their]3523-their passions - [those two that [I]0-i really loved]3526-those two that i really loved - have gone from [this earth]1273-this earth . It is no doubt best for [them]3526-those two that i really loved . What would [Nancy]257-nancy have made of [Edward]189-edward if [she]257-nancy had succeeded in living with [him]189-edward ; what would [Edward]189-edward have made of [her]257-nancy ? For there was about [Nancy]257-nancy a touch of cruelty - a touch of definite actual cruelty that made [her]257-nancy desire to see [people]507-people suffer . Yes , [she]257-nancy desired to see [Edward]189-edward suffer . And , by [God]188-god , [she]257-nancy gave [him]189-edward hell . [She]257-nancy gave [him]189-edward an unimaginable hell . [Those two women]3529-those two women pursued [that poor devil]3530-that poor devil and flayed the skin off [him]189-edward as if [they]3529-those two women had done it with whips . [I]0-i tell [you]3531-you [his]189-edward mind bled almost visibly . [I]0-i seem to see [him]189-edward stand , naked to the waist , [his]189-edward forearms shielding [his]189-edward eyes , and flesh hanging from [him]189-edward in rags . [I]0-i tell [you]3531-you that is no exaggeration of what [I]0-i feel . It was as if [Leonora]183-leonora and [Nancy]257-nancy banded [themselves]3529-those two women together to do execution , for the sake of humanity , upon the body of [a man who was at [their]3529-those two women disposal]3532-a man who was at their disposal . [They]3529-those two women were like [a couple of Sioux who had got hold of [an Apache]3534-an apache and had [him]189-edward well tied to a stake]3533-a couple of sioux who had got hold of an apache and had him well tied to a stake . [I]0-i tell [you]3531-you there was no end to the tortures [they]3529-those two women inflicted upon [him]189-edward . Night after night [he]189-edward would hear [them]3529-those two women talking ; talking ; maddened , sweating , seeking oblivion in drink , [he]189-edward would lie there and hear the voices going on and on . And day after day [Leonora]183-leonora would come to [him]189-edward and would announce the results of [their]3529-those two women deliberations . [They]3529-those two women were like judges debating over the sentence upon [a criminal]3535-a criminal ; [they]3529-those two women were like ghouls with an immobile corpse in [a tomb beside [them]3529-those two women]3536-a tomb beside them . [I]0-i do n't think that [Leonora]183-leonora was any more to blame than [the girl]567-the girl - though [Leonora]183-leonora was [the more active of [the two]1715-the two]3538-the more active of the two . [Leonora]183-leonora , as [I]0-i have said , was [the perfectly normal woman]3540-the perfectly normal woman . [I]0-i mean to say that in normal circumstances [her]183-leonora desires were those of [the woman who is needed by society]3541-the woman who is needed by society . [She]183-leonora desired [children]1130-children , decorum , [an establishment]3543-an establishment ; [she]183-leonora desired to avoid waste , [she]183-leonora desired to keep up appearances . [She]183-leonora was utterly and entirely normal even in [her]183-leonora utterly undeniable beauty . But [I]0-i do n't mean to say that [she]183-leonora acted perfectly normally in this perfectly abnormal situation . All [the world]392-the world was mad around [her]183-leonora and [she]183-leonora [herself]183-leonora , agonized , took on the complexion of [a mad woman]3545-a mad woman ; of [a woman very wicked]3546-a woman very wicked ; of [the villain of the piece]3547-the villain of the piece . What would [you]3548-you have ? Steel is a normal , hard , polished substance . But if [you]3548-you put it in a hot fire it will become red , soft , and not to be handled . If [you]3548-you put it in a fire still more hot it will drip away . It was like that with [Leonora]183-leonora . [She]183-leonora was made for normal circumstances - for [Mr. Rodney Bayham]295-rodney bayham , who will keep [a separate establishment]3549-a separate establishment , secretly , in [Portsmouth]103-portsmouth , and make occasional trips to [Paris]3-paris and to [Buda]172-buda - [Pesth]173-pesth . In the case of [Edward]189-edward and [the girl]567-the girl [Leonora]183-leonora broke and simply went all over [the place]2848-the place . [She]183-leonora adopted unfamiliar and therefore extraordinary and ungraceful attitudes of mind . At one moment [she]183-leonora was all for revenge . After haranguing [the girl]567-the girl for hours through the night [she]183-leonora harangued for hours of the day [the silent Edward]189-edward . And [Edward]189-edward just once tripped up and that was [his]189-edward undoing . Perhaps [he]189-edward had had too much whiskey that afternoon . [She]183-leonora asked [him]189-edward perpetually what [he]189-edward wanted . What did [he]189-edward want ? What did [he]189-edward want ? And all [he]189-edward ever answered was : "[0-i] [I]0-i have told [you]3016-you . " [He]189-edward meant that [he]189-edward wanted [the girl]567-the girl to go to [[her]567-the girl father]1584-her father in [India]93-india as soon as [[her]567-the girl father]1584-her father should cable that [he]189-edward was ready to receive [her]567-the girl . But just once [he]189-edward tripped up . To [Leonora]183-leonora 's eternal question [he]189-edward answered that all [he]189-edward desired in life was that - that [he]189-edward could pick [himself]189-edward together again and go on with [his]189-edward daily occupations if [the girl]567-the girl , being five thousand miles away , would continue to love [him]189-edward . [He]189-edward wanted nothing more . [He]189-edward prayed [[his]189-edward God]3557-his god for nothing more . Well , [he]189-edward was [a sentimentalist]1105-a sentimentalist . And the moment that [she]183-leonora heard that , [Leonora]183-leonora determined that [the girl]567-the girl should not go five thousand miles away and that [she]183-leonora should not continue to love [Edward]189-edward . The way [she]183-leonora worked it was this : [She]183-leonora continued to tell [the girl]567-the girl that [she]183-leonora must belong to [Edward]189-edward ; [she]183-leonora was going to get a divorce ; [she]183-leonora was going to get a dissolution of marriage from [Rome]17-rome . But [she]183-leonora considered it to be [her]183-leonora duty to warn [the girl]567-the girl of the sort of monster that [Edward]189-edward was . [She]183-leonora told [the girl]567-the girl of La Dolciquita , of [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil , of [Maisie Maidan]235-maisie , of [Florence]182-florence . [She]183-leonora spoke of the agonies that [she]183-leonora had endured during [her]183-leonora life with [the man]1816-the man , who was violent , overbearing , vain , drunken , arrogant , and monstrously a prey to [his]189-edward sexual necessities . And , at hearing of the miseries [[her]183-leonora aunt]1405-her aunt had suffered - for [Leonora]183-leonora once more had the aspect of [an aunt]3565-an aunt to [the girl]567-the girl - with the swift cruelty of youth , and with the swift solidarity that attaches [woman]1801-woman to [woman]1801-woman , [the girl]567-the girl made [her]567-the girl resolves . [[Her]183-leonora aunt]1405-her aunt said incessantly : "[0-i] [You]3017-you must save [Edward]189-edward 's life ; [you]3017-you must save [his]189-edward life . All that [he]189-edward needs is a little period of satisfaction from [you]3017-you . Then [he]189-edward will tire of [you]3017-you as [he]189-edward has of the others . But [you]3017-you must save [his]189-edward life . " And , all the while , [that wretched fellow]3571-that wretched fellow knew , by a curious instinct that runs between [human beings living together]3572-human beings living together - exactly what was going on . And [he]3571-that wretched fellow remained dumb ; [he]3571-that wretched fellow stretched out no finger to help [himself]3571-that wretched fellow . All that [he]3571-that wretched fellow required to keep [himself]3571-that wretched fellow [a decent member of society]3573-a decent member of society was that [the girl , five thousand miles away]3574-the girl , five thousand miles away , should continue to love [him]3571-that wretched fellow . [They]3575-they were putting a stopper upon that . [I]3017-you have told [you]3017-you that [the girl]567-the girl came one night to [[his]3571-that wretched fellow room]1232-his room . And that was the real hell for [him]3571-that wretched fellow . That was the picture that never left [his]3571-that wretched fellow imagination - [the girl]567-the girl , in the dim light , rising up at the foot of [his]3571-that wretched fellow bed . [He]3571-that wretched fellow said that it seemed to have a greenish sort of effect as if there were a greenish tinge in the shadows of the tall bedposts that framed [her]567-the girl body . And [she]567-the girl looked at [him]3571-that wretched fellow with [her]567-the girl straight eyes of an unflinching cruelty and [she]567-the girl said : "[3017-you] [I]0-i am ready to belong to [you]3018-you - to save [your]3018-you life . " [He]3571-that wretched fellow answered : "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't want it ; [I]0-i do n't want it ; [I]0-i do n't want it . " And [he]3571-that wretched fellow says that [he]3571-that wretched fellow did n't want it ; that [he]3571-that wretched fellow would have hated [himself]3571-that wretched fellow ; that it was unthinkable . And all the while [he]3571-that wretched fellow had the immense temptation to do the unthinkable thing , not from the physical desire but because of a mental certitude . [He]3571-that wretched fellow was certain that if [she]567-the girl had once submitted to [him]3571-that wretched fellow [she]567-the girl would remain [his]3571-that wretched fellow forever . [He]3571-that wretched fellow knew that . [She]567-the girl was thinking that [[her]567-the girl aunt]1405-her aunt had said [he]3571-that wretched fellow had desired [her]0-i to love [him]3571-that wretched fellow from a distance of five thousand miles . [She]0-i said : "[0-i] [I]0-i can never love [you]0-i now [I]0-i know [the kind of man [you]0-i are]3019-the kind of man you are . [I]0-i will belong to [you]0-i to save [your]0-i life . But [I]0-i can never love [you]0-i . " It was a fantastic display of cruelty . [She]567-the girl did n't in the least know what it meant - to belong to [a man]3062-a man . But , at that , [Edward]189-edward pulled [himself]189-edward together . [He]189-edward spoke in [his]189-edward normal tones ; gruff , husky , overbearing , as [he]189-edward would have done to [a servant]1117-a servant or to a horse . "[0-i] Go back to [[your]0-i room]3020-your room , " [he]189-edward said . "[0-i] Go back to [[your]0-i room]3020-your room and go to . sleep . This is all nonsense . " [THEY]3582-they WERE [BAFFLED]323-baffled , [those two women]3529-those two women . And then [I]0-i came on the scene . [MY]0-i COMING ON THE SCENE certainly calmed things down - for the whole fortnight that intervened between [my]0-i arrival and [the girl]567-the girl 's departure . [I]0-i do n't mean to say that the endless talking did not go on at night or that [Leonora]183-leonora did not send [me]0-i out with [the girl]567-the girl and , in the interval , give [Edward]189-edward a hell of a time . Having discovered what [he]189-edward wanted - that [the girl]567-the girl should go five thousand miles away and love [him]189-edward steadfastly as [people]507-people do in sentimental novels - [she]183-leonora was determined to smash that aspiration . And [she]183-leonora repeated to [Edward]189-edward in every possible tone that [the girl]567-the girl did not love [him]189-edward ; that [the girl]567-the girl detested [him]189-edward for [his]189-edward brutality , [his]189-edward overbearingness , [his]189-edward drinking habits . [She]183-leonora pointed out that [Edward]189-edward , in [the girl]567-the girl 's eyes , was already pledged three or four deep . [He]189-edward was pledged to [Leonora]183-leonora [herself]183-leonora , to [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil and to the memories of [Maisie Maidan]235-maisie and of [Florence]182-florence . [Edward]189-edward never said anything . Did [the girl]567-the girl love [Edward]189-edward , or did n't [she]567-the girl ? [I]0-i do n't know . At that time [I]0-i dare say [she]567-the girl did n't , though [she]567-the girl certainly had done so before [Leonora]183-leonora had got to work upon [his]189-edward reputation . [She]567-the girl certainly had loved [him]189-edward for what [I]0-i will call the public side of [his]189-edward record - for [his]189-edward good soldiering , for [his]189-edward saving lives at [sea]345-sea , for the excellent landlord that [he]189-edward was and [the good sportsman]3593-the good sportsman . But it is quite possible that all those things came to appear as nothing in [her]567-the girl eyes when [she]567-the girl discovered that [he]189-edward was n't [a good husband]3146-a good husband . For , though [women]2443-women , as [I]0-i see [them]2443-women , have little or no feeling of responsibility towards [a county]3596-a county or [a country]3597-a country or a career - although [they]2443-women may be entirely lacking in any kind of communal solidarity - [they]2443-women have an immense and automatically working instinct that attaches [them]2443-women to the interest of womanhood . It is , of course , possible for [any woman]3070-any woman to cut out and to carry off [[any other woman]3153-any other woman 's husband]3600-any other woman 's husband or [lover]3601-lover . But [I]0-i rather think that [a woman]686-a woman will only do this if [she]686-a woman has reason to believe that [the other woman]3429-the other woman has given [[her]686-a woman husband]509-her husband a bad time . [I]0-i am certain that if [she]686-a woman thinks [the man]1816-the man has been [a brute to [[his]1816-the man wife]388-his wife]3606-a brute to his wife [she]686-a woman will , with [her]686-a woman instinctive feeling for suffering femininity , "[0-i] put [him]3022-him back , " as the saying is . [I]0-i do n't attach any particular importance to these generalizations of mine . [They]3608-they may be right , [they]3608-they may be wrong ; [I]0-i am only [an ageing American with very little knowledge of life]3609-an ageing american with very little knowledge of life . [You]3610-you may take [my]0-i generalizations or leave them . But [I]0-i am pretty certain that [I]0-i am right in the case of [Nancy Rufford]257-nancy - that [she]257-nancy had loved [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward very deeply and tenderly . It is nothing to the point that [she]257-nancy let [him]189-edward have it good and strong as soon as [she]257-nancy discovered that [he]189-edward had been unfaithful to [Leonora]183-leonora and that [his]189-edward public services had cost more than [Leonora]183-leonora thought they ought to have cost . [Nancy]257-nancy would be bound to let [him]189-edward have it good and strong then . [She]257-nancy would owe that to feminine public opinion ; [she]257-nancy would be driven to it by the instinct for self - preservation , since [she]257-nancy might well imagine that if [Edward]189-edward had been unfaithful to [Leonora]183-leonora , to [Mrs. Basil]268-mrs. basil , and to the memories of the other two [he]189-edward might be unfaithful to [herself]257-nancy . And , no doubt , [she]257-nancy had [her]257-nancy share of the sex instinct that makes [women]2443-women be intolerably cruel to [the beloved person]3612-the beloved person . Anyhow , [I]0-i do n't know whether , at this point , [Nancy Rufford]257-nancy loved [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward . [I]0-i do n't know whether [she]257-nancy even loved [him]189-edward when , on getting , at [Aden]174-aden , the news of [his]189-edward suicide [she]257-nancy went mad . Because that may just as well have been for the sake of [Leonora]183-leonora as for the sake of [Edward]189-edward . Or it may have been for the sake of both of [them]3613-them . [I]0-i do n't know . [I]0-i know nothing . [I]0-i am very tired . [Leonora]183-leonora held passionately the doctrine that [the girl]567-the girl did n't love [Edward]189-edward . [She]183-leonora wanted desperately to believe that . It was a doctrine as necessary to [her]183-leonora existence as a belief in the personal immortality of the soul . [She]183-leonora said that it was impossible that [Nancy]257-nancy could have loved [Edward]189-edward after [she]257-nancy had given [the girl]567-the girl [her]257-nancy view of [Edward]189-edward 's career and character . [Edward]189-edward , on the other hand , believed maunderingly that some essential attractiveness in [himself]189-edward must have made [the girl]567-the girl continue to go on loving [him]189-edward - to go on loving [him]189-edward , as it were , in underneath [her]567-the girl official aspect of hatred . [He]189-edward thought [she]567-the girl only pretended to hate [him]189-edward in order to save [her]567-the girl face and [he]189-edward thought that [her]567-the girl quite atrocious telegram from [Brindisi]71-brindisi was only another attempt to do that - to prove that [she]567-the girl had feelings creditable to [a member of the feminine commonweal]3617-a member of the feminine commonweal . [I]0-i do n't know . [I]0-i leave it to [you]3618-you . There is another point that worries [me]0-i a good deal in the aspects of this sad affair . [Leonora]183-leonora says that , in desiring that [the girl]567-the girl should go five thousand miles away and yet continue to love [him]189-edward , [Edward]189-edward was [a monster of selfishness]3620-a monster of selfishness . [He]189-edward was desiring the ruin of a young life . [Edward]189-edward on the other hand put it to [me]0-i that , supposing that [the girl]567-the girl 's love was a necessity to [his]189-edward existence , and if [he]189-edward did nothing by word or by action to keep [Nancy]257-nancy 's love alive , [he]189-edward could n't be called selfish . [Leonora]183-leonora replied that showed [he]189-edward had an abominably selfish nature even though [his]189-edward actions might be perfectly correct . [I]0-i ca n't make out which of [them]3622-them was right . [I]0-i leave it to [you]3623-you . It is , at any rate , certain that [Edward]189-edward 's actions were perfectly - were monstrously , were cruelly - correct . [He]189-edward sat still and let [Leonora]183-leonora take away [his]189-edward character , and let [Leonora]183-leonora damn [him]189-edward to deepest hell , without stirring a finger . [I]0-i dare say [he]189-edward was [a fool]1550-a fool ; [I]0-i do n't see what object there was in letting [the girl]567-the girl think worse of [him]189-edward than was necessary . Still there it is . And there it is also that [all those three]3626-all those three presented to [the world]392-the world the spectacle of being the best of [good people]3088-good people . [I]0-i assure [you]3623-you that during [my]0-i stay for that fortnight in [that fine old house]3629-that fine old house , [I]0-i never so much as noticed a single thing that could have affected that good opinion . And even when [I]0-i look back , knowing the circumstances , [I]0-i ca n't remember a single thing any of [them]3626-all those three said that could have betrayed [them]3626-all those three . [I]0-i ca n't remember , right up to the dinner , when [Leonora]183-leonora read out that telegram - not the tremor of an eyelash , not the shaking of a hand . It was just [a pleasant country house]3630-a pleasant country house - party . And [Leonora]183-leonora kept it up jolly well , for even longer than that - [she]183-leonora kept it up as far as [I]0-i was concerned until eight days after [Edward]189-edward 's funeral . Immediately after that particular dinner - the dinner at which [I]0-i received the announcement that [Nancy]257-nancy was going to leave for [India]93-india on the following day - [I]0-i asked [Leonora]183-leonora to let [me]0-i have a word with [her]183-leonora . [She]183-leonora took [me]0-i into [[her]183-leonora little sitting - room]3631-her little sitting - room and [I]0-i then said - [I]0-i spare [you]3632-you the record of [my]0-i emotions - that [she]183-leonora was aware that [I]0-i wished to marry [Nancy]257-nancy ; that [she]183-leonora had seemed to favour [my]0-i suit and that it appeared to be rather a waste of money upon tickets and rather a waste of time upon travel to let [the girl]567-the girl go to [India]93-india if [Leonora]183-leonora thought that there was any chance of [her]183-leonora marrying [me]0-i . And [Leonora]183-leonora , [I]0-i assure [you]3632-you , was [the absolutely perfect British matron]3634-the absolutely perfect british matron . [She]183-leonora said that [she]183-leonora quite favoured [my]0-i suit ; that [she]183-leonora could not desire for [the girl]567-the girl [a better husband]3636-a better husband ; but that [she]183-leonora considered that [the girl]567-the girl ought to see a little more of life before taking such an important step . Yes , [Leonora]183-leonora used the words "[0-i] taking such an important step . " [She]183-leonora was perfect . Actually , [I]3088-good people think [she]183-leonora would have liked [the girl]567-the girl to marry [me]3088-good people well enough but [my]3088-good people programme included the buying of [[the Kershaws]324-the kershaws ' house]3639-the kershaws ' house , about a mile and a half away upon [the Fordingbridge road]3640-the fordingbridge road , and settling down there with [the girl]567-the girl . [I]3088-good people loved [Nancy]257-nancy very much - and [Leonora]183-leonora knew it . However , [I]3088-good people left it at that . [I]3088-good people left it with the understanding that [Nancy]257-nancy was going away to [India]93-india on probation . It seemed to [me]3088-good people a perfectly reasonable arrangement and [I]3088-good people am [a reasonable sort of man]3645-a reasonable sort of man . Well , [you]3646-you see , [I]3088-good people did follow [Nancy]257-nancy out to [India]93-india after a year .... [I]3088-good people must confess to having felt a little angry with [Leonora]183-leonora for not having warned [me]3088-good people earlier that [the girl]567-the girl would be going . [I]3088-good people took it as one of the queer , not very straight methods that [Roman Catholics]3648-roman catholics seem to adopt in dealing with matters of [this world]798-this world . [I]3088-good people took it that [Leonora]183-leonora had been afraid [I]3088-good people should propose to [the girl]567-the girl or , at any rate , have made considerably greater advances to [her]567-the girl than [I]3088-good people did , if [I]3088-good people had known earlier that [she]567-the girl was going away so soon . Perhaps [Leonora]183-leonora was right ; perhaps [Roman Catholics]3648-roman catholics , with [their]3648-roman catholics queer , shifty ways , are always right . [They]3648-roman catholics are dealing with the queer , shifty thing that is human nature . For it is quite possible that , if [I]3088-good people had known [Nancy]257-nancy was going away so soon , [I]3088-good people should have tried making love to [her]257-nancy . And that would have produced another complication . It may have been just as well . It is queer the fantastic things that [quite good people]3060-quite good people will do in order to keep up [their]3060-quite good people appearance of calm pococurantism . For [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward and [[his]189-edward wife]388-his wife called [me]3088-good people half [the world]392-the world over in order to sit on the back seat of [a dog - cart]3655-a dog - cart whilst [Edward]189-edward drove [the girl]567-the girl to [the railway station from which [she]567-the girl was to take [her]567-the girl departure to [India]93-india]3657-the railway station from which she was to take her departure to india . [Edward]189-edward was lounging in [his]189-edward chair smoking a cigar and [he]189-edward said nothing for quite five minutes . The candles glowed in the green shades ; the reflections were green in the glasses of the bookcases that held guns and fishing - rods . Over the mantelpiece was the brownish picture of the white horse . Those were the quietest moments that [I]3088-good people have ever known . WELL , [he]189-edward carried out the programme to the last breath . It was a very clear winter morning , with a good deal of frost in it . The sun was quite bright , the winding road between the heather and the bracken was very hard . So there [you]3035-you have the pretty picture . Mind , [I]0-i am not preaching anything contrary to accepted morality . [I]0-i am not advocating free love in this or any other case . Society must go on , [I]0-i suppose , and society can only exist if the normal , if the virtuous , and the slightly deceitful flourish , and if [the passionate]3036-the passionate , [the headstrong]3037-the headstrong , and the too - truthful are condemned to suicide and to madness . But [I]0-i guess that [I]0-i [myself]0-i , in [my]0-i fainter way , come into the category of the passionate , of the headstrong , and the too - truthful . For [I]0-i ca n't conceal from [myself]0-i the fact that [I]0-i loved [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward - and that [I]0-i love [him]189-edward because [he]189-edward was just [myself]0-i . If [I]0-i had had the courage and the virility and possibly also the physique of [Edward Ashburnham]189-edward [I]0-i should , [I]0-i fancy , have done much what [he]189-edward did . That is what [we]3042-we are here for . But then , [I]0-i do n't like society - much . [I]0-i am that absurd figure , [an American millionaire , who has bought one of [the ancient haunts of English peace]3044-the ancient haunts of english peace]3043-an american millionaire , who has bought one of the ancient haunts of english peace . Then [she]257-nancy will say that [she]257-nancy believes in [an Omnipotent Deity]3455-an omnipotent deity or [she]257-nancy will utter the one word ' shuttlecocks , " perhaps . Yes , it is queer . But , at any rate , there is always [Leonora]183-leonora to cheer [you]3721-you up ; [I]257-nancy do n't want to sadden [you]3721-you . That is the great desideratum of life , and that is the end of [my]257-nancy story . [The child]1315-the child is to be brought up as [a Romanist]2238-a romanist . IT SUDDENLY OCCURS TO [ME]257-nancy that [I]257-nancy have forgotten to say how [Edward]189-edward met [his]189-edward death . [You]3721-you remember that peace had descended upon [the house]1359-the house ; that [Leonora]183-leonora was quietly triumphant and that [Edward]189-edward said [his]189-edward love for [the girl]567-the girl had been merely a passing phase . Well , one afternoon [we]3728-we were in [the stables]3729-the stables together , looking at a new kind of flooring that [Edward]189-edward was trying in a loose - box . [Edward]189-edward was talking with a good deal of animation about the necessity of getting the number of the Hampshire territorials up to the proper standard . [He]189-edward was quite sober , quite quiet , [his]189-edward skin was clear - coloured ; [his]189-edward hair was golden and perfectly brushed ; the level brick - dust red of [his]189-edward complexion went clean up to the rims of [his]189-edward eyelids ; [his]189-edward eyes were porcelain blue and they regarded [me]257-nancy frankly and directly . [His]189-edward face was perfectly expressionless ; [his]189-edward voice was deep and rough . [He]189-edward stood well back upon [his]189-edward legs and said : "[257-nancy] [We]3056-we ought to get [them]3057-them up to two thousand three hundred and fifty . " [A stable - boy]3730-a stable - boy brought [him]189-edward a telegram and went away . [He]189-edward opened it negligently , regarded it without emotion , and , in complete silence , handed it to [me]257-nancy . On the pinkish paper in a sprawled handwriting [I]257-nancy read : "[257-nancy] Safe [Brindisi]71-brindisi . Having rattling good time . [Nancy]257-nancy . " Well , [Edward]189-edward was [the English gentleman]3731-the english gentleman ; but [he]189-edward was also , to the last , [a sentimentalist , whose mind was compounded of indifferent poems and novels]3732-a sentimentalist , whose mind was compounded of indifferent poems and novels . [He]189-edward just looked up to the roof of [the stable]3733-the stable , as if [he]189-edward were looking to heaven , and whispered something that [I]257-nancy did not catch . Then [he]189-edward put two fingers into the waistcoat pocket of [his]189-edward grey , frieze suit ; they came out with a little neat penknife - quite a small penknife . [He]189-edward said to [me]257-nancy : "[257-nancy] [You]257-nancy might just take that wire to [Leonora]183-leonora . " And [he]189-edward looked at [me]257-nancy with a direct , challenging , brow - beating glare . [He]189-edward remarked : "[257-nancy] So long , [old man]3024-old man , [I]0-i must have a bit of a rest , [you]3024-old man know . " [I]0-i did n't know what to say . But [I]0-i thought that perhaps that would not be quite English good form , so [I]0-i trotted off with the telegram to [Leonora]183-leonora . [She]183-leonora was quite pleased with it .
